Review: silly performances and some huge gaps in logic mar an otherwise interesting tale of an eclectic group of people stranded at the last stop cafe and motel due heavy snowfall one of the stranded is colorado state highway patrolman adam beach who discovers murder scene and bag full of cash from recent bank robbery someone amongst the group of strangers is bank robber and murderer but is it the same person or are there multiple criminals adam beach unfortunately was the wrong choice for the lead in this he does not play the role enough seriousness be believable or enough goofiness for it be funny his performance is stuck somewhere in the middle and this really needed it be on one side or the other rose mcgowan is cold and unpleasant the eye as always and jurgen prochnow what on earth is he doing in this best performance comes from william taylor as cheesy yet still somehow cool and confident wayne newton drifter type the last stop is available on dvd from sterling home entertainment as usual sterling they have filled out this dvd extra features the disc contains the in its original aspect ratio of choice of dolby surround sound or dolby digital surround sound full length audio commentary track director mark malone interviews the cast and crew the original trailer and the usual cast and crew biographies the itself might not be the greatest but sterlings effort of adding decent extra features while keeping the price affordable suggested retail of makes this dvd worth the money r

phil curtolo madonna antonio banderas jonathan price in an alan parker music from andrew lloyd weber and lyrics tim rice evita now have admit the trailer for this rockoperaturnedmajor motion picture is almost breathtaking for some the soundtrack is wonderful listen so why would not the movie be wonderful see simple little over hours of constant singing can almost drive you insane the story of eva duarte madonna evita is full of drama that is trapped inside all the notes and chords she was an orphaned child who ends up becoming hooker then goes into the field of acting and finally meets juan peron price the soontobe first president of argentina they fall in love and eventually marry sounds pretty good does not it well the story gets better as eva goes on the rainbow tour across europe trying win respect eva duarte was wonderful lady however all of the dramapacked moments above were never understood because the actors and actresses sang fast be understood went into theater at magic cinemas the attitude that evita was going be terribly boring and left happy because was right they only thing that kept me awake during the movie was the loud bangs of the drums and strums of the guitar although it did come off as dull the beautiful cinematography is eyecatching as was madonnas performance as the spiritual leader of argentina madonna would have definitely been an fan of musicals on the big screen if you are going pay see movie you want see movie now have admit it is lot cheaper pay than plus see the play but that is what did me in all this review contains is my opinion and my grade was set before even saw the movie now you may be saying what kind of critic is he and you are right as critic should have given the movie chance but as year old quentin tarantino fan it was way too hard

i have never seen man so in love himself than george lucas the overt success of the three original star wars films lucas has become not necessarily filmmaker but the head cheeze at huge toy company the phantom menace the new product on the shelve only this toy was made for million but every kid wants it and like all other expensive toys falls apart within an hour after playing it the product in question star wars episode the phantom menace jeez is pure and simple its about the money baby no one in their right mind would create such fiasco if they knew it would not make ton of money before its fourth week of release come the sw franchise as stranger since have absolutely no idea why the sw movies are so popular find them rather boring and full of nothing but eye candy phantom menace is like the first sw minus nothing in the whole concept is remotely enjoyable even the special effects seem rather bland the story in this new one is mindless mess the acting wooden and the action sequences like something out of video game sw phantom menace is one of the worst films of the year so far title like sw tpm lucas has one big head on those shoulders thought chris carter did for releasing an xfiles movie although that movie adaptation was an excellent way spend two hours pm is one long headache

an affluent horse breeders past comes up haunt him an ages old coverup and blackmail comes back haunt him at the hands of one of his accomplices that is pretty much the essence of the movie and have say that it becomes quite boring at times and is very slow that aside the story was well presented and probably quite close and representative of its source the acting in particular found very good the character development was also quite interesting but alas the story simply did not hold my interest enough for me get into the movie few things about the story did not sit very well me for example the original scam and coverup heavily involved the character played sharon stone yet in the end her character played relatively small role and it seems she should have been utilized more further the story along better on the flip side the character played catherine keener found be very interesting and thought that it was developed very well and helped the story lot the characters aside this movie had some interesting merits but in the end it lacked in story and pacing as far as the acting and casting for this movie is concerned have say that the choices of nick nolte and jeff bridges were great as well as that of catherine keener all these people acted their parts admirably as for the part that sharon stone played she played it well but the part was not utilized enough the directing for this movie is something that have comment on because for once in long while you see director actually add very distinctive flavor movie this is one of those occasions matthew warchus in my opinion added an interesting touch and spin the movie and think he tackled touch subject myself would not be able look at horseracing and make movie out of it there is certain flavor about this movie and think that the direction of the movie is the reason for this the one flaw that do have comment on is the pacing the subject matter in my opinion was not interesting enough on its own have this kind of flavoring and directorial touch about it certainly hope that the director makes more movies as this does show promise even if myself do not like it all in all found this movie boring and very slow the acting was good but the story just did not evolve enough and was not captivating enough make simpatico an enjoyable movie watch although there is much going for the movie did not find it good even though see the merits and style used and can compliment the movie on them would not recommend this movie anyone but if you are horse fanatic or racing fanatic then you will most likely enjoy this movie

a fullyloaded entertainment review website coming soon hunter thompsons fear and loathing in las vegas written in is already an american classic not merely because it was an unadulterated journey through the postpsychedelia of the but also because it ushered in new form of journalism known as gonzo soon after the book was written hunter thomspon became the basis for character in doonesbury known as uncle duke and that is the problem fear and loathing in las vegas the movie although the book is one of my favorites now agree thompsons own assessment of the novel as unfilmable the main problem is that the book although detailing wild drug use and trippedout adventures was not written on the road it was written and edited hunter thomspons relatively sober at his home so although the book depicts drug use and still more drug use it is told sense of aloofness and some humor hunter thomspon the narrator while always drugged out still has grip on reality and can still tell journalistic ability what is going on around him not so the characters in fear and loathing in las vegas despite name changes and one minor scene from the book dropped the movie is an exact duplicate of the book in terms of dialouge unfortunately this can get annoying in the form of johnny depps who plays thompson excessive narration and the characters while having vivid personalities are played as characers on the screen dr raoul duke johnny depp the name raoul duke was an alias of thompsons and his riding companion dr gonzo benicio del toro who is large samoan lawyer have no personalities or emotions at all save for stoned the is very faithful the plot what there is of the book in that dr raoul duke is sent sports illustrated cover the mint and takes along not only his samoan lawyer but also car trunk full of drugs from there one set of stoned adventures after another happens including one of the few good scenes in depp high on acid watches all the people in the bar around him turn into literally lounge lizards while the movie has its moments few it is almost unwatchable at parts especially towards the end despite lot of celebrity cameos the stars never get off the ground the set decoration and costumes are great and probably deserve an oscar nomination however as we all know it is not sets or effects that make movie its the characters and quite frankly these characters are no good

filmmakers will use all manner of tricks flesh out and brighten up dull dreary and overused idea doug liman swingers director of the ultrahip and severely dark comedy go is an example of just such filmmaker in his latest he gives the viewers raucous neonlit backdrop as cinematographer and points the audience down druginfested path of misadventure as director but he fails come up any parallel structure in his multitiered movie and he fails connect the audience on any level bringing the worth of his efforts nil and the value of go about the same his movie is produced anthologystyle telling the same story from multiple three points of view much as an author might write serial novel consistent this ethic liman and screenwriter john august provide bit of an overlap at the beginning of each narrative and insert brief connections other narratives the thread that laces the three stories together is drug deal and the events thereafter in story we have checkout clerk ronna sarah polley looking score some rent money and turning drug trafficking do it in story we have regular drug dealer simon desmond askew gone las vegas giving ronna her opportunity and in story we have gay soap actors zack jay mohr and adam scott wolf working undercover for the police bust said drug deal neither of the three stories have much substance and the movie has the feel of campfire story albeit rather strange one that could be told in five ten minutes in fact the movie was originally short entitled expanded feature length the early april release date is too mistimed capitalize on the movies christmas setting and the los angeleslas vegas nightlife is something too far from the mainstream for most theatergoers attach themselves the characters are shallow the point of prerequisite and performances from littleknown players like polley askew and taye diggs do not help or hurt the roles in fact even bigger names like mohr wolf and katie holmes do not have enough time make substantial success although that is almost expected for lack of continuous screen time the success in the picture should come from thread that binds the stories go does not have this and it suffers because of it as far as teen movies are concerned go represents the absolute bottom for its constant stream of indecipherable light and sound mean nothing without some sort of common theme the following do not count as common themes drug deals people attempting have romantic interludes drug dealers people resorting drug deals for alterior motives or people not involved in drug deals stumbling into them at times the humor in go is sickly funny and on low night almost watchable but for the majority of its running time and for most viewers this movie will best be left teens at blockbuster on saturday night

i feel sorry for the financial backers of waterworld is supposedly the most expensive ever made at million and is also one of the stupidest boy did they get ripped off in fact this is not really movie but more of an amusement park ride plot it is not even just another case of cliches strung together well it is that too it is something that is painful watch because it relishes in its flaws kevin costner stars as man who is some kind of mutant half manhalf fish he is an explorermariner on an alternate earth that is completely covered water because the polar ice caps melted he is referred as the mariner but they the meaner would have been more appropriate title because he is cold rigid and strict and he is supposed the be the good guy he docks at small floating village of sorts he trades dirt for money and this introduces us the other important characters first we meet one of the villains then the soontobe heroine child prodigy wacky inventor and group of primitive people that somehow have some of the technology we have today but also some of the lowtech tools used pirates and vikings immediately the films biggest flaw is apparent are these people primitive or highly advanced it does not seem like anyone can read yet they have skidoos and airplanes how are these things powered and if they have airplanes could not they just keep flying until they reached dry land also if the planet is completely covered in water where did they get the materials make these things am sorry am all for checking your brain at the door when going the movies but elements like these cannot go unnoticed because they draw our attention away from the story and confuse us there was potential here for good pirate story set in medieval times before modern technology so why mix the two together it does not make any sense there really is not much of plot here because the story moves so quickly it never takes time explain anything the only thing we learn is that the prodigy child enola mojorino has tattoo on her back that is supposedly map dryland who put the tattoo there and how come it has taken them this long figure this out we never get an answer just stupid action movie about whoever can get the girl will be the victor of sorts if they reach dryland make long boring stupid and just plain bad story short the mariner escapes woman named helen tripplehorn and enola they sail for long time encountering some strange people in the process and fight off the smokers as lead the idiot villain deacon hopper who kidnaps enola the story becomes overly grand adventure the mariner taking on an army of goons rescuing enola and bringing them all salvation how original even all its special effects action and adventure this is boring not single character is likable therefore neither is the plot dennis hopper completely rips off jack nicholsons joker while costner just plain rips still waterworld is professionally made good production design and an original idea but no substance it just hope they do not make sequel

watch battlefield earth is wallow in misery it is one of the most ludicrously conceived efforts in recent history it has clumsily told story insipid dialogue shallow characterizations ugly scene transitions no evidence of dramatic arc headacheinducing sound effects and resolution that is completely implausible worse there is the promise of sequel why save your money some films go quickly video this one however should go straight the scifi channels mystery science theatre in the year man has become an endangered species most of humanity called mananimals was destroyed generations ago in battle against race of plundering aliens called psychlos survivors have either taken up shelter in caves or were enslaved mine earths resources for the rest of their lives the aliens are menacing looking humanoid species that stand ninefeet tall who resemble inbred klingons dimwitted as they are tall their culture is predicated on power extortion and getting leverage travolta the leverageusing star plays terl the conniving security chief that oversees the mining facility on earth much of the movie is spent showing us examples of terls petty machinations he routinely employs deception and then punctuates his statements maniacal laughter but one thing is certain he hates being stationed on earth when the home planet informs him that he will be spending the rest of his life on this planet he begins devise his latest plan he will select group of slaves secretly mine out gold ore site it is not clear how this benefits terl except that it makes him richer in place where he has no use for it the scrappy jonnie goodboy tyler barry peppers is selected as the slave groups leader psychlo knowledge machine gives him the mining knowhow but the machine also teaches him other things such as the psychlo language the principles of our founding fathers euclidean geometry and the location of fort knox this enlightenment just does not prepare him for the mining assignment it also prepares him organize and stage massive revolt against their captors we are going blow up their home world he says but first we need few more supplies in days he and his comrades evolve from cave dwelling loincloth wearing rat eating slaves fighter pilots and nuclear weapons experts now the audience is laughing as maniacally as terl the media have been working overtime let the public know that john travoltas labor of love is piece of scifi drivel numerous journals have called it an illconceived idea stemming from blind hubris arrogance and poor planning and after watching this movie you will wholeheartedly agree this is terrible that is illogically constructed tediously acted and frequently begs the question why was this ever made at price tag of million this will be remembered as gigantic folly assuredly becoming the avengers of this summer both films were unforgivable and this promises suffer the same speedy fate and subsequent indignity in addition the universally pejorative reviews there is another bizarre element the battlefield saga this would never have been made if not for the star power of travolta who for over decade had been trying persuade studios bring the story the big screen the controversy is that travolta is scientologist and battlefield is based on novel ron hubbard the religions late founder this led some believe that battlefield earth would amount scientologist dogma laden subliminal messages but the story is so poorly told that any message subliminal or otherwise is totally undetectable if the audience got anything out of this it was this we are not too unlike the psychlo leader like terl the audience felt imprisoned dreaded their situation and looked for any opportunity leave could that be the scientology message

an year old woman jumps enthusiastically on her couch wearing tightfitting leather as she cheers on her favorite tv wrestler calling his opponent pumpbitch two men messily eat fast food as their septic truck leaks raw sewage directly behind them and roughly people are booted in the crotch welcome ready rumble judging from the fact that pottymouth adam sandler is the reigning boxoffice comedy champion you realize albeit while shaking your head that yes there is an audience for this sort of thing ladies and gentlemen weep for society mind you when executed style and comic ingenuity jokes like an alarming bodily fluid mistaken for hair gel there is something about mary and laxativeinduced attack of explosive diarrhea dumb and dumber can be extremely funny unfortunately ready rumble is not being helmed the farrelly brothers nor is it bolstered script that accommodates the viewer anything even remotely clever or inspired ready rumble is built around the dedicated fanbase of professional wrestling in fact sounded like fine concept for goofball comedy but director brian robbins and screenwriter steven brill handcuff themselves and limited stampede of asinine humdrum bathroom humor basically the only thing they manage is evoke memories of pauly shore and bio dome gordie boggs david arquette and sean dawkins scott caan take pride in being hardcore wcw wrestling fanatics day they transport raw sewage night particularly on nitro monday they pay homage their personal hero and savior jimmy king oliver platt the undisputed leader of the professional wrestling community two tickets an upcoming nitro performance gordie and sean are psyched about witnessing the king defend his title firsthand but unscrupulous boxing kingpin titus sinclair joe pantoliano sporting long hair and cowboy boots has other plans sinclair is plotting have diamond dallas page playing himself pummel the king into the tarp thereby dethroning the dignified wrestler and embarrassing him in front of bewildered auditorium full of fans gordie and sean are shocked rioting madly while arguing this is not even payper view event they take it upon themselves track the king down and supply the encouragement essential for their fallen idol make comeback attempt along the way you can expect lot of sh jokes as well you may find something like in ready rumble if you are rasslin aficionado yourself or you are dedicated fan of the lowest of lowbrow comedies welcome lowbrow humor open arms that is if its fresh and resourceful rumble is nothing but sloppy frightfully unfunny swamp land of misbegotten retardation the first halfhour is the ultimate test of patience luckily the simpleminded events pick up steam particularly the wellchoreographed wrestling action director robbins showed knack for capturing the brutality and excitement of football in varsity blues and when in the ring he does professional work but the violence is too excessive having the fake soap opera of wcw wrestling turn into bloody skirmish brings back unfortunate memories of owen harts tragic accident just last year especially one characters dive during cage match this is not something you want comedy be reminiscent of outside the wrestling action the lewd jokes and puerile sight gags bring new meaning the term scattershot while the dialogue fluctuates in on the vulgarity scale of brills extensive vocabulary ranging from diddly boob and so on the final tally chuckled few times groaned lot and indulged in one spirited belly laugh involving martin landau as geriatric wrestling coach who fights pretty impressively for castingwise ready rumble is an odd duck oliver platt as champion wrestling figure he is perhaps bit chunky but fellow wrestlers acknowledge this in the ring calling him fatty dampens the blow suppose rose mcgowan is fully disposable as sultry wcw cheerleader the nirtoest of the nitro girls proclaims gordie but extra pep is added appearances wrestlers goldberg macho man randy savage and sting among others wcw fans are sure appreciate these others well will not found merit in david arquettes bountiful energy as gordie brings me my finishing ahhh praise for the in ready rumble have discovered something even more annoying than arquettes att television commercials now there is low blow for you

it is rare treat when quality horror is released in the theater and unfortunately mans best friend we will be waiting while longer the stars ally sheedy and lance henrikson in tale of biogenetics gone wrong sheedy plays nosy reporter whose need for good story provokes her snoop inside of emax poorly guarded million dollar biolab that she finds herself effortlessly intruding the result she unleashes the experimental wonder dog named max german shepherd genetic recombination allowing it swallow like snake camouflage like chameleon climb trees like leopard and attack the strength of tiger max takes liking sheedy and she finds herself protecting the animal from the cruel technological realm of emax owned henrikson well it does not take long before the hormonally unstable biohazard unleashes his jowls upon the unsuspecting suburban landscape offers max juicy leg of mailman etc sheedy is boring nonpresence on the screen tripping through the enormous plot chasms neglected the writerdirector apologize for lack of credits suppose was eager leave the theater and in my rush forgot take note of the director writer producer etc henrikson offered the only relief from the contrived narration of the script giving his character as much development as he could considering the flat dialogue plaguing the the movie depends upon it is ability impress the audience animal special effects but all it presents is dog that can growl open door handles his paw sit roll over play dead and sick the rest of the special effects were so poor found them offensive the attains submediocrity an unambitious at best horror fans might find that cujo offers better bite

joe versus the volcano is really one of the worse movies made in very recent memory the strangest thing is that you would think nothing would go wrong it it has solid cast tom hanks meg ryan as the lead roles but you can never judge movie its cast if there is one good thing about joe vs the volcano it is that the plot is original unfortunately it is also incredibly stupid the movie begins joe tom hanks going work this opening sequence is very boring and slow it shows joe walking his office but on the way he has wait in long line passing strange and slightly depressing scenery obnoxious lighting sequence like this should take minutes here it takes over it is obvious that joe hates his job at his office one of his coworkers is meg ryan oddly enough she plays different roles in this movie joe leaves go doctors appointment his doctor informs him that he has brain cloud this means that in few months he will die so what does joe do quit his job of course when he arrives home joe meets an old man named graynamore lloyd bridges graynamore tells joe that in order get some important mineral for his company from an island the natives need someone sacrifice their volcano please their fire god startling coincidence the boat trip the island takes few months the time he reaches the island he will almost be dead from the brain cloud anyway so joe agrees graynamore gives joe credit card buy everything he needs go on this great adventure joe goes on date meg ryan his coworker the day before the boat trip joe meets one of graynamores daughters she is also surprise meg ryan except she looks more hippyish they both have dinner and the next day joe gets driven over his boat the lady that sails the boat is another one of graynamores daughters and wonder of wonders she is also played meg ryan as they sail the island meg ryan tells joe that the natives of the island have craving for orange soda after some stupid talking scenes they also deduce that graynamore had his doctor be the one that joe went and that the brain cloud thing was made up they do plently of cheap special effects on the boat voyage joe goes fishing and catches hammerhead shark this is cheap gag that has been pulled off many times but top it off the shark is obviously rubber and fake one night there is storm cheaplooking lightning bolt strikes the boat and everything is cast overboard fortunately joe and meg ryan manage find some of the luggage that joe brought sail pure luck they get the island since the natives like orange soda they wear soda cans as attire stupid or what before joe leaps in the volcano he gets fed right before he jumps meg ryan pleads him not when joe decides she goes in him because she loves him now this is where the movie should end but unfortunately the cheesy ending bug comes in the volcano blows the couple out and into the ocean where they land on joes luggage they float another part of the island as they watch lava pouring out of the volcano towards the villagers give this movie see it only if you are buff that enjoys bad movie every now and then or if you really like tom hanks or meg ryan

be gentle urges natasha henstridge matthew perry in the whole nine yards have not made love in five years neither have rebuts perry am married if jonathan lynns latest comedy relied simply on jokes of that caliberand it certainly triesthen it would be an innocuous if rather obvious little instead its failings go much deeper first off who has not had enough of the tough wiseguy intimidates the timid wise guy genre if you want make pretty penny or two in nowadays simply write comedy pairs robert de nirojames caanbruce willis type billy crystalhugh grantmatthew perry type and wait for the royalties roll in who is next jack nicholson and martin short it certainly does not have be funny the whole nine yards is not particularly funny but it is borderline offensive offensive in the way it continues trend of poking fun at career criminals who would not think twice about pushing your motherinlaw off the brooklyn bridge her feet encased in concrete that might sound like funny sight gag but the problem is these films have long since lost sight of the fact that taking human life is not all that funny begin when the corpse is placed in car doused gasoline set ablaze and referred as barbecue it makes you wonder when all this playing killing for laughs is going end the whole nine yards is also offensive in so much as its three central female characters are portrayed as nothing more than sex objects rosanna arquette plays slutty chainsmoking french canadian who is married matthew perrys nonetoosuccessful dentist it is an unflattering role made all the more so the unflattering outfitsand unflattering situationsinto arquette is thrust then there is natasha henstridge species and ii who plays the welltodo wife of contract killer bruce willis she gets involved perrys character when he comes chicago hoping negotiate finders fee mob boss yanni gogolack kevin pollack transposing his vs his ws after willis jimmy the tulip tudeski moves in next door henstridge and perrys characters hitting it off is about as likely as bruce and demi getting back together perry might have the charm but he does not have the physical attributes of traditional leading man especially in closeup most objectified of the bunch is amanda peet who turns in sexuallyripe performance as perrys dental assistant it transpires questionable career goals peets gratuitous nude scene proves how low this movie will stoop keep its audience from dropping off when my cousin vinny is the highpoint of directorial career including such forgettable films as clue greedy and sgt bilko you have wonder if lynn chose the wrong career path perrys pratfalling goofiness coupled willis likable hardness could have had some potential but no script work and director who seems be watching from the wings their characters run out of gas quickly

flubber is the second best example of how take all the life out of remake an adaptation and hysterically enough both were distributed disney it is the kind of that may be slightly entertaining tiny kids but anyone else will feel left out as it is boring slow and incredibly lifeless what could be cinematic magic is instead dead in the water and it is shame because it could have been great hypothetically mean flubber as you probably know is remake of the disney classic never saw the absent minded professor where well absent minded professor played fred mcmurray created an erratic substance known as flubber you know flying rubber the new one keeps the basic plot but appears have added lot else like more absentmindedness on the part of the proffessor some more villains and several showstopping moments like big rumba the flubber and some more elaborate setups none really make it any better but instead make it worse the basic plot revolves around college professor philip brainerd robin williams who creates lots and lots of inventions but is sadly absent minded in fact he is forgotten his wedding the colleges president sara jean reynolds indie actress marcia gay harden two times before he forgets it again at the beginning does not this warrant some kind of mental treatment anyway on his wedding day the third one he invents the flubber not only bounces off of everything like super ball on speed but can also change shape like the aliens in water form in the abyss philip believes that this invention once fully realized will save his college is in threat of being shut down millionaire tycoonvillain chester hoenicker raymond barry is ironically enough the same college his brat son will wheaton thought he was dead goes through plot twist hoenickers goons named smith and wesson ha ha what great sense of humor this has who are played clancy brown and ted levine both who needed the pay check discover it the hard way and try steal for hoenicker who wants it just ecause he is evil enough subplot involves philips attempts win back sara who is angry at him and good reason but who is being seduced who is basically philips belloq wilson croft christopher mcdonald playing the hysterically suaveyetunsuave asswhole once again and in another subplot philips daytimer robot weebo voiced the oneandonly jodi benson falls in love him yuckityyuck what is most pathetic about this is how dull it is you do not need be cynical college student be able see right through this is another in long line of cheap attempts at making quick buck disney who have essentially become the puff daddy of the industry halfassedly remixing classics or nonclassics for distribution the general public who sadly eats it all up earlier in they released jungle jungle an adaptation of really awful french un indien dans la ville yeah improved over the original but not much disneys in about as bad shape as warner brothers right now only creatively in the rush ship out for distribution disney has forgotten give this little thing called magic such scenes as dancing flubber flying car basketball team that pretty much sucks flying all around thanks some carefully placed flubber and an elaborate ending all fail amaze delight or even cause people laugh sat there the entire stone faced chuckling perhaps twice and shaking my head at all the bad jokes who could really laugh at scene where philip enters the wrong classroom and starts teaching chemistry did not think so it does not help that our protagonist is essentially unfunny or even really respectable philip is not lovable absent minded professory just really dumb man being played robin williams williams is brilliant comic actor okay brilliant actor in general but here he is given very little do but occasionally get hyper over something and other times act sad those times he is not bad but what are we supposed think of man who is forgotten his wedding thrice maybe it was funny andor respectable in the i like disney and usually enjoy their films not only animated but live action and their recent films save for hercules was good but not great have been worse than lackluster they have been pathetic jungle jungle is probably the worst saw last year flubber probably second what do they need do perhaps create something new get writers who can write something that is universally entertaining films like the parent trap and mary poppins are films that are live action or in the latter case mix of both but even can still watch them because they are not only written be magical children but be fun adults what is more torturous that taking child that insults you and annoys you at every turn and my god could not they have done something else edie mcclurg

i am going start this review off hypothetical question let us say you have just been in car accident and the driver of the other vehicle is unconscious your friends have left go get help and you are waiting see if the victim wakes up towtruck comes along and the driver hops out of the truck see what is going on he then proceeds kill the unconscious victim snapping his neck do you run away screaming for your life staying away from the main road run away but not too fast and stay on the main road even when the madman in the truck starts following you stop catch your breath try negotiate the psycho and when that fails start running away again all the while staying on the main road if you answered you are far more intelligent than the screenwriter of texas chainsaw massacre the next generation and will likely hate this movie however if you answered prepare enjoy made idiots like you in mind texas chainsaw massacre the next generation is being called sequel but it is really more of remake of the original there is few changes here and there but it is essentially the same even the infamous meathook scene has been recreated the story opens four teenagers hitting the road on the night of their prom and somehow ending up in the middle of nowhere needless say they soon encounter leatherface and his nutty family much carnage ensues call this movie inept would be putting it mildly in addition the laughably idiotic situation mentioned in my hypothetical question there is moment towards the end of the where one of the baddies is killed an airplane that literally comes out of nowhere it just swoops down and kills him its wheel no explantion is given as who was flying it or why heshe is going around killing people the planes wheel the dialogue is even more atrocious zellwegger who is kidnapped the family early on keeps trying have normal conversations these people when you are surrounded maniacs wielding chainsaws and dead corpses would think that rationality would go out the window speaking of going out the window there is scene in zellwegger jumps out window apparently the stunt double had little trouble because she visibly gets stuck in the window the director quickly cuts wide shot where the stunt double does not get caught in the window this was one of many glaring inconsistencies there are so many in fact that if were name them all this review would be several pages long the only reason am giving this movie one star instead of no stars is because of matthew mcconaughey he plays member of the family hydraulic leg homemade might add and is so completely overthetop you cannot help but be amazed his performance he obviously had lot of fun this part and it really shows he makes jack nicholsons portrayal of the psychotic inn keeper in the shining look restrained in comparison for horror movie texas chainsaw massacre the next generation contains surprisingly little gore in fact in contains none there is little blood here and there but that is as far as it goes leads me believe that the budget must have been astonishingly low and it shows everything about the movie looks cheap from the sets the costumes especially leatherface once frightening and nightmare inducing he is now as terrifying as dame edna do yourself favor and take pass at this remake check out the far superior original instead

susan grangers review of session usa films sometimes you just get more than your bargained for like when bostonbased hazmat elimination run scottish actor peter mullan and his trusty assistant david caruso assures town engineer paul guilifoyle that they can remove insidious asbestos fibers from victorian hospital facility in week erected in deserted and decomposing since the danvers mental hospital is one of the most malevolent locations ever chosen for the structure is so massive its labyrinth of rubblestrewn corridors collapsing floors stagnant pools of water isolation cells and ominous surgical chambers where experimental prefrontal lobotomies were performed that their task seems impossible within that time frame and each member of their inexperienced crew stephan gevedon brandon sexton iii and josh lucas is coping his own personal demons as one one their minds seem be affected the grim areas in they are working the films title is derived from salvaged reeltoreel audiorecorded sessions involving the demonic possession of young woman who is suffering from multiple personalities the time session occurs so do dreadful disasters filmmaker brad anderson obviously envisioned this as gruesome chainsawmassacretype ghost story but the script lacks structure and is not particularly scary the conclusion is more ludicrous than convincing on the granger movie gauge of session is dark gloomy silly me at first thought that the original name of the danvers lunatic asylum bore some reference mrs danvers the creepy housekeeper played judith anderson in alfred hitchcocks truly terrifying rebecca that also involved cavernous mansion called manderley

the time dennis quaid the ostensible star of switchback makes his first appearance at about the minute mark you may find yourself wondering why he bothered after all writerdirector jeb stuart has already set up fairly promising pair of parallel story lines the first finds amarillo texas sheriff buck olmstead lee ermey facing hotlycontested election battle just as brutal double homicide is discovered at motel in his jurisdiction as olmstead begins his investigation we also meet the two men who come be our prime suspects lane dixon jared leto is an enigmatic young hitchhiker bob goodall danny glover is the jovial motorist who offers lane ride from texas his utah destination all the necessary conflicts seem be in place the internal struggle of olmstead over the clash between good politics and good police work and the external struggle as one of the two travelers eventually becomes villain the others protagonist but then quaid shows up as grimly determined fbi agent frank lacrosse lacrosse is certain that the amarillo murders are the work of serial killer he has been tracking for nearly two years he is not supposed be tracking him any more according the bureau they have got their man but lacrosse has very important reason for believing otherwise two months earlier lacrosses own son was kidnapped the killer and the boy has yet turn up anywhere lacrosse knows his killers work and he knows that the man is still out there somewhere trying continue their game it would not be fair reduce everything that is wrong switchback quaids presence but it is pretty good place start there is reason lacrosse feels like an intruder in the narrative instead of its vital center as dramatic actor dennis quaid possesses exactly one facial expression and one vocal intonation we can tell lacrosse is determined because his face is perpetual tightjawed sourpuss pucker we can tell he is grim because every word comes out in an eastwoodesque rasp more flexible performer might have given weight the character pulling the audience into his haunted intensity making switchback _his_ quaid merely looks annoyed and slightly constipated it is tough become emotionally invested in characters turmoil when it looks like all he really needs is big bowl of bran flakes even without quaid it does not appear that switchback would have stayed on course the early scenes between leto and glover have lively energy building our curiosity over man the taciturn kid or his gregarious benefactor is the real threat unfortunately stuart tips his hand far too early in the game both through the pitch of the individual performances and the facts he chooses reveal once the mystery of the killers identity is dispatched the interaction between leto and glover becomes stale and predictable in fact stale and predictable describes the direction that switchback takes in general falling back on fartoocommon devices like cats jumping out of nowhere climactic fistfight on board freight train and edgy law enforcement agents it is too bad stuart was not willing spend more time sheriff olmstead far and away the most interesting and appealing character in the played atypical restraint lee ermey he is wonderful unconventional hero who seems genuinely comfortable accepting the consequences of acting on his convictions focusing on the olmstead would have signaled filmmaker willing take few risks his casting and storytelling instead stuart places his trust in name star who cannot carry the material maybe next time he will throw away that one crucial page in the script the one where the grimly determined fbi agent wanders onto the scene muck up perfectly good story

gregg arakis the doom generation was possibly the very worst ever made so why did see his latest teen bisexual angst opus first of all some of the reviews were fairly positive also the cast consisting of cameos from dozens of washed up ex tv stars including christopher knight eve plumb shannen doherty and david leisure was promising last of all wanted give arraki one more chance mean the guy cannot be that untalented can he the answer that question is three letters long nowhere follows the character dark on his wild and odd journey through los angeles since arraki does not know how make anything coherent it is hard describe the plot let us just say that dark spends the bulk of the movie whining that his girlfriend will not make commitment him and jealous because she sleeps around other guys and girls the only remotely compelling storyline involves sarah lassez as teen who has chance encounter famous tv star he turns out be nice guy who does not care for fame and wishes he could walk down the street without being mobbed fans this story has shocking twist and tragic end that did not see coming it is the first time ever felt any compassion for character created arraki and this can be attributed the appealing performance of lassez thought maybe arraki was improving in his craft he works better the camera this time around especially in the early scenes halfway through the did not necessarily find myself enjoying the but it seemed like considerable improvement on the doom generation then as the movie went on arraki loses all sensibility and introduces us exploding heads twisted sex games and alien abductions it is sad because he almost actually had some decent material here but he ruined it his usual in your face am such renegade maverick filmmaker look what can do attitude the performances are generally better than in the doom generation is not saying much at least we do not have suffer jonathan am the most hideous man in america schaech we are however treated another round of james am more wooden than keanu duval sarah lassez gives the best performance in the and kathleen robertson formerly of and now arrakis wife and rachel true are talented actresses caught up in this mess of the tv star cameos john ritter is the most interesting as deranged right wing tv evangelist if prefer nowhere the doom generation it is only in the way that would prefer being assassinated than receive constant physical torture maybe greg arraki does not want you like his characters maybe he wants laugh and make fun of those of us who try care about them maybe he just wanted piss me off if so he was successful

sometimes when decide write short story or poem think of title first and then think of subject go it it seems that the makers of disturbing behavior had similar train of thought when it came the title sequence would not be surprised if couple of guys got together and created the opening credits and then someone saw it and made up story go along it the title sequence is so good so ominous and original that it had me engrossed before the picture even began of course my attention dwindled shortly into the disturbing behavior like so many thrillers starts off interesting and ends up laughably ridiculous it is teen horror no interesting violence or sex it is suspense no suspense it is an evil small town story no story speak of it is disaster listless and uninspired disaster that just barely misses onestardom because of few good sequences mercifully short running time and one terrific set of opening credits our main man is fellow named steve clark blandly played jimmy marsden he moves small town his family after tragically his brother shoots himself steve is very upset about the untimely death of his brother we learn this through strange homevideo like nightmares that he has occasionally the big trial for steve is of course fit in at school and make new friends marsden looks like your stereotypical jock down the last detail so he seems poor casting choice for social reject as social reject he falls in some pretentious dopesmoking philosophers gavin nick stahl and rachel katie holmes gavin informs steve that the local group of jocks known as the blue ribboners are actually bunch of zombies assimilating new members into their group while sporadically killing innocent people so it is up our group of mismatched protagonists solve the mystery and do something about it the end of it all something has happened and things have been explained but the still does not make any sense disturbing behavior was written scott rosenberg have seen his name around recently he was one of the toucheruppers on the armageddon script and imagine that for the most part he knows what he is doing when it comes screenwriting he did however have complete lapse in judgement when he got the idea for this and then decided actually take the time write it out evil small town films are pretty common the last one phantoms is also dismal failure but it takes lot of skill make the formula work rosenbergs script is complete mess lacking in even the most basic attempts at characterization and it makes no sense nor is their any purpose when things are finally explained there is supposed be an element of surprise when we see what is happening the jocks but the never explains exactly what is happening they get strapped chairs microchip is inserted into their eyes and poof they become sexcrazed superviolent machinelike creatures the doctor responsible for all this dr caldicott bruce greenwood must be pretty nuts for thinking that this kind of behavior is step up from the way high school jocks actually behave or perhaps this is the only realistic element in the much of the writing is simply bad and rosenberg has no intuition when it comes the way high school kids act in one terrible scene gavin explains steve all of the high school cliques while pointing them out in the cafeteria up front should say that in four years of high school did not eat in the cafeteria even once that aside the various social groups he points out are general uninteresting and poorlyshown for instance he points the nerds who are all wearing glasses and playing their laptops it is such an obvious cliche that cannot believe rosenberg even bothered most of the dialogue is forced no one says bite me anymore and none of the scenes have any degree of wit this picture is not inspired and most scenes flop from one the other no sense of momentum or energy the blame for this can be placed on director david nutter who apparently likes his films dry horror films should at least exploit violence but this one is shockingly timid there are few good scenes though such as an interesting trip through an insane asylum this is however the most forced scene in the for how our heroes get there or why they bother are things we never learn also liked the school janitor character played william sadler he has few lines that are surprisingly thoughtprovoking the acting is largely waste of talent marsden is as said bland thought not particularly bad bruce greenwood is shamelessly wasted stahl and holmes both show they have talent but the direction is not good enough hone in on their skills stahls performance seems more like parody of high school potheads none of these characters expand beyond their one dimension and frankly watching cardboard cutouts of human beings run down hallways while screaming just is not all that cool disturbing behavior is wreck of and it started out wreck before shooting even began am surprised there were producers who read this script and thought that it would make good or that it would make lot of money at the box office it is not boring or even blatantly awful but it is an uninspired lump of it sure starts off nicely but the regression into total absurdity is so consistent that the very last scene is outright laughable so if you go see this take my advice appreciate the credit sequence and pray it never ends

written david schow and john shirley based on the comic book series and comic book strip james obarr cast brandon lee ernie hudson michael wincott david patrick kelly rochelle davis and jon polito mpaa rating presumably for rape language and violence running time minutes looks like he zigged when he should have zagged ernie hudson as police officer commenting on suspicious death comic book translations are notorious tricky anyone up for doublebill of the punisher and captain america and the crow proves no exception despite gross of good intentions brandon lees final does not fly very high the story opens on halloween eve better known as devils night wilmingtonasdetroit is in flames and the police are tending at least one murder young rockmusicianturnedpavementartist eric draven lee found on sidewalk sixstories below the apartment he was thrown from the cops are also upstairs administering aid his fiance who was assaulted and raped and not necessarily in that order she dies the perps escape and exactly one year later draven rises from the grave wreak revenge sound familiar unlike charles bronson whose only known superpower involves an inability refrain from filming death wish sequels lees character has supernatural strength and amazing agility and can even reheal from gunshot wounds faster than robert patrick in terminator his side is his crow the presumable source of his powers as related in the narration wearing what appears be alice coopers leftover makeup lee is plopped into an underlit urban landscape that was obviously modeled after batman and blade runner but no number of redlit rainsoaked streets can compensate for cheap fx that make the crow seem closer darkman than batman the glaring miniatures should show better on video though nod darkman is an insult sam raimi though because alex proyas cannot decent action scene save his life his two best setpieces some banzai boardroom butchery and cool church roof sword fight are also undercut the awful editing of dov hoenig and scott smith blame said editors for the films frightful flashbacks as well but the pace is quick thank god and every goodideaturnedbad is over before it begins the cast is better than it should be ernie hudson is good choice as friendly policeman and he gets off most of the films funnier lines newcomer rochelle davis does well as both the narrator and dravens scrappy ward jon polito has small succulent role as pungent pawnbroker and michael wincott makes distinct impression as longhaired mr big whose collection of ancientswords makes him seem like he walked into the from the trailer highlander iii there can be only one finally there is brandon lee son of bruce lee and yearold risingstar who was fatally shot during shooting lee had four films his name kung fu the movie laser mission showdown in little toyko and rapid fire and the crow would have been nice feather in his belt and that is about it there is nothing great from him here just good performance that owes as much presence as ability when the echo of that gunshot finally fades watching the crow should prove an even less remarkable experience despite healthy dose of humor and some surprising sincerity the crow is still just couple notches above its straighttovideo brethren for now maybe it is an appropriate eulogy an actor who could only get better

synopsis sullen julie james still haunted nightmares of the killer ben willis from know what you did last summer perks up when her new best friend karla wilson wins trip for four the bahamas arriving at the start of the hurricane season julie and karla run around in very tight clothing and realize they have walked into trap set the rainslickered slasher huge hook for hand comments may be showing some pop culture illiteracy here but have never seen an episode of the fox tv series party of five am only vaguely aware of the show is premise and my knowledge of it comes from brief commercials halfpaid attention while watching the tube party of five do know however seems be the starting ground for actresses in the teen horror genre neve campbell scream queen of the and star of scream scream and the craft is regular of the show so too is jennifer love hewitt lo and behold following in the footsteps of campbell hewitt now has horror franchise of her own the know what you did last summer line though the original released last year was watchable enough this insipid sequel had me looking at the theaters glowing red exit sign longingly throughout jennifer love hewitt is very goodlooking young leading lady however unlike neve campbell hewitt struggles acting she just is not convincing in this and she was not in the original either this puts many young males including myself in paradoxical quandary she is very attractive but the annoying spoiled valley girltype character she tries play here is annoying the extreme and ruins many of the scenes emphasize exploitatively her figure add the mix the equally pleasant yet irritating brandy another rising teen tv star and you get one frustrated male audience have spent so much time on hewitt and brandy for reason still know what you did last summer though cashing in on the success of the original ultimately serves as vehicle for these two young actresses nothing else here is original or interesting this movie in fact makes other recent soso horror films like urban legend and john carpenters vampires seem like stunning works of high art still know relies heavily on tired slasher cliches an isolated location storm parentless teenagers false alarm nightmares lots of bluelighted darkness scenes garbed slasher who walks around in the background without the characters seeing him knives and other sharp instruments lying around everywhere etc you get the picture the entire audience knows all the secondary characters introduced in the are going receive the business end of the killers hook they may as well have huge targets painted on them like scream and its numerous knockoffs these secondary characters are supposed serve as comic relief unfortunately still knows characters are not all that funny in particular one character chainweedsmoking guy is obnoxiously annoying and certainly does not die soon enough the death scenes the way are relatively violent for theatrically released horror several of them are uncomfortable watch and they reminded me of the sickening gore scenes in hellraiser bloodline truly sadistic movie this too did not help the supposed humor still know was shooting for and what is the deal the slasher himself know that the slasher is not particularly intelligent genre but ben willis has got go down as one of the most silly slashers in mainstream horror come on the guy looks like the gortons fisherman and his gruff voice makes him sound like disney pirate though his lightninglit appearances ellicited muchneeded laughter in the theater his appearance borders on the absurd in the horror and that is really saying something so all that is left talk about here is jennifer love hewitt and brandy both prance about in tightfitting revealing outfits or in various states of undress yet neither of them ever actually do nude scene hewitt however does do postshower scene in her thin bathrobe is quite titillating this scene alone made this onestar turkey earn two stars under my rating system otherwise hewitt and brandy both grate on the nerves early in the for instance brandy wins the trip the bahamas she and hewitt jump around and scream and screech for what seems like forever needed extrastrength tylenol after that part oh and the films conclusion talk about repetitive people who saw know what you did last summer will predict still knows ending at least minutes before it happens boring saw this movie my brother at the local downtown movie theater admission is only one dollar on wednesdays and we often go see bad movies on these days just ridicule them it is usually fun thing do along the rest of the audience who do not seem mind participating in mass mystery science theater type viewing still know what you did last summer however produced several lengthy uncomfortable silences from the audience underscoring how bad it really is if it were not for the main actresses revealing wardrobes would have had very very hard time sitting through this lame sequel cannot imagine trying watch it on video horror films seem times better in theater because they rely heavily on audience participation and would not recommend it people unless they are horror fanatics or huge fans of hewitt and brandy read on website somewhere that another sequel is already in the works what depressing thought hewitt apparently needs spend more time on tv figuring out how act rated this contains lots of violence several gory scenes and couple nubile horny teenagersthough the sex act itself is always thwarted would say this is unsuitable for kids but teens would not have problem sitting through it especially since they obviously compose the films target audience

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned assess alex coxs the winner as loser would be so indolent it would be derisive it would be glib it would be dismissive it would be entirely accurate rarely have seen as excruciatingly annoying as the winner wouldbe comedy quickly proves be tedious unfunny and unengaging the attempts be fresh and quirky utilising myriad of colourful characters weave its absurd tale but appears overlook the fact that nobody in the is remotely interesting and that all of the characters are essentially preposterous the is set in las vegas and the focus in the winner is on philip vincent donofrio an aloof naive young man blessed the odd gift of luck he virtually cannot lose at the tables despite this prodigious talent philip is perpetually mournful and quite indifferent about his gambling fortunes neither taking joy in his winnings nor having the foresight mask his abilities consequently he becomes an easy target for those who would ride upon his coattails and take advantage of his talent louise rebecca demornay sultry lounge singer insinuates herself into philips life for the purpose of swindling him while philips estranged brother and conveniently louises exbeau johnny michael madsen arrives on the scene add some colour johnny also happens be toting their fathers corpse sans one hand meanwhile philip is also befriended trio of lowrent opportunists frank whaley billy bob thornton and richard edson who have every intention of taking advantage of their new buddys gift the dice serenely overlooking the chaos from behind the scenes is the casino owner delroy lindo it is probably not giving away much reveal that his role in the winner is essentially that alluded at the end of the flashy sequence in martin scorseses casino details the organization hierarchy of casinos operations he is the eye in the sky it could be maddening endure whose central protagonist is so oblivious of the ongoing blatant manipulation but fortunately this is not the case in the winner if only because our sadsack hero is such sap not even remotely sympathetic or compelling it becomes impossible root for philip or even care about his fate and the wouldbe swindlers of philips fortunes are all drawn out as such ludicrous transparent buffoons entirely unimaginative and uninteresting schemes that one watches the winner complete sense of disinterest it is shame as the winner features talented cast mr donofrio is an underrated and gifted actor huge range mr lindo has remarkable screen presence infiltrates every in he appears mr madsen ms demornay and mr whaley have all done good work in the past none of the actors in the winner are in top form here and this will not likely be prized addition their respective resumes director alex cox does what he can wendy riss screenplay and it is his credit that this at no point feels like an adaptation of stage play was startled learn that the winner was in fact based upon one while tedious the is wellpaced and does not meander but it would be nearimpossible task for mr cox or for that matter virtually any other director that comes mind overcome the films widespread shortcomings in plot and characterization his credit my understanding is that he has chosen distance himself from the project in acknowledgement of its deficiencies caught the winner at its world premiere at the toronto international festival in september and in fairness it is entirely possible that the has been extensively revamped since then due the lacklustre audience reaction generated there were more walkouts on this than any of the others screened be honest though could not begin isolate what could be done this improve it assume that throwing the whole thing out and starting over is out of the question the winner has apparently played on cable television in the united states and is beginning limited theatrical release at the time of this writing the has nice upbeat score pray for rain but am honestly not being facetious when state that the thing treasured most about my screening of the winner was the bag of popcorn upon was munching

filmmaking in mm from technical acting stands out even more when you consider the star writer and supporting castall reputable but joel schumacher and his brand of unlikable filmmaking strikes again like paul schrader schumacher has his moments but they are few and far far between basically this picture is crap and no one should pay see it why not walk out well this would not be thorough review about thoroughly bad movie heres why you should spend your money on dog food or gum instead of mm first thingif you do not heed my advice then understand what you are about see before you even think about paying good money for this crud it is not easy watch did not know the details of the story beforehand but at least my ignorance can help others now the ha plot revolves around tom welles nicolas cage as surveillance expert and private investigator rich old woman discovers snuff in her late husbands safe she calls welles and hires him try and find out if the young girl it had be young girl did not it schumacher who appears be murdered in the really is dead she is horrified that her husband would have owned such in mm of course and just wants welles snoop around without police interference see what he can find familyman welles agrees against better judgement or any concrete leads even after cringing and grimacing at the sight of the grotesque murder let me backtrack for moment see snuff in the james bond diamonds are forever tiffany case asks whether he prefers brunettes redheads bonds response is that it does not really matter as long as collars and cuffs match well collars and cuffs do not match in the real blonde what might have sounded good on paper ends up as largely unfunny meandering comedy on screen the supposedly satire of the superficiality of soap operas and the modeling business is wafer thin it plays like an ally mcbeal episode dragged out the nth degree replete few unnecessary fantasy sequences writerdirector tom dicillo manages the material as if poking fun at daytime dramas is fresh idea it is not the only surprise here is that the talented dicillo could make familiar terrain so dreary matthew modine plays joe struggling actor waiting tables in order pay the rent he is no agent and no credits since he is too proud take on roles in commercials or soap operas that is not really acting he tells his girlfriend of six years mary catherine keener whom he bickers constantly about sex but they need the money so joe finally agrees take part in madonna video but it is not really madonna starring in the video but lookalike played elizabeth berkley still trying jumpstart her career after showgirls this points out how artificial this whole business is one supposes dicillo has referred the real blonde as offkilter but an interesting combination of all sorts of stuff the wanders all over the place without getting anywhere is remarkably on kilter and perhaps the single exception of the alwayslikable modine who is not afraid stand around in very unattractive bathing suit surrounded hunks the entire cast is vague and uninteresting catherine keener who is appeared in dicillos previous three films including the brilliant living in oblivion is at her most annoying in the real blonde look at her closely she really cannot act at all her reactions are all wrong almost always out of sync her costars she reacts too soon or too late lines and situations she moves her eyes or her mouth far too much she frowns she yells she babblesshe blows chunks maxwell caulfield plays joes actorwaiter buddy bob the one obsessed dating natural blonde bobs personality not mention caulfields acting ability parallels that of the character he plays on the soap opera passion crest stiff and uninteresting maybe that is the point daryl hannah is dim and uninteresting as the real blonde of the title soap dish who beds bob both on and offcamera hannah looks about fifty in this movie she is only why is that almost all the women in the wear tops that show their nipples why is that marlo thomas plays an uninteresting fashion photographer kathleen turner plays an uninteresting talent agent buck henry plays an uninteresting shrink christopher lloyd plays an uninteresting caterer and so on the best parts of the the real blonde are the beginning and the end brief scenes of an elderly woman losing and then finding her dog there is more depth and sincerity in single closeup of her expressive face than in the entire while this contrast is supposedly meant highlight the shallowness of the other characters lives the only thing that makes shallow and superficial interesting is if it is funny

if were plot graph of year against movieplotridiculity for movies you will probably see line constant gradient now if were plot that same graph for the movies that the michael bayjerry bruckheimer has made over the last years that line would be exponential in growth the team started out the will smith vehicle bad boys was no more than hr long actionmusicvideo nevertheless entertaining then came the rock where audiences flocked see nicholas cage team up sean connery against some terrorizing general fighting over some stupid cause conair was ridiculousy dumb in its premise but it did have fun moments and who can forget the nursery rhyme sang that psycho killer played steve buscemi while these movies worked because there was something better coverup the dirt armageddon does not very much like deep impact meteor is heading towards earth and they did not realize it until days from impact deep impact settled the modest meteor size as large as the city of new york but armageddon just had be bigger well about the size of texas that kinda meteor whould probably knock earth out of its orbit the panic of this sighting spurs the idea of landing people on the meteor drill it then nuke it sounds familiar and who better do such job than harry stamper bruce willis your very own oildriller extraordinaire and his team of machomisfits nursing the tagline there as not nothin on this planet that harry cannot drill in that days harrys group was split into teams trained for deepspace flight and finally blasted into space in special drilling vehicles on new space shuttles the main relationship drama of armageddon is formed within the relationship of harry j and grace give you an idea j works for harry and loves grace harrys daughter the problem is harry hates see his daughter hanging around some scruffy grunt like himself for the rest of her life so while j and harry struts it out grace is place in position where she is unable take sides so she remains seated in the nasa control tower crying over both of them in about of the movie the human elements this movie tries inject proves be nothing more than just an excuse for more slowmos and goldtinted photography the anguish of the world is potrayed scenes of people praying running for their lives or just sitting still staring at the sky sounds fine right know but it looks too out of place on screen too staged if you were ask yourself what is the difference between armageddon and rb music video you would probably just said the music not surprising since michael bay is child of that industry and has actually managed transpose his mtv skills screen successfully his foray into armageddon just proves that he does not when stop well there is really nothing much sum up here the stockaitkenwaterman of movies have projected their artform into ridiculity beyond the plane believability where people still accept even if they did not believe deep impact was ridiculous in most aspects and believe the makers know this the thing is they decided shroud myth and fantasy purely believable human tale of suffering and coming in terms ones problems ultimately brought it above the ashes it had initially put itself in armageddon is an overcrowded loud messy preposterously manipulative waste of money and deserves remain in that same pile of ash if you have planned watched this over deep impact because of liv tyler bruce willis or the tagline from the makers of the rock please catch deep impact before it finishes its run it may be the only meteor worth watching in longlong time if you have see it please bring earplugs and some aspirins for the vertigo expect armageddon lds retail at at carrefour come release time gee even that is not worth it

tina fetch me the axe favourite book of mine called the golden turkey awards relates the story that when mommie dearest was unleashed upon unsuspecting audiences back in paramount soon realised they had problem on their hands it was not just the films disappointing box office performance indeed in the coming years some people would be going back see it two three even six times no the main problem was that what was intended as serious biopic of screen queen joan crawford was turning into the laugh riot of the year in desperate attempt capitalise on this unexpected turn of events some publicity hacks dreamed up outrageous print advertisements screaming mommie dearest the biggest mommie of them all executives at paramount were appalled and soon had the ads withdrawn but it was all too late mommie dearest was already cementing its place in camp cinema history unfortunately faye dunaways energetic at times ridiculously overthetop performance is about the films only redeeming feature based on daughter christina crawfords trashy biography mommie dearest chronicles series of mainly private events in the life of her moviestar mother if you believe this movie it was life was racked obsession lonliness child abuse and rampant egomania the begins crawford adopting two children and concludes in the office of her lawyer where her now grownup daughter and son find out they have been left out of their mothers will joan always wanted her kids be able fend for themselves you see but that is about the only thread in the narrative that manages survive the films end the script laboured over four writers bad sign in itself is poorly connected series of episodes that builds little dramatic momentum frank perrys direction is no more than competent and dunaways bitchy lines aside the dialogue is flat and uninvolving in fairness the films second half ditches some of the cartoon hysterics and does develop degree empathy for its characters when the adult christina moves out of home into her own modest dwelling joan visits and keeps in touch not helping her financially but encouraging christinas own acting and career ambitions crawford does seem care about her daughter but you can sense the emotional distance and feel some of their pain you also get glimpses of what the could have been in the hands of better writers ah but there is dunaways performance and what delicious piece of campery it often is having just been sacked her studio after run of box office duds crawford storms home late at night and proceeds go ballistic in the garden she has the maid drag the kids out of bed come down and clean up the mess she is making spotting young tree she does not like the look of she turns the trembling christina and utters the immortal line tina fetch me the axe she proceeds enthusiastically dismember the poor sapling in the films most outrageous scene joan realises that some of her daughters clothes are hanging on wire coat hangers oh dear sounds like the perfect excuse for another temper tantrum does not it this time she gives her daughter horrible beating while delivering another classic outburst no wire hangers ever and later when the board of her late husbands company pepsi cola tries divest her of her directorship she displays superb grasp of business etiquette jumping her feet and roaring do not fuck me fellas oh joy something of camp classic then but if that is not you are cup of tea then mommie dearest does not have too much recommend it better you see the real crawford in the women mildred pierce or whatever happened baby jane great films distinguished great performances and far more eloquent testament this great woman than frank perrys shrieking piece of tabloid froth

phil radmar jao has hairy problem his beard is growing so rapidly that he has shave every hour he recently met the author of nonfiction book on lycanthropy also referred in the movie as werewolfism and phil now believes that his problem is that he has become werewolf using enough chains and handcuffs be hit at sadomasochists convention he ties himself in at night lest his urges overcome him and phil is just one of the many quirky characters that inhabit shopping for fangs made on pittance the features an almost exclusively asianamerican cast as directed quentin lee and justin lin the movie is so amateurishly bad that it could almost be parody of indie films jeanne chin plays katherine meek and softspoken wife who worries that her husband is unhappy her because she is not giving him enough sex we know this through the endless scenes of her confessing her sins real and imagined her therapist as her husband jim clint jung plays muscle man macho crudeness the picture is filled stereotypes there is mysterious loudmouthed waitress big platinum blonde wig who brags everyone she meets that she is lesbian she spends most of the movie putting the moves on her favorite customer gay guy and the lone white major role the author on werewolfism has wildly unkempt orangey blonde curly hair from its opening scene of an attempted rape at knifepoint its easy guess ending twist the script rarely has anything offer the story is so minimally developed that it feels almost like the actors were adlibbing one can only hope that the directors next will have some substance and some credible acting shopping for fangs runs it is rated for sex violence and profanity and would be fine for older teenagers
