ladies and gentlemen payback is the most expensive episode of the equalizer have ever seen gibson plays porter burglar shot and left for dead his wife deborah kara unger in an alltoobrief cameo and partner henry after successful heist as morgue attendant sets about removing the bullets from porters back porter miraculously springs back life he makes it his mission as walking dead man without conscience exact revenge on those who screwed him and reclaim his share of the loot in running gag porter demands but everybody mishears him and assumes he is after the entire haul in his travels or travails porter encounters several other onenamed villainous cretins like fairfax james coburn as whitehaired millionaire thief and carter kristofferson as brownhaired millionaire thiefthe kingpin of the obligatory operation helgelands was recut mel the producer is devoid of an imperative dime store charm the novelty of seeing big movie star mercilessly dispatching criminals wears off quickly because the bad guys can only be differentiated their coifs and because mels schtick does not evolve from act onehe is the terminator stranded in plot without scifi hook keep us interested after the initial sadistic thrill is gone payback should have been called playback it is minute loop of the same short sequence mel want my money anonymous villain no mel shoots gun anonymous villain dies mel meets up his hooker friend bello second verse same as the first it is not porters singlemindedness that robs the of snap crackle and pop as character who has already died once he has nothing lose and so much gain the movie lacks danger the only thing porter is in jeopardy of is putting the audience sleep payback has gritty metallic look it that also becomes monotonous its cinematography would be more appropriate in one of those bleak urban psychodramas that come out of england every couple of months director of photography ericson core should have been fired early on for lighting bello so vavavavoom in permanant midnight look like potato in gregg allman wig analyze such mediocrity is grant payback far more attention than it deserves perhaps only someone as experienced antagonistsasprotagonists as tarantinolook what he did the similar heroless botchedrobbery tale reservoir dogscould have pulled off this material loose remake of john boormans point blank the movie presents us the conventions of pulp fiction all women are femme fatales even the cops are in on it etc and crosses them the conventions of cheesy tv crime melodramas death is never in the cards for the main character etc but transcends neither

when you have run out of old tv shows turn into movies guess you try video games why did go see mortal kombat annihilation the quest seek an answer this query may prove better movie that the one just saw this was bunch of fighting yelling special effects and bad acting set an oppressive techno music soundtrack the plot is fairly simple portal has opened between our world and the outworld allowing evil forces commanded shao kahn brian thompson wreak havoc and attempt destroy humanity the good guys led sorcerer rayden james remar and human mortal liu kang robin shou must take the fight outworld where the fate of both worlds will be determined heres the catch they must reunite princess katana talia soto who is on the good side her resurrected mother queen sindel musetta vander who is on the bad side for their love for each other will close the portal and ensure humanitys safety for another generation how this is supposed work still have no idea but liked katanas line knew love would keep us together since that captain and tennille song ran through my head and got good laugh there are some seriously stupid things in this movie take for example transportation system utilizes the inner winds generated earths magma flows you get in this metal ball transports you through underground tunnels really fast how fast as katana says you will be moving so fast it will be as if you are not moving at all what later sonya blade sandra hess goes find jax lynn red williams otherwise known as saber on tvs american gladiators at medical research facility on the island of oahu how do we know this is where she went there is sign on the facilitys perimeter fence that reads medical research facility oahu hawaii remember this is not caption but an actual sign guess the location is on there for all those medical researchers who keep forgetting where they are there is lot of major flipping action too the first encounter between good and evil shows kahn and rayden swiftly arching though the air toward one another do they land and immediately get into the fighting does one of them land first and catch the other off guard do they collide in midair no apparently they flip toward each other so they can talk without having yell from far away why did they need those metal balls travel everyone could have just flipped from point point i have admit the fight scenes are pretty good although you can tell they are heavily enhanced digital effects and fly wires allowing the characters surpass the limits of the human body and the laws of physics the movies thrills are derived from these scenes and most of the audience responses are on the visceral level when someone gets trashed really badly ouch was the most common expletive heard when screened this one you could tell that the filmmakers knew in advance that fights not plot would be the main draw since dialog is apparently in the just get from one fight the next it seems that is all there is in this movie maybe it is as had mentioned the acting is bad there is not one solid performance in the although williams as jax was pretty funny after fight between sonya and one of the bad guys degenerates into female mud wrestling jax says you look good in mud no really you do remar plays rayden an inconsistency makes it hard take his character seriously and shou is relatively emotionless as liu kang brian thompson who has played good guys bad guys and even an alien on tvs the xfiles but always some musclebound behemoth is your average evil demigod but it is more the scripts fault than his own that he does not have anything original say the one really impressive thing about this movie is that there is not one swear word in the whole hour and half another thing should be noted is that for all its punching and kicking blood only appears in one scene all in all mortal kombat annihilation is loud violent shallow and marketed toward kids hey just like the video game

the swooping shots across darkened rooftops suggest very tim burton movie but alas no caped crusader descends save this instead it is skeletal housemaid julia roberts who must bear witness this unfortunate retelling of dr jekyll and mr hyde for few fleeting maddening moments director stephen frears dangerous liaisons gets everything just right the tone the colors the characters all the ingredients make mostpowerful potion out of valerie martins bestselling novel yet it fizzles too quickly the volatile mixture losing potency from the very first scene casting is large part of the problem the story all but collap ses around ms roberts she does not have the range for this kind of drama her accent also comes and goes though it is nowhere near as glaring as the total lack of chemistry between her and costar john malkovich he looks the same in both of his roles an incredible fact that is missed everyone in the story the very british supporting cast including michael gambon and george cole gives credibility the smaller parts glenn close also appears as madam that the good doctor calls upon her performance is as close intentional camp as the movie ever gets and as bonus offers likely peek at her upcoming cruella de ville in the liveaction dalmantions the biggest botch in mary reilly is suspense there is none no terror no tension nothing without any weight wit or wonder propel the story the viewer is left little more do than pay attention the period detail few buckets of blood and stuart craigs fabulously dreary production design all of gets old after about an hour at point recommend leaving the pacing in the secondhalf is especially abominable if you do stick it through your sole reward is halfhokey special effect depicting the infamous transformation mr frears reportedly recut his several times missing several release dates in the process obviously no one advised him throw up his hands and just turn the whole damned thing over mel brooks blucher mary reilly is the second robert louis stevenson story of the month after muppet treasure island perhaps mr frears should consult brian henson on future projects daresay that even ms piggy is better choice for certain roles than julia roberts and she does have great chop

guilt guilt is something felt while watching basic instinct for the ninth time the penultimate a thriller basic instinct made my last few teenage years worth living but know so well that it is terrible made terrible director incapable of feeling guilt verhoeven went on make the even more offensive showgirls and on november seventh unleashed starship troopers innocent moviegoers like me who cannot control the urge see giant bug movies the pic begins the most unintentional laugh of the year simple white on black title card reads starship troopers my friends and speculated that the night before the prints were shipped verhoeven realized he forgot the credits is this how hundred million dollar movie should open were the rest of the that subdued starship troopers is about group of white blondhaired himbos and bimbos who all have spanish last names they graduate high school join the military and then rather curiously decide travel an alien planet and destroy all lifeforms on that planet the story is so incomprehensible and told so bombastically it is akin minutes of someone screaming punishments at you in foreign tongue aside club lovers will be happy know that dance music has not changed in the future one plus starship troopers contains some very funny sequences specifically the newsreels of the future hysterically funny actually but the cynicism of these reports left me curious as whether verhoeven felt pessimistic about the story in between the storytelling lacks focus say the least the politics of the are scary the actions of the major female characters are dictated their outofcontrol libidos there is even creepy sex scene the lovely dina meyer makes out nude the sickening van dien while half her face is covered her opaque sweater just the way he seems like it use the term sickening because van dien is the least appealing actor have encountered in big budget picture all chiseled features and machismo he even barks eulogy at funeral like military orders of course verhoevens probably the one blame and perhaps am jealous because am so disgusting at any rate movie called starship troopers should not be about sex exactly ten years ago verhoeven made robocop was about nothing but skillfully made and oddly moving and rrated despite its goofy premise maybe it is asking too much for verhoeven make pgmovie thenhe is master of insipid violence however ten year old boys would adore starship troopers if they could see it

what is your favorite new york moment this ones climbing the charts starring john cusack kate beckinsale eugene levy molly shannon directed peter chelsom rated pg there is no doubt that of romantic comedies follow distinct pattern guy sees girl guy wants girl guy goes through unreasonable obstacles get girl guy gets girl in rare cases the genders are flipped predictability is given rarely though is romantic comedy as cheap as obvious or as pointless as serendipity that uses its theme as an excuse for its plot contrivances lightweight does not begin describe it this is like antigravity it begins in new york city bloomingdales product placement that rivals cast aways fedex for sheer blatancy jonathan trager john cusack and sara thomas kate beckinsale both go for the same pair of gloves after going through the perfunctory motions jonathan gets keep the gloves and the two of them go out for ice cream followed ice skating jonathan falls hard and sara is charmed when she writes her name and number down on piece of paper truck rumbles and blows it out of her hand she takes this as sign from fate that they should not be together jonathan is flabbergasted pacify him she comes up an idea jonathan will write his number on dollar bill she will promptly spend when she gets home she will write her name and number inside book love in the time of cholera and sell it used bookstore if the bill gets back her or the book him it will mean that they are meant be together three years later both sara and jonathan are now engaged other love interests both realize they are not content both go looking for the other what happens now is so absurd that am almost tempted recommend the for the sake of seeing it the two of them run circles around each other in set of incredible coincidences that would describe as contrivances if it were not for the ohsocleverly dismissing that criticism building its plot around serendipity of course since the movie is about fate the screenwriter can do anything he damn well pleases am not buying it there is no suspense in any of this because we know exactly what is going happen but serendipity insists on drilling its purportedly adorable nonstory into our heads instead of will they meet the question we are asking is when will they meet already make matters worse every coincidence is telegraphed from mile away the last reel was bored enough actively look for signs that something else incredible was going happen cusack is fine and beckinsale at least is not saddled another lumbering clunky screenplay she is had bad luck what brokedown palace and pearl harbor on her resume just an inanely pointless one serendipity also relieves the tedium the amazing eugene levy who plays snarky bloomingdales salesman what is the interest in watching movie that spirals around and around predestined no pun intended conclusion serendipity wants tug at the heartstrings but it only tests our patience

i did not come into city of angels expecting greatness have never seen wim wenders wings of desire the classic movie upon city is loosely based then again have seen enough stories are based upon similar plot device the little mermaid both the disney version and the original folktale being among them that had some high expectations about the possible power such story of impossible love can hold unfortunately city of angels ended up fulfilling few of them the plot for those that could not tell from the previews revolves around the angel seth played an almost creepy intensity nicolas cage who in the midst of his angelic duties falls in love heart surgeon named maggie meg ryan in her most endearing performance since when harry met sally of course his being an angel prevents him from doing much about his love except appearing at random times talk her watch her buy groceries only disappear in the blink of an eye their love must remain unrequited unless seth decides make the ultimate sacrifice and become human using this framework as jumpingoff point the movie attempts veer through some heavy philosophical ruminations on the nature of desire the joys of being human and the definition of perfection the first half of the movie succeeds on most points cage excellently plays the eminently difficult role of an angel who does not know feelings so cannot really express preventing the character of seth from getting boring despite his limited repertoire of intent looks and hangdog expressions unfortunately cage takes the intensity too far sometimes and then seth comes across as more creepy than sensitive as maggie ryan manages be convincing as heart surgeon who has trouble coming terms her having lost patient on the operating table despite having done everything right her beauty unlike her unbearable cuteness in french kiss is mature intelligent and winning likewise some interesting ideas float around at the beginning of the when the camera pans through traffic jams and libraries and we get hear the thoughts of the random people who flash across the screen the audience experiences little of what it must be like be an angel the beautiful camera work shooting down onto the hectic world of los angeles from the improbable perches of the angels also gives us sense of the unique wonder angels feel the begins lose its way though when the focus tightens more and more on seth and maggie the grand angelic perspective gets lost except for some idly tossed lines about the incredible beauty of the world through an angels eyes the movie devolves into an examination of how seth cannot feel the world or more importantly he cannot feel maggie he cannot smell her hair feel her touch or taste the pears she eats this change in focus attempts capture the audience in seths intense longing but in doing so the conflict disappears if he wants maggie so badly then why does not her just make the leap and become human after all what is so great about being an angel sure you get sit on marlboro signs but what is that compared getting be meg ryan and from there once the yearning has been established and the romantic denouement must occur it is all downhill the philosophy becomes heavyhanded the dialogue pedestrian when it tries be deep and the plot twists simply attempt yank few more tears into the audiences hankie it is the last thirty minutes of the movie then that wrecks the feel like the writer pulling out all the melodramatic stops has robbed me of what could have been genuinely powerful movie experience on both the romantic and the philosophical level came out feeling robbed seeing so much possibility in becoming nothing could go on longer but do not want ruin the end revealing any of the cheap plot devices the relies on city of angels then is paradox it is wellacted particularly look for dennis franz cutting against typecasting as happygolucky fallen angel wellfilmed and based on wonderful idea all these possibilities though are what make the so unredeemable when the closing credits come up

plot summary the year is the ozone layer has long since gone and the earth is now protected from radiation shield invented connor mccleod the shield although saving lives has made the atmosphere hot and humid connor is mortal and tired old man who has given up hope on returning from the opera one night connor is accosted the leader of terrorist organisation they have tried find out what the company that now runs the shield unit are covering up connor is then attacked two assassins sent katana from the planet zeist like zeitget it they fail and connor becomes immortal again chopping their heads off he then brings ramirez back life in glencoe in scotland both ramirez and connor are rebel leaders back on zeist and have been sent earth as punishment connor now has the option return being the last one but opts stay his new found immortality and fight find out about the company and the shield katana meanwhile fearing connor would return sets out himself kill the highlander if you have never seen it being fan of highlander and mr connery was in the cinema as soon as could see highlander ii the quickening wish it had been quicker feel whatever else you can say about bad script bad music etc if you sit just plain bored through most of it then nothing much else needs be said the was short but in my opinion only twelve minutes or so the time mr connery is on the screen for is worth watching the plot sounds little ridiculous but was willing give it chance maybe they could pull it off instead find that the characters have completely changed from those in the first it is as if they are different people the same names witness connor jumping into bed the leader of the resistance where is the attitude of who wants live forever when love must die gone the love subplot must have had footage cut out the highlander and ramirez both seemed aware of powers they had never mentioned before putting our heroes in deadly situations and then having them walk away because of some new power is very annoying still want know why connors coat becomes flame proof when he is immortal we are not given enough time on zeist believe in it nor are we told why advanced aliens still use swords kill why not dynamite or laser saws or just plain bullets followed quick chop the neck know the head needs come off but you could at least immobilise your opponent laser rifles first be fair one assassin tried this but he must be the worlds worst shot meanwhile connor develops lukeskywalkerlike powers of laser beam deflection as for bad guys we see rebellion on zeist crushed easier than grape and then the rest of the plot depends on katana being obsessed killing mccleod in case he returns zeist two assassins are sent presumably they are meant be good at killing but an aged connor kills them both no problems no more assassins are sent katana supposedly very powerful man goes himself kill connor has he no more assassins has he no better why was the rebellion crushed so easily then michael ironside is totally unconvincing bring back the kurgan he seems like cartoon character and really is not that evil just stupid and violent we see the trick of the chief nasty threatening child again and killing lots of innocents yet he still seems like no threat perhaps because he seems too stupid threaten connor or maybe because his two best assassins would not have been amiss larry curly and mo so much for plot and characters the music is atrocious it is at best intrusive and at worst annoying bring back queen there was an audible sigh of relief when connor played queen track in juke box believe this at least is be corrected for the american release the acting is at best flat except for mr connery lambert is uninteresting and when he delivered there can be only one this time around it just made me wish there had only been one highlander michael ironside is unconvincing sorry michael usually like you and everyone else was incredibly forgetable so why visually the is interesting at all times it has blade runner feel it and some of the special effects are quite stunning add this an irrepressible sean connery who smiles throughout the whole or is he smirking himself his lines and delivery might make the worthwhile had it not been so obvious that he cannot take the whole thing seriously at all but hey would have done it for million oh and agree previous reviewer she does look like sharon stone but believe it is her first incidentally there is line producer credited and hear rumours of highlander iii the wizard

cigarettes takes place on new years eve monica played martha plimpton is having huge new years party everyone in town is trying get there but some are caught up in other things this is the basic plot of cigarettes as we meet the characters headed towards the party we are sent into many subplots are unoriginal and not interesting at all this disappointed me greatly the should have been more about the party than the people trying get there in my opinion lucy played courtney love is kevin played paul rudd the two are in relationship that is more of friendship but starts blossom into something more than that this subplot is extremely boring and dull and am getting quite sick of plots like that janeane garofalo is involved in another subplot dealing kevin she plays ellie an exgirlfriend of kevins this subplot is completely waste of garofalos talent there was no point it at all and it was hardly even in the movie when lucy runs into bartender played ben affleck another subplot is formed the bartender is invited lucy come monicas party at the bar he runs into two more girls the girls are played angela featherstone and nicole parker but unfortunately due the terrible acting of both of them do not even remember their characters names ben affleck is good actor but his character does not go anywhere so he does not have much screen time give good performance featherstone and parker are horrible in their roles and they are part of the reason the is so bad christina ricci plays val and gaby hoffman plays stephie the two girls are trying get the party but are extremely lost they meet some guys and end up going around them all night this subplot was alright but it was quite annoying stephies accent hoffman did an okay job of acting but ricci did good she was underused considering she is such wonderful actress another subplot in the is the relationship between cindy played goldie hawns daughter and jack played jay mohr jack is an actor who does not care about the girls he goes out he just likes dates for one night and the next day he does not kate hudson is huge klutz she gets herself into very funny situations that are the funniest parts in the entire movie they are probably the only funny parts in the entire movie as well this subplot could have been used more mainly due hudsons performance mohr was not good but he was not bad he was just alright did not find acceptable there is not much say about the performances in the none of the characters are developed or shown enough really tell if the acting is good or not the only performances that can judge are christina riccis as always good performance kate hudsons funny role courtney loves mediocre performance and paul rudds annoying and overused performance was hoping for little more out of jaw mohr ben affleck casey affleck gaby hoffman dave chapelle and especially out of janeane garofalo the two strongest things in the were the great soundtrack and the original costumes martha plimpton and christina ricci had very different and original outfits made me feel like was in the year the soundtrack is full of tunes ranging from want candy tainted love the songs in the movie also helped create the feel that you were back in the during the often found myself asking the questions is there reason this is there any moral story is there point are any of the events going on in the necessary do care what lucy and kevin are going through the movie is extremely boring and the time they reached elevenoclock one hour before midnight could not wait for the movie be over the plot is okay but the subplots make it terrible maybe if the was about the party not about the people at the party it could have been lot better the bottom line just like slasher movie this comedy is just one too many

seem have glued myself myself starring jason biggs seann william scott chris klein thomas ian nichols allyson hannigan shannon elizabeth natasha lyonne tara reid mena suvari eugene levy jennifer coolidge directed b rogers rated american pie reunites the cast members from american pie in different setting instead of being high school seniors looking score before they graduate they are now past their first year of college and have gathered in beach house enjoy the summer of their lives jim jason biggs is still an insecure geek looking improve his performance oz chris klein is still the sweetest guy on the block having sickeningly saccharine phone conversations his studyingabroad girlfriend stifler seann william scott is still horny stoner kevin thomas ian nichols still has no personality and finch eddie kaye thomas still longs for stiflers mom have missed anyone so obviously not much has changed this is not problem provided that the movie boasts the rapidfire hilarity and unexpectedly true sentiment of the original but american pie is the very definition of sequelitis it is coarser yes and it pushes the envelope even more but its heart is not in it it is easy cash capitalize off the first films success but it would have been worthier investment prolong the franchise coming up something original part of the reason why the does not work think is that while in the original the kids quest for sex was comingofage stepping stone as much as an outlet for their horniness here everything has been cheapened they behave like those idiot frat boys who kill themselves drinking they have no motivation except for sex sex beer and sex that is not say that you cannot make decent comedy from that premise but it is one of american pie undoings missing too is the sweetness that permeated american pie the thiscouldbeyou quality of the main players here the characters are too aware of themselves as popculture icons and they are even more onenote stifler and finch are now caricatures while jim oz and kevin are forced make awkward selfdiscoveries at arbitrary moments none of them betraying what the writers think the audiences want see and then there is the soontobenotorious scene where jim superglues himself himself perfectly demonstrates yet another of the films ailments one that also permeated say it is not so director b rodgers debut there is fine line between comedy and abject humiliation and american pie is on the wrong side of it it is hard laugh at the characters when you are profoundly embarrassed for them shielded my eyes watching this more than have watching any horror movie if there is one redeeming factor american pie it is the inimitable eugene levy as jims dad who pops in on jim as he is about score and utters lines like your mother and have been known get frisky not so much anymore but and then when the girls parents walk in blurts out this must be your daughter did not get her name but hopefully my son did if only the rest of the movie had the wit and wisdom of levys performance this is an unworthy sequel grossfest that brought back the raunchy teen comedy the boxoffice of this onw should keep the genre going strong is disappointing the genre needs hiatus filmmakers are getting lazy

i will be the first admit it when you mention the book great expectations immediately begin experiencing flashbacks junior high english class where was confronted torturously boring book filled people such nonsensical names as pip and magwitch yes it is classic of literature but it was rather dry one shoved down my young throat like spoonful of bitter medicine certainly the experience was not truly that bad but quote ethan hawke in the latest movie adaptation of said book am not going tell the story the way it happened will gonna tell it the way remember it anyway return from nostalgia lane and get back the present in it is trendy attempt modernize the classics now presents an updated version of great expectations instead of pip this time the central character is named finn played as boy jeremy kissner and ethan hawke as an adult finn is an orphan being raised his unfaithful sister maggie or should that be mrs joe kim dickens and her boorish fisherman husband joe chris cooper the setting is the florida coast during the mids finn is blooming artist and spends his time running around the beach drawing fish one of his two favorite subjects during one of these escapades he literally stumbles upon an escaped criminal robert deniro borrowing page from the superhuman max cady deniros criminal has seemingly limitless lung capacity and favors hiding on the ocean floor ok maybe that is an exaggeration but he certainly beats any of houdinis records in the opening scenes of the and that is nothing next the fuel efficiency of finns motorboat but digress anyway finn does the convict good deed just show that he is really swell guy and then the plot moves on enter miss havisham or ms dinsmoor here anne bancroft abandoned at the altar some years ago ms dinsmoor is the epitome of the crazy rich old maid bizarre clothing eccentric mannerisms and few pounds of makeup anne bancroft seriously overacts in this role although she ends up nowhere near believable character she does add some humor the joe is hired help the gardening at her unkempt manner but the insane ms dinsmoor soon hires finn be plaything for her niece estella raquel beaudene as young girl gwyneth paltrow as an adult for no apparent reason other than provide the main plot of the finn is instantly stricken for the estella perhaps it is her snooty attitude or her utter disdain for his person or maybe finn has simply never met girl before in any case neither as children nor adults chemistry simply does not exist between the two and yet finn spends the remainder of the pining for her even when as an adult finn arrives in new york at the behest of mysterious benefactor reacquaints himself estella and draws her portrait in the nude there is nothing in fact there is more sexual tension between helen hunt and greg kinnears gay artist during similar scene in as good as it gets at this point the audience has grown as cold and detached as estellas character and could not care less about the two characters the bulk of the blame here falls upon gwyneth paltrow she fails imbue estella remote character in the book even the vaguest traces of humanity there is obviously something wrong when watching the you are more interested how big her nose looks in silhouette than you are about her character without strong estella finns obsession seems baseless you wish he would just stop whining let estella marry his rival walter plane an oddly subdued hank azaria and just get on his life in fact the two relationships that work in the are purely tangential the main plot finns relationship his brotherinlaw joe is interesting if bit stereotypical what is more fascinating are his interactions deniro although it is only bit part it goes show how much vitality strong actor can create it is apparent that director alfonso cuarsn put lot of work in creating the imagery of the some of the shots work but others are too obviously staged for example both of the water fountain scenes have any impact finns art actually the creations of italian painter francesco clemente is used throughout the but it mostly fails have the intended effect we never see why finn would generate this style of art is simultaneously crude and insightful as result it ends up as distant as the rest of the modernizing the classics is currently in vogue just see william shakespeares romeojuliet simply update the action modern setting and apply plenty of modern rock but such adornments do little perk up great expectations as much as dreaded the novel when first read it you would probably be better off suffering though reading than watching this romanceless

you damn dirty apes that is just one of the inadvertenty hilarious lines from planet of the apes that is taken on comedic context over time no one back then seemed realize how overthe top charlton hestons acting style was but it shows now particularly in this mystery science theater wannabe that was taken for masterpiece in its time actually winning one oscar for makeup no less and being nominated for couple others it also spawned multiple sequels like beneath the planet of the apes escape from the planet of the apes return of the planet of the apes beneath the escape from the return of the planet of the apes planet of the apes the next generation police academy of the apes the list goes on heston is an american astronaut who spends few thousand light years in space his three companions and ends up on planet not too dissimilar from earth the thing is on this planet humans cannot talk or think and the guys in the gorilla masks are the dominant species hestons companions are killed or turned into vegetables the apon is imprisoned he surprises them all his gift of speech making two primate scientists roddy mcdowall and kim hunter believe heston is the missing link between ape and man believe me we movie critics have been thinking the same thing for years when the two apes present the idea before judicial counsel the head ape being shakespearean actor maurice evans it is received as heresy for all good monkeys know god created ape in his image but heston has already seen cave that contains evidence that humans were originally the dominant species before apes ever gained the ability speak and run for president and he takes them there holding up baby doll and yelling if humans could not speak then how do you account for this talking doll and how do you account for your acting ability mr heston the absolute most laughable scene comes the movies surprise conclusion will not reveal the details except say it involves heston falling his knees on beach and yelling god damn you all hell several times in succession the movie is atrocious and should only be viewed those members of society who like watch bad movies and laugh at them what makes planet of the apes even more amusing is that it was supposed function as some sort of social irony condemnation of fundamentals who reject the theories of evolution but let me tell you if darwin could see the ape masks and hear the rotten dialogue exchanges heston female ape may kiss you before go ape but you are so ugly he would convert creationism on the spot luckily for us sciencefiction movies have evolved over time the point at some of them are actually good

new address same old attitude do not forget recommend read the journal or send me some of that nasty hate mail starring bruce willis billy bob thornton liv tyler ben affleck written jonathan hensleigh and j abrams directed michael bay it rocksactually lots of rocks fly at us or from us in slow or fast motion at several points in the they seem like dangerous rocks because they kind of twirl through the air instead of just propelling forward and when they landonce in while when we need break from the space sequencesthey cause damage enough destroy the chrysler building and the like nary mention of these apocalyptic events is made after they occur they also just might be the most interesting element of armageddon steroid users answer deep impact bruce willis stars as harry stamper famed oildriller commissioned the white house and nasa stop giant asteroid before it travels beyond zero barrier and destroys our planet why an oil driller they require someone experienced deepcore mining plant nuclear missile into said asteroid in one unintentionally hilarious sequence nasa asks harry inspect deepcore driller they built based on his own blueprints it is poorly constructedharry criticizes almost every aspect of it we trust nasa build space shuttles that can land on twirling asteroids harry assembles the obligatory ragtag bunch of cowboys including blond guy fat guy black guy wiseass and the man who is sleeping his daughter affleck once they reach space we experience sequence after sequence of something going wrongperhaps the fact that they sent bunch of nincompoops into outer space has something do it cannot count the number of times they almost fail the mission on all my fingers and toes whether or not they save the day will not reveal nor will you care will say this you know you are in trouble when deep impact dwarfs your asteroid movie in terms of emotion and scope willis has barely chance come alive ditto for affleck their big scenes are mostly reserved for the third act in last minuteand futileattempt inject warmth into the material steve buscemis characterthe wiseassis exceptionally problematic rockhound as he is called is sarcastic and foolish so they tape him chair where he spends most of the so why did they bring him up there begin rather why write him into the give his almostwitty oneliners serious willis who scowls and mopes and demonstrates psychotic tendencies at one point he chases after affleck his shotgun for screwing his daughter firing often and causing significant damage his oil rig am guessing he qualifies under nasa guidelines as someone unfit for space travel at least in my world where the sky is blue liv tyler is pretty and humourless as always suspiciously four of her fathers bands aerosmith songs grace the soundtrack director michael bay lays the visual and sound effects on thick like ketchup eventually drowning the movie onscreen the middle hour is nonsensical pyrotechnic assault on the average primates brain whenever someone dies in this movie crew member inevitably yells out we lost insert dead persons last name here must admit that not once could distinguish dead oilguycumastronaut from live one and closeups of the corpses faces beneath cracked helmets provided little assistance as their skin was often covered in fake blood armageddon is not as terrible movie as godzilla it looks nicer and has fewer plotholes within its equally ludicrous framework it has vivid soundmix but at almost twoandahalf hours could not believe how little actually happened over the course of the story the love story has been played up in the ads perhaps hoping catch people before they recover from titanicfever bollocks the lovers in the are miles apart throughouterase all thoughts of nude sketching or carsex and replace them obligatory shots of liv tyler tearing up while ben affleck dicks around in mooncrawler remember little called jaws in this three independentminded men suddenly found themselves on fishing boat in pursuit of deadly shark they did not much like each other at first eventually they started respect one another one of jaws great scenes involved the wouldbeahabs drinking and singing songs and telling stories this is the sort of malebonding foreign bay or his producer jerry bruckheimer who throw too many characters into the mix and expect we will care about them on the grounds that the world is about end not once do we get the feeling that these characters are even acquaintancesi would be surprised if these actors bothered introduce themselves one another before action was called male friend who loved the suggested me that perhaps cannot relate bunch of men who do not bare their souls who believe in dying macho concepts like heroism and kind of chestbeating bravery this will respond that the boys in armageddon are neither heroic nor brave nor smart even this team could not build birdhouse and if get no respect for disliking movie all the synthetic feeling of trailera trailer for movie written team of bodybuilders and greeting card authorsi have never been prouder wimp my whole life

the one question that eats at me after seeing corky romano is why touchstone spent so much money marketing this throwaway since june have not been able turn on the tv or go the movies without getting hit some ad depicting chris kattan as the spastic corky shrieking out ahas take on me in his yellow miata why would disney sink so much cash into the corky hype machine honestly was hoping that all the goofball ads were actually front for decently funny movie man was wrong corky romano is one of those throwaway clich ridden tvstartofilm vehicles built upon the most rickety of plots fortunately for chris kattans precariously positioned career corky does have some good laughs even if most of them are of the lowestbrow variety kattan plays the title character the unsinkable assistant veterinarian corky who has penchant for sunshiny tunes bright ties and banal coffee mug slogans you do not have be crazy work here but it sure helps when his mob boss dad peter falk is about be put away on murder charges his bungling lughead brothers peter berg and chris penn rope in innocent black sheep corky infiltrate the fbi as an agent and steal the evidence predictably hijinks ensue if the basic plot sounds bad wait until you get into the innerworkings of this clunker the writers will amaze you the depth of their inanity corkys fbi agent identity is named corky pissant that is pronounced peesahn it is french he becomes firstrate agent accidentally stumbling mr magoostyle onto the proper clues and talking his way in and out of situations plays like something out of sitcom and not good sitcom mean the romano family brothers even insult each other farting in each others face and in scene taken straight from there is something about mary corky gives dachshund mouthtomouth resuscitation but it is not complete disaster the manic kattan does occasionally rescue some comic moments including bit featuring cat in fat suit named jesus and another involving schoolchildren german shephard and kilo of cocaine plus berg whose career has obviously gone downhill since the last seduction and chicago hope gives great turn as the illiterate brother paulie and it is nice see that richard roundtree of shaft fame is getting work unfortunately for those out there who cannot truly appreciate animal or fart jokes corky will not have much offer you so the next time one of those pesky ads appears on your tv asking who is corky you can simply reply who cares

kids today they do not just want see heartthrob and master thespian freddie prinze jr loving on the ladies no they want see him doing something that takes little more in the acting department namely playing baseball through series of drippy voiceovers we are informed that there is no better proving ground for major league baseball than the cape cod summer baseball leagues where college alsorans and hopeful dropouts go play in the hopes of attracting big league attention our man freddie has landed spot as pitcher on the prestigious chatham as where he is hoping for his big break it is only after he is given ample time show off his abs and scamper about in womans thong do not ask that we learn what the real story of summer catch will be that prinze is poor townie named ryan dunne struggling make name for himself that neither his father fred ward nor brother jason gedrick pulled themselves out of their blue collar jobs and resent anyone who tries and that the local beauty tenley tenley jessica biel is so far out of his league that he probably should not even bother but of course he makes play for her summer catch also makes an abortive stab at another half dozen subplots the jealousy of fellow townie and brazen slut dee dee brittany murphy the alienation felt ryans nonbaseball playing best friend gabriel mann or the fat chick fetish of fellow player miles marc blucas worst of these is ludicrous bit involving that show is wilmer valderrama and beverly dangelo both of whom appear in the simply provide nutty mrs robinsonlike substory and remind you of how much better done that was in bull durham in fact virtually all of summer catch feels like it is been done better somewhere else for starters the has major question of identity it is definitely not sports movie and it fails pretty miserably at being romance the worst part is the amateurish script cowritten an arli writing alumnus and guy that starred in leprechaun chockfull of phony emotion the end it all becomes platform for each character deliver soliloquy ryan that he must take heart dad is on hand give fatherly yet drunken advice coach brian dennehy just loving the fact that he is got some work on the big screen is on hand give the curmudgeonly counterpoint ryans catcher matthew lillard playing himself again is on hand tell ryan play catch him and make fun of the fat fetish guy ryans stoner best friend is on hand give the gogetemtigerwe arebehindyou talk and the girlfriend is on hand give heartwarmingnuzzlyfollowyourdreams counsel before long you start wonder is freddy prinze jr is capable of having thought of his own do not answer that the only real joy in the is found in biels character and not just because of the skimpy outfits are also usually wet she is the only one in the movie that is able do much her role taking the rebellingagainstdaddy character at least passing grade when she is on screen the time flies when she is not you realize that for some ungodly reason this movie is almost two hours long for pg teen romance despite nearconstant sexual innuendo one has ask warner brothers what were you thinking for her part biel has fallen so far from her th heaven roots that she has almost become denise richards is either about eat her alive or vice versa either way good luck jessica as for freddie if he keeps pumping teen romances out at the rate of two year prinzes next summer catch is liable be venereal disease

plot two sister witches have live curse placed upon their family prevents them from ever enjoying full life lover the hex invokes the eventual demise of their loved one when one of their past loves comes back haunt them they have figure way out of their eternal dilemma critique have been waiting for good witch movie for while now but hold on your brooms and incantations cause this puppy is far from being it for that has the word magic in its title this movie contains very few moments of magic or humor for that matter drama suspense or romance well actually there is some manufactured romance within plot that is so muddled it never lets you in on whether it is comedy drama horror show or murder mystery or maybe it is romance eh it does not really matter cause the characters in the are so boring and uninteresting that you have absolutely no basis on care for them or the as whole if only the filmmakers had spent as much time on the plot as they did the sinfully obvious soundtrack this might have had chance be more than what it is now is an unentertaining crappy that uses the witch angle as diversionary tactic weave us away from its grabbag of stupid voiceovers overdone songs melodramatic romance undeveloped story and uneven acting only wish that could make that one hour and fortyfive minutes of my life reappear but alas it is lost in the spiritual world of interesting ideas gone wildly awry little known facts about this and its stars this is based on the novel written alice hoffman coscreenwriter akiva goldsman also wrote the screenplay for batman robin director griffin dunne is known mainly as an actor in such films as an american werewolf in london and after hours

tristar rated language sexual situations violence minutes director and writer darren stein cast rose mcgowan rebecca gayheart judy greer julie benz chad christ ethan erickson carol kane pam grier tatyana ali review geoff berkshire jawbreaker is the very definition of ripoff this uninspired teen comedy takes equal parts carrie heathers and clueless and mixes in all the necessary teen movie clich along the way writerdirector darren stein forgets give the life of its own the opens voice over from geeky fern mayo judy greer about the four most popular girls at reagan high courtney shayne rose mcgowan who can basically be summed up as satan in heels julie freeman rebecca gayheart good girl the face of supermodel marcie fox julie benz dimwitted blonde who demands that people call her foxy and liz purr charlotte roldan an angel in disguise liz is everyones favorite because she is both beautiful and kind liz is about turn and as prank courtney convinces the other girls help her in kidnapping liz on her birthday morning in order keep liz from making any noise courtney stuffs jawbreaker into her mouth before they gag her they then stuff liz in the trunk of courtneys car but when they open it later polaroid camera waiting capture the moment their lives will never be the same poor liz has swallowed the jawbreaker and choked death it lodged in her throat the audience is treated few too many graphic looks at lizs dead body courtney thinking fast decides pass the death off as rapemurder and marcie and reluctant julie assist her things get complicated when fern discovers what the three girls are up in order keep her quiet courtney comes up another plan and transforms geeky fern into vylette hoping that she will also help replace liz in the minds of the devastated students up until about this point the is effective enough however an investigation begins into lizs death and the becomes excessively dull the recently rediscovered talents of pam grier are thoroughly wasted in the role of detective vera cruz and the is downright insipid in its treatment of both the characters and the audience during this long middle stretch courtneys plan frame sleazy guy marilyn manson in brief cameo is never believable for second meanwhile the audience is stuck watching string of random events fail develop the characters or add anything of interest the plot julie leaves the group and begins lame romance aspiring actor zack chad christ he apparently gives her the courage turn on courtney but the way things develop only make julie look stupid ferns rise popularity is equally lame we do get the best scene in the the only one spark of originality during this section it is smart and subversive bit where courtney gets the high schools resident jock stud dane ethan erickson demonstrate using popsicle exactly what he would like for her do him it at least provides us look at courtneys personality but the way the scene finishes does not make any sense stein is very conscious of the teen movie tradition he is working in and not only freely borrows major plot elements but also includes direct acknowledgment of this some stunt casting william katt and j soles students in carrie are lizs distraught parents jeff conaway from grease is julies creepy single dad and carol kane the frightened babysitter in when stranger calls camps it up as principal miss sherman at times jawbreaker feels simply like teen cinemas greatest hits but the audience is cheated watered down interpretations of the best this genre has offer the only notable aspect of jawbreaker is the incredibly stylish look the costume design vickie brinkford and the production design jerry fleming are both bright and vivid they were apparently instructed work from the color palette of jawbreaker and the screen is always splashed bits of vibrant color director of photography amy vicent who beautifully lensed eves bayou does remarkable job here as well shot composition and camera movement is consistently impressive performances are mostly subpar mcgowan providing only few good moments compared her excellent work in the doom generation and scream and gayheart making the biggest impression due the sweet nature of her character and her obvious beauty none of the actors look as if they have set foot inside high school within the last five years the exception of actresssinger tatyana ali who has small role as cheerleader the male cast all resemble male models and are credited names like auto stud college stud and high school stud the soundtrack is decent and imperial teens catchy yoo hoo makes bigger impression than any other aspect of the

all that education you should know what happiness is starring sylvia chang teresa hu hsu ming li lieh mao hsuehwei directed edward yang written yang and wu nienchen cinematography christopher doyle and chang huikung every country has eventually its new wave france had its nouvelle vague brazil its cinema novo china its fifth generation and on and on some waves just take longer than others before they wash over us cleansing us the balm of discovery taiwans new wave came in the in the work of directors like hou hsiaohsien wan jen and edward yang that day on the beachyangs first featureis central it created new language for young taiwanese directors even if the first attempts speak that language were hesitant and faltering later works refined the techniques that yang first explored here giving taiwan distinctive international presence that day itself is long and frustrating the document of nations attempt find voice it does not lack ambition it anatomizes urban life in modern taiwan in the manner of antonioni elaborating the alienation that the westernized whitecollar middleclass feel as their lives are shaped oldfashioned rolesdedicated career men loyal housewivesthat they find unfulfilling jiali sylvia chang is the focus but the brings others into its compassher husband her brother friends from her college daysas it charts her discontents no one is happy jiali married her husband welei at young age at the time her brother had been urged into an arranged marriage despite his affection for another woman and so jialis marriage seemed in comparison good one she chose welei of her own free will they loved each other but it goes wrong that day dutifully presents all the clich welei becomes absorbed in his career indulges in an affair coworker jiali feels restless and trapped bound choice she made while young but no longer seems wise the never redeems these clich conveying the feel of authentic experience the intensity of lived pain and much of it seems trite and belaboured it unfolds awkwardly as series of flashbacks told during luncheon in vienna where jiali meets her brothers old flame teresa hu now concert pianist whom she has not seen since college both women seem rather sad and resigned their sadness their circumstances and those of jialis brother and college friend suggest not so much that they have made the wrong choicesmarried the wrong man chosen the wrong career path etc but rather that the choices available them were inadequate it is not that jiali married the wrong man she did not the problem is that she needed marry at alland that if she did not marry she would still be just as unhappy for woman in modern taiwan that day tells us the cards are stacked the dice are loaded she can play the game but the house always wins the films sympathetic feminist implications are presumably the reason it caused such controversy upon its release in taiwan seen now it does not seem provocative indeed it is hard imagine anyone having felt passionate enough about the generate any controversy it may be ambitious it may be innovative but it is also terribly terribly dull and what was new for taiwan was not necessarily new for the rest of us yang adopts methods established years before antonioni and others and his use of those methods is fumbling uncertain undisciplined nor does he bring anything newother than the localeto the material there are moments when that day takes on some of the emotional richness it strives forin young couples first kiss in the awkward meeting of woman and her husbands mistressbut they are brief too often yang devotes needless time mundane scenesgrocery shopping flowerarrangingin nothing happens little is said no emotion imparted perhaps if the were content focus on such reflective inward moments leaving us guess at thoughts and feelings it might have been ambiguous suggestive insinuating but jiali and her disaffected companions do not only brood in silence they talk about their problems at length in detail redundantly and eliminate all subtleties at two hours and fortyfive minutes it all seems exorbitantly long indulgently longwinded consider the defining moment for jiali the titular day on the beach the thrust of the whole explains easily enough what we are think of that moment what it means when she walks away from particular situation even so the has not one but two characters explain it for us verbally in case we may have missed the point needless time is devoted expressing what should have remained unexpressed and that is the problem throughout the look of the is as tedious as the drawnout narrative it was the first feature shot christopher doyleat least it is his name in the creditswho is now rightly regarded as one of the worlds leading cinematographers in the freewheeling expressionism of his work directors like chen kaige and wong karwai he seems incapable of fashioning boring image you would never know it from watching that day due either doyles inexperience or yangs humdrum direction is almost perverse in its insistence on making the physical environment seem as drab and banal as possible in scrutinizing the long decay of marriage that day manages capture the ennui of the experience but none of the damage none of the heartbreak

the first in very long list of things wrong still know what you did last summer is the title think about it for second if the last movie was called know what you did last summer would not the next movie have be still know what you did two summers ago if anyone working on this movie had an q greater than five would have thought about it logically and said hey wait minute but alas the people behind this are obviously idiots so will not hold them that what will hold them is the fact that they have pretty bad movie on their hands even for teenage slasher flick guess am one of the few critics who actually kind of liked the original emphasis on the kind of it was not great or anything and maybe not even necessarily good but at least it did not have me glancing at my watch every minute or so like it is sequel did there are just so many problems this movie that it is hard trying figure out where start first of all guess is the setting the movie offers no rational reason why the had take place in the bahamas other than the fact that the producers wanted seaside setting exactly why does the fisherman want go through all the trouble of faking radio contest get julie james jennifer love hewitt one of the only survivors of the first and her new college buddies out the islands before he hacks them up the movie suffers from this kind of logic all the way through in one scene julie is in tanning booth at deserted gym when the hooked fisherman the slicker comes in and seals up the booth so the damsel in distress cannot get out no matter how hard she tries when julie discovers she is going slowly fry death she screams for help and her friends come her rescue now this is all fine and dandy except for one thing instead of spending five minutes trying bust open the booth why not just turn the freakin thing off in another scene one of the characters after having their significant other all but decapitated the man in the slicker says julie just do not tell anybody it rained the whole time oh yeah have just been terrorized hook wielding sociopath and had some of my best friends gruesomely slaughtered but hey will crack jokes anyway after all it is in the script the films only saving graces are few wellexecuted suspense sequences and really cool cameo the reanimator himself jeffrey combs he brings some good comic relief and life an otherwise limp movie way go jeffrey have hunch that the reason this fizzles while the first one at least kept it is head above water is the recent absence of writer kevin williamson scream and even it is sequel he displayed real talent as screenwriter his ear for dialogue and the terrific endings he puts on all his films make him standout from all the rest of the horror writers and think still know has really suffered not having him on board the cool atmosphere is still there this time around but just did not like the characters or the writing as much as did in the first one even though the movie does not have williamson it still has hacky ending trying do what kevin did the first two scream some may consider this spoiler but if you have seen any horror movies whatsoever then you should be able guess the identity of the madman within twenty minutes having two killers and this time having one of them being family member the other think someone in the audience put it best when after the movie had ended another the killer is back cliffhanger he said who is this time the grandma all in all still know tries be as successful as the first the was but really fails in the attempt mean it is okay when slasher movies ripoff each other but when they start copying themselves

there is nothing new under the sun is phrase often used when the speaker actually means let us find something copy of course there are very few completely original ideas even earthshattering concepts are built upon the vast body of human experience there is after all no need reinvent the wheel time after time recently it seems that does not feel the need even rewrite the script my understanding of the word sequel is continuation of the story the industry has defined the word mean reshooting the original minor changes have an overwhelming desire see an inferior version of brian depalmas adaptation of the steven king novel this is your dream come true rachel emily bergl high school outcast is beginning notice weird things happening around her doors slam shut themselves glass globes blow up her mother has severe mental problems and her father is absent popular boy unexpectedly asks her out the incrowd conspires embarrass her at public event any of this sound familiar once the audience catches on that this is the same story as carrie there is little do but wait for the inevitable ending the effects are bit better this time around but the does not work nearly as well there are couple of minor plot differences rachel lives foster parents because her mother is institutionalized the boys at her school are portrayed as even more evil than in the original they keep score of their scoring points given for each conquest and uh there must be other story changes but none stand out one nice touch is the casting of amy irving again as sue snell over years ago she was the one girl who tried help carrie now high school counselor she befriends rachel but her characters potential is squandered there is too much about sue that does not make sense after the slaughter when carrie kills most of her classmates sue is driven mad and spends time in the institution that rachels mother is in still living in the same small town the woman wellknown history of mental problems is hired as high school counselor sue tells rachel that her telekinesis is genetic disease this may be the one original idea in the but the reasoning behind describing psychic powers as disease is never explained sues eventual fate is an admission director katt shea and writer rafael moreu that they had an interesting character but could not figure out what do her blink and you will miss it some of the events are filmed in black and white but the rationale for this is unknown it does not add anything and the choice of scenes appears somewhat random the rage retains some of the trappings of carrie without the meaning in the first the color red was motif connected carries onset of powers at the same time she began menstruating here there is an abundance of red but for no apparent purpose the casting of high school jocks and cheerleaders as villains is beginning wear thin one might be lead suspect that most filmmakers were unpopular in school and the history of teenage films is an extended cinematic revenge of the nerds the biggest mistake the makes is including clips of the original seeing sissy spacek on the screen only points the quality of that and the flaws in this one

plot outline wendy samantha press jazz singer loves mack hugo race criminal and wanna be rock singer who is planning bank heist mack is also being tailed couple of cops one an inexperienced rookie dominic sweeney the other john flaus worn out veteran who frequents wendys jazz club they are tailing mack because he has an audiotape that may show evidence of governmental corruption meanwhile wendys sexually awakener fifteen year old sister rebecca elmaloglou has moved in her and is secretly watching mack and wendys late night love trysts much zaniness ensues the review main problem first about of rood rock star actor conversions in filmdom ever really work unfortunately trying cast hugo race as violent sexy criminal falls into the what the hell where they thinking category that takes up of the rest but hell it is not as if he is the only problem in this wellintentioned but ultimately below average aussie thriller leads race and samantha press are wooden and dull hampered some unfortunate attempts at sexy dialogue early on though they do manage some heat later in their love scenes helped no doubt them keeping their mouths shut the suffers every time the story shifts back these two is unfortunately the other main story is not any great shakes either the second part concerning two cops political corruption and that elusive tape is incredibly muddled at many points during the movie had no idea what was going on situation that did not improve on repeated viewing there is no doubt that this films achilles heel is its script as for the rest of the cast it is mixed bag john flaus one of australias most criminally underused actors is in top form as the withering alcoholic jazz fan cop who may or may not have sold out the highest bidder although he falters at one point when the script calls for him get up on stage and deliver drunken beat sermon but believe me they way it was written no one could have pulled it off dominic sweeney is fine though he seems be uneasy in front of the lens but he really is not given whole lot do pre home and away elmaloglou is pretty good as the inquisitive jojo but her character seems extraneous the story well at least until the final scenes must admit in too deep does have some impressive qualities not the least of is it visual element cinematographers mark gilfedder peter zakharov have achieved the almost impossible making melbourne look like sweat drenched tropic city is akin turning london into san paolo the bar is an oppressive red like all of it is patrons are being baked while they drink outside it hazy orange day and cool blue night if only deborah parsons script could have supported this idea better having two directors colin south john tatoulis does not help either the most glaring example of is the final retributionfight scene where for some reason the camera pulls away from the onscreen action and more importantly it does not pull away anything else it just stays static as the fight happens in the distance it has no reason it it is just bad direction and ultimately that is what sums up in too deep it is tries be good and you want it work but it is just lacking the talent behind it that it needs succeed

the scene at the end of dead poets society when robin williams english students stand up on their desk and say captain my captain gets me every time unfortunately the court room scene near the end of robins newest patch adams does not have anywhere near the same impact from the surface patch adams looks very promising it is story about not so young man patch adams robin williams who finds meaning in his life through helping sick people when the opens we find patch depressed and suicidal checking himself into mental hospital in few scenes strongly reminiscent of one flew over the cuckoos nest he ends up helping the patients through their problems and it is here that he finds how much he loves working people so he checks himself out of the hospital and heads straight medical school right from the start patch uses comedy help make the patient more comfortable he continuously breaks medical tradition and makes the dean of the school angry shortly after joining medical school he meets and falls in love carin monica potter they along patchs dork friend truman daniel london start medical clinic for uninsured people once the dean catches wind of the clinic he tells patch he cannot graduate and kicks him out of school patch like what any true american would do takes the school court it is here where the not so climatic court room battle takes place over whether or not patch can become real doctor have never seen movie some potential just completely blow it it seems more like series of short sketches rather than fulllength movie considering it runs almost two hours much too long for such light it could have flowed much smoother not mention the fact of how serious the takes itself and manages cover all the cliches of bad melodrama robin williams saves the from being abysmal several comic scenes that elevate the movie entertaining and worthwhile levels but those moments are rare and in the end patch adams is barely average

the real blonde a womans face an arm some pumpedup pectorals blond hair mans sad face slender legs random hand here and there as the opening credits of tom dicillos the real blonde unfold these scattered fractured glimpses eventually come together form the image of bikini briefclad man on his knees clinging nurturing woman his head concealing her unclothed breasts if only the rest of this formless aimless ensemble comedy assembled so coherently joe matthew modine is waiterstruggling actor too proud take gigs in commercials or soap operas he is feeling somewhat dissatisfied his relationship his livein love mary catherine keener who holds some subconscious hostility toward the male gender mary makeup artist regularly works on model sahara bridgette wilson who is obsessed the underlying messages in disneys the little mermaid the bottle blonde has turbulent onagain offagain relationship bob maxwell caulfield soap actor who yearns for the taste of real blonde he finds in costar kelly daryl hannah as the unspools variety of other characters pass through fashion photographer blair marlo thomas marys shrink buck henry and selfdefense instructor denis leary joes casting agent kathleen turner and hardass boss christopher lloyd and mystery woman elizabeth berkley who keeps on crossing joes path where exactly does all this go that is question best posed writerdirector dicillo who does not appear have the slightest clue himself his meandering largely unfunny script and direction are like hopelessly lost drivers turning into deadend narrative streets only reverse course and hit another creative culdesac and another and another at one point bob frustrated the soap scripts complains the head writer jim fyfe that his and kellys characters keep on going in circles no hint of development or growth that is most certainly the case here joe gets job and ultimately botches things he and mary bicker they make up only have the pattern repeat itself unhappy his bottle blonde bob gets his real blonde but is unsatisfied he returns the faux and is still unsatisfied if there is point all of this dicillo dances around it spending his time on apparent digressions that as it turns out are not digressions at all the real blonde is not without some amusements it does have the occasional funny line and situation leary henry lloyd steve buscemi and dave chappelle shine in their small roles keener is likable refreshingly earthy lead berkleys appearance is mercifully brief she receives outrageously prominent billing and ad placement for tenminute role and there is the irony of having caulfield play wildly popular soap star who makes the ratings skyrocket last year the actor was fired from the daytime drama all my children after scant six monthsdue lack of viewer interest but on the whole the real blonde is frustrating sit that lives up the stereotypes of its titleit may be glossy on the surface but there is nothing going on inside opens february

jack frost is one of those dumb corny concoctions that attempts be heartwarming family but is too muddled in its own cliches and predictability be the least bit touching this does not come as surprise since the studio that made it is warner brothers who is on current streak of one bad after the other jack frost michael keaton is struggling middleaged rock musician who loves his wife gabby kelly preston and yearold son charlie joseph cross but does not spend nearly enough time them when he receives call from music label that wants hear him play he has cancel his planned family outing up in the mountains for christmas halfway there jack has second thoughts but on his way back home is in car accident and dies switch forward year christmas is approaching once again and charlie and gabby are still having difficult time coming terms jacks death when charlie begins play the harmonica his father gave him the night before he died the snowman outside the house is taken over jacks spirit jack wants spend some time his son before the upcoming warm front melts him but charlie desperately tries prevent his melting demise frosty the snowman is classic cartoon and the idea of snowman that is alive works splendidly when animated but as liveaction it does not work at all after somewhat promising prologue in the frost family is established jack frost quickly goes downhill especially once the snowman comes into play since jack has been deceased for whole year you would think there would be many questions ask him such as what happens after you die or how does it feel be snowman but instead the focuses on snowball fight subplot and an inevitably oversentimental climax that could be telegraphed before even sat down watch the movie the performances are respectable enough but no one deserves be punished appearing in silly like this michael keaton at least got off easy since he disappears after the first twenty minutes but what exactly does he think he is doing his career here have always liked kelly preston she is clearly talented charismatic actress but has never been given good role in her life usually having settle for onedimensional supporting character as in nothing lose and addicted love joseph cross was probably the highlight in the cast since he believably portrayed boy suffering the loss of parent in one of the only subplots that actually works due its wittiness henry rollins is highly amusing as hockey coach who becomes terrified and paranoid after seeing the live snowman this brief hint of cleverness is pushed the side however the triedandtrue main plot at hand is the sappy story of father and son since knew what was going happen the time the conclusion came around had no choice but sit there and listen painfully insipid cringeinducing lines of dialogue some of my favorites was an interaction between the son and father you da man says charlie no da snowman replies jack or how about this little zinger coming from school bully that miraculously becomes friendly towards charlie and tries help him out snowdad is better than no dad do people really get paid in for writing pieces of trash like this the snowman created john hensons creature shop is more believable than the snowman from last years unintentionally hilarious directtovideo horror flick also called jack frost but it still was difficult tell if it was person in suit or computer effects either way it was an awful lot of work go through just come up final product as featherbrained as this project as seasonal holiday picture jack frost is pretty much clunker better christmas from this year is will be home for christmas better yet my suggestion would be stay home and watch quality such as it is wonderful life christmas story or prancer jack frost is an earnest but severely misguided and children as well as adults deserve better doubt they would want see movie about the death of parent anyway

some movies require you turn off your brain in order watch then there are movies that require you accept that everyone in the movie has turned off their brains the real mccoy is both it is charmless molassesslow and so full of genuinely stupid people that the commission of atlanta where the real mccoy is set might well consider some sort of ritual suicide for their complicity in this humiliation the real mccoy opens bank robber karen mccoy kim basinger being arrested in the middle of job six years later karen is out on parole and looking stay straight she soon bumps into t barker val kilmer hapless wouldbe thief who idolizes karen t also has ties jack schmidt terence stamp the man who blew the whistle on karen six years earlier for refusing work him schmidt who is in cahoots karens sleazy parole officer gailard sartain again wants karen help him stage robbery this time he has some leverage karens kidnapped son just when she thought she was out they keep pulling her back in contrivances and sloppy plotting fly off the screen so fast and furiously you have duck avoid being hit them leading the list is the jack schmidt character who through unexplained but presumably foul mains is already extremely wealthy when our story begins there is no reason given why he should need or want get involved in another crime let alone why he would actually participate in the breakin karens initial encounter t during botched convenience store holdup also strains the limits of credibility it would have been simple enough have them somehow entangled at that point but instead they
