run into each other the next day because they are leaving their parole officers at exactly the same moment small world eh then there is the convenient car trouble during an attempted escape and pet tigers through the power of the laws of bad cinema must inevitably confront someone who has blundered into their cage however the buffoon prize goes the atlanta police who come off like the keystone kops on bad day but the fun does not end there in the shambles of script william davies and william osborne there is also the absence of single solitary interesting character karen is earnest and singleminded in her motherly devotion but lacking any kind of edge would make her convincing criminal and basinger is not thespian adept at fleshing out flimsy material schmidt is flaccid villain the parole officer is complete blank and karens son and exhusband might as well be furniture only kilmers t is remotely appealing but his one potentially intriguing quality his ineptitude is never developed in fact kilmer disappears during the middle of the just when his admiration for karen could have made for an interesting subplot might have been more forgiving if the pacing had been more appropriate caper comedy but the real mccoy goes nowhere fast various scenes of sneaking and skulking seem take forever and some end no reason evident why they did not end up on the cutting room floor even the reasonably clever climactic breakin falls victim this syndrome including scene of one of the thieves drilling open vault lasts kid you not four minutes there is no tension in the scene just tedium russell mulcahy highlander is director some style and indeed the real mccoy looks reasonably good but he completely stumbles in the editing room there are so many big problems the real mccoy that am tempted overlook the little ones like karen disarming one of schmidts henchmen and throwing his gun into the middle of park where her son is playing like fountain crushed when van runs into it reappearing in one piece few moments later tempted but am pretty good at resisting temptation

you think that these people only exist in the movies but trust me they are as real as life once talked guy who thought the united states government was putting satellites into orbit could fry an individual persons brain microwaves then sat in room full of people who believed that the government rigged state elections even listened man who swore that nicotine was an additive that cigarette companies put in their products for the specific goal of getting people addicted these people had what are known as conspiracy theories ideas about how unseen forces work deceive and control the public little imagination goes long way in richard donners conspiracy theory jerry fletcher mel gibson is new york city cab driver who seems have conspiracy theory about everything his latest that nasa is trying kill the president causing an earthquake from the space shuttle might sound outrageous us but is all in days work for him he combs the newspaper looking for tidbits that leave telltale warnings about the goingson behind the scenes and from there jerry draws his conclusions upstanding citizen that he is he tries convince alice sutton julia roberts of the justice department that the president must be warned lucky gal alice who met jerry when he saved her from couple of muggers and has had listen his theories during the six months since what she does not know is that jerrys interest in her is far more than well professional he goes great lengths follow her around and watch her in her own apartment but when some secret government types seem take an interest in jerrys ideas and his limitedcirculation conspiracy theory newsletter he finds himself in danger and in real need of alices help one of the problems conspiracy theory is that it tries pass itself off as an actionthriller when it seems have neither whole lot of action nor significant number of thrills part of this is result of the films slow pace it takes forever set up the relationship between jerry and alice and even once that is over the rest of the seems be lot of boredom that every once in while stops take break for excitement at over two hours this could have been significantly condensed and had it is running time shortened twenty minutes half an hour but even then the action scenes would not be able save the instead of truly exciting and engaging set pieces we are treated few of the generic scenes the requisite black elements black helicopter men in black action suits and body armor black vehicles you know the drill they come on down all kinds of neat gadgets and weapons but for some reason guy just bunch of theories and some chick no training somehow manage elude them every time big deal we have seen it all before watching the wished donner had at least tried use little imagination but was out of luck now when say it took forever set up the relationship between jerry and alice completely mean what one person is relative the other and not romantic involvement oh donner and screenwriter brian helgeland would like you believe that the end of the movie the two main characters will end up falling hopelessly in love each other but there seems be no evidence of that ever occurring you see there were more sparks between gibson and danny glover in the lethal weapon movies also directed donner than between gibson and roberts in conspiracy theory the two just do not click and when you throw in number of happenings that would cause alice reject jerry altogether like finding out he is been stalking her the subsequent attraction is absolutely forced the script in general also seems forced like someone sat helgeland down and forced him write it then took it and forced it upon us dialog is undistinguished and rather unmemorable the point that almost stopped listening even gibsons usual gift for ad lib could not punch up the sufficiently raise my interest although one of jerrys theories about oliver stone was mildly amusing unfortunately much of what is discussed in the is not inherently important what is going on but instead filler that starts out potential but ends up just being extraneous because it is never followed through for example jerry professes that man found drowned in his swimming pool was actually murdered the government in new york subway station he even goes so far as explain that the station was flooded at the time due water main break hence the water in subway station and that the coroner should check the mans lungs for chlorine this is convincing enough alice that she seems believe him you know what happens then nothing zip nada no followup whatsoever so what is the significance okay heres another one couple of well known real life assassins were found have possessed copies of the d salinger novel the catcher in the rye jerry also has bunch of copies whenever he goes into bookstore he has buy one leaving out the question of whether or not this makes jerry an assassin we are never given reason believe why this would make him an assassin not when we find out about his salinger collection not when he goes the bookstore not later on when we get the answer our first question the point becomes totally extraneous oh did mention that patrick stewart is in this yeah he plays this government psychiatrist named dr jonas who may or may not be bad guy that is about it for all the presence this usually marvelous actor has he is nearly forgettable in conspiracy theory you can just lump him in the supporting players the exception of cylk cozart who plays agent lowry of the fbi this guy was really likable and wish he and his character had gotten more screen time okay heres my theory this really started out as great but some of its jokes were actually true the government came in and forced donner make edits for the sake of national security and this was what was left over

my son and share perverse predilection for bad movies we are amused and entertained the cheap thrills the corny dialog the ludicrous premises and the bad acting since other family members aspire higher forms of entertainment we usually wind up indulging our proclivity together cannot remember when we disagreed on the relative merits of clunker until species came along he was not amused on the other hand was able easily suspend the applicable requirements in the usual manner and declare myself suitably entertained perhaps the evident skills that were brought the process of producing bad product was what prevented him from extracting fun out of mediocrity on the other hand appreciated the fact that the producers and director knew exactly what they were doing insulting my intelligence and brought adequate moviemaking skills the project movie does not have be good be well made at least in terms of the craft the movie could have been better if it were not so brusque this movie slaps you conception pregnancy delivery and young childhood in consecutive frames without pausing for infancy the producers of nescafe have nothing on this alien race in womans womb balloons immediately after the male orgasm and few seconds later young child tears its way out of her abdomen in sloppy and gory version of an insideout cesarean an autopsy scene in buzz saw cuts through the cranium was not the kind of indulgence that condone say nothing of the fact that it was scientifically incorrect in real autopsy the saw does not cut through the scalp it is used only after the skull has been exposed the opening sequences of exploration of mars were very good the writers showed excellent skills for ceremonial speech writing but the spontaneous dialogue would qualify for subtitle as bad as it gets as the movie progressed vowed remember the lines that made me cringe but only one stuck eve natasha henstridge was cloned from sil the original alien sexual predator but her mating instinct was artificially attenuated was all that was needed turn her into noble and cooperative prisoner in wistful display of resignation and understanding she tells her friend and jailer marg helgenberger i think of all the places that will never see and all the people that will never meet it is enough melt the most callous heart at another point she protests i am human too you know she is only half right peter medak the director knows his business justin lazard as the doomed astronaut does nothing enhance his credentials james cromwell his father is perfect in short role marg heldenberger the dna scientist is pleasant and beautiful natasha is an exquisite ornament george dzunza knew and delivered what was expected of him as the dumb general that messes things up michael madsen was there black buddies do not usually survive in this type of movie but mykelti williamson manages stay around for the final credits is more that we can say for lazard

it seemed like the perfect concept what better for the farrelly brothers famous for writing and directing comedies offensive subject matter than make movie about guy split personality it is exactly the sort of thing the brothers relish poking fun at something serious in this case mental illness throwing all care the wind get laugh jim carreys signed on too even better the national alliance for the mentally ill even helped out levying complaints against the brothers new before its opening claiming it was misrepresenting the condition of split personality labeling it incorrectly as schizophrenia and so forth such protest seemed like just the sort of thing that would of course only add more fuel the farrelly brothers fire proving that some people just could not take joke and that the farrellys would be helping the more enlightened viewers yet another dose of their brilliantly subversive comedy yes it all seemed perfect but one thing went wrong their movie is not funny it is not for lack of trying the farrellys utilize in me myself irene their most highconcept premise ever carrey plays charlie baileygaites man who after being dumped his wife for midget limo driver decides bury all his aggressive feelings deep down inside and never release them this of course means all his neighbors exploit his entirely tooforgiving nature making his job as rhode island state trooper increasingly difficult soon enough charlies repressed aggression manifests itself into second independent personality named hank deepvoiced boorish ogre unafraid of taking the assertive actions his predecessor had been unable muster this guy is not above crashing car through the wall of the barber shop in he is been insulted or holding little girls head underwater because she refused stop jumproping in the street then things start getting lost in the most complicated plot the farrellys have ever attempted and the runs off its tracks some have suggested that this is not problem because the farrelly brothers brand of humor does not require plot work they are wrong of course plot was greatly instrumental in building up the kind of rollicking comic energy that infused the farrellys last effort there is something about mary outside providence was technically an earlier project the brothers earlier was not funny merely because it contained outrageous gags despite what some newsmagazine articles would have you believe but rather because its most outrageous gags were entirely unexpected in mary the farrellys managed several times pull off neat sleightofhand trick they would have you thinking the story was going one way then reveal its real direction in delightfully surprising fashion me myself irene contrast seems have been made folks who looked at mary and saw only the surface grossness missing all of the subtle machinations that really made it work having been produced the same guys who made mary irene seems like an even bigger disappointment the brothers pile on the offensive humor taking shots at race midgets albinos mental illness and all manner of bathroom jokes but they have not come up way make any of it fresh most of me myself irene comes off as rote bythenumbers adolescent comedy the plot carrey forced drive alleged fugitive irene waters renee zellweger who is in more trouble than anyone knows back new york has an ending that is entirely predictable from the getgo think charlie and irene will fall in love yeah me too the farrellys then introduce scores of different characters and none of them ever manage do anything you have not already expected them do no matter how outrageous their actions might be compared the curveballs the farrellys are used throwing this stuff is almost entirely softtossed presenting an obvious problem when grossout humor loses its shock value it is no longer funny merely gross the jokes that do work are milked over and over until their effectiveness runs dry take for example the subplot involving charlies three black sons anthony anderson mongo brownlee jerod mixon the incongruity of it all is funny for while three burly black men discussing higher math in ghetto language and whitebread carrey mouthing said language an entirely toopleasant smile on his face but the end of the they are still doing the same schitck it has not been elevated another funnier level and it has not been dropped either that is too bad because it ceases be amusing about halfway through me myself irene reeks of wasted opportunities there ought be more focus on how other people react charlies new personality and on how charlie deals the consequences of hanks actions this does not really happen nearly every supporting character learns about charlies condition early on so they do not have any opportunity be surprised it the throws what looks like patented farrelly curve in scene towards the midway point involving an albino companion charlie and irene pick up called appropriately whitey but the script does not go anywhere it instead leaving the thread twisting in the wind before awkwardly tying it up during the climax jim carrey is gifted comedian both physically and vocally but he is left nothing much do here except contort himself in manner similar steve martin in all of me it is great showcase of flexibility and splitsecond roleshifting but none of it is terribly funny carrey does not pull any stunts we do not expect him pull and the farrellys script does not give him anything else pull the situations in he must perform the roleshifting are not set up in any meaningful way perhaps carrey can take solace in the fact that his supporting actors fare no better zellwegers irene is not strong female lead mary in mary may have been part adolescent fantasy but she was also intelligent and strongwilled irene is nothing in particular as the never makes clear whether she is ditzy clever or neither as such she gives us nothing latch onto as the only sane person in the chris cooper is stuck playing exactly one note as corrupt fbi agent and his character is entirely too straightlaced for movie like this he like the others does absolutely nothing unexpected after viewing the shapeless mess that me myself irene eventually dissolved into was stuck wondering whether or not the farrellys had outsmarted themselves maybe their kind of comedy can only work for so long until audiences get wise it and stop being shocked but do not believe it good filmmakers find ways of surprising their audiences even after people have grown attuned their style if the farrellys are indeed good smart filmmakers and still think they are they will rebound just fine even after that happens though will still consider me myself irene be highcaliber misfire

wesley snipes is master of selecting bad action roles murder at s marshals money train drop zone boiling point and the ultimate camp passenger the art of war is another entry in this very ugly and unique category ultimately it is little more than ridiculous action plot as believable as the warren report ugly violence that would have made peckinpah cringe and terrible acting blist actors like michael biehn and anne archer oddly it feels like the undiscovered sequel another snipes masterpiece rising sun the movie revolves around the convenient story of special un operative caught up in secret murder conspiracy involving chinese ambassador the chinese triad brotherhood rich chinese businessman played that bad guy from rising sun caryhiroyuki tagawa chinese un interpreter and inexplicably donald sutherland the ends more confusion than boatload of chinese immigrants trying register at ellis island or should say the ends the most blatant ripoff of both the matrix and all of john woos hong kong films combined am really at loss figure out why wesley snipes had the gumption not only star in this action dud but also act as one of the producers of the usually enjoy snipes movies though his dramatic roles better show off his creativity as an actor than the flashiness of his action films simply am amazed the how inane the script was filled terrible cliches and extremely violent action sequences director christian duguay screamers has strange attraction the viciousness of violent acts showing splattering brains people impaled broken shards of glass and lots of gargling and gagging as blood sprays everywhere it also sickens me know that oliver stone one of the greatest directors working today had his hand in producing this monstrosity guess snipes sold stone on the conspiracy angle and stone chose not read the script watch the dailies be involved in casting or anything else or else he would be filing court order remove his name from the credits it is also seems evident that the russkies as our new bosom buddies and the middle eastern terrorist angle being beaten death in the last couple of years that the new international enemies in are the communist chinese am sure over the next couple of months even more chinese conspiracymartialarts action flicks are going be popping up in your local multiplex hopefully they will not include wesley snipes

senseless is prime example of what can happen when you try push onejoke concept bit too far director penelope spheeris is no stranger this having subjected audiences before such tortures as the beverly hillbillies marlon wayans stars as darryl witherspoon college senior vying for lucrative job at prominent brokerage however he lacks the advantages of his chief opposition scott thorpe david spade in the smarmy sort of role he can deliver in his sleep an athletic record sponsorship fraternity and most of all wealthy family back him up in fact darryl has work at four jobs simply make ends meet but there may be light at the end of that tunnel he signs up as human guinea pig in neurological experiment run the universitys dr wheedon brad dourif as result his senses are magnified tenfold using his newfound abilities he sets himself in complete pursuit of the job unaware that there may be some disadvantageous sideeffects having super senses naturally marlon wayans plays this comedy at full throttle giving jim carreyish amounts of physical humor the problem is aside from few genuinely inspired bits there is not much that is funny here the has it is one central gag and pads out the rest of its length rather obvious lowbrow humor there obviously was not much thought put into the plot the entire job selection process is completely ridiculous mean why the emphasis on extracurricular activities if the entire job is going come down singleelimination quiz anyhow and is this the only job being offered economics majors this semester give it credit senseless does try create secondary joke darryls roommate tim laflour matthew lillard apparently he is supposed be faddish but the never does anything him leaving him in piercing phase throughout the movie his intervention scenes darryl however do provide rare and welcome laugh and then there is the love interest is always pathetically tacked onto comedies like this one in this case the object of darryls amor is janice tamara taylor fellow student who will not have anything do darryl until he gains his supersenses needless say the romance is completely extraneous and adds little the this is that desperately needed something else be that good plot more jokes or simply funnier ones or strong character or two anything would have helped senseless get off the ground as it is all the manic exuberant mugging in the world cannot help marlon wayans get this one off the ground

i came an epiphany while watching the bachelor an innocuousenoughonthesurface romantic comedy it is not the sort of in one would expect achieve any moment of clarity but there it was nonetheless sat there watching this marshmallow of movie unfold when suddenly realized what is so ridiculously wrong the entire romantic comedy genre circa in word it is the same thing that is wrong so many movies circa writing more the point it is the refusal acknowledge that characterizations matter when you are telling story about relationship the bachelor is merely the latest in long line of films where we are expected get dewyeyed over any pairing of attractive pleasant people just because they are attractive and pleasant in this particular case attractive and pleasant exhibit is jimmy shannon chris odonnell single guy who has been watching his friends slowly but surely sucked into marriage it is scary notion for jimmy even though he dearly loves attractive and pleasant exhibit anne renee zellweger his girlfriend of three years convinced despite his reservations that it is time sh or get off the pot jimmy proposes anne very badly anne refuses leaves jimmy in very odd position when his eccentric grandfather peter ustinov dies and leaves very specific video will jimmy stands inhereit million if he is married m on his th birthday stays married for years and produces child there are only couple of minor problems jimmys th birthday is the next day anne is nowhere be found meaning jimmy has find another willing bride from among his many exgirlfriends it is wacky brewsters millionsesque premise acknowledged as such in one of the films better more selfaware lines of dialogue the kind where shallow and materialistic guy learns what really matters at least that would be the case if jimmy were not already worldclass altruist screenwriter steve cohen slides into the story an even more draconian condition in the will if jimmy does not get married not only will he lose all the money but the family billiard table buisness will be sold out from under him costing hudreds of jobs from the outset jimmys motivation is not cash it is the livelihoods of his devoted employees it is almost embarrassing for his marital misgivings play role in the bachelors plot development any human standard the guy is impossibly selfless and that is the essence of the gutlessness endemic films like the bachelor the fear of giving the characters flaws overcome on their way happiness there is never any tension between the two starcrossed lovers because there is no sense that anything remotely significant is at stake the blandly nice odonnell could not pull off randy cad if he tried so the filmmakers do not even let him zellwegers anne may have issues her sickeningly affectionate parents as an impossible standard live up but no one dares make her anything but the woman lightly wronged and forget about seeing enough of jimmy and anne together feel invested in their potential reconciliation the parade of sitcom set pieces had better be damned funny since they are all that stands between us and blissfully sweet foregone conclusion will admit couple of those set pieces are amusing including ustinovs rantings about procreation and restaurant fulltobursting men popping questions and champagne corks far more of them are either tedious or downright ghastly like the shudderinducing sight of brooke shields as an icy fortunehunter or the hideous collection of stereotypes when hundreds of potential brides gather in church you are never going get too many raucous belly laughs from like the bachelor but that is not the real problem nor is it the real problem that you know exactly the kind of warmnfuzzy conclusion it is leading up the problem are beginning and middle that are equally warmnfuzzy there is no spark no energy no humanity it is an emotional pudding guaranteed not offend any consumers digestions we have reached point where our proxies for cinematic romantic wish fulfillment do not even have pulse the bachelor is love among the mannequins

are you like me do you get annoyed seeing people talk on their cellulars in public places shouting out loud not giving ratts ass about anyone around them and basically just wallowing in their own selfimportance well if you are than you will most likely agree my rating of this since it basically features trio of annoying ladies bickering away on the phone for an hour and half only make up and hug in the end aaaaaaaahhhh plot three grownup sisters living their own separate lives begin reestablish their communication lines when their dear old dad falls ill critique this would be good movie if it was not for the fact that it is got very little say features uncaring people sharing annoying phone conversations is chockfull of bad acting moments and provides less emotional satisfaction than any thirdrate afterschool special and am being nice how junk like this gets made is beyond me but happy am that the ephron sisters will finally be dealt professional blow considering the regurgitation level of their material had just about reached its limit the only true emotional moment demonstrated between meg ryans character and her dad in this is when he hugs her and swings her around at christmas tree lot wow how deep of course the same christmas tune that is played in every ephron flick chimes out in the background while characters continue build bonds among one another making reference old quaint movies or movie stars stop me am gonna cry again this is mess the characters are boring and irritating watch the plot has something do three selfish sisters talking on the phone whole lot kind of liking their father but not really and then finally realizing the error of their ways while sharing an emotional moment about movie stars from the admittedly was not expecting much from whose television trailer features meg ryan screaming every two seconds and big dog rolling its eyes but even was surprised at the level of ineptitude when it came some of the acting efforts put forth in this meg did fine as the sister who cries lot looking as adorable as ever but someone please put lisa kudrow inside permanent home of limited range cause this woman basically is that very same character that she plays in every single movietv show that she is in enough already and diane keaton must have spent more time thinking about her role behind the camera in this one cause her acting was amateurish at best neither one convinced in emotional scenes granted they gave walter matthau the best lines in the and that is probably where my rating of three points comes from all in all this movie is not funny unless you are one chuckle at train wrecks provides zero drama unless you consider loud phone conversations moving generates absolutely no emotion although did tear up when meg hugged coffee machine and ends on perfectly pretentious note oh no please do not get any flour on my donna karan dress ugh suggest that all ladies take their husbandsboyfriends see this movie if they are pissed off at them about something thatll teach em mess you oh and incidentally mrs joblo also likened this movie piece of cow dung flailing in the wind so there then again maybe you will like it

i have confession even though am movie junkiei saw eye of the beholder and yet still watch moviesi have never seen any of the original godzillas note that godzilla is not sequel the s godzilla released in it is the american release of godzilla flick called gojira nisen mireniamu so part of me was excited as drove the local multiplex see godzilla the latest entry in an almost year old franchise this was longawaited treat was expecting goofy good time complete bad dubbing science fair level sets and ludicrous plot line the last thing expected was for the movie be so boring can only imagine what the theatre full of kids saw this felt you do get all of the so bad they are good traits so normally associated the franchise but you have sit through snoozer plot that has the organization of rorschach blot it is deal was not willing accept hiroshi kashiwabara and waturu mimuras script crams in way too many details and in many cases fails follow up on them the maneuver is not only disconcerting but gives the movie permanent logy weighty feel godzilla starts off destroying power plants and then just stops was it whim bold political statement do not know its foe an ancient meteor that looks like prudentials logo does not just fight the beast from the far east no it is got have lifesaving powers plot erase the data from japan desire clone and the ability become spaceship and then some kind of tentacled space creature there is battle between the head of the godzilla prediction unit takehiro murata and slimy government official hiroshi abe over the handling of godzilla and personal issues and then there is the plucky news photographer and blah blah blah it is like watching magnolia all over againexcept without the good writing keen sociological insight and aimee mann songs what waste when the talking and the plot points stop hurtling at you godzilla does the jobit is entertaining and goes down easy the action scenes are cheesy in their grandeur though little sluggish the dubbing is nice and awful murata sounding like he is in constant need of cough drop as for the dialogue one line summarizes the goofiness factor did anyone see that flying rock go this movie also marked the first time since the three stooges that have heard the word imbecile used in casual conversation though the summer movie season is drying up and godzilla has its moments would not take kids see it they will probably end up asking more questions than charlie rose

capsule five friends at stag party are involved in the accidental killing of prostitute the coverup attempt becomes monster that eats up the friends two wives and several innocent bystanders this was real audience pleaser at toronto but it did not do much for me low directed peter berg who acted in the last seduction and copland five buddies go on stag outing las vegas while cameron diaz works through the logistics of her upcoming wedding one of them one of the buddies accidentally kills prostitute several people no moral compass they started out simple innocent little cocaine party and accident look what happened they have one moral person among them daniel stern and one totally amoral person christian slater it is more selfish let the amoral lead so they do this is strange but not really funny or biting black comedy should actually be funny as well as strange there should be some element of satire the satire is missing here did not find myself laughing here either what we have is strange crime tale one just does not care what happens these people the same idea of people just getting themselves in deeper and deeper has been done frequently if this is popular it is just bringing familiar plot new generation it begins like diner particularly daniel stern and ends up like an extended horrorcrime comic book there are several logical holes in script if security man goes investigate complaint and disappears would not the guests he was investigating be the first suspects someone framed for crime in the way shown would be judged innocent after minimal forensic detective work am desperately trying avoid making this spoiler popular and situation ethics get real slamming some acting of grief is hammy and overdone more yelling than humor

what hath kevin williamson wrought while the horror movie revival spurred on his _scream_ has yielded few decent entries in the genre_i_know_what_you_did_last_summer_ _halloween _h_ and _scream__ it must be noted that williamson himself had hand in the writing of those films those williamsonless post_scream_ efforts among them _wishmaster_ and the recent _disturbing_behavior_ have been frightening all rightfrighteningly insultingly _bad_ add that list _urban_legend_ takes promising premise and runs it through predictable meat grinder of idiocy the influence of williamson on screenwriter silvio horta is clear in two key areas first the opening sequence like that of _scream_ is an extended set piece detailing the singular murder that gets the proverbial ball rolling this sequence in pendleton college coed michelle mancini natasha gregson wagner is decapitated while driving also reveals the other obviously williamsonesque touch the killers look dressed in large hooded parka wielding an axe the killer bears more than passing resemblance the _i_know _fisherman sans the hook one thing horta does not borrow from williamson however is the intriguing premise students at pendleton are being killed way of urban legendsthose contemporary bits of mythology passed from person person group group year year that become so embedded in the social consciousness it hardly matters if they are true or not such as the tall tale that mikey from the life cereal commercials died from fatal combination of pop rocks and pepsi he did not michelle slain the killer lurking in the backseat of lore is but the first fall prey an urban legend come true as the body count rises fellow pendleton student natalie alicia witt suspects not only link between the murders but personal link her past as well the setup shows promise but the story never takes off due in large part horta and the director the aptly named jamie blanks who fires round afer round of his namesake in terms of suspense and scares too many of the wouldbe shocks are fakeouts reliant on bombastic music cues and the films chase scenes are riddled the cliches that _scream_ tried subvert like screaming damsels knowingly running themselves into dead ends when they shouldand couldrun out the front door but that is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes cliches there is also the climactic villain confession in contrived and waytooconvenient motive is revealed not mention the credit card opening up the locked door trick is cliche in any genre banks and hortas intentional attempts at humor are also lame the fact that the best gags are lazy injokey references the other credits of costars joshua jackson and rebecca gayheart says lot about the imagination of their humor some laughs are also had when the rather predictable identity of the killer is revealed but am not so sure if some of the more hilarious things about it were meant be so the filmmakers do not get much help from their onscreen talent was far from fan of bland _i_know _ starlet jennifer love hewitt but would talke her any day ove the dreadfully stiff and uncharismatic witt whose inept attempts at emoting were often met laughter witt has pefect foil in her equally pesencechallenged leading man jared leto _dawsons_creek_ star jackson mugs his way thorugh glorified cameo gayheart displays all the depth and range of well noxzema spokeswoman and robert englund lends the little more than his freddy krueger pedigree as folklore professor granted the cast is hampered their material loretta devine who has done some fine work in films such as _waiting_to_exhale_ is saddled the ridiculous role of pam grierworshiping campus security guard the recently resuscitated horror genre cannot rely on the efforts one mannamely kevin williamsonto stay alive if other filmmakers continue make such shoddy product as _urban_legend_ the genre looks once again go the way of screen slashers many victims

warner brothers has scored another marketing coup the onetwo punch was started in the summer the release of batman forever trailers for ace ventura were bundled the bat ensuring that every jim carrey fan in the free world would know about the impending sequel carrey went on win raves as the riddler and the everwise warner chose halloween as the release date for the video at walmart mere two weeks before carreys return in this marketwise but misfired comedy ace ventura when nature calls is painful reminder of just how grating the rubberfaced comic can be when allowed perform within an uncontrolled environment he may have been brilliant under the direction of joel schumacher in batman forever but here left his own devices carrey quickly wears out his welcome the opening sequence is far the bestan amusing spoof of cliffhanger ace performing mountain rescue of stranded raccoon you can guess what happens mr paws hint it sounds like splat the plot quickly shifts temple in the himalayas and then notsodarkest africa where ace is on the case of missing white bat his hair and limbs both wildly askew carrey flies through his routine in about thirty minutes the rest of the is just more of the same sure the plots linear and the production values solid but where is the scripted humor support carreys sloppy slathering writer and director steve oderkerk provides precious few setups instead carrey just mugs away playing for the camera even when most of it is not funny the better gags have been shown in the ads though bit ace emerging bucknaked from the backside of mechanical rhino is something see though an arguable improvement over the original ace ventura when nature calls is still snooze for anyone over the age of ten the script is virtually devoid of wit tribal mask jokes jerry lewis cameos forget it if anything the inexplicable presence of simon callow four weddings and funeral and bob gunton the shawshank redemption suggests that working carrey is the classical actors ultimate challenge just how long can they keep straight face

synopsis wealthy cuban landowner luis banderas gets more than he bargained for when he sends away for an american bride not only does his new wife turn out be the beautiful julia jolie she also harbours secret past of dubious merit soon julia has absconded both luis fortune and his heart and as he pursues his wife through the cuban underworld luis begins realise that for him there is no turning back review given the absurdism of its wouldbe plot it is unlikely that original sin could have been turned into reputable piece of filmmaking regardless of writer director or stars this is at its heart bmovie junk lurid melodrama appeals neither the brain nor the heart but the nether regions that said original sin could at least have become enjoyable junk had the filmmakers embraced its trashiness and indulged in it instead cristofer seems have mistaken this for serious production and directs it as such the result is vapid uninteresting morass of obvious crosses and double crosses as likely incite yawn as thrill consider the initial sex scene between banderas and jolie brightlylit and mostly filmed from above it looks like an excerpt from an amateur soft porn show cristofer does not even manage capture the allure of cuba instead of portraying his setting as steamy sensuous island paradise it appears bland and lifeless at least banderas and jolie manage inspire some interest there are hints at times that they want have more fun the script but are not being given the chance the same cannot be said of jane whose billy is nebbish and transparent also unwise is the jolie framing sequence practically gives away the films denouement

when pair of films from the same director gets released just three weeks apart it could mean one of two things that the recently overworked individual is due for welldeserved rest or that either of these movies has been sitting in studio safe for while and the timing is merely coincidence the latters the case john mctiernan and the thirteenth warrior finally hits theatres year and counting after its original spring opening and fast on the heels of mctiernans the thomas crown affair remake flick that got good reviews you do not have believe superstitions wager guess that thirteenth will not be so lucky reportedly shelved following skirmishes between mctiernan and producer michael crichton whose eaters of the dead novel provides warrior source and its initial title this messy melange of cultureclash drama and brutal warfare feels empty and sluggish sorta like braveheart without any of the passion but the bloodshed certainly remains there is enough carnage on display here satisfy those in search of purely visceral thrills though please note that the admittedly pungent battle sequences containing all this death and dismemberment alternate talky passages interminable in their dullness these circath century clashes involve roving band of cannibalistic creatures capable of decapitating opponents their bare hands and dozen norse soldiers out stop them from terrorizing the viking countryside the good guys are loud crude often unintelligible and judging from their highly icky hygiene habits pretty smelly boot makes them perfect foils for the dignified arab ambassador antonio banderas who tags along quite reluctantly they are also so hard tell apart that it hardly matters when few of them meet violent demises you will wince you will groan you will grouse have not we seen this guy killed twice before banderas stands confused amidst the chaos partaking mostly from distance as savages in darth maul facepaint and draped in the latest animalskin fashion run amok he is not the hero his soulful eyes and lean build do not exactly herald champion of shwarzenegger proportions and the thirteenth warrior wisely does not pretend he is allowing his foreign and physically imposing costars step into the spotlight when the going gets rough let the characters interaction sans swords and shields however and there is still struggle for the audience follow or even care about the story it is not the end until audiences have witnessed halfbaked romance murky political intrigue veteran actor omar sharif funny girl dropping in cameo role and climactic indiana jones and the temple of doom esque chase through the villains underground lair all this clutter receives stunning visual treatment courtesy of cinematographer peter menzies jr but the collaboration between die hard helmer mctiernan and jurrasic park creator crichton should have yielded more than sumptuous sights graphic action and unintentionally telling moments heard during the thirteenth warrior final scene dog whimpering how appropriate

the red violin is cold sterile feature that leaves you uninvolved and detached it is movie that seems almost clinical as it traces the plusyears history of the legendary musical instrument of the title opening in the th century the story shows how violinmaker nicolo bussotti created the instrument as gift for his unborn son but when tragedy strikes the violin becomes the personification of its makers grief from there the violin comes into the hands of an orphaned child prodigy at an austrian monastery again tragedy strikes as the child is struck down at the moment of his triumph we follow the violin through the centuries as it finds home in england and in maos communist china before being discovered expert charles morritz samuel jackson who mounts painstaking investigation prove its authenticity the violin becomes morritzs obsession just as it is for all those who converge on montreal auction house bid on it morritz however is the only one who knows the secret of the instrument and can understand and appreciate its creators intention the red violin could have been touching inspirational story as soaring as beethoven symphony however director francois girard fails make any emotional connection the viewer here is story that could have made use of various camera angles and lighting heighten its impact girard for some unknown reason uses mostly master shots keeping his camera and thus us at distance we get no feel for the miracle that is the violin it is resonance its purity of sound are not emphasized enough make an impression nor are any of the performances memorable it is as if girard wanted all his actors play second fiddle his violin the red violin promises much but delivers little it is dull at times bit pretentious and might murky the movies music soars over its story and performers and that is its only saving grace

there have been merchantivory costume dramas more of pulse than the mod squad selfconsciously hip cinematic rendering of the old tv series still looked upon fondly so many babyboomers well said squad certainly will not be pleasant viewing experience for them or anybody else maybe even the teen target audience the movie has been geared towards contemporary take on this decidedly show does not exactly seem unwarranted but one wonders if the mold it accumulated while waiting on the shelf did not transform into fullblown case of botulism how curious that the begins defining both mod and squad insisting that the latter is group of people working together and then contradicting this definition keeping its titular trio apart for sizeable chunk of the running time they are julie pete and linc reformed delinquents working undercover for the lapd exposition put out of the way so fast that you are likely be lost from the opening moments on and they are respectively played claire danes giovanni ribisi and omar epps talented actors each deserving of better than this their plight involves standard copcorruption stuff as our wouldbe protagonists catch wind of an internal coverup after their superior reliable dennis farina one of the best things here and gone so quickly gets killed and framed for drug trafficking they pout lot and eventually get cracking expose this convoluted conspiracy using surveillance tactics that would impress the hardy boys and linda tripp but few others when you are supposed be asking what is going happen next you will instead entertain thoughts like who are these people and why should care or are not thrillers supposed contain thrills not that danes epps and ribisi do not give it shot danes can do the troubled teen thing in her sleep as evidenced my socalled life but she is saddled mysteriousboyfriend josh brolin subplot so seethrough you begin seriously question her socalled intelligence ditto for ribisis saving private ryan looney loose cannon though at least he performs wildandcrazy vigor that occasionally demands attention but epps poor epps epps higher learning is so shortchanged he is reduced literally waiting around for bad guy chase him all this sloppiness can be attributed the screenwriters one of whom scott silver is also the director they must think that if they dress up their stupid story in such spiffy trappings the look of the is really quite impressive it will somehow pay off but this mod squad plods anyway characters are nonexistent present are just some goodlooking young things modeling cool levis and cooler attitudes plot hardly escapes confusing convention and the one genre element you would think would be show up in generous portions few nifty explosions some fights any kind of action whatsoever only rarely makes it this dull gabfest all those quick put down last months inept but serviceable my favorite martian update need take step back heres smalltobigscreen translation that really should have stayed in its former incarnation mod or not

david schwimmer from the television series friends stars as sensitive and slightly neurotic single guy who gets more than he expected from the grieving mother barbara hershey of classmate he cannot remember hello mrs robinson though quite cute as romantic comedy the pallbearer is paced like funeral march the characters act react and interact at halfspeed making for one excruciatingly long sit and what is the dreary lighting cowriterdirector matt reeves brings some snap the storys midsection the briefly comes life when our hero attempts resolve his feelings for another classmate very appealing gwyneth paltrow this time though most viewers will have either fled or fallen asleep those tough souls who stay it can marvel at the sleepyeyed schwimmer hound dog head cold who can go for over an hour without ever changing his expression

saving silverman is good example of good comedy gone bad as love story it is good however as comedy it falls flat on it is face think throughout the short minutes laughed total of seven times and those were just chuckles at the most the movie does not have the oomph make it great movie and does not have the script make it funny movie wayne lefessier steven zahn d mcnugent jack black and darren silverman jason biggs have grown up all their lives together they have been best friends forever and vow stay close till the end while in bar after doing show their band based on their love of neil diamond darren meets young woman named judith amanda peet whom he instantly falls for wayne and d however think differently and when judith tells darren that he can never see his friends again it is up wayne and d try and begin saving silverman the performances are topnotch and surprisingly they are what keep the movie afloat jason biggs right off the flop loser does an ok job playing silverman but he is stale and flat at times steve zahn is perfect in the role of wayne lefessier and even though the movie is about silverman lefessier is really the main character and the narrator of the movie itself jack black is well jack black and he does an all right job as d but he is not as funny as he has been in the past amanda peet plays the ultimate bitch as judith and neil diamond plays neil diamond he is better at singing than acting anyway the performances in the are good but it is too bad the script is not speaking of script hank nelkans choppy script is not only badly written but not funny enough even for an episode of sesame street the trailer for the movie as most movies gives away everything that happens in the movie especially the funniest parts somewhere saving silverman was meant be good movie and it could have been but alas in the end it was not dennis dugans direction is all right he adds few directorial touches here and there nothing special being simple comedy saving silverman is perfectly bad movie in more ways than one it has great cast good director and sweet story it is just too bad it has bad script and is all together bad movie

one of my brothers favorite movies is b halickis cult flick gone is sixty seconds one of the best products of the carchase genre that provided drivein fare during the chase pics had more tire squeals than dialogue but they had strong visceral appeal although it boasts bigger budget and familiar stars the remake of gone in sixty seconds is relatively weak and dull randall memphis raines nicolas cage is retired car thief who runs gocart track he got out of crime so that his younger brother kip giovanni ribisi would not take up boosting cars however kip became thief anyway and now he is in big trouble kip promised deliver fifty luxury and sports cars gangster raymond calitri christopher eccleston the end of the week calitri expects memphis fulfill kips bargain if he does not come through kip dies memphis gathers his old crew angelina jolie robert duvall will patton chi mcbride and vinnie jones and kip brings his boys j cross william lee scott scott caan and james duval as if calitri breathing down their necks was not bad enough the team is pursued cop delroy lindo who is still ticked off that he never busted memphis and rival gangster rap star master who wants take over calitris clients watching gone discovered that stealing fifty cars is not any more interesting than stealing one maybe that is why the first fortynine are fairly easy and the thrills are saved for eleanor shelby gto model that has always eluded memphis but the big chase does not live up the long wait had high hopes for gone because it is director dominic senas second kalifornia his debut was brilliant study in the relationship between violence and its audience in that movie sena took simple thriller plot couple gives serial killer ride and successfully endowed it deeper significance in gone he seems be aiming for drama about two brothers who cannot communicate each other but that goal just does not mesh this plot gone either takes itself too seriously or not seriously enough it is not light enough be fun or mean enough be intense this chaser has more dialogue than tire squeals but is none the better for it the lack of action is waste of the premise should have challenged the filmmakers create the most spectacular car chases ever the weak script is waste of talented cast in newsweek interview last year sean penn blasted his old pal nic cage for making bad movies much as like cage for every good picture he does leaving las vegas bringing out the dead there are two major stinkers snake eyes con air mm city of angels that ratio is probably better than what lot of his peers can boast but cage has real talent it is shame waste it in glitzy superficial tripe like gone in seconds

steve martin is one of the funniest men alive if you can take that as true statement then your disappointment at this will equal mine martin can be hilarious creating some of the best laughoutloud experiences that have ever taken place in movie theaters you will not find any of them here the old television series that this is based on has its moments of humor and wit bilko and the name is not an accident is the head of an army motor pool group but his passion is his schemes every episode involves the sergeant and his men in one or another hairbrained plan get rich quick while outwitting the officers of the base mchales navy granddaddy that is the idea behind this movie too but the difference is that as farfetched and usually goofy as the television series was it was funny there is not one laugh in the the remake retains the goofiness but not the entertainment everything is just too clean it was obviously made on back lot and looks every bit like it it all looks brand new even the old beatup stuff martin is remarkably small in what should have been bigger than life role in the original phil silvers played the huckster heart of gold and more than touch of sleaziness martins bilko is pale imitation the only semibright spot is phil hartman as bilkos archenemy it is not saying much considering martins lackluster character but hartman leaves him in the dust

have you ever been in an automobile accident where you have miraculously walked away only few scratches yet the car has been obliterated into an unrecognizable mangled wreck well that has never actually happened me and hope that none of us will ever experience this situation but after watching this inane exercise of movie certainly feel that have miraculously walked away unscathed after twohour ride that mercilessly careens back and forth before finally plummeting into an icy pond oddly eye of the beholder is psychologicalromancethriller starts off promisingly enough when the opening sequence introduces us british intelligence agent called the eye ewan mcgregor working in washington dc in the humorous opening scene he eyes top lawyer across the street in his office his pants down using an array of hightech surveillance and communications equipment he proceeds transmit pictures of the bared lawyer pc screens and fax machines in his office the law firms employees get good chuckle the audience gets good chuckle the eye is later given an assignment where he encounters beautiful woman ashley judd there is something compelling about this mysterious woman despite her glamorous looks however we learn that she is psychopath propensity kill men that get too close her after the murders she sobs while singing the christmas tune little bluebirds and laments about being abandoned her father long ago after each killing she puts on different wig assumes new name and then makes her way another state the eye has witnessed all her murderous transgressions but he does not alert the authorities he somehow empathizes her sense of loss the eye it turns out also is haunted his past his daughter was taken away from him and he anguishes this loss every day of his life his tormented psyche creates ghostlike image of his daughter he engages in conversation she becomes sort of spectral adviser and one thing that the ghostly daughter says is that he must help the woman he now diverts his energies into trying help her find some kind of salvation it does not matter that he has witnessed all of her murders and it does not matter that the eye is abnormally reticent hiding his entire life behind computer screens he follows her dozen different locales and shadows her every move keep her out of trouble when crazed druggie jason priestley attacks her he shows up for some quick butt kicking when the police are closing in arrest her he provides distraction so that she can escape all the while the woman has no idea who her guardian angel is and the eye stays just out of sight peculiar how bad is this movie refer you my review quote source litmus test just take look at the fullpage ad in the newspaper and see where they are pulling quotes for this movie they are from magazines called flaunt and mirabella no doubt they were impressed judds series of catwalks and disguise changes the major problem eye of the beholder is that the jerks forward always unsure of its ultimate destination if it was thriller there was little keep us entranced if it was love story there was absolutely no emotional pull completely disjointed in structure it is only saving grace was its stylish look reminded me of my favorite car commercial the one where the on the tachometer dissolves into winding road and passenger rail car dissolves into small miniature on childs train set am also still hopeful that ashley judd will find serious role showcase her potential talents beyond that the is hopelessly outofcontrol and is in need of seriously better traction and handling

bad bad bad that one word seems pretty much sums up beyond the valley of the dolls if that summary is not enough for you how about ta ta ta still have not got the point other than director russ meyers predilection for casting attractive large breasted women who ultimately expose the aforementioned anatomical areas there is really only one other reason recommend even taking look at this movie that is the fact that it was cowritten famed critic roger ebert who also was responsible for the screenplay after watching this movie you will never be able sit through another one of his reviews where he gives movie thumbs down for bad writing straight face this movie stinks out loud quite frankly this movie deserves but there are parts of it that are so bad they are almost funny so am giving it and maybe that is too generous right from the opening credits knew that had classa bomb on my hands not only are the way the credits actually shot distracting but the first scene you see includes big breasted young woman being chased guy in nazi uniform had absolutely no idea why the hell that was happening it does get explained later and as soon as the first scene is over we cut completely unrelated scene be honest as sat through this movie mesmerized just how incredibly awful it was actually forgot about the seemingly out of place opening until it popped up again later in the the quality of the writing during the rest of the it would not have surprised me if the opening had never been explained so what is this movie about you ask like it really matters ok here goes this allgirl band headed kelly macnamara dolly reed and her friends go try gain foothold in the music industry once there they do manage find success due as much their hooters as anything else it sure was not for their brutally bad singing voices and the movie chronicles how their lives change for the worse as the pressures of fame get them everything from big egos booze and drugs free flowing sex sends them on downward spiral there are couple of other idiotic subplots thrown in for good measure but the fame is the one that pretty much sums up this thing from creative standpoint there is nothing redeeming here other than the abovementioned obsession big knockers that russ meyer seemed have the dialogue is so incredibly bad that it literally is funny in parts mr ebert has generously thrown in helpings of hey man dig and my all time favorite this is my happening and it freaks me out now ask you lines like that how can you go wrong ebert had tried inject as many big words as possible into the dialogue maybe he thought it would make the movie seem smarter do not know but all the big words in the world would not be able disguise the bad writing and even worse acting but the wretched dialogue goes along well the wretched quality of everything else in this movie have seen home movies directed better than meyer managed this turkey in fact there is one scene the one in they are in van driving make their fortunes during really had question if meyer or his editors had just suffered serious head injuries add the directing and writing the music in this movie almost got up check my sound system see if it was broken there was such pile of crap emanating from the speakers then we have the cast first lets start david gurian who played harris the manager of the band this has got be the goofiest looking guy that has ever set foot in front of motion picture camera sadly his acting does not come close making up for his looks if you have been following along up this point this should not surprise you meyers stable of well endowed girls also have the benefit of being fairly attractive go along their other assets dolly reed plays kelly the leader of the band and no surprise here she was cast for her cup size not her talents and yes she does loose the shirt few times and display her impressive talents sadly her ass is almost as large as her chest hey it sexist movie so am writing sexist review then we have former playboy playmate cynthia myers in fairly small role as casey one of the other band members this goes along the rest of the idiotic thinking in the movie meyer casts gorgeous playmate rack kill for and who obviously has no acting talent at all but her nude scenes are the biggest disappointment of all sure russ now is the time get artsy and throw in some well placed shadows on the up side she does have fun lesbo scene sound like am writing review in porn magazine but hey will admit it the only reason that actually managed sit through this damn movie was catch look at cynthia myers naked and since that was huge disappointment pretty much wasted two hours of my life on this turkey the only thing that can say about this movie is that you should stay away from it unless of course you want feel good about yourself knowing that even pulitzer prize winning critic like roger ebert has screwed up at least once in his life too and if you are thinking of checking it out for the double ds you are better off just downloading nude cynthia myers pictures off the internet this is movie that should be avoided at all costs an even better idea might be require video stores place warning on the box of beyond the valley of the dolls beware this movie is extremely hazardous your common sense proceed extreme caution

undercover army detective and rape counselor find themselves locked inside an investigation into some bigwig general daughters rape torture and murder they must delve through all of the unspoken army rules and the hushhushes figure out the conspiracy behind the shocking murder critique the numbers see above this is just there it sits there on the big screen for couple of hours floats around goes overdone code of silence enough already next subject please see it on video if you wanna fall asleep after seeing much better movie like an officer and gentleman otherwise save yourself the trouble and go take crap instead you will feel much better afterwards trust me little known facts about this and its stars ironically john travolta turned down the lead role in an officer and gentleman eventually went little dickie gere ironically on james woods part he completed one of his earliest acting roles on tvs welcome back kotter starring none other than john travolta actor james woods recently confirmed reports of his big dick on howard sterns radio program unlike rocker tommy lee woods is also alleged have an iq of he apparently scored perfect on his verbal sats and on the math section what man john travolta is married actress kelly preston and they have son named jett travolta loves them planes word on the street is that the kid was apparently conceived during weekend at demi moore and bruce willis home director simon wests first was the jerry bruckheimer produced con air before that he directed tv commercials including the budweiser ad the dancing ants yippee veteran director john frankenheimer ronin the manchurian candidate portrays the character of general sonnenberg in this the imdb reports that when senator robert kennedy was shot at the ambassador hotel in
