who knew that in years eddie murphy who made such brash raucous bigscreen splash in __hrs _ would become cuddly the disconcerting trend begun in this summers cutesy largely laughfree _doctor_dolittle_ continues this earnesttoafault dramedy although he is topbilled here murphy is merely support for jeff goldblum who plays ricky hayman the programming director at home shopping network sales are way down and rickys job hangs thread until he meets murphy mysterious spiritual guru whom desperate ricky puts on the air while sales skyrocket and becomes an overnight sensation the reinvigorated rickys greed grows endangering his budding romance goodhearted media research consultant kelly preston writer tom schulman has some promising ideas satirizing home shopping and infomercials and the nature of instant celebrity but these ideas would have more bite if stephen herek had invested any energy into the direction of the the sluggishly paced _holy_man_ is not only slow and overlong minutes but an unfunny bore and murphy can do little juice up the proceedings cleansed of both the attitude _and_ comic sensibility that made him star is for the most part straight man he is curiously lifeless presence goldblum is actually quite good but it is hard for the audience sustain much interest in his character and spiritual journey when the director does not seem be much interested either

pokemon the movie has lot of bad things in it first of all it is plot heavy mess that has bad voice talents badly written script and fantastic animation the first came out the end of and was huge hit grossing almost million domestically sequel soon followed and even made million warner has released their third movie based on the immensely popular video game and tv series and its waste of time and celluloid this time ash ketchum and his friends are on their way the johto battles my little brother told me the new spinoff is pokemon the johto journeys so go figure anyway he comes in contact young girl who is father has disappeared after trying discover the unown they are small pokemon powerful punch and have great psychic abilities the unown bring together their psychic abilities and create entei powerful legendary pokemon who barriers young mollys house and creates every wish she wants now it is up ash and his friends stop this pokemon entei and show him be good pokemon rather than bad one too bad really that this is bad movie surprisingly the first movie was entertaining and somewhat absorbing the second was piece of trash and this one is almost in between it has some good qualities animation message in the end but the flaws seem overpower the goods am still not sure what the big thing is about pokemon they are ugly little animals who speak their own name for their language besides meowth my personal favorite and you do not understand what they are saying my little brother just thought the movie was amazing and kept leaning over and asking him happened or what pokemon that was his response was big lecture of how this is that and that is this he sure did put me in my place the second and third movie being bad have feeling pokemon the movie might be total bust as well pokemon the movie has some redeeming qualities for the kids and the pokemon fans will dig every minute of this for those parents andor brothers and sisters who have sit through this bring pillow

he does not have hardtodecipher accent he does not always speak in monotone and his face does not always wear the same impassive expression in short the former nfl player turned fox sportscaster turned actor is too good be bad but too bad be good unfortunately the same cannot be said of his first star vehicle firestorm is just plain awful one of the most glaring problems long who made his acting debut in john woos broken arrow is that he is so mediocre that he often blends in the scenery as ace firefighter jesse graves long is supposed be playing biggerthanlife action hero the kind of he man who will crash through flaming door save child or parachute into burning clearing rescue some stupid campers unfortunately despite the best efforts of firsttime director dean semler photograph long using heroic shots that make kevin costners work in the postman look stark jesse turns out be pretty boring good guy put it kindly this is not wellwritten motion picture firestorm is collection of howlingly bad lines set against backdrop of disaster movie clich taken together form something that requires level of viewer inebriation be recognized as plot the only reason this is getting one star instead of something lower is that most of the fire sequences are realistic and was fascinated the meticulous planning that must have been necessary stage them effectively we are introduced our big burly hero one afternoon when he and some colleagues jump into the midst of forest fire save group of people during this sequence our big burly hero proves that he is also sensitive guy risking his life save little girl and her dog yes the dog lives from being broiled alive flashforward year now our big burly hero is taking over as chief of his smokejumpers association replacing outgoing honcho wynt perkins real actor scott glenn but this day our big burly heros first in charge is not going be businessasusual group of nasty escaped criminals have set wyoming forest alight aid their flight freedom led randy earl shaye william forsythe the sadistic creep who must be killed twice really die they pose as canadian firefighters who somehow got lost across the border along the way they meet and take hostage the damsel in distress suzy amis eventually our big burly hero is placed in position where he has fight the fire rescue the damsel in distress defeat the sadistic creep who must be killed twice really die and restore order the galaxy firestorms director dean semler is former cinematographer he won an academy award for his work on dances wolves so it is no surprise that the looks good unfortunately that is firestorms lone asset and it falters near the end when computergenerated special effects fill up the screen these are of about equal quality what you might observe on nintendo video game the action sequences include variety of chases are occasionally interesting but never invigorating everyone including long appears be going through the motions there is not memorable performance be found from beginning end unless you count the forest fire generates some heat as the sadistic creep who must be killed twice really die william forsythe lacks panache he is worse than generic bad guy he is boring generic bad guy who does not have any snappy oneliners hurl at our big burly hero my advice scott glenn absolute power and suzy amis titanic is accidentally forget this the next time they are making out resume there is some small comfort in knowing this early in the year that already have one entry for my bottom list at least hope there are not worse films than this and know was not the only one who really disliked this movie as the audience was filing out of the screening loitered in the theater lobby catch few comments the general consensus seemed be that although the movie sucked the promotional key ring was cool the problem is that fox will not be giving out key rings regular moviegoers so that nixes any reason see firestorm

seen at amc old pasadena pasadena ca in sdds paul verhoevens last movie showgirls had bad script bad acting and plot use the word in its loosest possible sense that served only allow lots of sex and nudity it stank starship troopers has bad script bad acting and plot that serves only allow lots of violence and gore it stinks nobody will watch this movie for the plot but heres brief synopsis anyway some friends straight out of high school sign up for the federal reserve armed forces at time when evil bugs from the planet klendathu are sending meteors towards earth from the other side of the galaxy after one slips through the defences and destroys buenos aires the home city of the main characters war is declared this involves sending the grunts who include johnny rico van dien and dizzy meyer down the surface of the bugs planet much carnage ensues the troops are withdrawn and sent another planet answer distress call more carnage ensues after being rescued their plans are changed capture brain bug is believed be controlling the aliens battle plans look did not write this ok yet more carnage ensues get the picture interspersed throughout all this are brief ads from the federal network present the picture of neofascist state much like in verhoevens robocop there are many problems starship troopers the plot where one exists drive the movie onwards is silly harris star of tvs doogie howser md is presented psychic ability talk his ferret early on in the movie apparently so we will accept his ability mindmeld brain bug later on in addition the first thirty minutes of the movie until the characters sign up for service drag on like bad episode of beverly hills the characters are onedimensional so much so that when dizzy is killed she says it is ok because she got sleep rico had hoped that verhoevens use of noname cast would allow him kill off several of the lead characters surprise the audience but such an idea appears have escaped him the dialogue is embarassing and is not helped the frequently terrible delivery almost burst out laughing when harris delivered his speech about the need sacrifice few hundred people for the good of the species finally the fake ads become nuisance although they evoke the propaganda of the wwiiera movietone reels as presumably they are meant their complete lack of subtlety blunts their effect some people will say all of that is irrelevant the movie hinges on the battle scenes so what about those battle scenes well admit the effects are good the bugs move about quite convincingly especially when they have been deprived of few of their limbs and people have their brains blown out their limbs cut off and their bodies ripped in two in quite impressive ways but this is my problem the entertainment value of the rests almost entirely on its graphic portrayal of gore and its continous attempt gross us out starting early on when richards character vomits onscreen verhoeven appears be trying make movie employing the elements that made robocop success but fails spectacularly while robocop had message about the importance of being human and gave the bad guys some motivation starship troopers lacks even these simple features when the brain bug sucks out characters brain near the end of the it is merely an analogy for what the has done us this is full of graphic violence and is not suitable for children under

often similar little boy lost in park that he had no right venturing into the call of the oboe toque do oboe is disappointing that seems have wandered astray many elements of the are solid and have potential far greater than director claudio macdowell will ever know but they simply do not convert into solid work although setting is never established it becomes apparent the takes place somewhere in latin american village in present day the community is dull one where every day is downhill slide from the last over time the people have taken themselves the town cinema is closed no tourist has passed through in years and the daily funeral processions are accompanied no one other than the grave digger so what happens when tourist paolo betti does arrive one day he sends this routine and dull town into mayhem and shock it is revealed that he is musician who plays the oboe as hobby when he sits down in the park one day give solo performance the entire community gathers around for their first bit of entertainment in countless years it is from that that the musician meets some of the villagers and agrees play at the local cinema in accompaniment silent thus opening the theatre for the first time in ages the woman that talks him into this witty task is the cinema owner leticia vota who also happens be engaged the towns police inspector figure who soon becomes suspicious of his fiances involvement this musician the rest of the plot closely resembles freak show gone horribly astray it features character who literally rises from his grave woman who has phone conversation god and the aforementioned inspector who goes from an intriguing and serious character an almost humorous drunk technically this is nightmare the music score is poorly edited into the so it is often choppy rough and abrupt the lighting is poor at best makes it increasingly difficult focus on many scenes and the english subtitles are full of misspelled words and are often absent presumably on the assumption that the audience will be able understand some simple portuguese and spanish phrases this translation flaw is best highlighted at the beginning of the when what seems be relevant fight is filled dialogue but the subtitles are limited fewer than words in addition the pace of the seems uneven it opens series of long panoramic shots that alone can test ones patience the then moves into faster pace that again slows towards the end as the director seems determined reach the two hour mark there was however potential for this it is piece exploring the beauty of cinema and music and the reunification of people these are all topics that could easily fill movie perhaps if there were no freak show and the technical aspects were improve there might just be thing of beauty at the end most importantly though the director would have patch up the plot and make it flow better so that the two hours are not such bore until then there seems be little more hope for this piece than that boy has simply crying out mommy while he wanders astray in park

a friend invites you movie this would evade the explosions and special effects of standard summer fare and be grounded in reality the plot is as follows after terrifying incident mother and her independent daughter separate from the father and move away from the city they need fresh air get some perspective maybe start over romance begins brew however as one of the locals played an international superstar in rugged clothing sparks things up especially at countrywestern slow dance it stars rising young starlet helms good cast and is directed one of the better actorturneddirectors in you accept you jump at the opportunity see what you believe be _the horse whisperer_ but poor moviegoer you have been conned alas you find yourself watching incredulously _hope floats_ oh woe your hope has sunk why was this movie made why was it released it is travesty on nearly every level and has the authority sink the careers of nearly everyone involved at the hands of better script the could have been gem but it is clueless as what it is about and only succeeds in transferring same cluelessness us poor viewers _hope floats_ stars sandra bullock as birdy who after discovering her husband has been cheating on her her best friend on national television no less takes her daughter and drives back her home helmed countryish bumpkin eccentric played gena rowlands she decorates stuffed wildlife birdys nephew travis played _leave it beaver_s cameron finley is under her custody and in one of the films many failed injokes is always seen wearing different halloween costume what is the point of this does it make any sense is it supposed be funny the point of the is show that the family is eccentric but was convinced that the grandma should have been locked up for endangering the mental welfare of child all of this undercuts the plot of there is none there are only many scenes that are supposed register emotion there is the scene where birdy who used be the prom queen is humbled approaching peer she once mocked for job there is the scene where birdy dances her father in the hospital for alzheimers and then there is the sentimental scenes justin played harry connick jr who is taking liking her again showing her beautiful pad that he built from scratch and during each of these scenes was sidetracked my earlier question what sort of eccentric grandmother go through such great pains as provide dog costume kermit costume cowboy costume whip and full furred barney costume for her grandson wear during dinner what sort of warped ramifications would this lead for the rest of his life outside of this there are other sure signs of screenwriters block when the daughter stands up the bully at school when birdy almost loses her job when the family pulls in goofy lipsynch cheer someone up when someone dies when the daughter cries no wails in exasperation that her father is not coming back in movie like this you notice the strings being pushed and you sit there comatose hoping it will end who can survive such debacle worry for bullocks career has been running on autopilot for the last few years she has an attitude solid perkiness and can drive busbut she cannot handle the emotional scenes much less hold southern accent harry connick jr is worsestick singing or get some acting lessons please gena rowlands is the best part of the but she is such good actress that it staggers the mind that she is weighed down such lukewarm material here it would be severe tragedy if the recurring star of john cassavettes great films is known for this two notes forest whittaker cut the slowmotion sequences there are twelve times where you undercut your own direction such failed trick have you done so you could have shaved off tenminutes of this almost unbearable debacle you have had know something was wrong if your cinematographers filter makes the candlelight appear like little s you are not bad director but you cannot change terrible script there is recurring scene where birdy working at the neighborhood fotomat finds the machine go wrong and image after destroyed warped dark image appear think about it succession of destroyed images may have been more entertaining than this movie

any remake of an alfred hitchcock is at best an uncertain project as perfect murder illustrates frankly dial for murder is not one of the master directors greatest efforts so there is ample room for improvement unfortunately instead of updating the script ironing out some of the faults and speeding up the pace little perfect murder has inexplicably managed eliminate almost everything that was worthwhile about dial for murder leaving behind the nearly unwatchable wreckage of wouldbe thriller almost all suspense films are loaded plot implausibilities the best thrillers keep viewers involved enough in what is going on so that these flaws in logic do not become apparent until long after the final credits have rolled unfortunately in perfect murder the faults are often so overt that we become aware of them as they are happening this is very bad sign not only do such occurrences shatter any suspension of disbelief but they have the astute viewer looking for the next such blunder of course in the case of perfect murder at least that gives an audience member something do besides concentrating on the inane plot and the lifeless cardboard characters perfect murder is not strict remake of dial for murder but it does borrow heavily from frederick knotts play was also the source material for hitchcocks version as well as madefortv retelling emily hayes gwyneth paltrow is the wealthy wife of powerful wall street moverandshaker steven hayes michael douglas their marriage is not going well emily resents stevens controlling instincts and as form of rebellion she is having an affair penniless painter david shaw viggo mortensen when steven learns of the relationship he decides confront david but his approach is not that of typical cuckolded husband instead of yelling or threatening steven offers david proposal that is too good resist for in cash before the rest after he is break into stevens new york apartment and kill emily of course after getting the first payment david never bothers ask how he is supposed get the rest ultimately am not sure of the three main characters we are supposed be sympathetic the coldhearted husband who wants his wife dead so he can get his hands on her fortune her mercenary lover who is willing do the deed for halfamillion or the woman who is happily carrying on an extramarital affair not only are these individuals all profoundly dislikable but they are not interesting it is possible make good movie detestable characters see reservoir dogs but there has be something compelling about them in this case there is not steven emily and david are all lifted directly from the screenwriting text book on stereotypes the actors in this are obviously just on hand get their paychecks michael douglas is playing the kind of heartless tycoon that he can do in his sleep he is gordon gekko an unfaithful wife gwyneth paltrow who was recently delightful and appealing in sliding doors is simply awful here she now has the dubious distinction of have starred in two of worst thrillers the other being hush at least viggo mortensen i jane has little fun his part but then he usually does interesting things even in bad movies the thin supporting cast includes david suchet the star of poirot as police inspector and sarita choudhury kama sutra as emilys best friend perfect murder is plodding production that generates almost no suspense from beginning end there are not many twists and turns in the unexpectedly linear script makes the ending inevitable almost from the start it is surprising see director andrew davis the man behind the fugitive involved in this mess but like his stars he too needs earn living it is just that remaking hitchcock and doing it so badly hardly seems be an honorable way go about getting the dough

steve martin shines but sgt bilko fails impress based on the popular sitcom sgt bilko follows the string of oldsitcomstomovie conversion fever remember the brady bunch movie or the beverly hillbillies released sometime back brady bunch was moderate hit in in the us while hillbillies flopped do not really know whether the minds are running out of good ideas or just being plain lazy but the tvconversionmovies are hitting our screens like wildfire sad say mixed success such movies are mostly targeted at us viewers since they are usually followings of such series over there and the larger the following the more likely the sitcom will be made into movie sgt bilko frankly have not seen any its original tv version even the charm and wild antics of funnymen steve martin and dan akroyd failed entertain sgt ernest bilko is the man behind the motor pool place of vehicle storage and repair of fort baxter though totally unskilled in the field of work that he is supposed be in charge of he has an almost superhuman ability and zeal sniff out moneymaking opportunities from running gambling den in the military garage pools though materialistic in mind bilkos methods has thoughtfully enriched the lives of the men of fort baxter providing them some form of real recreation within the camp and the people love him for that colonel hall runs the entire fort and thanks his inborn blissfullyconfused state bilko has managed hide his operation though nearly every living person in the fort knows about it bilkos state of ascent is suddenly underfire when the pentagon sends major thorn tough cookie on army regulations check on the progress on the million hovertank project new weapon under development within the forts grounds add his problems thorn is determined bring bilko down in retalliation of major sabo done on him bilko during their younger army days director jonathan lynn who directed my cousin vinny in marisa tomei won an oscar for bestsupporting actress managed pull sgt bilko through suitable pacing and some exceptional moments of laughter but that is about it there are really not enough laughterpackedmoments in sgt bilko fully entertain the average moviegoer still steve martins sgt bilko is played finesse and fullforce the renowned comedian without him sgt bilko would have just fell flat on its face sgt bilko did moderately well in the us box office early this year but doubt it will earn much elsewhere around the world the current trend in mixed successes in such tvconversions may be blessing in disguise really at least it will force rethink any of its initial intentions turn another tvidea into movie or at the very least approach those ideas more creativity unless you are fan of the tvseries or love watch steve martin in action you can skip this one when deciding movie catch in the local theatres am sure there are better ones around

look the new version of psycho came out and the world did not end guess gus van sant really is not the bringer of the apocalypse unfortunately though that psycho did not end the world as we know is the best thing that can be said for it van sants controversial retelling of alfred hitchcocks classic has polarized filmgoers everywhere even before it premiered without benefit of an actual viewing many have said that the will at best suck being an almost good critic waited until actually saw it decide that the at best sucked and that concludes the use of the word suck and hopefully the thoughts that am braindead orangutan director gus van sant took the original hitchcock and refilmed it shotforshot using the same exact script few minor alterations the inherent challenge was in making the suspenseful and scary even though large group of the audience will know exactly what will happen at the exact time suspense probably could have been attained if the actors had been able create something new or different than the original sadly that did not occur it is hard be overshadowed vera miles and john gavin from the original psycho but that is what exactly happened julianne moore and viggo mortensen in moores case the would have been helped if the files gillian anderson had been cast instead especially since moore goes through the entire doing scully impression from the cold demeanor and expressions her rigid way of forming sentence moore is scully mortensen who liked in i jane opts play sam loomis as cowboyhick would have been nice if he had gone past that starting point sam has twang and cowboy hat but that is about it mortensen turns in one of the most uptight performance in recent memory anne heche in the janet leigh role does few good things in her brief time on screen at least her marion crane has little life in her cannot be said for most of the rest of the cast the best work though comes from vince vaughn as the demented mamas boy norman bates he is not going make anyone forget anthony perkins but he is effective both in being naughty and nice the best part of the is the dinner scene heche and vaughn where they simply talk there is some solid acting there something that is not carried through the rest of the van sant has made boring all the camera tricks that hitchcock so eloquently used in are not as eyecatching now what passed for brilliance then has been copied so many times so many directors that they do not impress or excite van sant in what assume is grasp at originality decided put some streamofconsciousness images into few famous scenes was that lamb in the middle of the road these images included some questionable editing choices took away from the scenes themselves and caused at first bewilderment and later laughter definitely not hitchcocks intention at least danny elfman had the good sense not mess bernard herrmanns original famous and terrific score if like psycho does not frighten then what is the point aside from norman the characters are thinly drawn people who leave no connection the audience there are things van sant and company could have done at least make their recreation interesting in the end however the new psycho is noble attempt but alas dismal failure

an american werewolf in london is john landis groundbreaking feature about an american tourist who gets himself bitten werewolf in jolly old england the groundbreaking part of the movie is the special effects more specifically the makeup used for the transformation of man into werewolf and for the ghosts that haunt the main character even twenty years after its release that part of the movie is still impressive although would have say that it really is the only part of the movie that could be considered impressive the rest of the movie is run of the mill werewolf flick some extra gore thrown in for good measure if it were not for the cutting edge makeup effects used in the werewolf transformation it is most likely that this is that would have gone largely unnoticed when it was released back in and good reason the acting is not great and neither is the writing well ok we do not actually expect either of those things be great in horror but one other important element is lacking here too it is not scary no exception you know what is going happen before it happens you do not even need the obligatory scary music give you hint will give director john landis credit for this being one of the best looking horror films that have ever seen but john it just was not scary did not know if this was intended be some sort of romantic drama and the whole werewolf thing was just thrown in get people come the theater see it but it did not work for me actually it was intended as sort of spoof on horror films but the mix of the comedic moments the melodrama was so bad the intended humor was lost on me it is never good sign that you do not realize movie is supposed be funny until after the movie is long over and you read it in the background material call me crazy but you should not have do research on movie enjoy it am not even going get into the plot of the movie that much since the title pretty well sums the whole thing up werewolf bites boy david naughton boy ends up in hospital where he is tended and eventually falls for pretty nurse jenny agutter and then strange things begin happen boy including and must admit this is very nice touch visits from his friend who was killed in the same werewolf attack that ended up him in the hospital the neat thing here is that his buddy is rapidly deteriorating corpse know it sounds strange but it actually works the scenes between david naughton and the dead buddy griffin dunne are really the best parts of the movie as said probably the only reason that this was hit was because of the special effects while they are still impressive today they are not impressive enough or plentiful enough warrant watching this and since they are more or less the highlight of the there are far better choices out there if you want scary movie curl up your sweetheart watch actually the sequel an american werewolf in paris is more entertaining since it does not take itself as seriously and actually provides few more laughs along the way

capsule annoyingly unentertaining obvious and paperthin buddycopdrugsexywitness movie presence of director michael bay shows none of the talent he demonstrated in the rock have seen this movie already said as looked at the box art no have not even seen trailer for the movie do not even know what it is about but can look at the way they are promoting it and know have seen it already thought it is about these two cops and they are buddies sort of they are at each others throats lot but they really do like each other and everyone else in their department hates them ecause they are hotshots and they have some kind of diametric opposition in their relationship and one day they are in the middle of cop business as usual when they get mixed up in this plot that involves really sadistic bad guy lots of henchmen who can never hit anything the billions of rounds of ammo they are always carrying and the bad guy is drug lord and there is witness and she is this sexy thing who rubs both of them the wrong way and their supervisor wants their badges for breakfast when they blow up half the town bringing this guy down only missed the bit about the badges the rest got deadon and had not even left the video store yet the cops in this movie are will smith and martin lawrence and the bad guy is the immensely underutilized tcheky karyo smith plays cop who has trust fund and is thus not cop for the money martin is family man shades of the nowtired lethal weapon dynamic here whose wife and he are at total odds this leads some strained scenes about lawrences not getting any and some totally unneccesary bits him skulking around his own house thinking his partner is now his wifes back door man not funny tiresome bad boys gets some of its incredibly meager selling points from the presence of will smith and martin lawrence will smith is natural and am happy see him in movies like six degrees and men in black he is funny and charming without trying be he really does seem be enjoying himself martin lawrence is different story he is so uptight and verbally constipated that sitting through his improvised riffs are trial movies like this are not about originality know this they are about style and energy and synergy between actors know this too and yet while watching bad boys its glamorous photography and impossibly exact stunt choreography felt fed up would seen con air despite being completely implausible was still great fun because it tried however feebly put some new life into the mix bad boys is dry run and overlong too clocking in at just over two hours lot more byplay than felt could be justified could write this movie you could write this movie many people have many people will continue write this movie over and over again other people will buy it from them and make it and we will pay money see it more the fools we all in terrifyingly prescient line from his book scanner darkly phil dick once mused that the mcdonaldburger as he called it would eventually eclipse money as the token of cultural and financial exchange one day we will all just sit in our living rooms and sell the same burger back and forth each other the same could be said about this movie have the sinking feeling we are going see it again soon

in the first death wish movie mildmannered new york architect paul kersey played charles bronson was avenging the death of his wife in the second he was avenging his daughter in the third he instigated small war in order avenge the old friend fourth movie on the other hand begins kersey doubting the point of his violent crusades and living the quiet life his girlfriend karen played kay lenz however since this is death wish movie we know that sooner or later something bad is going happen the people kersey cares for this time karens teenage daughter dies of crack overdose and kersey is forced return his old vigilante ways kerseys new targets unlike the previous movies are not the ordinary street punks but rich heavily armed and wellconnected drug dealers even such unstoppable killing machine like kersey needs some support and it comes from the publisher nathan white john ryan determined avenge the drugrelated death of his own daughter whites plan is make kersey kill major players in two rival drug dealing organisations and thus instigate the war between them the plan begins take shape but kerseys actions bring attention of two police detectives reiner george dickerson and nozaki soon teckoh fourth and unfortunately not the final installment in the death wish series will probably remembered as the typical movie of cannon group production company responsible for some of the worst cinematic trash of the last decade however although some critics might argue death wish the crackdown represents slight improvement over the death wish paul kersey one of the most intriguing and potentially controversial characters of the is still being dumbed down mediocre script and charles bronson really does not feel the need put much effort in his acting however the hand of veteran director lee thompson seems more capable of michael winners and the action scenes seem slightly less surreal although they still look cheap and repetitive and downright boring there are some attempts for the movie have plot between the numerous scenes of violence and one of such attempts is potentially interesting plot twist at the end the script even tries fake some social conscience through criminally underused kay lenzs character and predates the war on drugs campaign that would inspire many products in next few years there are even some halfhearted attempts of humour both intentional and unintentional like in scene where kersey assassinates mob figures wine bottle but the quality of this movie is still far away from bronsons classics special note xphiles mith pilleggi the actor who plays ad skinner in the files could be seen in small role of cannery lab foreman

this is the movie that could singlehandedly bring mystery science theater out of cancellation it is one of those movies that is so bad it is absolutely hilarious due in no small part its big star supermodel cindy crawford if you only remember one thing about fair game it should be that it singlehandedly proves crawford should stick the sports illustrated swimsuit issues if you thought kathy ireland was laughable in alien from a you will change your mind when you see fair game ireland would win handfuls of oscars if this was her only competition in real casting coup crawford plays attention moviegoers you are about enter meaningfree zone should the sound system malfunction during your viewing of cigarettes do not panic the will work just as well as silent movie chronicling the meaningless lives of vain yuppie types the movie covers the same ground as the wilt stillman films last days of disco barcelona and metropolitan but without any of his acerbic wit and the inviting style of his writing firsttime writer shana larsen makes the mistake of creating couple of dozen characters and not giving any of them any depth there is not one of these characters worth caring about the movie features such cornucopia of hot young stars that it looks like celluloid version of people magazine among others the movie features ben affleck casey affleck david chappelle janeane garofalo gaby hoffmann catherine kellner courtney love jay mohr martha plimpton christina ricci and paul rudd and unlike people magazine the people speak not that they have anything interesting say it is new years eve in and monica martha plimpton is preparing her big party structured as series of relatively unrelated stories about her guests on the way the party director risa bramon garcia flits back and forth among her stars monicas apartment is in noho an area that one of the guests describes as so cool all of the poor people live there typical of the shallow couples in the movie are kevin paul rudd and his friend and wouldbe sexual partner lucy courtney love they argue about whether lucy is slut or not since she sleeps everyone except him of course she dares him go immediately bathroom stall and have sex her turns out be neither erotic funny or successful rather like the rest of the story the movie gets its title from the carton of cigarettes that lucy gives kevin for his new years eve birthday cigarettes are shield against emotional interaction other people kevin later tells lucy in snippet of dialog that sounds profound only outside the context of the movie another character played jay mohr has problem his sexual triumphs every woman he beds falls deeply in love him the next morning when his latest conquest tells him of her affection for him his response is like lot of people as the movie finally draws close the characters awaken from their postparty game of musical beds some have passed out early from alcohol abuse and remember little while others actually have some clue as what happened the movie itself is so forgettable that the time you reach your car in the parking lot all trace of the will have vanished from your mind is probably the best thing that can be said about the movie cigarettes runs it is rated for profanity sex and one dope smoking scene and would be acceptable for older teenagers

i have nothing against unabashedly romantic films when done right at least slightly evident restraint they can be engaging sweeping appealing but it is hell of shame when someone botches it as badly as nora ephron botched sleepless in seattle hollow boring romance that should appeal only the most gullible of viewers the ones willing buy into ephrons whiny views of life and romance tom hanks and meg ryan two of hollywoods most likeable stars play sam baldwin and annie reed repectively baldwins wife recently died and he moved seattle his son jonah seeking get away from the familiar surroundings remind him of his late spouse jonah senses tension and calls talk radio show tell the world about their problems sam seems ready strangle his son for calling the show but when he gets on the phone he begins pouring his heart out ephron has him do this so that annie reed meg ryan can hear it annie is happy woman she is engaged walter an allergyprone working man and seems be perfectly content but after hearing sam the widower on the radio show she becomes convinced that he is her destiny and is willing risk her engagement for it five years after this movie hit theaters hanks ryan and ephron would team up again in the far better although still subpar romantic comedy you have got mail is about people who hate each other in real life falling in love on the internet at least that movie had sense of spontaneity here it seems that the first one hundred minutes exist solely set up for the last five the fact that sam and annie will finally meet is so excruciatingly obvious that everything else is perfunctory sleepless in seattle is full of wonderful performers from its two leads supporting stars like bill pullman and rosie odonnell but none of them can save the from being bore its characters are dull and empty its script is not funny or particularly charming the script has fundamental problem annie gives up for little reason her life walter pursue sleepless in seattle whom she has never even seen it is the kind of life decision that real people do not make and its major unforgivable plausibility sacrifice in essence this movies purpose is head towards goal that should not even exist it is ten minute short ninetyfive minutes of filler if you were show me sleepless in seattle and did not have review it you could just call me asleep in philadelphia eugene novikov

if you have seen the trailers or commercials it is rather difficult really figure out what this movie has in store well it is hard tell after watching the movie as well bruce willis is resident of the future and it is rather bleak future the worlds population had disintigrated into mere and is no longer ruled humans but animals the reason in an organization called the army of the monkeys contaminated the world pure virus thus wiping out practically the worlds population in mere month bruce willis character is one of the surviving few but is enslaved scientists as are most of last living humans they barter his freedom sending him on an assignment and having him do the ultimate task go into the past find the leader of the army of the monkeys and kill him well this explanation did not come easy although the movie is very thought provoking of us as people our future and the evilo in the world as story it is very confusing and dragging know movie isnt keeping my interest when fidget in my seat or feel the need look at my watch only find that it is only been an hour passed terry gilliam has certain style that realize many appreciate and have not watched his previous work brazil but this movie felt like it took too long tell and yet when one realizes the end is near because it is very easy figure out you wish it were more complex and not mention that the movie is depressing is the only reason why it did invoke emotion from me

house on haunted hill starring taye diggs geoffrey rush ali larter famke janssen peter gallagher bridgette wilson max perlich lisa loeb james marsters and chris kattan directed william malone written dick beebe house on haunted hill initializes itself the audience scene involving zombielike mental patients attacking and murdering doctors in the goriest ways possible one doctor is killed instantly after having pencil rammed completely through his neck nurse has her head forced into barrel of water these mobs of zombies presented are like those in previous bhorror flicks grunting noises and cadaverous movements except this time at the end of the millenium the is given the power show exactly how horrific these creatures can be in past horror films the actual murder scenes are left out or not shown forcing the viewer assume their own nasty bloody deaths for the hapless victims house on haunted hill does not want their audience have an imagination everything is provided for them watch and squirm not think this nonsense violence thrown out of nowhere is unfortunately the most refreshing part about this house on haunted hill is based on the of the same title introduces handful of characters as quickly as it can following the opening blood fest the has no intention of providing character development or laudable plot the aim here is scare the audience chilling unexpected shots of blood guts and mayhem however the is neither scary nor unpredictable the plot involves five people who are dared spend the night in haunted house for one million dollars an amusement park owner geoffrey rush each character is failure in the external world and acknowledges that they would do anything for that money since the characters are immediately generalized as either greedy or caring the expectations of who will survive or not is killed five minutes after you meet them the problem is that every character is not likable the two who come closest being civilized are womanizer taye diggs who should be doing films lot better than this all of his talent and businesswoman who accepts being womanized ali larter the characters presented are so annoying and pathetic that it is hard cheer for them or scream them the worst character in this or maybe in any released this year is chris kattans watson pritchett he spends the whole whining about the spooky house in tone so irritating and inappropriate that he unintentionally begins seem more evil than the house itself waiting for pritchett die was strenuously difficult act sit through the most humorous actor of the bunch is geoffrey rush playing steven price an homage victor price who starred in the original playing the rich man who supposedly organized the party he plays the role perfectly in twisted way where it is obvious that he is up something just the expressions on his face however rush is pretty much wasted in confusing subplot involving hateful marriage evelyn price played famke janssen the main problem is that house on haunted hill is not scary top off that huge disappointment every actor was wasted and the script was completely ludicrous if the annoying characters and hilariously bad dialogue were intentionally underdeveloped similar deep blue sea the goal for creating creepy suspenseful action was completely missed

fit for ghouls night out fat girl stands cast iron firm the simplistic fatuous builtin excuse that its woman director is baring the harsh sexual realities of adolescent girls being boy might not understand female behavior and am unequipped analyze this particular pseudofeminist comingofage story fair enough will pretend ignore the mannered posturing and health class this is nono dialogue when older teenage boy coaxes younger teenage girl let him fuck her up the ass speaking variations on it will not hurt for scene that seems last at least ten minutes this is done almost entirely in an unbroken master shot that suggests unimaginative camerawork more than unblinking voyeurism they dare you look away without possessing the courage of allowing the children actually sound like children they are mouthpieces for writerdirector catherine breillats onenote clinical politics rather than show an evenhanded evaluation of the rigors of hormonal change breillat previously responsible for the unwatchable romance wants indulge in her hour of hate life is pain highness get used it she would find keen bedfellows in neil labute and todd solondz other sultans of misanthropy who lack the balls be earnest or honest for children dealing trauma and pain is complicated bury that in sarcasm and academic theory feels cheap these wouldbe auteurs more like hauteurs have not earned the right display suffering because they do not layer it in emotional truth as mike leigh does throughout naked and david lynch in several key scenes of blue velvet of course there go again comparing her all these better male directors do not care gender be damned she is borderline inept braced for kneejerk reaction from the art house crowd mortified shock or compulsory applause will suffice writerdirector catherine breillat may well accomplish her mission get rise out of people do not be fooled this grotesque oversimplification of awkward forays into passion may be quickly forgotten remembered only as cold boring philosophically arid and incompetently photographed the hyperviolent climactic sequence proves so extraordinarily misguided that honestly wondered whether breillat had thrown in an impromptu dream sequence twelve years old bundle of dough sour pout the superb ana reboux plays the titular fat girl thousand yard stare and frumpy insouciance her character is also named ana sitting at the table morosely slurping down banana split her presence is grounded and heartbreaking it is pity breillat never finds anything for her do other than get defensive against her evil storybook sister year old elena roxane mesquida for bringing transitory boyfriend home their shared room in this summer cottage ana has no escape from her position as stoic bedside observer elenas depressing confusion of cheap sex romance the boy in question smug italian college kid named fernando libero de rienzo is real piece of work claiming that the experience is declaration of love while begging for blowjob ana does not receive any warmth from her largely absent parents who join elena in making fun of her hefty girth she finds pleasure in wandering the beach alone singing songs herself and swimming in the pool kissing the metal railing and pretending that it is her paramour reboux commands the screen but there is only so much child actress can do recounting pretentious monologues herself if one is inspired rescue this young performer and place her in better movie at least she fares better than the other young talent asked perform in intense love scenes that might feel justified if they were not so dramatically misguided this minute vignette is something of horror show but breillat saves her nastiest poison for the very end on the long ride home punctuated an uncomfortable silence between family members gigantic trucks swerve as the hour grows late will mommy fall asleep at the wheel perhaps or maybe there is something deadlier around the corner lying in wait pounce upon the unsuspecting fat girl what is more she might even like it the intent of being unfair and unpredictable placing her heroine in the most diabolical of corners in order face up impending adulthood breillats extreme flourish of sadistic tawdriness reveals her as master purveyor of contempt fat girl is bitter pill indeed aka ma soeur screened at the new york festival feature coming soon

marie could not talk paulie the parrot star of his own movie tells us about the daughter in his original family dad could not listen and mom could not cope so they got rid of me paulie the autobiography of talking not merely mimicking parrot has jay mohr in the lead role of the bird the voice not the body and as the minor character of benny smalltime crook who uses paulie pull off small scams like stealing twenties from atms as the parrot mohr is delightful when director john roberts allows him cut up benny on the other hand is character you have seen thousand times before and mohr brings nothing new that role robertss deliberately slow pacing of laurie craigs script lends subtle sweetness its humor but creates some definite problems when kids movie wants mosey along watch out if the material is not crisp and perfectly composed beauty can sometimes dissolve into tedium so it is paulie when they let their bird do his standup comedy routines the show hums and the audience roars too often however sleepy silence ensues among the viewers as they wait for the story pickup again tony shalhoub the smartmouthed chef from big night plays misha recent russian immigrant the s he had been teacher of literature at home but now he makes his living as janitor in the animal research lab paulie has been taken for study although misha gets few nice lines am russian like long stories his somber part seems designed only elicit our sympathy besides paulie the only character worth noting other than cute small parts played cheech marin and gina rowlands is the speechimpaired marie played in precious performance cinematic newcomer yearold hallie kate eisenberg naturally enchanting she gives the picture genuine heart the bad news is that her part is confined the first half the best scenes have the bird dancing and strutting show off his comedic skills when maries family gets cat for example the bird who has not wanted learn how fly until then takes an instant interest in soaring tricking the cat while insulting him at the same time paulie calls him stupid hairball their rapid physical antics add the humor of the situation it is good quality sitcom material but performed animals when one of the humans without much of voice begins sing paulie cringes am bird he explains his frequently subtle humor have small brain and it is about explode the movie contains rich doses of john debneys dreamy music heavy use of solo violin he keeps reinforcing the films heartwarming themes and when paulie finally takes off in flight the orchestra comes up loud and strong cymbals clashing it is long story says paulie it is the only kind he knows reflects misha and the motion picture runs the standard length for kids movie still feels too long the best parts are enthralling but then there are all of those dead spots inbetween paulie is movie that never quite lives up its promise but manages charm nevertheless paulie runs it is raged pg for few mild profanities and would be fine for all ages my son jeffrey age gave the movie his biggest complaint being that there was not enough action he thought paulie was funny and the actress that played marie was quite good his friend sam almost thought the movie was awesome excellent and gave it he thought paulie was good but he did not believe the way maries speech impediment was acted

well heres distasteful thoroughly amateurish item that surprisingly was actually boxoffice hit at the time of its release after just viewing the for the first time my primary question is how did anyone an iq north of enjoy this movie it is cheap idiotic unfunny and not nearly as raunchy as had heard it was at least some smut would have livened things up bit porkys tells the story if you can call it that of four clueless high school buddies pee wee dan monahan billy mark herrier tommy wyatt knight and mickey roger wilson whom desperately want get laid women for the most part are mystery them and in this movie they are the audience as well since all of them are written and acted as if they are aliens from different planet their plan is sidetracked however when they venture out smarmy strip bar named porkys they are able get into using fake ids after they pay the manager onehundred bucks for three hookers they are played trick on and find themselves being dumped into the swamp below the building for these four teenage guys this means war on porkys porkys ultimately manages fail on almost every possible level as teenage sexromp it is not wild or amusing enough as comedy all of the jokes are predictable and fall flat as look back at the it is something suspect most people from that era would want bury deep in grave and as revenge movie it is crushing bore one of the most offensive things about porkys is how jawdroppingly inaccurate the is about teenagers the four main characters are not even attempted be developed as characters and we learn very little about them except that they are horny and would probably feel more comfortable in preschool that sure is revealing information the female characters fare even worse under the inaudacious screenplay and direction bob clark the women are all treated as objects or comedy props rather than real people for example the two gym teachers mrs balbricker nancy parsons and honeywell kim cattrall only have one purpose and that is be made fun of mrs balbricker is gruff noholdsbarred overwight woman who will not stand for any foolishness and in one particularly embarrassing scene for all involved honeywell has sex coach and barks like dog there is no way tell if parsons or cattrall are servicable actresses even though have the suspicion they are not but one thing is for sure they are asked do things in this that are not at all funny only humiliating prove how outoftouch this socalled comedy is compare it other more serious films about teenagers and it looks even worse in comaprison any of the john hughes pictures such as sixteen candles or the breakfast club put porkys at an even greater shame those films actually dealt serious teen matters but remained great deal funnier thanks their bright and truthful writing and heck if porkys wanted be teenage sex movie would take fast times at ridgemont high or the last american virgin over this any day of the week director bob clark is not bad director two years after he made porkys he directed the nostalgic holiday classic christmas story would forgive him for this misfire in fact if it was not for the fact that he also wrote the screenplay just the thought that someone would actually sit down write such piece of garbage and think that it was actually worth releasing unto the unsuspecting world is actually whole lot funnier than anything in porkys

review ghost dog the way of the samurai cast forest whitaker henry silva cliff gorman john tormey gene riffini victor argo tricia vessey isaach de bankole camille winbush director jim jarmusch writer jim jarmusch rating good shot stars languid yet pointed and focused ghost dog the way of the samurai sublimely savages our cultural fascination the mafia and the sleek ultracool cinematic image of the hitman juxtaposing the samurais honor code of feudal japan against the tradition bound modus operandi of the americanitalian mafia it ceaselessly chips away sculptors precision at the archaic foundations of both as they lumber dinosaurlike function in the modern era director jarmusch gleefully plays the iconoclast ripping into mafioso precepts splashes of acidic wit using palate of bleached colors jarmusch lugubriously maintains tone of desolation that belies the many sparks of laugh out loud humor punctuating the he does not cater audience expectations of hypercolorized stylized violence and gunplay where no one dies the action is presented in flat brutal codas bullets have permanence death has consequences the movie rises beyond standard conventions become meditation on the concepts of honor and loyalty it is an antimovie of sorts there are few photogenic empathetic characters for the audience fall in love this is not that lovingly holds your hand there are dark contemplative moments and the firmly holds you the shoulder just so asserting itself for all see the fulcrum for the movies thematic balancing act is ghost dog mafia hitman twist on the stereotypical image of the mob enforcer ghost dog is hilarious contradiction in terms unlike the sleek muscular killing machines one is accustomed we are given an inner city black man who is overweight and slovenly replete chapped dirty hands and rumpled clothing he wears hooded sweatshirt he often pulls over his head giving him monklike appearance there are no acrobatic back flips and shiny super guns in his arsenal he uses old worn weapons and simply goes about his tasks in economical efficient and pleasureless fashion ghost dog is disciple of the old ways of the samurai distilling the essence of his life through the filter of book he reads daily hagakure the way of the samurai life consists of simple pleasures for him ice cream warm rooftop naps and good books ghost dog lives as it were the basic tenet expressed his book one should start each day considering oneself as dead living atop an abandoned building surrounded his flock of pet carrier pigeons ghost dog exists in netherworld lacking creature comforts and friends he craves nothing more as he puts it late in the have seen all want see he exists in spiritual world of the mind gaining moral sustenance from his readings ghost dog was not always as he is presented in several roshomonlike flashbacks it is shown how ghost dog was assaulted racist white males and beaten nearly death until the timely intervention of good samaritan that samaritan being foot soldier in an aging crime family ghost dog pledges his life the service of the man louie tormey as repayment after years of loyal service ghost dog is sent louie kill handsome frank made man within louies organization who has run away the crime bosss daughter louise vessey ghost dog wordlessly executes his task witnessed louise whom he spares as she sits watching betty boop cartoon clutching copy of the book roshomon in bit of synchronicity louise loans the book ghost dog upset that frank was taken out someone not from the family the mob bosses in turn put out hit on ghost dog in perverse twist of loyalty their assassinated comrade the rest of movie holds the dated value systems of both the mafia and ghost dog up the light of new millennium many acerbic asides as the two come factions come into conflict the theme of old cartoons flares up time and again each time showing cartoon violence that is in sharp counterpoint the reality of ghost dogs world each time character is shown watching cartoon it is from the same era betty boop felix the cat etc reflection of days gone near the end louise is watching cartoon that is departure from the previously shown ones it is bit of audacity on jarmuschs part that is nicely effective despite it is surrealistic nature as ghost dog floats through his world his life is touched two people one is sage little girl winbush who connects ghost dog through their love of reading she comes symbolize melding of the old ways and new sensibilities just as louise ultimately does films end the fact that jamusch is so effective at illustrating the tenuous bond between the two is testament his skill as writer the other person in ghost dogs world is an ice cream de bankole vendor who only speaks french yet intuitively shares rapport ghost dog the vendor is the literal stranger in strange land jarmusch through rappercomposer rza underscores his rap and reggae music at first blush seems dichotomous but its primal rhythms serve strengthen the fundamental nature of the movie ghost dog seems draw some type of strength from the rap music he listens as he negotiates the streets in various stolen cars in and of itself presents another paradox about ghosts dogs sense of honor the head mafioso is played henry silva stone faced resignation of all the cartoonish mobsters he is the only one who appears self aware of his state in the world gorman plays sonny lieutenant who respects the old ways yet has quirky affinity for rap music love comically shown in several impromptu displays ruffini seems the truest reflection of the mafia he is husk of man assisted two hearing aids who barks out advice without truly hearing what he or others are saying whitaker carries the using what truly great actors use his face ghost dog is reticent speak often going for long periods without doing so the fact that whitaker can convey such wide range of emotion through gesture or look is remarkable talent although the has deliberate pace some of the late night drives and walks taken ghost dog dragged the momentum down truly tragic is how ghost dog misinterprets japanese honor in his final confrontation the mob he reveals himself be so desperate for spiritual guidance through the hagakure that he fails truly adapt it what is real and true in his world carried on the shoulders of remarkable performance whitaker ghost dog rises beyond being characterization or icon into figure that garners sympathy if not bit of pity

i rented brokedown palace last night blind having heard nothing about it beforehand and enjoyed it immensely despite some flaws for anyone wishing have the same experience would suggest reserving judgement of the movie until viewing it in its entirety that is no easy task superficially it bears an unfortunate and not necessarily unintended resemblance several other movies notably return paradise and midnight express as result nearly every review of brokedown palace subsequently read became hopelessly entangled in making the obvious comparisons the consequence was nearly universal condemnation is shame as this is fine for those who have yet view the movie let me say that it is not an attempt portray the nightmarish reality of the third world criminal justice system as was midnight express nor completely the moral dilemma and examination of the meaning of friendship and humanity that was the heart of return paradise in my view if this is be compared any other source it would have be joseph conrads acclaimed novel lord jim problematically the basic storyline seems more than familiar two american teenage girls on vacation are sentenced spend most of their lives in thai prison for drug smuggling in an obvious setup involving suave conman shadowy criminal conspiracy and corrupt third world justice system the girls are alice claire danes and darlene kate beckinsale they are lifelong buddies who planned highschool graduation trip hawaii and then secretly changed their destination the more exotic thailand without telling their parents once there they find hotel and go sightseeing includes sneaking into luxury hotel sip expensive drinks poolside they get caught trying charge the bill the wrong room minor transgression will later come back haunt them but they are saved from hotel security charming friendly australian nick daniel lapaine who takes care of the bill more polished execution of the girls scam he then proceeds separate the girls and make smooth moves first toward alice then toward darlene now alarm bells are going off among viewers the everpresent nick is too slick and his stories do not add up us the girls of course are too naive notice long before it happens we are anticipating the inevitable disappearance of the fasttalking smuggler and the arrest of our teenaged sittingducks at the airport en route hong kong caught holding the bag literally containing heroin just as predictably the thai police and courts do their part in meting out injustice and our trusting tourists are prisonbound for long stretch left unanswered is the red herring issue of whether one or the other of the girls was willing accomplice for those in need of ready answer might suggest closer scrutiny of the bell hop at the girls fleabag hotel as one door after another their comfortable former life is closed the girls and their families turn in desperation the noiresque expatriate lawyerfixer yankee hank bill pullam and his thaiborn partnerwife recurring element of the movie is the tension between appearance and reality as expressed in one of the films tag lines who do you trust and hank is no exception although seasoned movie goers and those familiar pullmans oeuvre will find few surprises much of the remainder of the movie is smorgasbord of intriguing themes incompletely explored in shorthand fashion lou diamond phillips for instance plays delightfully sinister and callous dea agent who while appearing be casually accommodating hank withholds vital information at crucial moments is he part of wider conspiracy an inherently powerful if somewhat tired premise the offers parts riveting courtroom drama prison story and potential character study of american teens their relationship and what constitutes friendship between them the result is reasonably engaging and suspenseful the girls interaction hanks investigation and the various trials and hearings offering hope for their release delivering tensionas does the foredoomed possibility of their escape if brokedown palace has major flaw it is its creators tendency like timeconstrained tourists take frequent side trips down fascinating alleys only reverse direction halfway down and return the storys main avenue and if that were all there was brokedown palace it would not be very good movie but believe the writers and director were after bigger game and in this they succeeded for the main theme of the movie like the proffered name of its location is freedomin all its permutations ultimately the other subthemes may be considered window dressing young and pretty alice danes is an old soul wild streetwise teenager thirst for freedom and adventure presented as perfect blend of yin and yang dark and light is her cautious best friend darlene beckinsale cleareyed and straightforward alice is more complex than her friend she comes from poorer background has reputation for getting into trouble and has lost the trust of everyone including her own father whereas darlenes life is ontrack aimed at college marriage kids career suburban home middle age and fulfillment alices is uncertain unfocused and yearning one poignant scene in the shows darlene shouting across an open moat visitorsfriends and relatives from home whose lives continue while hers is in limbo tellingly alice is present but not included just as revealing of their different personalities when alice and dar first come thailand the openness and delight on alices face does not read as simple naivet the way she stands up and stretches as she and her friend ride along in small boat reaching toward the sun she really is drinking in what she believes be freedom while dar remains seated in the shade brokedown palace begins an admission alice of her guilt in tape recording sent hank however unintentional it is all alices fault she is responsible for persuading her friend lie her parents sneak away from the safety of hawaii the perils of thailand try the petty scam places them in the clutches of the evil nick in case one misses this point in the inevitable confusion of films beginning darlene obligingly reminds alice of her culpability in prison dar of course is the willing dupe in her view confers innocence never mind that it was her coercion of reluctant alice accompany her hong kong placed them in police custody in the first place or that her naive confession sealed their fate dar is innocent it does not matter alice is the subject of this movie she and her journey toward personal freedom along the way we are treated an unsympathetic portrait of the shallow american culture created these girls their halfbaked sensibilities and materialistic goals in the end that culture like its representatives yankee hank and dars father man who knows how grease the wheels proves as impotent as its government in the face of the girls tragedy thailands culture contrary most opinion comes off much better comparison it amazes me that reviewers argued this point at both extremes believe the filmmakers view was that thai culture is vastly different from the american but not necessarily inferior the thai the sole exceptions of corrupt official and spiteful prison spy were uniformly consistent in their behavior and true their principles the girls were shown be treated no better but certainly no worse than the nativeborn their prison in stark contrast the probable reality was no hellhole being relatively clean and sunlit the prison authorities demanded good hygiene provided medical care when needed and hard manual labor consisted of picking grass the thai guards were authoritarian what else but certainly not routinely sadistic as for the thai justice system the reasoning of the thai judges during both an appeal hearing and in the films penultimate scene was devastating in its logic and morality freedom has many faces and brokedown palace explores many of them in the extreme we have freedom of the body and freedom of the spirit some settle for the former alone while others remain imprisoned an entire nation roam without the latter but freedom seldom comes without price is why the movies other tag lines are what is your dream and how far would you go believe could make good case for the interpretation that the person who attains freedom incarcerated or not films end is alice she finds redemption and salvation through the acceptance of personal responsibility think the light bathing only her figure among the assembled prisoners in the final scene visually signals that fact kate beckinsales character might more properly be likened the released temple bird referred twice during the trained fly back its cage as the thai magistrate observed in the films climactic scene the issue was always one of character and the jamaican prisoner made it clear that freedom is achieved within oneself if one thinks back over the movie character was transformed their experiences increasingly the cinema landscape seems have become littered endless permutations of kung fu womanfemale characters virtually indistinguishable from male action figures here at last is the story of modern heroine in reading the many users comments was struck what seems an unusual phenomenon whether or not person liked the movie almost everyone praised the actors think about that when was the last time you came away from motion picture possibly hating it but raving about all the performances in it do yourself favor rent brokedown palace and watch it open mind there is more there than meets the eye

everyones heard about this movie and more specifically the scene everyones heard the famous barnyard animal quote squealed no pun intended over and over and everyones got admit that they will never travel down river again without thinking of deliverance good that is what you are supposed do oh if you are one of the ones who has not seen this yet or you somehow have not heard about what happens heres your spoiler warning deliverance was real shocker for it is time major advances were being made in films and deliverance made its own advances when it introduced new horror into the industry when it was first released it literally shocked the audiences it was something that for the most part had really never been seen on the big screen before among widerelease films an rating but todays standards and in todays world such scenes as the one in deliverance can be reproduced in way that is not as shocking although they can be even more graphic g pulp fiction pulp fiction did it in way and expanded on it in way that it could even be interpreted as funny but in deliverance was no laughing matter the story centers around group of four atlanta men who decide take rafting trip down backwoods river in georgia while the river is still there and in its glory the initial leader of the group is lewis burt reynolds in his prime real outdoorsman and more of daniel boonetype then any of the others joining him are ed jon voight bobby ned beatty and drew ronny cox the groups first objective is find someone drive their cars down the river the point where they will end their trip they make arrangements few mountain men who accept for the task drew also has the famous dueling banjos competition local who is let us say genetically challenged the men then set off down the river lewis also the master at canoeing leading the way everything seems be going fine until the two canoes split up leaving the unexperienced ed and bobby alone they encounter two hillbillies armed shotgun who captured them ed is tied tree while bobby is sodomized one of the men ed nearly receives the same cruelty but lewis arrives just in time fire an arrow through the rapists back the other hillbilly gets away and the men have decide what do the dead body disposing of dead bodies is done rather frequent throughout this while attempting make quick paddle for it both canoes tip over drew who was without life jacket was possibly shot and cannot be found lewis suffered rather nasty compound fracture during the incident and is in serious condition this leaves ed and bobby ed decides go out and look for the remaining hillbilly alone the bow and arrow the question arises if he will be able handle himself as he horribly botched first shot attempt at deer his comment wonder how anyone could kill living thing will have more meaning in the future deliverance is definitely wild ride oops am doing it again it is extremely tense at some points and very dramatic it is definitely one of those must see movies and should be considered one of the classics of its decade

in october of audiences were dazzled the horror surprise hit know what you did last summer the went on gross over million dollars in the s and even developed cult following much like the previous years million dollar grossing scream when the trailer hit theaters in september attached urban legend it looked like wonderful followup did it live up the first the answer is no jennifer love hewitt returns as julie james survivor of the serial killer that attempted kill her and her friends year before she has been so upset since the incident nightmares haunt her all over the place but she has move on she know attends college and is best friends funny outgoing girl named karla brandy who is trying hook julie up will benson played newcomer matthew settle karlas boyfriend is tyrell the funny outgoing type who is played soul foods mekhi phifer freddie prinze jr also returns as ray julies boyfriend from year ago one morning julie and karla are called up local radio station who are offering four tickets the bahamas if they can correctly identify the capital of brazil of course they answer it correctly and they are off the bahamas julie wants ray come but he declines the offer so karla secretly invites will instead help boost her plan of hooking him up julie after they arrive at their hotel it is just them and the staff on the island it starts off as the weekend of their dreams something just had come mess up the one carefree weekend of julies life though ben willis muse watson is back and he is not letting anyone survive this time will ray come the rescue before he can kill them off one one jennifer love hewitt and brandy turn in respectable performances brandy in particular was impressive considering this is her first feature you could see that the characters were horrified and they would do anything possible survive matthew settle and freddie prinze jr are completely different story let us start settle matthew is completely fake in this you could not believe word coming out of his mouth you could tell he was acting and its reasons like him that this one is not as good as the first one he does do good job towards the end but that does not clear up the scars he already left on the freddie prinze jr is almost as bad as matthew settle was he is almost completely unbelievable and the majority of his lines are completely meaningless and out of place we do not see him as much as settle otherwise he could have done just as much damage as settle did mekhi phifer is alright as tyrell but yet again the dialogue is out of place the plot of still know turns out be pretty good one at the end of the movie like where the filmmakers went this second installment but maybe if it occurred in the same town as the first one it would have been bit better the
