cinematography and setting of their island are simply wonderful there are lot of very nice shots around their hotel the sound is pretty good but still not as creepy as the first films jennifer love hewitts song how do deal is also played for about thirty seconds still know what you did last summer is nothing compared the first the first was very suspenseful and it contained some very memorable scenes the last fifteen minutes of still know what you did last summer really picked up and almost reached the same level as the first before this part in the there are many unnecessary deaths and fake scares that is okay though because the is still very much fun and there are few suspenseful scenes think the reason this was not as scary as the original was because in the first one the killer terrorized the people involved in the incident he made them suffer for what they did in the second ben willis just kills anyone he feels like he does not stick ray and julie who were the ones he is actually after he had go after karla will and tyrell if the characters he stalked were in some relation the incident that went on when he was ran over julie ray helen and barry it could have been much better and it would have made lot more sense the bottom line not disappointment but third in the series would be out of hand

brian depalma needs hit really badly since scoring big the untouchables in depalma has seen casualties of war raising cain and particularly the disastrous bonfire of the vanities go down in flames consequently it would be easy enough consider carlitos way shrewd commercial choice for depalma reteaming al pacino scarface and returning the gangland ground has yielded his two greatest box office successes it does not hurt any that he has latched on solid story and brought out dynamite performances from pacino and sean penn carlitos way while hampered depalmas characteristic excesses and stylistic cannibalism is truly tense and engrossing drama carlito brigante pacino is lifelong criminal who finds himself unexpectedly given second chance in carlito is released from prison after serving only five years of thirty year sentence when his conviction is overturned on technicality he declares himself reformed tired of life on the streets and determined fulfill his simple dream of buying into rental car business in the bahamas among those who find this conversion hard believe are david kleinfeld penn carlitos crooked attorney and childhood friend and bodyguard pachanga luis guzman carlito rediscovers old flame gail penelope ann miller and seems ready retire in peace old ways die hard though and old associates pull carlito step step back into life he cannot seem shake carlitos way will probably make the strongest impression the two outstanding set pieces bracket the in the first carlito accompanies his young cousin on drug buy will have anyone pulse on the edge of their seat the closes an equally thrilling chase through the new york subway and grand central station both highlight depalmas gift for choreographed mayhem and these are not the only occasions when the stage blood flows freely yet for all the viscera found the character study even more compelling carlito brigante has lot of michael corleone in him an aging gangster trying unsuccessfully go legit but where the culmination of the godfather saga played like opera there is more of an immediacy carlitos way an everpresent sense of doom launched the title sequence sets the flashback story in motion you sense that there is no way after so many years that carlito can stay out of trouble indeed he observes that his attempt at the straight life is more function of time than change of heart you do not get reformed you just run out of wind pacino captures carlitos dilemma surprising subtlety and the cautious observation borne of years of experience watching every corner for an enemy sean penn is even better turning in his best performance date as kleinfeld jew in the world of puerto rican and italian wiseguys kleinfeld is an outsider huge chip on his shoulder he could have been simply pathetic heavy drinker and cocaine addict playing tough guys way out of his league but penn invests kleinfeld tremendous nervous energy and an overwhelming survival instinct he shows man moving steadily towards the brink making the moment he goes over quite jolting as compelling as the narrative is viewers may experience profound sense of deja vu depalma continues steal shamelessly from other directors this time adding scorsese his repertoire point of view tracking shot and copacabana scene more than passing resemblances goodfellas he even recycles some of his own previous plagiarisms like degree swing around kiss vertigo via body double and the climactic shootout will strike many as far too reminiscent of the train station sequence from the untouchables from story standpoint there is an obligatory love story cliche would longsuffering girlfriend character penelope ann miller is good but limited actor who does not do anything new the role and eventually she becomes just distraction never integrated fully enough into the story still it is easier be forgiving of superficial flaws when the backbone is so solid the two principle characters held an iron grip on my attention one all the cinematic thievery in the world could not break carlitos way plays like tragic novel deliberate confident and powerful those willing grant depalma his tendencies towards the extreme should find themselves well rewarded

i have never been huge fan of jeff bridges but loved him in the big lebowski the part of jeff the dude lebowski was reportedly written specifically bridges in mind and the fit is perfect the dude is an unemployed denizen of los angeles hippie slob on bowling team soft spot for white russians he is enjoying leisurely soak in the tub when two thugs break into his apartment demanding be paid for the money his wife owes after much pleading he convinces them they have the wrong guy but not before they urinate on his rug the dude assumes that these collection agents were after another jeff lebowski famous millionaire who also lives in a so he goes meet his namesake ask for enough money replace his rug the millionaire refuses but calls him back when he discovers his wife has been kidnaped he wants the dude act as gobetween for the kidnapers dude and his friend walter john goodman take on the task and get caught in an intricate web of kidnapers millionaires high schoolers nihilists artists pornographers thugs and league bowlers comedy is perhaps the most subjective of genres so take my recommendation as you will for me the big lebowski is very funny it is an incredibly successful comedy the ratio of laughs intended jokes much higher than in most films not only are the two leads bridges and goodman funny separately and together but each supporting character is refreshing comic figure all the characters end up as the butt of jokes but the jokes are always deserved and never contrived each person may be comic caricature but there is always respectful selfacceptance that lets us laugh at these people without condescension the characters are firmly established and they never change their behavior for quick cheap laugh it is not what they do that is funny it is who they are is why the acting is so important and so successful in this movie worth mentioning are john turturro as jesus that is jeezus not haysoos the greaser bowler who is in lusty marriage the game julianne moore as the postpostfeminist artist whose work has been described as vaginal steve buscemi as the eager tagalong bowler who is constantly rebuked and ignored teammates dude and walter and sam elliott as the rambling longwinded narrator aside from the performances what makes all the characters funny and interesting is the astute dialogue people lose trains of thought they interrupt they boast they repeat themselves they repeat their friends they sound natural taken fargo the coen brothers last it is evidence that the brothers are observant listeners and gifted writers ethan coen is not just good at directing actors he is also good at technical directing he and cinematographr roger deakins created beautiful world on perhaps beautiful is the wrong word nihilists carpetpissers and thugs are not objects of beauty but the bowling photography and series of vikingbowling fantasy dream sequences are lovingly photographed as though the dude himself were in charge of immortalizing them on all around the big lebowski is great solid comedy outstanding acting writing direction and photography all combine make this great comic success

synopsis captain picard and the crew of the starship enterprise disobey federation orders and defend peaceful community of the baku from the evil admiral dougherty and ruafro the enterprise crew in the meantime experience the rejuvenating qualities of the baku homeworld lt worf grows pimple data sings opera pieces picard scores baku chick riker shaves while sharing bubblebath troi and the enterprise women note their firmer breasts comments star trek the next generation was hugely successful sequel tv series star trek science fiction series developed devoted fan following in the even though it still enjoyed high ratings star trek the next generation ended production after seven years so that the cast could replace the original star trek cast in paramounts franchise centering on the voyages of the starship enterprise star trek insurrection is the ninth star trek movie and the third focus on the star trek the next generation crew star trek insurrection qualifies as one of those movies star trek fans such as myself would rate somewhere between okay and good after star trek the final frontier nearly awful movie almost as bad as the repugnant star trek voyager tv series star trek fans could probably swallow anything paramount throws out in the trek franchise do not wish spend this review comparing insurrection the eight other trek movies most people reading this probably have not followed star trek anyway so comparison would seem tedious at best let me thus make my comparisons briefly so that it is out of my system star trek insurrection is not as good as the previous installment star trek first contact star trek insurrections comic tone may be best compared star trek iv the voyage home star trek ii the wrath of khan is still the best trek movie okay let us move the movie itself star trek insurrection infuses basic science fiction premise humanitys exploration and colonization of space lot of lowbrow humor and witty oneliners this combination works well more often than it fails but when it does fail the humor really seems cheesy much of this appeals trek fans nostalgic fondness for the starship enterprises crew audiences unfamiliar trek lore may miss the significance of some plot points and may even become confused at times star trek insurrection begins scenes of the tranquil life on the baku homeworld forget the actors and special effects the beautiful setting of this movie its snowy mountaintops and verdant valleys steals the show this tranquility however is broken data an android who reveals the baku that they are being secretly monitored the federation and their alien allies the sona it seems that this world is veritable fountain of youth sustaining its inhabitants indefinantly in young healthy state the enterprise crew led captain picard investigates datas actions and uncovers conspiracy between the sona and an enterprise admiral relocate the baku and plunder the planets youthrestoring properties sound pretty heavy it is though this plot anything but unique and groundbreaking is undermined the films constant barrage of humor when going after data for instance picard sings an opera piece him this is supposed be cute and humorous in much more funny sequence work grows large pimple on the side of his nose as result of his exposure the baku homeworld pimple his crewmates try as they might cannot avoid looking at the acting in star trek insurrection is for the most part pretty good since they have been playing these characters for years those portraying the enterprise crew reassume their roles effortlessly enough the terrific actor patrick stewart plays captain jeanluc picard and delivers moral speech picards trademark his usual aplomb brent spiner another fine actor plays the android data well enough again and provides the best moments of comic relief in the though the old androidwishingtobehuman motif will tire some trek fans familiar the routine from the tv series the supporting cast who appear in this movie alone are also pretty good despite many other critics negative opinions murray abraham the winner of an academy award for his performance in amadeus plays the major villain ruafro well enough ruafro reminds me somewhat of the baron harkonnen in the version of dune like the baron ruafro continuously has his skin looked after it is stretched and stapled servants in one particularly memorable scene ruafro becomes very agitated and his facial skin splits open and bleeds ruafro is no khan from star trek iithe best trek villain everbut he is much better than the forgettable dr soran from star trek generations okay promise no more comparisons donna murphy must also be noted as baku woman anij who picard falls in love murphy is not young woman supermodel body she is mature woman an attractive countenance this is the type of woman whom picard for those who know the character well would be enchanted in fact the chemistry between murphy and stewart works very well here particular plot point involving anijs ability slow time down an ability she shares picard becomes one of the most intriguing parts of the movie for as good as the actors and setting were star trek insurrections special effects were surprisingly disappointing they proved adequate sometimes barely for s mainstream science fiction but they fell way short of the standard trek movie and paled in comparison those seen in the trailer for star wars the phantom menace trailer reportedly preceded many showings of insurrection the space battles involving the enterprise and sona ships in particular seemed trite and unsuspenseful and the final confrontation between picard and ruafro took place on completely unconvincing interior of satellite the new enterprise itself only seen in this and its predecessor remains largely unexplored though its exterior does not look quite right for reason cannot explain despite star trek insurrections frequent comic goofiness and occasional substandard special effects enjoyed the it maintains roddenberrys largely optimistic view of the future and rejects the gritty violence of its predecessors particularly star trek first contact though do not get me wrong the dark tones of trek films like first contact can work very successfully would recommend insurrection as matinee for saturday afternoon especially for fans of trek or science fiction in general rated pg cannot see this being objectionable the viewing audience young or old

us critictype people are always shaking our heads and telling everyone that movies are not thrill rides but think that back the future ii is one of the few exceptions if the original had the spirit of the then this has the spirit of the full of fights chase scenes cliff hangers special effects some detective work and of course the vision of the hightech future the picks up exactly where the first left off doc lloyd marty fox and jennifer elizabeth shue travelling years into the future because something bad is going happen marty and jennifers kids doc tells marty he must take his sons place at an incident that will cause chain reaction if marty mcfly jr says yes griff wilson in one of four different roles whoever said history tends repeat itself was not joking especially when it comes the movies essentially the same chase scene that marty endured in the takes place again in the year but it is not as authentically exciting this time because it is so obviously parody of itself at the end of the situation marty has changed the course of history for the better and it seems like everythings copasetic right wrong since when do things go according plan in the back the future movies there are so many minor conflicts and details that effect the plot and the direction of the story will not even bother list them all basically we get see marty as an old man his house his family etc we also go back an alternate and then back again everything happening so fast the never stops catch breath the films best aspect is the fact that it actually goes back the first movie and shows lot of the action that occurred from another angle it is difficult convey the sense of wild and zany fun without describing every little detail the only thing sacrificed in this is the suspense instead of grand finale we get lots of little victories the end everything is back normal but something happens that leads yet another sequel but it does not seem gratuitous back the future part ii is really great adventure movie it certainly has more originality than other films but it lacks certain charm that was dominate throughout its predecessor

magnolia left me relling from the theatre staggering from the relentless assault of an adventurous director reveling in his craft at nearly three and half hours magnolia will strike some as brute of it not only demands your attention but challenges you grasp the significance of seemingly unrelated storylines and hidden intentions it is delirious depressing heady pretentious surreal filmmaking it is also movie that will polarize its viewers director paul thomas anderson takes talented cast wraps them in net of interrelated stories and sets them spinning in symphony of despair whose song does not let up until an oddly exhilerating biblically influenced pseudoclimax the characters make up modern day gomorrah in the soulless way in they live their lives there is frank mackey tom cruise slithery snake charmer of men whose search and destroy seminars teach how mentally rape woman get into her pants there is earl partridge jason robards dying media tycoon yearning make amends for lfe of callousness finding his estranged son there is game show host jimmy gator phillip baker hall self absorbed tv icon who is hiding more than few secrets from his public and there is police officer jim kurring john reilly who cloaks himself in the codification of organized religion and the legal system perhaps masking man who needs rules fuel his decision making process given equal weight are stories involving cokeaddled emotional cripple melora walters former tv quiz show champion william macy materialistic adulterous wife julianne moore child jeremy blackman victimized mentally abusive parent and caring empathetic nurse philip seymour hoffman hovering over all these characters is cloud of death lies and despair it is not pleasant movie there is not one bad note in the acting it is affecting and layered and wonderful there is moment where tom cruise wordlessly implodes that rivals work he has done in whole films then he tops himself mesmerizing deathbed scene walters plays her character redeyed rawness and fierce selfdestructiveness that is anxiety inducing robards convincingly portrays fading whisper of man who still hears lions roar when he speaks director anderson has apparently given the actors lattitude emote the problem is that he stays on them too long julianne moores character linda quickly escalates frenzied pitch of guilt tears screaming and remorse and never backs off from it after few hours it turns from interesting chinese water torture quite few scenes such as the game show go on just bit too long and will be offputting for those used pat minute where the main theme is reiterated several times just in case you missed it the first go around and just what is the theme alienation hopelessness anderson challenges you draw your own conclusions and he does not make it easy the starts showing three strange and seemingly unrelated events it is harbinger of the synchronicity come at times different stories reach reach key moments at the same time other times stories seem veer off into uncharted territory regardless of what else is happening anderson is audacious enough even have group sing in the middle of the what is surprising is that it mostly works if you have doubts about andersons intentions will ask you pay attention the final frame despite all the sturm und drang magnolia ultimately speaks mans capacity for hope and attempts at redemption despite magnolias needlessly long running time and its propensity for uneven editing as anderson plays the auteur showing off fro the masses have admire his guts this is truly adventurous filmmaking that spits in the face of conventional storytelling my rating bulleye stars side note helping anchor the is perfectly matched soundtrack featuring aimee mann her lyrics often add depth scene thematically while the actual music is both morose and beautiful when she sings save me at the end it enhances the yearning felt the characters just as wise up mirrors the anguish felt all as they contemplate their lives

a group of high school kids mix up group of hiphop artists as documentarian strives discover why todays youth seem attracted black culture the review if black white the new from writerdirector james toback is eventually remembered for only one thing it will be the revelation that brooke shields claudia schiffer marla maples and mike tyson can act however this partly improvised gem will be remembered for more than that black white is fascinating it makes statement about americas youth and hiphop culture without getting heavyhanded overly serious featuring cast of known commodities ben stiller robert downey jr and hot newcomers singers bijou phillips tobacks is complex worth seeing black white has multiple storylines that are all related each other la robert altman there is dean the basketball player allan houston who is asked rig games for money mark clear stiller in exchange for fifty grand game this eventually spills over into the life of deans longtime friend rich power gangsta who controls city blocks of harlem rich has deal the imminent opening of whiteowned club on his turf meanwhile the young white girls who like hang around rich and his homies get talked into being in documentary sam donager shields and her gay husband terry downey jr others who make appearances are william lee scott as the young white punk will joe pantoliano as his district attorney father jared leto as high school teacher marla maples as the mother of one of hiphop crazed teens claudia schiffer as deans girlfriend and mike tyson as mike tyson the stories ebb and flow through the losing and gaining prominence over time friendships are lost lovers are gained and there is an occasional burst of violence originally rated nc in the united states black white features lot of sex between black gangstas and young white girls while the was trimmed down tamer rating viewers will wonder what could be more explicit than what they are seeing the threeway sexual beginning of the nicely warns viewers of what they are in for and several audience members got up and left at that point the frequent sex is one of the films few flaws as the titillation is overdone and at times completely unrelated anything else going on in the tobacks credit the level of violence in black white is almost nil these gangstas and hiphop artists are given real problems and concerns and only become guntoting crazies when it benefits them appear that way whenever character finds himself on donagers handheld digital camera he starts spouting off righteous tirades on america and proclaims his independence but not everyone has fully bought into the idea charlie phillips is full of bluster about why she loves hiphop but admits that in ten years time will be way over this these youth know they are going through phase and are simply enjoying it toback fills the spaces between these tirades scenes that are lightweight and funny most of the humour comes from mike tyson who provides the films comic relief without really trying he is given big words like vernacular say and as rich tries discuss particular street problem tyson he frequently has ask him use smaller words and explain himself better playing on tysons image as dimwit but tyson also gets the films scariest moment as he is mercilessly hit upon the very gay terry tyson is marvel watch as he fights remain calm the scene is entirely improvised downey jr being told just keep at tyson until he gets reaction the reaction he gets being slapped and then choked is astonishing as downey jrs face turns frightening shade of purple black white is about hiphop culture and the films omnipresent hiphop soundtrack strongly supports this but toback keeps things from becoming too serious moving from story story as quickly as he does toback keeps us from becoming attached any one characters struggle thus black whites message about hiphop becomes secondary the itself toback just wants us have fun and maybe learn little about hiphop along the way and we do

one year has passed since the last time we saw them and but wayne campbell and garth algar are back but they have moved out of their parents homes and now have their own pad in an abandoned warehouse waynes still hopelessly infatuated his girlfriend cassandra and of course garth is still having his own personal growing pains they guys are just finishing off one of their shows and head off an aerosmith concert where they run across cassandra and her new manager stereotypical industry slime not unlike the character rob lowe portrayed in the previous again the promoter is not only after the money that cassandras talent can bring in the storyline quickly degrades parallel of the original guy loses chick guy realizes mistake and guy gets chick back fortunately there is more this movie than this somewhat sheer plot the wit and humor in this are surprisingly intelligent and fresh many inside jokes on the and music industries as well as just lot of hilarious scenes of wayne and garth showing their true color highlights of the movie include spoof of jurassic park garths seduction married woman surprise appearance charleton heston s batman setup in the guys pad and some pretty groovy chats jim morrison and some naked indian guy an unexpected lipsync of ymca you could see that one coming mile away and of course hilarious parody of those badlydubbed kungfu movies we love laugh at and if you have ever wondered why there is always boxes of watermelons chickens and people walking plate glass in the middle of streets you will find out here this movie also explores wayne and garth little more garth has somewhat of coming of age and wayne gets learn little about himself little help from our old friend jim morrison few old jokes from the previous movie are explored here again but this time few twists keep them fresh and luckily few if any of them are overused overall the movie has plenty of continuity flaws especially in the fight scent between garth and cassandras dad but these are easily overlooked as this is after waynes world the plot is flimsy but manageable there are few special effects but they are fairly seamless and fill nicely into the plot the acting is good for this sort of movie but there are some very bright spots in the big picture this movie is just plain fun there is lots of intelligent humor that makes this special during the whole one hour and minutes did not even think about looking at my watch single time silly but riotous at times this is an excellent movie even better than the original

john carpenter directed this stylish and gory vampire flick has it is good side and it is bad it is held up some good performances and dazzling special effects leading up an ending that is pretty satisfying james woods gives an outstanding performance that almost covers up the movie the good side some neat scenes of vampires and violence the bad no scares yes that is right even though being directed one of horrors most cherished directors vampires is the least bit scary if not at all james woods stars as jack vampire hunter out stop the plans of the master vampire valek played thomas ian griffith whom wants vampires walk in the daylight daniel baldwin plays his sidekick montoya wisecracking guy who really is not that funny in the opening scene jack along montoya and the team of vampire hunters find an abandoned house vampire occupy of course we all know sunshine kills vampires and that is just how they kill these vampires hooking them ropes and dragging them outside letting them burn death after throwing party for what happened the vampires that did not die come back trash it they kill almost all of jacks team leaving only few alive sheryl lee plays prostitute katrina who was bitten valek but not yet turned into vampire she is rescued jack and flees them on their search for valek they have fight they are way against vampires leading up finale that is welldone great special effects vampires definately could have been done better the makeup special effects and story are first rate but there is no scares or terror that the could have had it me had more humor than horror almost being compared fright night the mix of violence and comedy john carpenter does great job of directing this he eases through some tough times and saves the flaws are noticeable but forgettable the script is clever and funny many lines that make us laugh out loud much enjoyed vampires few exceptions it is one of those films you see but do not take heart you enjoy the time you spent and go on the recently released psycho is the same way it is not as good as you would hope but it is fun and entertaining vampires is good horror flick no scares but plenty of other content please the viewer

in the wake of the smashing success of rumble in the bronx it is looking more and more likely that more jackie chan films will see american release rumor has it that one of these films will be drunken master ii the version have is copy from the laserdisc it is widescreen and bilinguallysubtitled as are most hong kong films these days availability over here in the united states is very limited these films must either be purchased via pirates or sought out from asian distributors such as tai seng the subtitling on the copy have is slightly hard read the letters are white and bit small although the american release will almost certainly be dubbed this review is of the subtitled version so please keep that in mind if you are reading this review help you decide whether go out and see it be fair must admit that have never been very fond of periodpiece martial arts moviesthe ones set in some nebulous china of the distant or not so distant past perhaps it is because most of those have seen were filmed on inferior stock either butchered dubbing or allbutillegible subtitling or perhaps it is because their plots all tend be very similar each other and in many cases all but nonexistant in fact many of them get so wrapped up in their subplots that they seem forget their main plot entirely until only few minutes before the end or for that matter it might be because the jackie chan films more modern settings armour of god rumble in the bronx etc tend have more spectacular stunts often involving large motor vehicles and large explosions whereas period pieces simply have the martial arts having said that must now turn right around and say that drunken master ii is remarkable exception all or most of the above is one of the better martial arts films have seen and quite enjoyed it surprised well so was drunken master ii is about young man named wong feihong played jackie chan who is master of the drunken boxing style of kung fu where he learned this style is uncertain as his father wong keiying ti lung is steadfast in his opposition feihongs practicing it rather than some more normal style of kung fu apparently feihong is some sort of figure from chinese folklore rather like paul bunyan is for americans but have heard very little about this and could quite well be wrong so will leave analysis of that the people who know it better one of my friends points out that the character of wong feihong is also featured in the once upon time in china movies but have not yet seen those the plot of drunken master ii is somewhat hazy as are the plots many such films but if you are watching jackie chan odds are you are not expecting something on the order of war and peace the story seems revolve around those evil foreigners who are spiriting away ancient chinese relics and hence chinas cultural heritage while overworking underpaying and beating up chinese workers in nearby steel mill however this plot merely serves as framework for the other main story of the filmfeihongs perpetual struggle win his girlfriend supplicate his father keep his pregnant mother played anita mui from fighting and keep from getting beaten up evil foreigner thugs the macguffin that drives the plot is precious antique jade imperial seal is being taken away the evil foreigners in the beginning feihong accidentally steals it while trying recover an identicallywrapped box containing the medicinal ginseng his father was bringing back for customer in the process he clashes another thief who is himself trying for the seal but ends up instead the ginseng after feihong narrowly avoids getting caught the seal the evil foreigners lackies thanks some timely intervention generals son cameo appearance andy lau who would later take on the starring role in drunken master iii comedic chaos ensues back at the wong household when feihong and his mother attempt come up replacement for the missing ginseng and so it goes and the plot thickens later on such as when feihongs girlfriend maneuvers him into kung fu match rival or when feihong and the thief now revealed be loyalist manchu officer trying recover the seal and stop the evil foreigners are attacked en masse another grand kungfu movie tradition but think have already spent more time on the plot than it really deserves let us move on the real draw of jackie chan movies the action there is plenty of martial arts action be found in this movie of course in kung fu that is be expected however this is not just another kung fu movie this one has jackie chan doing the fight and stunt choreography and jackie chan is genius the primary martial arts style featured in the is drunken boxing form of kung fu attempts draw the adversary off his guard making it seem like the fellow using it is drunk further for the purposes of this at least drunken boxers fight better when they actually _are_ intoxicated but there is fine line between just drunk enough and drunk into stupor under normal circumstances the idea of someone staggering around looking sloshed but managing fight effectively and even incredibly might seem rather stupid but jackie pulls it off flair the kung fu sequences are so intricate in their staging and execution that it is pointless try describe it on paper so will just say that the fightsespecially the big climactic fight at the endin themselves make the movie worth watching another thing drunken master ii has going for it is the stunt work even without motor vehicles well not counting train there are some remarkable stunts in this among other things jackie dives off balcony into table and crawls across hot coals not once but at _least_ twice if you count the outtake shown during the credits quicktime movies of these stunts can be found through the www movie database unlike in american films these stunts are _not_ faked drunken master ii stars several veteran actors of the hong kong movie scene including jackie ti lung better tomorrow and anita mui the heroic trio series rumble in the bronx the performances are firstrate especially when it comes the comedy parts of the the scene where feihong and his mother conspire literally behind feihongs fathers back cover up for the missing ginseng root is hilarious as is the scene where feihongs mother having just revealed that she is pregnant is threatening hurt herself in order draw her husbands anger away from feihong jackie has developed his knack for physical comedy into sort of mastery over the years and he is in fine form all through drunken master ii as far as cinematography is concerned it certainly works for this it is nothing spectacular but is at least dozen times better than all those old kung fu movies of the the picture is crisp and clear one thing find particularly worthy of mention is that at least in the copy have the screen was wider than any have ever seen on videotape beforealmost whole of the screen was blocked out above and below watch this on bigscreen tv or movie theater if you can it will be an utter shame if this is eventually panandscanned for american video release drunken master ii shows the full potential of period piece kung fu movies and it is good enough overcome even my usual distaste for such movies the plot does meander bit but that is be expected in this type of if you like this kind of movie you will love this movie and if not well give it chance anyway if nothing else the martial arts and stunt sequences are themselves worth the price of admission or rental

at first glance three kings looks be just another war movie the version of all those favourite war movies names cannot remember the version it definitely is just another war movie not in your dreams imagine pulp fiction approach saving private ryan thats three kings for you believe it or not it bears the cool of the former and the stark humane meaning of the latter the story brings us the twilight of the gulf war the allied troops victorious majpr archie gates clooney leads an enterprising bunch of grunts rather unorthodox postwar looting spree the millions in gold bars secretly stowed away saddam in desolate village in the desert as the rest of the troops are celebrating their victory and getting ready be shipped home this wild bunch goes awol on an armed humvee the vehicle of choice of the us army they soon find out that they have much resistance as they get tangled the local rebellion against saddams forces frequently switching their modes between looters and robin hoods merry men they become consciously attacked their own morals as the begins roll it seemed have rather light mood it special effects such as when gates describes his men how bullet can kill simply paves the way for lighthearted funny action movie three kings is much smarter than that as the conflict becomes more and more complex the audience will be trapped in limbo trying stay focussed on that lightmoodseriousmood that the seem portray personally found this analogous the same feelings of the main characters involved in the trapped between their initial plan paved greed and their own sense of humanity this simply made the entire experience of watching three kings truly brilliant action sequences are not shot as your oldfashioned war films nor anything like steven spielbergs inyourface war violence they are carefully built generate tension just the right tight closeups and pauses right before the action starts not john woo for sure but more of sergio leones spaghetti western style tons of them starring clint eastwood great performances clooney and wahlberg but the brilliance have lie in the conception of this the screenwriter and the director three kings ranks among the best films of the year well for me at least highly recommended

mickey mouse had better watch his back there is new critter in town and he is the nameless animal attraction of mouse hunt dreamworks skgs clever first foray into family fare although it runs out of steam towards its end this liveaction comedy still boasts enough energized slapstick and inventive set pieces best disneys entire nonanimated kiddieoriented catalog but consider that list includes dismal tripe like air bud flubber and that darn cat and it is really not such difficult feat pull off still throw the two rodents in boxing arena and will be hoping that the mouse from mouse hunt knocks some sense back into mickey nathan lane robin williams significant other from the birdcage and lee evans last seen as nervous bellhop in the fifth element play ernie and lars smuntz befuddled brothers who have just inherited two unwanted assets from their late father william hickey in his last role dilapidated old string factory and dilapidated old mansion although lars made deathbed promise upkeep the former he and ernie decide sell the latter for big bucks after learning it was designed famed architect but there is lone obstacle in their way single mouse lives within the walls of the house and he is not about give up his place of residence without fight movies aimed at young audiences are rarely this visually exquisite the effects blending the talents of some live mice one animatronic mouse and one computergenerated mouse are pretty seamless the splendid production design seems be straight out of tim burtons mind the smuntzs architecturallyunsound mansion is like something straight out of the nightmare before christmas and the vortex of bizarre machinery in their factory resembles some of vincent prices warped contraptions from edward scissorhands mouse hunt is pretty dark movie even some of the humor can be grim but it is hardly ever meanspirited the star of the show is neither the topbilled lane nor the titular mouse it is lanky british comedian evans whose hysterical bodily antics suggest cleanedup jim carrey without the obnoxious overkill note toneddown but nonetheless outrageous impromptu striptease evans banter the everaffable lane is funny stuff too and holds its own against the movies more flashy physical shtick vicki lewis beth from newsradio is solid in supporting role as lars moneygrubbing wife and in nifty bit of novelty casting christopher walken is macabre delight as spooky exterminator who takes his job little too seriously popping dropping into his mouth and noting his tape recorder that the mouse has calcium deficiency blech basically onejoke idea mouse outsmarts couple of bumbling humans is given rather engaging execution their sparring is imaginatively realized do not think will ever forget the sight of that tiny little mouse making his getaway on rolling wheel of gouda and although you really never fully root for either side that is okay warmandfuzzy union between the two parties is practically promised from the first frame they share mouse hunt may take while get going the rather lengthy setup could test the patience of some of the younger children although rather liked it much in part lane and evans and the climactic sequence is allowed play out for bit too long but this appears be one family movie that most members of the family will be able find agreeable not unlike the original home alone

a miracle of filmmaking some like it hot is brilliant and maybe the foremost example of slapstick comedy brought screen clever sight gags and plot twists it is the pinnacle of writerdirector billy wilders career stunning feat considering the vast catalogue of films he had helped make jerry lemmon and joe curtis are two stage musicians who go from gig gig trying earn enough money feed themselves one night as they are playing at banned prohibition speakeasy the place is raided as it turns out the owner spats columbo george raft was ratted out toothpick charlie george stone several weeks later on valentines day jerry and joe go garage pick up car and end up witnessing gangland murder of charlie columbo in parking garage eager escape the duo are forced take job in florida all expenses paid the only catch its girls band so josephine curtis and daphne lemmon make their way onto the train and go florida on the way there they meet sugar kane monroe bombshell singer who is looking for love jerry and joe immediately fall for the singer but there is two problems they are in drag and millionaire osgood fielding joe brown falls madly in love daphne what follows in pure hysteria still complicated further the arrival of spats columbo florida for the italian opera lovers festival tony curtis is hysterical as joejosephine especially in his preposterous attempts woo sugar marilyn monroe in wonderfully comic performance is sugar providing incredible timing and sex appeal along true sincerity the scenes however are all stolen either brown or lemmon lemmon is hysterical as daphne cast as the less rational one lemmons performance is ridiculously crazy it is disorder in the style all billy wilders brown is particularly hilarious as osgood as we are treated the finest kind of comedic irony he manages use lemmons ingenious performance as springboard for an even loonier performance as completely eccentric millionaire every setpiece is flawless as wilder brilliantly changes settings constantly and uses every comic trick in the book make his picture wilders script is stunning as he carefully combines gangsters crossdressing romance sex music gender roles and social taboos in riotous blend of wit and oddball craziness wilder manages create scenes of utter hysteria so pitchperfect that the audience is dying of laughter the last comic piece the final line of this absolutely incredible wilders is dead wrong when he says nobodys perfect billy wilder is especially when he makes something this disastrously funny nobodys perfect but billy wilder

a welcome cinematic trend over the past couple of years has been make the works of shakespeare more accessible the younger audiences who are the vast majority of moviegoers contemporizing the bard and altering the settings familiar surroundings prime example of this is things hate about you was basically the taming of the shrew in high school less successful was last years adaptation of hamlet ethan hawke as the heir apparent of the denmark corp here the setting was the corporate world of new york now comes a faithful retelling of one of the most tragic of shakespeares tragedies like things hate about you the stage is high school private prep school where odin james mekhi phifer is the oncourt general the basketball teams standout player julia stiles featured in things hate about you as well as performing ophelia in hawkes hamlet plays desi brable odins girlfriend whose father also happens be dean of the institution josh hartnett pearl harbor is on hand for the villainy playing the scheming hugo who sets the tragic wheels in motion was actually filmed couple of years ago but was shelved because of the columbine high school tragedy the movie directed tim blake nelson best known for his costarring role in brother where art thou and written brad kaaya is very grim an air of tragedy weighs it down from the opening scene the closing credits and that is how it should be of all of shakespeares tragedies othello is the most harrowing not because of any body count but because of the psychological havoc wreaked iago whose motivation in the sheer pleasure of his treachery kaayas profanefilled script after all these are high school kids does offer hugo subtle motive of sorts the young man considers himself the basketball teams prime utility man who does little bit of everything pass shoot rebound but is constantly in the shadow of odin plus his father the teams coach played ferocious intensity martin sheen showers more love and concern on his star player than on his own flesh and blood the script follows the familiar lines of the classic hugo begins dropping hints odin concerning desis fidelity eroding the stars confidence in those he considers closest him affecting both his relationships and his game it all ends in blood of course is why the movie was originally shelved the performances in vary phifer is at first cocky and selfassured emotions he handles ease he also does quite well displaying odins darker side his defensive sensitivity about being the only black at the institution his growing distrust of those he loved his rage and the erosion of his belief system hartnett is appropriately cool and machiavellian as he weaves his deadly web of lies and deceit turning friend against friend and lover against lover stiles seems bit stilted but occasionally also rises the occasion moving from adoration confusion fear of her young knight the does contain few missteps subplot involving hugos theft of the school mascot is left hanging also desis actions concerning michael andrew keegan odins former teammate and best friend who was kicked off the team because of one of hugos machinations is puzzling why she would continually be seen michael however innocent the circumstances when she knows her man suspects the two of cheating behind his back it is irrational but these are minor carpings overall is stylish and faithful adaptation if nothing else it may encourage some people read the original text and that will counterbalance the severity of this feature

there is scene early in soul food george tillmans comedydrama about large africanamerican family and the ordeals they go through during crisis that caught me completely off guard during wedding the groom is flirting some tramp and in an attempt prevent scene his mother in law played irma hall comes the rescue the way in she does this makes me think irma hall is one of the greatest actresses around right now however this is just one magical moment in movie filled them vanessa williams vivica fox and nia long star as three sisters who have each gone their own way in life williams is teri successful lawyer who is frustrated her husband miles attempts at music career fox is maxine the strongest of the sisters can be confirmed the stability of her marriage and the wisdom of her son ahmad who narrates the long is bird hairdresser who is the last of the three get married her husband lem is an intense passionate individual whose temper gets the best of him sometime but never stops loving at the center of everything is irma hall as big mama jo every sunday the family gathers together for dinner at mama jos house there is lots of conversation lots of laughs and the occasional controversy mama jo presides over the family like all mothers should she is stern and disciplined but also caring and forgiving everything is going fine until tragedy befalls mama jo all of sudden chain reaction of events begin destroy the family it gets so bad sunday dinner is even cancelled without mama jos guidance there is noone keep the family together frustrates ahmad miles and maxines marriage begins fall apart as he focuses on his music and flirts the troublesome faith lems temper gets the best of him when his convict past starts catch up him and teri tries prevent maxines efforts sell mama jos house the third act of the deals ahmads attempts patch things up he decides take over where mama jo left off and tries get the family back together for one more sunday dinner the acting everyone in the ensemble is outstanding special notices irma hall and brandon hammond hall gives performance that deserves be recognized the academy her mama jo is one of the most memorable characters have ever encountered in movie brandon hammond is an actor bright future he is wise enough not play cutesy and shows an admirable range and depth and speaks the final lines of the movie on the perfect note tillman obviously based this movie on his own memories of growing up every scene in the movie is purposeful and convincing except maybe an odd flashback sequence the dialogue is beleiveable and funny and then there is the food tillman gives us several close ups of the soul food and it indeed looks very tasty can see why sunday dinners became such tradition for this family soul food is one of the most purely entertaining movies of the year

director david fincher has such an eye for detail is very rare in these days terry gilliam comes mind as another one is one of the best art forms because not only can you tell story but you can use the camera capture the smallest detail and have it mean something but most directors seem go for action the slightest ounce of story so whenever director uses the camera its fullest potential the almost automatically deserves good review and when they add fascinating story it you have nearly perfect entertainment finchers the game is no exception this the game is one of the most interesting and complex films come out of in long time fincher has not made since seven his box office and critical hit defied expectations and became one of the best movies ever so it is about time he made another and what ride it is the game is not quite as powerful as seven but in some ways it is better overall the game could have used little more clarity or little more uncertainty it walks line of insanity and reality but it never goes either way until the very end the outcome is satisfying enough for the preceding events and it makes lot of sense once everything is set straight unfortunately unlike the usual suspects we are never given enough information figure out for ourselves what is happening whether it be true or false however this also gives the frightening aspect the game uses the fullest extent the game is told completely from its main characters point of view nicholas van orton michael douglas is highstrung and isolated businessman he lives alone in his giant mansion divorced from his wife elizabeth and is celebrating his th birthday the same age at his father committed suicide at in the same mansion for his th birthday conrad sean penn the rebel of the family gives nicholas gift certificate crs consumer recreation services it will make your life fun again his brother promises as skeptical as nicholas is he is somewhat intrigued and annoyed the lack of informationsomething this businessman hates seeing billboard in an office he decides visit the mysterious company jim feingold james rebhorn greets nicholas and guides him through the signup process consists of psychtests physicals emotional responses and other mind games each game is suited each persons emotional and psychological needs explains feingold one day nicholas gets call from crs and they explain that he failed the tests even more intrigued and now somewhat angered at the time he spent signing up he starts asking around see what people can tell him about the company what he does not realize is that the game has already begun the phone call is just the first of many strange events be thrown nicholas way how he finds out that he is involved has be witnessed because it is amusing and fun and visually impressive the detail involved in finchers shots is incredible and almost requires second viewing just appreciate the effort that went into them seven fincher had almost every single shot mean something he also has the unique ability make you look at exactly what he wants you compared seven though the game is light and comical because of this films sense of humor and selfawareness nothing can be taken quite seriously so do not try make much sense of what goes on in the game because it does not want you what does make sense is the final revelationwhen everything becomes apparent and clear if taken as it is the games ending makes complete sense but if you try and critique every minute detail then you get yourself into plot holes and incredibility perhaps that is the reason docked the while trying remain realistic and plausible the plot is too unbelievable create any real tension on screen we do not really care if douglas character lives or not because it is not believable the ending requires you have believed anything that has happened previously but if you suspend disbelief and take the as it is you can accept the game as an emotionally and psycholically disturbing thriller michael douglas gives terrific performance as nicholas douglas has played lonely businessmen before but here he adds another level his performance his character who is normally levelheaded and relies on facts is forced trust nobody can he believe the waitress he bumped into what about his brother who got him involved in the game in the first place douglas portrays this aspect of his character extremely well and gives one of his best performances even better than his falling down persona the supporting cast is essential in this and casting was critical sean penn is always good and he gives yet another credible performance as douglas brother deborah kara unger from crash is the waitress he bumps into and her performance is extremely good in fact she almost steals the from douglas james rebhorn portrays his character very well and adds some confusion and desparation douglas predicament another good performance comes from armin muellerstahl from shine as the book editor but considering that douglas is in every single scene of the game he not only commands this cast but makes this distant and lonely character come colorful life the game is rated for language violence some gore and some nudity and drugs what is essential for this work is the writing john brancato and michael ferris have woven confusing and compelling screenplay witty dialogue and some very funny moments this screenplay will probably get an oscar nomination for best original screenplay because it does almost exactly the same thing the usual suspects did however the visuals of the game are enough make the viewer enjoy the vexing plot and if you can get yourself believe everything occuring on the screen you will be thoroughly entertained one of this years best films

originally launched in this popular was reintroduced in whole new generation of moviegoers based on the mighty successful musical from broadway grease was followed in the less stellar grease starring young michelle pheiffer in one of her first feature roles plot highschool musical set in the showcasing the relationship between the cool danny zuko of the tbirds travolta and the innocent and pure sandy olsen newtonjohn from australia the follows the couple and their vivacious friends during their last year at rydell high through song dance and humour critique funloving energetic and innocent look back at times much simpler this movie effectively juggles thin romantic story line and the overall experience of the superb soundtrack and some great dance numbers admittedly am somewhat biased in this opinion since this blasts me into my past as rebellious youth grease was one of schmoes first bigscreen experiences and every other scene sends me reeling into the times of my elaborate grease bubblegum card collection and the lesser responsibilities that possessed at that time but apart from the nostalgic vibe was still extremely impressed this as it continued amuse me despite my previous dozen or so viewings this took john travolta from dimwitted sweathog on tvs welcome back kotter and transformed him into moviestar of spectacular proportions saturday night fever in confirmed that sudden popularity unfortunately for the rest of the cast his popularity was not terribly contagious despite their effective showings in this classic movie on the down side some of the absolute innocence in this might bore or turn people off like when sandy sings about drinking lemonade and staying out until danny in summer nights and the plot is not exactly the most elaborate storyline ever created but despite these small reservations this movie carries enough great music and high energy keep anyone amused through its rapid minute running time and believe me am not fan of the musicals make sure look for young lorenzo lamas in the static role of the brainless football player as well as the national bandstand dance contest as one of the films absolute highlights and do not forget buy the popular soundtrack afterwards so that you could listen its peppy tunes whenever you are feeling little blue little known facts henry winkler of tvs happy days fonzie fame turned down the part of danny zuko because he did not want be typecast for the rest of his career both travolta and conaway were smitten newtonjohn during the filming of this picture conaway eventually bowed out of the woofest and married newtonjohns sister year later divorced after five years

set in the late at the height of yuppie excess and based on the book bret easton ellis who explored the same themes in another book was also made into movie less than zero american psycho puts new spin on the yuppie genre that ellis helped create christian bale is perfectly cast as patrick bateman high powered yuppie who hides terrible secret from his fianc and his colleagues it seems that bateman is serial killer and unfortunately for his contemporaries his tenuous grasp on reality is starting slip as he tries balance his meticulous daily routines slaughtering coworkers and prostitutes and hiding their bodies his mental fabric slowly begins unravel was first introduced the novel when was still in high school read an associated press article in our local sunday newspaper detailing the problems ellis was having getting his novel published due the controversial violence in it as usual when anything is controversial try seek it out but soon forgot about the novel and did not end up thinking about it again until stumbled across it couple of years later at bookstore picked it up and read it but was ultimately disappointed because it left more questions than answers the movie has similar effect but at least it is less cryptic than ellis novel for once has actually turned out be better than the novel it was based on both the book and the open bateman describing his fastidious morning preparations down exactly what facial scrubs and exfoliating creams he uses but the novel seems concentrate more on these excesses throughout the movie continues touch upon these things but makes more of point immerse us in batemans impending madness than detail things as painstakingly as the novel does as result the is immensely more entertaining lions gate seems be the studio champion of controversial films having picked up kevin smiths catholicrattling dogma and here american psycho there is no difference screenwriters mary harron and guinevere turner had the unenviable task of trying take novel about yuppies filled graphic violence and sex and make marketable out of it some cuts had be made the finished keep from getting an nc mainly involving sex scene comprising bateman and two women and initial reports said the was unwatchable thankfully it is watchable and harron and turner have made one of the most scathingly satirical films this side of south park bigger longer uncut side note cowriter guinevere turner also makes an appearance in the as an illfated acquaintance of batemans who after bateman suggests that she start making out female prostitute proclaims that she is not lesbian nor has any interest in it the ironic humor of the scene stems from the fact that turner the writerdirector of the go fish and who also assisted kevin smith parts of his script for chasing amy is lesbian it is subtle injoke and it is one found be pretty humorous despite having rather high profile supporting cast of young upandcomers including reese witherspoon most of the roles are waste and are the equivalent of extended billed cameos the real draw here is christian bale and his overthetop performance as patrick bateman whenever read novel always try imagine what it would be like as movie and who would be perfect cast as the characters always had hard time trying decide who would cast as bateman but never thought bale would deliver performance as perfect as his ends up being say bale runs away the character is vast understatement and he proves that he is as adept at chewing scenery as al pacino or rod steiger one sequence in particular involving bateman describing his love for huey lewis and the news song hip be square right before burying an axe in coworkers head features one of the most eccentric and kinetic performances have ever seen on side note despite the fact that huey lewis hip be square and pair of phil collins songs appear in the do not expect see them on the soundtrack release huey lewis expressly requested that his song featured in rather large set piece in the much akin the use of stuck in the middle you in reservoir dogs not be included on any soundtrack release am assuming that collins requested the same on similar note whitney houstons cover of the greatest love of all is also involved in scene comparable the other two and it is very obvious that it is not the houston version at all but merely an instrumental version culled from an unknown source apparently houston was not as open about the use of her song as the others were bigger controversy than the violence and sex has been brewing since the films release that of whether or not patrick has actually committed the crimes we have viewed during the course of the do not look the book for any answers because it will only serve confuse you more several web sites have been dedicated the subject but am still undecided there is evidence both for and against but the most scathing evidence against comes from scene near the end of the where bateman goes on killing spree taking out cops old ladies and cleaning staff equal gusto the scene seemed very dreamlike and as absurd as the action films it suddenly seems be parodying as an example bateman blows up police car very cinematically after firing several shots from handgun in the general direction of the car kept waiting for bateman wake up and for the continue on from there but bateman never does wake up and the whole sequence though comic throws the offbalance suppose was the intention other than the few flaws have mentioned american psycho is an incredibly entertaining although you may not leave the movie fully understanding whether or not what has just transpired actually occurred in batemans reality think this movie is destined for greatness as cult and deserves the spot it will take as such it may not change anyones life but it will certainly have an effect know will certainly hear hip be square in different context the next time hear it r

ever wonder what happened gabe kaplan you remember he was the title character in that sitcom welcome back kotter always trying help out the sweathogs frequently trying dodge mr woodman ever wary of his wifes tuna casserole so you ask where is he now mr kaplan actually spends much of his time these days playing professional highstakes poker that is right am not sure if it is his main source of income but from what have heard the guy occasionally comes away at time and there you were thinking was going tell you he was doing offbroadway theater you silly goose well gabe kaplan is not in the movie rounders nor is the about the actor come gamblers life but rounders is about poker and gabe plays poker and thought that was kind of neat connection sorry about the segue or lack thereof matt damon plays mike mcdermott law student who also has singular talent for the game of poker he is been playing for while and more than being proficient he has caught the bug he goes all the underground games in new york city knows the regulars and knows how win in the beginning of the he is built up nice thirty grand nest egg he takes the speakeasytype gaming parlor where the big boys play mike is there make his bid into the upper echelon staking it all against teddy kgb john malkovich an oreomunching cardshark ties the russian mafia mike has the potential take large pot and go vegas and buy into the world series of poker but instead he loses it all in single hand months later he is paying his way through law school driving delivery truck when mikes best friend and poker buddy worm edward norton finishes his jail term for hustling some students he wants pick up right were they left off working as team part others their betting cash although mike has stopped playing cards as promise his girlfriend and fellow law student jo gretchen mol worm connives mike into playing once more and mike bitten again the bug slides down that slippery slope risking his relationship education and reputation as playing poker again becomes the focus of his life make about gambling filmmaker will usually have play up the glamorous side get the audience behind the characters this is because few moviegoers will care whole lot about some guy in leisure suit or terry cloth shirt sitting at folding card table stogie in his mouth rounders however seems go more for the latter than the former the card clubs mike and worm frequent are not very glamorous at all there is basement lodge elk heads on the wall goulash joint these are the kinds of locales in director john dahl sets his shots except for one brief instance when the two players visit atlantic city the is bereft of the flashing lights of the casinos or the pleasant color of the green felt table the reason rounders still captures our attention is because it is less about the game of poker than it is about the personalities enjoy and are slaves it we are given nice set of interesting characters clear motivations and good actors play them matt damon is very natural as mike who struggles between his desire play the straight and narrow finishing law school and answering what may be his true calling playing professional poker ed nortons worm is truly worm always looking for the angle and playing everyone for what they are worth john turturro who amazes me his acting range tones it down in this playing joey knish virtual poker prodigy in his time who now plays the underground games make rent and child support payments he is both friend and mentor mike and turturros lowkey performance is totally convincing just as john malkovichs heavilyaccented teddy kgb is imposing as an adversarial dragon mike must slay prove himself martin landau is also thrown into the mix as one of mikes law professors abe petrovsky while landau slips well into the role his character spitting out personal anecdotes about staying true ones self facilitates the channeling of the storyline toward predictable ending perhaps the weak link in the otherwise formidable lineup of acting talent however is gretchen mol who just did not seem have much presence on screen she is genuine peach look at kind of cross between actress renee zellweger and singer jewel and would not be surprised if the three of them formed some kind of blondhaired triumvirate and attempted take over the world but her delivered lines seemed very flat and found myself looking for matt damons reactions instead good thing about rounders is that it does not get bogged down in the character development and statement making so much that it cannot find time for humor the is peppered nicely scenes that both make you laugh and keep the pacing going such as sequence where mike and worm move rapidly around new york from one game the next in widely different locales one game in cigar club had me in stitches love the sweetness of this dark maduro wrapper says one of the players clearly more interested in displaying his pretentiousness over the cigar in one hand than in the cards in his other was hoping mike and worm would really take these guys all the poker being played rounders had the potential be very confusing you might think you know lot about poker but think again luckily we are given narration damon during the more intricate moments explain what is going on the narrations are more informative than intrusive and apprise us of what the stakes are and why certain players want do the things they do it is nice that as the characters develop so does our comprehension of their world as about success and survival in the realm of underground poker rounders delivers in spades wait as about the culture of cards rounders is an ace hang on packed great acting and great characters rounders is full house okay guess that is enough oh the way if you ever want get into game ol gabe kaplan be sure bring note from epsteins mother

did you ever wonder if dennis rodman was actually from this planet or if sylvester stallone was some kind of weird extraterrestrial used think that about my th grade english teacher ms carey but after seeing this movie they may have confirmed my suspicions as the story goes at any time there are over thousand aliens living among us here on earth the men in black mib are the watchdogs that oversee the cosmic citizens guardians of our beloved planet from nastytempered aliens and secret service the stars based in new york city where weird is the norm the mib organization gives human form our spacefaring emigrants so that they may walk and live among us unnoticed but enforce the laws of earth the mib carry weapons that are powerful enough meet or exceed destruction quotas in one single blast they carry otherworldly technology erase peoples shortterm memory when common folk see the mib in action and their best leads on cosmic thingsgoneawry are the supermarket tabloids little do we know that there are much stronger battles of good evil going on in the depths of space one of the aliensashuman on this planet is an important diplomat that is carrying something very precious it holds the key literally universal peace giant cockroachlike alien soon arrives on the planet and steals this key in the wrong alien hands flippers mandibles tentacles it can be used as weapon therefore it must be recovered and returned it is rightful owners otherwise ensure universal safety earth will be destroyed along the key now it is the mib who must prevent this catastrophe the mib agents on the case are played tommy lee jones he is crustier than burnt toast and even more serious than al gore the stars in the sky no longer spark wonder in his eyes he is accompanied flippant rookie played will smith but despite this shootemup protectearthfromdestruction premise this is nothing at all like typical summer action movie and this is not an independence day knockoff rather this is stylishly offbeat scifi comedy that pokes fun at what the government always denies that there are real aliens that live here and that the government does its darndest cover them up but give it some sense of excitement and keep it within the parameters of the summer movie recipe there must be some kind of earthhangsinthebalance scenario yet this movie is very appealing the abundance of wierdness talking aliens peewee atomizers mortician who lives for her work and lots of yucky bugs and slimesplattering galore is played straight like as if this were normal of course we are in nyc it gives it deadpan feel makes it all the more funnier and odder jones plays the venerable seenitall agent seriousness and maturity smith is likeable and makes great comic partner jones straight man routine they click like dorothys ruby red shoes the look and feel of the movie is made even better direction from barry sonnenfeld the addams family this guy has knack for gothic comedy and successfully transfers his macabre sense of humor onto the screen and an appropriate dose of special effects helps bolster the oddness of their task without diverting attention from the human actors the story moves well and before you know it the end credits are already rolling the result is minutes worth of fun in the form of ewwwws and blechhhs aaaahhhs and wows let the men in black protect and color your world

i feel no hesitation in saying that there is something about mary is the best that will see all year from the moment the credits started roll at the end of the picture there was no doubt in my mind that had seen masterpiece that will remain unsurpassed in the remaining months of it is that good of when gene siskel said this about fargo only few months into dismissed the notion as ridiculous how could you possibly know that is so great that nothing you could possibly see in the future could beat it but after seeing the farrellys hilarious and surprisingly heartfelt masterwork now know what siskel was talking about once in very great while comes along that is so daring so brilliant and simply so enjoyable that at the end you just want stand up and cheer and you know at that instant that you have just experienced something very special now for the shocker mary is the grossest and most disgusting have ever viewed pink flamingos obviously notwithstanding the movie is so rude and guess inappropriate in nature that had hard time sitting in theater watching it my parents luckily had seen it before them so could warn the about what they were in for forget blazing saddles animal house and even the former king of grossout comedy monty pythons meaning of life they were all only preludes the farrellys assault on the senses in fact this may even be the funniest have ever had the pleasure of seeing the only real contender is monty python and the holy grail and most certainly the most hilarious come out all decade but as funny as it is something also has be said about the overall sweetness of mary it has huge heart you see the farrellys are truly gifted filmmakers they do not just present you string of dick and fart jokes although there are plenty go around they also very wisely add an unbelievable amount of charisma the main characters and actually have them develop as the story progresses it is funny though if you just look at an outline of the story it seems kind of contrived and predictable but believe me it is anything but ben stiller plays ted very shy and clumsy teenage geek who lusts after the school babe mary cameron diaz after he sticks up for her retarded brother warren early brown the cameraman believe it or not from scream his dreams come true when she invites him the prom in one of the films funniest scenes something goes wrong will not ruin it for those who know nothing about the and ted is unable face mary ever again jump the present after years of selfloathing ted finally hires private detective pat healy suitably slimy matt dillon track her down so he can have one last chance at winning the woman he has loved since high school healy finds that mary is still fullblown hottie and decides try and keep her for himself admittingly the basic story line leaves little be desired after all notreallyallthatfunny premise how can you sustain laughter for nearly two hours somehow the farrellys pull it off the performances here are also right on target as ted stiller adds just the right amount of clumsy charm make his character not irritating as he would normally be but very lovable and cameron diaz is perfect in her role for obvious reasons but the actor who really grabs your attention is earl brown as marys brother no other actor has even come close playing mentally retarded man as much natural ease as brown displays here know he will not be nominated but this is the guy who should not be counted out when it comes time hand out the oscar nods in february as good as the actors are though it is the directors movie all the way guarantee that on almost every other top ten list at the end of the year you will see the number one space occupied steven spielbergs wwii epic saving private ryan and yes that is great worthy of the recognition it has been getting but is harder making great war or having your audience laugh so hard that they cannot breath for minutes at time will let you decide that one for yourself but this critic is sticking his guns there is just something about mary

would rather die today and go heaven than live be hundred and go hell earnestly proclaims the pentecostal preacher that line coming from fundamentalist christian minister has taught us how we should fill in the rest of the story he will be turn out be scoundrel who has less actual belief in god than the average american and all of his preaching will turn out be cynical ruse extort money from his
