naive congregation from elmer gantry on we have learned what expect when the movies go church well think again for the apostle robert duvall has wanted make for over decade does not take the usual tack of smearing the minister and implication all the rest of organized religion instead it gives us highly devout man who certainly has his foibles but an absolute dedication his ministry and his god and arguably just as surprising the goodspirited is no comedy even if it does have humorous moments instead of levity the picture takes touchingly serious approach as it introduces us world not normally seen in motion pictures when in the privacy of his attic robert duvall as texas preacher euliss sonny dewey argues sternly his lord the scene shares kinship emily watsons character crying out for her god in breaking the wavess most powerful scene the body of the story starts sonnys coming upon an horrific auto accident is another part of life generally ignored modern screenwriters his well worn bible in hand sonny leaps from his car so that he can go pray over and the accidents dying victims the scowling police officer orders him go away and after he has tried work his miracles sonny leaves smile in the confidence that he has done the lords work robert duvall not only gives moving and realistic performance surely destined receive an academy award nomination but is also the films director writer executive producer and chief financier rarely has movie been such labor of love white suit peachcolored shirt and tie and dark sunglasses sonny looks as much like rock star as preacher duvall has every movement down pat even when he is walking down the street the ever strutting sonny cannot contain his energy he dances and claps all the way sonnys churches having more black members than white means that he shares his preaching duties many deepvoiced black orators but his rhetoric is always competitive may be on the devils hitlist but am on gods mailing list he shouts the congregation in revival tent and they lap it up people jump up scream praise the lord and mean it the intensity of their shared religious experience is palpable but sonny is no saint it turns out that he has wandering eye angers his wife jessie played in remarkably controlled performance farrah fawcett jessie gets her revenge taking up the churchs youth minister and conniving gain control over sonnys church leaving him unemployed sonny letting his temper get the best of him does something foolish causes him have leave town and two beloved kids forever the bulk of the occurs in small predominately black church in louisiana he builds up from derelict building no congregation into remodeled church one way road heaven holiness temple an enthusiastic flock in this part he rebaptizes himself as the apostle f the apostle is hard worker willing take on any odd job necessary obtain the funds for his church he asks his members tithe but he gives all of his money and his good deeds extend secret donations of food for the local poor folks man who cannot stand be still he tells one of his friends quit school because did not like recess in his new town he meets toosie miranda richardson who like him has family that she has not seen in while his romance the separated woman like the rest of the does not follow the standard patterns we have grown expect from our movies billy bob thornton shows up one day playing local racist and general troublemaker his confrontation the apostle is yet another of show is many surprising scenes again breaking many rules and conceptions about what approach deeply religious people might take although it probably could not have ended any other way the movie does wrap things up nicely and do not miss the sweet epilogue during the films closing credits tour de force acting performance duvall and surprising and unrelentingly dedicated script makes for an outstanding and moving the apostle runs little too long at it is rated pg for mild profanity and brief violence and would be fine for kids eleven and up

one of the best movies have ever seen would heard extremely good things about this movie and though the previews did not really intrigue that much it was movie would been anticipating for few months now for some reason am not sure of this movie was not that big sucess over in the s it was definite hit the critics but did not exactly set any box office records after viewing this incredibly well directed written and acted movie cannot help but wonder why the strength of this is it is gritty realism the main characters are all human individual flaws no stereotype heroes you may not agree many of their actions in the movie or their approach life but that is what makes it so real had expected this movie be more of drama than thriller but was mistaken even the interrogation scenes moved at such pace so that it felt just as thrilling as any car chase and the ending whoa have never seen movie in my life where everyone in it acts brilliantly the three male leads guy pearce kevin spacey and russell crowe are all just terrific the best actor oscar talk surrounding this should have netted one of them statue but there is one problem there how could they have chosen between these three actors there is no way could look at this and say one of them was better than the other two it is impossible kim bassingers performance is also revelation would never been big fan of hers before and always thought she was well what is the word twinky that impression has changed as she complemented crowe and pearce perfectly the depth the story and characters is truly astounding no cardboard characters here the plot is full of twists and turns and some very clever sequences pearces interogation of three seperate suspects is nothing short of brilliant really cannot fault this movie at all was so glad see fellow australians pearce and crowe star in such breathtaking movie had been very familiar russell crowe beforehand from his many australian films but had not seen much of guy pearce intend change this next time visit the video store

this reviewer is ignorant of what hands were responsible for delivering the original version of the abyss in whether it was the meddling of studio executives or the work of writerdirector james cameron himself the original cut of this underwater scifi thriller was entertaining enough but also quite seriously flawed the main problem was fairly simple the films climax was unworthy of its buildup someone at th century fox and no doubt cameron himself must have agreed because in came the theatrical release of the abyss special edition now available on video it seems timely reevaluate what in its newly revamped state is now nearmasterpiece despite its borrowings from films like odyssey two alien and close encounters of third kind the plot is thus we meet the crew of an experimental underwater mobile oil rig designed the hardnosed lindsay mastrantonio and captained her soontobedivorced husband bud ed harris the rig and its crew are diverted from their normal duties when the navy seeks their help in investigating the mysterious sinking of u nuclear submarine requiring dive partway down three mile deep trench three navy divers arrive command the operation led the edgy lieutenant coffey biehn but series of strange sightings soon convinces at least one member of the civilian crew that whoever or whatever they are dealing as she memorably puts it are not speaking russian meanwhile on the surface hurricane is brewing and even worse series of incidents around cuba involving russians ships and an increasingly nervous s navy sets off an international crisis of possible catastrophic proportions this crisis is mirrored in the confines of the now isolated underwater rig the triggerhappy and increasingly paranoid lieutenant coffey at odds the crew about how do deal the mysterious goingson around them the human drama is often riveting the principal players performing an intensity that recalls the fine ensemble acting in camerons aliens the stunts hardware special effects and underwater cinematography are all outstanding and so they should be camerons technical credentials are well established but what ultimately makes the so gripping is three intersecting plot strands the tension between old sparring partners lindsay and exhubby bud the war of wills between the civilian crew and the navy divers as series of escalating crisis befall them and the slowly unfolding revelation of what lies at the bottom of the three mile deep abyss the abyss special edition is an improvement on the original in two major respects one is that it further fleshes out the relationship between bud and lindsay relationship at times touching at others incredibly intense and volatile the second improvement is the restoration of some absolutely crucial scenes towards the films end when the aliens demonstrate their control over water terrifying and extraordinary display of power world on the brink of nuclear war the inclusion of these startling scenes the storys climax is now given real weight why on earth were they left out of the original this reviewer finds it utterly incomprehensible so then we have minutes of additional footage that is turned decent underwater thriller into something quite magnificent say quite because some flaws do remain the most grating is several moments of corny schmaltz some new some old that may well have you reaching for the barf bag nonetheless the abyss special edition now stands this somewhat maligned among james camerons greatest achievements alongside aliens and terminator see it and be moved gripped and spellbound

i have soft spot in my heart for pure amoral sleaze liked showgirls there said it typically enjoy myself when sitting through that eszterhaz sexfilled cinematic tabloidish trash wild things is the best sleazy have ever seen it is filled great performances graphic sex threeway sex rape charges doublecrosses plot twists genitalia of all genders graphic violence death witty humor and best of all denise richards criticizing this for being disgusting raucous and just plain wrong is as fundamentally pointless as criticizing citizen kane for being disturbing or titanic for being lofty and epic wild things is that succeeds in its endeavors but do not just admire it for thisi admire it for being so entertaining and such fun time at the movies must admit upfront however that am directly in the center of the age group this has been engineered appeal imagine that this shows it is hard give plot summary without giving away pieces that should not be known thought had the whole thing worked out from the trailer but was wrong there are lot of turns here will just say that the takes place in blue bay rich little town in florida in blue bay lives sam lombardo matt dillon teacher who is accused of rape two of his students kelly van ryan denise richards and suzie toller neve campbell kellys mother sandra theresa russell immediately presses charges all of this happens fairly early in the and right up until this point had the whole predicted was wrong though and every time was proven wrong was shocked wild things is not even remotely plausible but it is so fun see where the story takes us that the implausibility of every scene is meaningless and often invited just for kicks remember first seeing the preview for wild things before the replacement killers would give the preview four stars it made me want see the movie so much that have been waiting for it anxiously ever since over the past few weeks though started realize that there was no way the could live up the preview see independence day thankfully was proven wrong the preview for this is one that needs be studied marketing analysts of every distribution company not only does it make us want see the but it does not give away any of the secrets but am not here talk about the preview am here talk about denise richards now found her mildly interesting in starship troopers but in wild things she appeals such base instinct that every scene she is in demands attention in way that almost no other performer can of course this might have something do her oceanic eyes and flawless body but thought she did great job acting too stop laughing no richards is truly findshe is talented and always convincing in this this mixed in her insane physical appeal makes her vital asset any she may grace in the future the other actors are good too dillon is as suave as ever it is nice see him bouncing back from albino alligator and in out bacon does good job acting all determined and stuff as sex crimes officer neve campbell gives the most layered performance of all of them though will not pretend that any of these characters are deep and complex for plot like this work all of these people have be insane and basically contrived that is okay because director john mcnaughton knows that he is making selfconsciously wicked each sceneeven the threeway sex sceneis observed hilarity mcnaughton and the result is sleazefest that is too smart resist there is not an inconsistent moment in wild things every bit of it is alluring garbage so trashy it is funny and so entertaining it is painful loved it

tarzan chadz good minutes hour minutes animated adventuredrama starring the voices of tony goldwyn tarzan minnie driver jane porter lance henriksen kerchak brian blessed clayton written tab murphy bob tzudiker noni white produced bonnie arnold directed chris buck kevin lima based on the story tarzan of the apes and characters created edgar rice burroughs seen july at m at crossgates cinemas guilderland ny theater myself for free using my hoyts season pass theater rating very good sound picture and seats title tarzan beautiful look at easy follow review disney continues its trend of producing animated summer blockbuster movies meant mostly for children but enough wit and charm for adults be interested and at least entertained the story the basic premise is the same as every other tarzan story boy is raised in the african jungle gorillas and becomes one himself never really understanding or even noticing that he is human and is lot different from the animals he befriends the first third of the shows how tarzan comes be adopted kala voiced glen close female gorilla who lost her own child in classic case of darwanism her mate kerchak henriksen is mean conservative leader of the pack of gorillas who make up tarzans extended family he refuses acknowledge tarzan voiced alex linz during the childhood scenes as son and often has hold himself back from killing tarzan after he continually does dangerous wild things that are the result of his own childish instincts have feeling children will quickly be able identify tarzan since all he really is is just kid who wants have fun and it is funny how the adults fail comprehend this later as the story transitions from tarzan as child fullgrown man voiced goldwyn he is encounter party of three humans from england jane porter driver beautiful woman who is something of zoologist and an artist her father prof archimedes porter voiced nigel hawthorne who is also scientist and their slick and cunning yet barbaric safari bodyguard clayton blessed it is easy tell where the story is going at all times but the screenplay does not seem like it was written hastily nor dumbed down for childrens enjoyment sure there is lot of cliche stuff here like claytons smugness and diabolical manipulation of tarzan and jane the goofy supporting characters voiced rosie odonnell in full brooklyn accent and wayne knight hello newman there is also lot of fun action such as tarzans swinging through the jungle on vines and sliding down and around tree branches and trunks it is just like skateboarding really fast and doing all sorts of tricks those mcdonalds commercials really prove this point ultimately you get exactly out of tarzan what you expect and mean that as compliment so have high expectations pros animation and sound are feast for the senses story is lighthearted breezy and not dumbeddown no stupid singalong songs get stuck in your head cons surprisingly violent should have been rated pg young children may not understand some of the more adult themes parents be ready have some heavy questions thrown your way running time is bit short would you recommend this friends not my friends but the moviegoing public would score or no rating

i have always been told that there are two things in life that are unavoidable death and taxes oddly have never given much thought either of the two maybe if did at least would stop getting collection notices from uncle sam yes let me make resolution devote myself better record keeping hold on all my receipts and do what it takes have the satisfaction that my returns are mistakefree and will keep me from incurring penalties it seems that the issue of death may not be so different at least envisioned here in this as this tender love story goes if you do good things and have clear conscience when you die you ascend place of great peace and beauty the dreams wishes and fantasies that you had when you were alive come true for those who die burdened soul however they wind up in that other place chris and annie winsome robin williams and radiant annabella sciorra seem like the perfect couple that deserve all that heaven has offer their love for each other is strong and their bond is undeniable but tragic events eventually tear apart the fabric of annies happiness and when chris dies after terrible car accident she commits suicide tortured soul who blames herself despair is perhaps the greatest sin and she will wallow in her guilt throughout eternity chris on the other hand has made it heaven and upon learning of annies fate he journeys hell find her and try free her from her nightmare this brims imagination containing lush imagery that shows the arcadia that is heaven and the bitterness and frightfulness that is hell it seems that heaven and hell could very well be product of our fantasies or nightmares it is shape and look is as infinite as our imagination as chris explores his new fantastic world and discovers things both amazing and wondrous he also begins learn more about himself certain questions baffle him at first why does his home in heaven ooze paint what is the significance of the asian stewardess why does he have an alltoowilling guide cuba gooding jr help him find annie but as he slowly begins realize the answers it makes him stronger and gives him greater chance save annie dreams is both visually and tellingly beautiful alas have one regret the movie did well gather more and more emotional speed but the denouement was curiously unsatisfying it seemed as if it was racing some kind of great finish but its intensity seemed wane in its final moments however your eyes will still well up tears and you will find lots savor the storytelling is purposeful and well constructed the journey is imaginative and was surprised how much enjoyed this

it was crazy time in france what the french revolution right around the corner king louis xv would soon die and his son would become king louis xvi such is the setting for beaumarchais the scoundrel about the controversial playwright spy and playboy pierreaugustin caron de beaumarchais beaumarchais was the author of the plays the barber of seville and the marriage of figaro today people think of them as quaint and harmless operas but back in when the movie takes place they were so scandalous that beaumarchais was thrown into prison more than once the movie beaumarchais the scoundrel takes lighthearted approach its subject resulting in an inviting motion picture one of frances most expensive productions ever the movie was huge hit when it opened there last year now in theatrical release in the united states it eschews the seriousness of most art house films romping good story the secret of the films success other than the lavishness of sylvie de segonzacs costumes has be the performance fabrice luchini as beaumarchais his glistening eyes and his infectious smile he mesmerizes the camera and the audience his wry little lips seem always hint at some unspoken deviousness he is planning in land where court intrigue determines ones destiny constant scheming was way of life for the aristocracy as our story starts we learn that beaumarchais has bought himself judgeship into his court comes member of the nobility demanding an immediate sword fight beaumarchais who has been having an affair the mans wife makes him wait until the current case on the docket is decided that over the fight is on luchinis charisma it is hard root for anyone other than him audiences may remember him from the marvelous colonel chabert in he played the attorney although he does not have half of the good looks of his assistant gudin played manuel blanc he dazzles the women and the viewers his grace and style michael epps warm and intimate cinematography provides nice accompaniment jeanmarc kerdelhues lush but realistic looking sets jeanclaude petit is music especially the hauntingly lovely flute solos make for an enchanting time at the movies director jeanclaude brisville who wrote the script along edouard molinaro fleshed out play sacha guitry according the press notes was just series of historic vignettes the disorganization of the play still comes through at some points in the movie but the actors smooth it over their goodhearted style typical of the scenes that come out of nowhere is the one in rotund benjamin franklin appears in large pot of hot water taking his bath one episode has beaumarchais working renegade spy who may or may not be man another has beaumarchais using his personal fortune aid the american revolution all of this may sound like dull historical drama but it is anything but the story plays more like theater of the absurd than movie based on historical facts the radiantly lovely sandrine kiberlain plays marietherese the real love of beaumarchaiss life but he is so likable that members of the audience may want compete her for him still his beguiling smile one can never quite be sure if you should trust him the movie on the other hand can be trusted deliver high old time beaumarchais the scoundrel runs it is in french english subtitles the is not rated but would be an for some nudity and sex and should be fine for most teenagers

what surprises me most about the longawaited batman is that the movie centers not on the caped crusader but on the joker the dark knight actually has less screen time than his homicidal arch nemesis can hear batfans everywhere protesting first they had the nerve cast michael keaton as batman and now they think they can get away making him second banana the joker and indeed this situation would have been altogether inappropriate and intolerable were it not for the fact that someone at warner brothers had the savvy cast jack nicholson in the role he was born play nicholson deserves the top billing he is receiving in the posters and opening credits since his astounding oscarworthy performance as the joker is the highlight of batman nicholson shows no inhibition or shame as he pulls out all the stops create joker that makes cesar romero look like bozo the clown romero played the joker in the tv series on one hand nicholsons joker is extremely funny his murderous escapades and manic outbursts include defacing paintings in an art museum and invading the television airwaves hilarious pirate broadcasts bring humor and laughter into an otherwise dark but on the other hand his outwardly jovial disposition is only mask for his intense contempt for all of mankind the jokers cruelty and demented diabolical nature are truly frightening and sinister this guy is off his rocker and he not only knows it he flaunts it but enough about nicholson as the joker am sure most people are wondering about michael keaton as batman like many was outraged when warner brothers announced that keaton had been cast as the caped crusader but batfans need not worry because holy unconventional casting keaton delivers he is convincing as the tormented millionaire bruce wayne and beneath his hard black body armor he is mysterious and formidable as the batman even though the screenplay only halfheartedly attempts develop the character keaton manages give hints of the inner turmoil and emotional rage that drive wayne don his bat gear and battle the low life scum of gotham city visually batman is knockout nothing short of triumph for director tim burton and his production team the movie successfully captures the noir look and bleak gloomy atmosphere of such batman comic books as the dark knight returns and the killing joke burtons is feast for the eyes the million budget is definitely on the screen the sets costumes and makeup are stunning and worthy of oscar nominations nicholson is not joking when he boasts wait till they get load of me his grimacing smile green hair and purple suits over orange shirts are colorful and outrageous keatons wardrobe is equally appropriate batmans cape mask and body armor make him look threatening frightening and invincible bringing mind not adam wests campy costume in the tv series but peter weirs outfit in robocop production designer anton fursts sets are wonder gotham city is dark and foreboding almost as if it were an expressionist vision of new york the batcave is cold bare and desolate the world that burton and furst have created in batman is melancholy nightmare of violence and corruption the movies gritty bladerunnerrobocop look is joy behold the plot on the other hand is not as rousing the screenplay is not up snuff in comparison the stylized sets and superb acting it takes forever for what little story there is finally kick into gear batman tries walk thin line between action and character psychology but it fails give us enough of either one as mentioned earlier the screenplay gives us plenty of the joker but it never fully establishes batmans psychological motives and underpinnings in terms of action batman is not as thrilling as you might expect burton seems more concerned the visual and dramatic elements of the story more than anything batman is mood while batman may not completely absorb and excite you it will likely impress you its success at bringing life the style and spirit of the batman comic books thanks its distinctive look the movie like good comic book transports us another world

casting doogie howser star neil patrick harris as mindreading military intelligence is only one of the guilty pleasures of starship troopers hugely entertaining megabudgeted scifi yarn directed paul verhoeven who is making quite recovery from his gstring epic showgirls sure starship troopers qualifies as cinematic junk food but that is forgivable when the junk food is this tasty everyone needs highcalorie changeofpace from falls onslaught of costume dramas and other assorted oscar bait and troopers does the job admirably despite its flaws for its first hour starship troopers plays like cheeky futuristic hybrid of saved the bell and i jane in the distant years ahead high school grad johnny rico casper van dien signs up for federal service along his girlfriend carmen denise richards he gets accepted into the mobile infantry but she wants travel the fleet academy become starship pilot so the couple is broken up but there is temptation awaiting both of them johnnys is in the form of an old friend dina meyer also in the infantry and still harboring secret crush while carmen attracts the eye of her flirtatious instructor patrick muldoon personal rivalry and sexual jealousy carry over into the final minutes when an impending alien menace begins making good on its threatening presence and obliterates part of south america killing johnnys parents and destroying his home our weakening lovesick protagonist is given new reasons stick around the mobile infantry and is dispatched group of fellow fighters the aliens home planet where he will head up ground assault end the threat for good but the enemy is far smarter more diabolical and numerous than the good guys give them credit for and after an initial walloping they must reexamine their strategy the exposition played like futuristic soap opera is silly but aware of its own ridiculousness enough merit more smiles than groans once we get past the campy character introductions and the numerous but never boring training sessions starship troopers really kicks into high gear its last half is all gruesomely violent action fury of severed limbs decapitations disembowelments brain removal explosions and other joltinducers that are really going please the and yearold boys lucky enough dodge getting carded or caught on their way into this deservedly rrated show the creature design and special effects are amazing as expected and their interaction the human actors are realistic imaginative high point it is nice see intergalactic beasties that are not too derivative of the titular menace from alien these monsters are appropriately terrifying sights especially the arachnids spiderscorpioncrab combo that is all sharp talons and even sharper legs they attack in packs of hundreds and it is funny scary sight see these bugs take repeated hits and still crawl jerk and struggle towards their intended victims in determined gooey mess it matters not that they actually have laughable master plan in mind ask yourself if species like this seems capable of carrying out such plot these sequences of insect warfare are numerous bloody and immensely satisfying the occasional dramatic moments one cast members death the final resolution johnnys love triangle are botched testament how starship troopers fails create any strong outstanding characters these bland kenandbarbie archetypes serve the story adequately enough keep any distractions at arms length but restrain the from achieving higher ground la star wars where even the slightest aliens had definite personality the acting is decent but never spectacular most of the performers hail from aaron spelling territory smallish roles on beverly hills andor melrose place and it occasionally shows van dien for example is limited but perfectly likeable in smaller parts are the aforementioned neil patrick harris as johnnys best friend and jake busey garys son as johnnys sidekick the latter excels at playing creeps see the frighteners or contact but seems offkilter as second banana starship troopers is based on the novel robert heinlein scifi writer who has not exactly seen any recent adaptation justice done any of his books what howler the puppet masters but the overall familiarity the alien trilogy and the promise of great gobs of gore could act as crowddrawer its own possible influence however might well work against it when the franchise continuation alien resurrection opens in few weeks we will know then crown as the best summer movie of the fall

historical epic as genre was almost banished from in early for many critics scholars and most importantly producers it was thing of the past something that could have attracted crowds only in the era of blackandwhite television and noncgi special effects but in same as in the case of dances wolves five years ago there came the man who decided use of all his energy and talents of actor producer and director in order revitalise that particular genre and same as in the case of dances wolves he was awarded for his effort oscars the name of the was braveheart and the name of its director and main actor was mel gibson the plot chronicles the life of scottish warlord and folk hero william wallace in his time english king edward longshanks played patrick mcgoohan has almost completely subdued entire british isles including scotland whose proud inhabitants are now subjected ius primae noctis and various other forms of humiliation and oppression english knights although english had killed his father many years ago young scottish commoner william wallace played mel gibson does not care about politics and wants only have peaceful life his new bride murron played catherine maccormack murrons death changes that and wallace takes arms and together small but dedicated band of followers begins guerrilla campaign that would systematically destroy almost every english garrison in the country through time more and more people join his ranks and in wallaces ragtag army scores surprising victory against english knights in the battle of stirling bridge but the newly won freedom is endangered the internal squabbles between scots themselves especially nobles under pretender robert the bruce played angus macfadyen who would not like have simple commoner as national leader braveheart was only the second in the directorial career mel gibson so it would not be fair compare it the better known genre classics directed david lean or anthony mann however even when we apply such criteria braveheart is more than decent historical epic that takes new and refreshing approach the genre the most noticeable element of this approach is naturalism while older films set in medieval europe used give fairytalelike vision of picturesque castles splendid costumes and knights in shining armour gibson shows us the extremely unpleasant world of poverty and feudal injustice where might made right and life was hard short and brutish this general unpleasantness is especially underlined in the scenes of battle where handtohand combat is naturalistically displayed in all its gory details never seen since verhoevens ultranaturalistic flesh blood compared this naturalistic approach most of old epics look like stage plays braveheart also employs humour at the right places not only make bloody realities of medieval british isles more bearable sensitive audiences but also underline its downtoearth atmosphere so different from previous historical epics what makes braveheart larger than life is his protagonist mel gibson obviously invested plenty of his energy and talent in bringing the mythical figure of william wallace and as result character of th century poems is transformed into superhuman being that resembles late th century comic book hero wallace is more than superior his enemies both physically and mentally yet he is able show his sensitive more vulnerable side naturally when the character is based on epic poems most of historical accuracy is going down the drain was the case almost every historical epic from in however even those who do not particularly care about history or are willing give poetic license scriptwriter randall wallace might think that he went over the top in idolising wallace especially in the second part of when scottish superhero manages seduce princess isabel played sophie marceau and make her child because of that the disbelief is hardly suspended and final scenes are not as effective as they should be mel gibson as an actor is truly wonderful and he is also helped small army of very good british and irish actors most memorable of them all is patrick mcgoohan whose cold calculated and evil medieval monarch is one of the most effective villains seen in contemporary cinema brendan gleeson who would later become famous for his role in boormans general is also very good as wallaces trusted companion as well as ian bannen is effective as leprosystricken king john balliol david oharra is very entertaining as wallaces irish ally and angus macfadyen brings lot of anxiety into his consciencestricken character of robert the bruce women in this have rather thankless roles especially marceau as onedimensional french princess catherine mccormack as wallaces wife was more interesting but she was eliminated from the picture early on from the technical point of view the is also very good photography john toll brings lot of scottish natural beauty the screen on the other hand the musical score james horner employs too much of modernday instruments for period piece set in medieval times although mostly welcomed critics and audiences alike braveheart was often criticised for homophobia and other forms of extreme conservatism the main reason for that was the fact that gibson among many historical facts chose be faithful only those related sexual orientation of longshank son prince edward played peter hanly he is not only presented as villain but also as one of the less competent in villains camp and portraying of homosexuals as villains or inferior heterosexuals is almost unforgivable sin in politically correct make things even more obvious good guys in this are the total opposite of effeminate and incompetent edward rugged macho men of mountains who are more practical and efficient because they tend employ conservatives common sense instead of fashionable theories of ivory tower liberals however although the message of this might look rightwing it owes more leftist ideology of various national liberation movements in th century according that ideology oppressed classes workers peasants are better suited fight for national freedom because their members has less lose in that struggle and as such they are more radical less willing make compromises and more efficient on the other hand privileged classes aristocracy bourgeoisie are more likely betray the cause of freedom and be in cahoots foreign oppressors in order keep their privileges this marxist worldview is presented in braveheart without any subtlety in the end whether the audience is patient enough discover hidden meanings or simply wants enjoy entertaining historical epic braveheart is more than adequate choice for all fans of this recently resurrected genre

if you had chance create genetically perfect child would you do it gattaca is presents future where society has answered yes this question but then ponders if this was actually the right decision gattaca came out only couple months following the first genetically engineered creature the lovable dolly the sheep and this in mind the only becomes more frightening the way the realm of genetics is heading it may only take couple decades until the future gattaca presents becomes true contrary the misleading trailers gattaca is not scifi thriller in the way that there is lots of murder hitchcockian suspense and chase scenes this is quiet sad about intelligent theories in fact the seems like it would have been written george orwell or aldous huxley the latter who is novel brave new world featured genetically engineered children it is that may likely become cult hit people who are frightened promise of shallow utopia is exactly what gattaca presents and the main reason dug it so much the story revolves around the genetically insufficient vincent freeman ethan hawke man high hopes but chance of heart problems and prospected life span of around years as child he was put down because of the threats of genetics while his younger genetically perfect brother anton loren dean was promised whatever his heart desired vincent yearns be an astronaut but when he gets job at giant space company it is as janitor ernest borgnine plays his boss but one day he finds out that it is probably possible that his desires can come true in the form of business deal brought out black market geneticist or something german wings tony shalhoub who did like hundreds of cameos in films back in men in black life less ordinary who is client is genetically perfect man jerome morrow jude law who has unfortunately been crippled fortunately though there is no record of the accident and he is willing give someone else his life since vincent looks bit like him after couple alterations some minor some really major he has donned the life of jerome and is doing his job there he meets genetically imperfect woman irene uma thurman who is genetically perfect in real life anyway hee hee and the two begin kind of relationship albeit very shallow one since romance is deemed how great mans stats are however murder of highlevel worker at his office is killed and one of vincentjeromes eyelashes is found the anal retentive investigators headed semiwily inspector hugo alan arkin and none other than vincents long lost brother anton who has not seen him since they were teenagers we know vincentjerome did not do it but his older picture being posted everywhere not only vincentjeromes in trouble but also the real jerome who is as much in it as he is however there is not many big suspense set pieces is actually blessing because if they were tossed in the would lose it is message and descend into just being scifi thriller la william gibson the suspense in the comes from the idea that vincent and jerome can easily be captured just dropping hair or dead skin while there are several scenes are pretty frightening there are no big distractions from the point of the much the dismay of commercial audiences what is actually portrayed is the lack of life in the utopian society that is created irene has no real spunk in her life and is rather amazed the sheer beauty of sunrise rather than genetically perfect people and the genetically flawless jerome is in actuality bitter man claiming that his accident was really no accident what jerome has done is fool the system in giving man who yearns for better things chance at that and the ending is shocking as it is definite work of dystopian propaganda but does not have the down ending of other works of this kind the production design of this is probably the best have seen this year it is stunning very pleasing the eye but still very cold since genetics has ruled out any chance of improvement the world has cooled into state of inhumanity and the sets echo sense of shallow misery and the sequence of all the highlevel workers doing their jobs has kind of gilliamesque feel it showing the nightmare of slipping into routine zombielike life the ability perfect people has left humanity cold and generally unhappy the acting from everyone is great thurman giving wonderfully cold performance and hawke creating character who has been beaten down the system but has found new sense of optimism bitter man who was willing give it out anyway interesting pointless fact uma and ethan started dating after this and currently she is pregnant his child but the best performance belongs jude law who steals every scene he is in and creates character filled the pessimism over having such horrible burden placed on his burden think that people are generally tempted the fact that genetics can actually create perfection in child but whether or not they would actually act on this temptation is something am not sure of gattaca warns us not go any farther chiefly because we will create world of elitism where the elite are shallow and unhappy and as bitter and angry as the lesser people are and when see possible future featuring fingered piano player well folks that just creeps me out

in one scene from the people vs larry flynt the hustler magazine publisher appears at selfstaged free speech rally as graphic photos flash on huge screen behind him flynt strides confidently across the stage delivering rousing speech over what really constitutes obscenity the spectacle was reminiscent of the scene in patton where the general spoke in front of giant american flag both scenes were stirring larger than life richly entertaining and felt totally like contrived set pieces for big movies overall that sums up the people vs larry flynt the is wildly entertaining hoot despite being based on fact feels like big phony movie the son of kentucky moonshiner flynt woody harrelson ran away from home and ended up operating strip clubs in cincinnati there he met althea leasure courtney love bisexual stripper who became his fourth wife and the love of his life bolster interest in his clubs he started sexually explicit newsletter that grew into hustler magazine flynt along the magazines ragtag management team headed his brother jimmy played nicely woodys reallife brother steak shake commercial veteran brett harrelson viewed playboy magazine contempt they mocked its slick articles and airbrushed photos striving keep hustler focused on what guys really want explicit photos that would make gynecologist squirm and extremely crude humor the films prime example of hustlers attitude is cartoon depicting characters from the wizard of oz in an orgy giving the audience an opportunity giggle at flynts naughtiness director milos forman conveniently ignores the magazines frequent attempts derive humor from child molestation racism and endless scatological cartoons flynts rag labored in welldeserved obscurity until he published nude photos of jacqueline onassis brought the magazine international attention big money and the attention of conservatives an obscenity bust followed the first in long series of battles between flynt and the law lawyer alan isaacman edward norton enters the scene hired flynts wife norton an exceptional actor is wonderful as the beleaguered lawyer trying navigate the legal system while dealing flynts increasingly childish and bizarre behavior in court we meet the sputtering conservatives headed citizens for decency leader charles keating james cromwell as keating blathers about flynts immorality the camera slowly moves in for closeup of his name tag inviting the audience gloat at the notion of morality being trumpeted keating who was later convicted in billion sl fraud flynts other prime foe is rev jerry falwell who sues over hustler parody involving him and his mother having sex in an outhouse tragedy strikes as flynt is shot wouldbe assassin leaving him paralyzed from the waist down dark period follows as flynt and leasure hole up in an a suite strung out on pain killers flynt eventually kicks drugs but leasure succumbs addiction and later aids after watch falwell on tv describing aids as punishment from god flynt directs his lawyer take the falwell case the supreme court leading the films climactic courtroom scene the people vs larry flynt is at its weakest when moralizing on free speech and lionizing flynt if they will protect scumbag like me then they will protect all of you declared flynt he is right of course but the director forman cheats in portraying the opposition as little more than hypocritical buffoons he also cheats in casting woody harrelson as flynt harrelson is an attractive charismatic man and his strong performance paints flynt as colorful folk hero even cursory look at the real flynt who is making the talk show circuit and plays the judge in an early courtroom scene shows bloated morose and bitter man an accurate portrayal of flynt would have made more difficult watch but richer one despite its flaws flynt is fast moving rousing movie some terrific acting especially courtney love whose vibrant performance will likely garner an oscar nod the story may be candycoated but it is still delicious candy

we all know the fate of childs play is the same for almost any these days that does marginally well financially sequel hell the newest installment in the quasipopular series currently out that would be bride of chucky and it grossed million in its opening weekend think is the sign of the apocalypse number five it is kinda fun go back and see how it all began rougly ten years ago the original task is retread for some and for others namely myself chance see what all the fuss was about alas the original childs play actually is not that bad even seeing it in the tiny claustrophobic and mechanicallychallenged theatre at my college was not the horribly dull experience thought it would be not just because of the nicely rowdy crowd you almost need watch like this and if you do not believe me try and watch this flick yourself one day but because as whole this is not bad movie it is not great but it does have two things that many horror films like this one do not have rather nifty premise and sense of humor both save this from horror hell is precisely where say know what you did last summer has recently gone the premise of childs play is that serial killer named charles lee ray brad douriff is shot and almost killed chicago hardboiled detective chris surrandon see what happens some oscar nominees and before he dies utters voodoo chant that sends his soul directly into kids doll called chucky doll has got be the scariestlooking kids doll have ever seen the next day bum who is stolen it sells it singlemother karen barclay catherine hicks who then gives it her young son andy alex vincent for his birthday of course chucky begins talking the kid and trying find way get out of the doll but certain twists come up like the guy he learned voodoo from reveals him that the only way break the curse is take over the body of the first person he told he was inside the doll that being andy and soon enough chucky is killing people either for revenge or for what seems like fun and people are discovering that chucky is not just kiddie doll one one the idea is neat one ripe for lots of comic terror and luckily it utlizes lot of that it plays an idea stolen from classic looney toons short that when someone knows that chucky is alive they tell people about it but when he tries prove themselves chucky does nothing and everyone thinks they are crazy it plays this as well as the whole childlike thought that dolls and toys come life and even manages cram in couple really frightening moments even if there is an entire sequence devoted cliches woman alone in house hears noise goes investigate it and finds nothing but wait for the kicker second later there is also harrowing car ride chucky trying knife the detective from the back seat and then trying attack him when the car finally crashes leaving the viewer at least rather visceral exprience the ending is rather fun as well albeit tad too drawnout about four different endings maybe five and the characters are more intelligent than the average horror lineup making them easier sympathize if there is one horrible thing about many horror films it is that the protagonists are morons who you cannot help but shout obscenities at and for the most part childs play steers away from that and most of all the chucky character is good one not just because he provides instant comic relief look that dolls moving on its own but because he is generally scary character if there is anything really wrong childs play it is that it is too trite and has too less self esteem at almost minutes childs play features way too less be real classic of horror it throws itself into simple three act setup that renders it quick and almost forgettable if it were not for the fact that the deals psychotic doll if the had more confidence in what it was presenting it would really push the envelope and become even more than just short bit of horror escapism is precisely why this kind of is only memorable as cheap little horor is not necessarily bad thing as such childs play is content be just the short typical horror but saves itself via sense of humor and nice quasicampy feel that makes it much more enjoyable than the average short typical horror

director penelope spheeris decline of western civilization ii the metal years dudes suburbia cast mike myers wayne campbell dana carvey garth algar rob lowe benjamin oliver tia carrere cassandra summary wayne and garth have public access show called waynes world the show is underground hit until benjamin oliver comes onto the scene benjamin wants turn the show into big hit nationwide possibly destroying the essence of waynes world in the process expectations medium long review must admit being bit reluctant going into this did not believe that they mike myers and dana carvey could hold it up for an hour and half figured that perhaps the first halfhour would be great and the rest would be fluff however was really surprised about how well they were able keep the laughs going for the virtually the whole the exception of the ending will not discuss for obvious reasons but it is not that bad story the plot was quite thin but it really was not that noticeable because of the rapidfire jokes that myers wrote in alot of the jokes are very similar hot shots in being very parodyish okay bad term extremely witty throughout although as in hot shots it got bit repetitive in the middle acting as in many comedies the acting is not really that important however myers turns in good performance as wayne playing the character perfectly although still liked him better back on much music in more canadian type of mode carvey is okay as garth but he lacks the spark myers puts into wayne tia carrere is mediocre as cassandra playing it very stilted lowe is fine as ben oliver but is nothing write home about without doubt this movie is mike myers all the way direction spheeris is classic music movie director making dudes and decline of western civilization ii the metal years she also directed the boys next door is different say the least she is very capable knows how direct comedy the correct camera movements it instill laughs etc one of the better jobs can remember for comedy overall would suggest anyone that likes snls skits go see this in the theatres however my personal opinion as in most comedies is that they work just as well on video you definately have be fan of music and all forms of media in general enjoy this without doubt this is the best comedy so far this year it will make tons dough for everyone involved let us just hope they make thousand sequels sorry had get the lame joke in forgive me

natural born killers is really very simple story that in essence has already been told in bonnie clyde some major variations in emphasis mood and degree both films glamorize outlaws in one case bank robbers and killers and in the other mass murderers both relate the story of couple liberated love but where bonnie clyde was partial and subtle natural born killers is total and blatant where bonnie clyde was social natural born killers is psychological what bonnie clyde hinted at natural born killers confronts and explores what bonnie and clyde stole mickey and mallory kill examine natural born killers as nothing more than psychological odyssey of realization and exposure of the frauds surrounding them expressed metaphorically as killing subdues the mysterious power this wields for the most part when mickey and mallory kill they kill all that frustrates them unnecessarily they kill what is trying kill them they kill what dissembles and cowers from life they kill what needs be killed this mythos is at least as old as the hindu trinity brahma created vishnu preserved and siva destroyed but he destroyed what needed be destroyed make way for the useful creations of brahma the following may be painfully mundane but metaphorically so accurate am forced say it for claritys sake plumber must remove the old lead and copper pipes that is destroy the old plumbing system in order replace it the new one made of plastics your plumber bonnie and clyde mickey and mallory and siva are all productive destroyers think you could say without much of challenge that religion is responsible for more killing and death presently and historically than any other phenomena muslims kill christians hindus kill muslims christians kill pagans jews kill christians etc you could reverse subject and predicate in each instance and still not be challenged religion is an orgy of killing the institution of the state only misses first place for technical reasons like it has not been major player for as long or the two are frequently indistinguishable the state is the divine idea upon earth hegel said meaning it is absolute allpowerful ineffable unassailable infallible authoritarian and patriarchal just like jhvh allah god etc well what does all this have do natural born killers let me first say that religions of this nature in the ideal take the place of sex consider the catholic church in its heydey took religion as seriously as any other religion or institution ever god takes the place of sex as manifested in all those vows of celibacy taken the pope cardinals bishops monks etc they forego the one in order come closer the other during the middle ages when this doctrine was unmitigated and unchallenged the most repressive regime the west has ever known in terms of scope and magnitude rose power parenthetically witness plato as well in the republic he attempted launch the first systematic absolutist regime not coincidentally he was something of mystic himself regularly assailing the passions catholicism as policy attacks the passions as evil it sees intercourse only as means perpetuate the species not as way pleasure masturbation is considered sin the sacrament of penance necessary for absolution this is religion this is authoritarianism in its essence as further evidence the nazis had the same attitudes as the church on these matters our culture most of the cultures of the world have been steeped in this tradition for thousands of years we cannot help but adopt even internalize some of these same authoritarian attitudes leading destructive split between the biological and social self mickey and mallory knox internalized them too then through spontaneous sexual awareness sparked in each one of them the presence of the other discovered them and began expurgating them from themselves and from the world in the process unifying themselves it is straightforward liberation through sex as some good patriarch once observed you can maintain control as long as everyone keeps their clothes on mm had vision of what the world would be like without contradictions they saw what civilization and culture and everyday life would be like under such conditions the moment of realization is worth thousand prayers as mickey says as the most consistent and impassioned critic of western culture there is nietzsche applying his typical stridency the matter let us look each other in the face we are hyberboreanswe know well enough how remote our place is neither land nor water will you find the road the hyberboreans even pindar in his day knew that much about us beyond the north beyond ice beyond deathour life our happiness we have discovered that happiness we know the way we got our knowledge of it from thousands of years in the labyrinth who else has found it the man of today do not know either the way out or the way in am whatever does not know either the way out or the way in so sighs the man of today this is the sort of modernity that made us illwe sickened in lazy peace cowardly compromise the whole virtuous dirtiness of the modern yea and nay this tolerance and largeur of the heart that forgives everything because it understands everything is sirocco us rather live amid the ice than among modern virtues and other such southwinds as far as can tell this is what the movie has say its alleged critique of the media is only secondary tertiary quaternary subsidiary for sure for example wayne gayles first report ends some gen dude saying if were mass murderer would be mickey and mallory in his most excellent bill and ted voice on one level you cd make the humdrum observation that because the media had glamorized these two psychopaths that the uncritical impressionable gen dumb guy confused the matter and took them for heroes it seems more likely that he made an independent judgement at subconscious level recognizing what mm were up and confessing that if he had the balls be so honest himself he would be just the bond series is an island in the world where else would we look forward cliches and all of the other things that occur in most of these films where else would pure escapism vulnerable hero the talking villains blatant product placement predictable action sequences and lots of promiscuity be hoped for instead of significant change do not understand it myself but that is what the bond series is based on for think films we have mostly got the same thing over and over again some variation and bit of change most notably in the two dalton films but even a king of cynicism cannot bitch about it and tomorrow never dies the again think eighteenth bond and second brosnan bond is no exception thank god the plot as in most of them is pure balderdash but seems have nice kind of edge it instead of just plain billionaire psychotics we get rupert murdochesque media mogulpsychotic elliot carver jonathan pryce looking bitching whitehaired cru cut and always talking like he is out of breath who has the admittingly ingenius idea of getting ratings creating war no this is not wag the dog he wants real war between china and england and is stupid enough put the coverage out before anyone else discovered it in comes bond james is sent all around the world trying do research on carver fighting his men and running into on more than one occasion chinese secret agent like him wai lin michelle yeoh asian action star extraordinaire and costar of supercop nearly stealing the screen from jackie chan in that one the two eventually and predictably of course begin working together and yes there is some sexual tension between the two luckily their relationship is never strained and she never gives into his cassanovaness until the finale thank god again in every bond james bags on average three women sometimes more sometimes less the latter being more potent towards the aidscautionary dalton and he does not spoil this one though we never see them of course mean they need stay around pg rating there is always one at the beginning some chick we never see again the big bond girl yeoh and this time we have an almostcameo teri hatcher as carvers wife paris who it seems was once one of the girls he bags at the beginning yes teris very attractive but she seems kind of dull of course it is not really her fault her part is underwritten and she is only in small part of it oh well and there are always the big henchmen the guys who do the dirty work for the polished big villains this time we get tall arianlooking not mention robert shaw in from russia love looking guy named stamper goetz otto who is pretty awesome although bit stiff well mostly his posture really and for bit of comedy we get cameo from vincent shiavelli as german or austrian assassin who is ordered do in bond at one point the government people have small parts as usual desmond llewelyn looking near death sadly getting only one scene in more grouchy mood than usual and judi dench getting more than usually gets mean it is judi dench and for no reason whatsoever except ecause he was so good in goldeneye joe don baker shows up again as wade admitting he has no reason for being there and is this time more annoying again oh well the action sequences are not letdown although sometimes go on too long they pop up every now and then mainly because they have for the sake of the series and some significant ones are the opening one one in garage bmw that runs on remote control and motorcylce chase on bmw cycle nonetheless through china streets or was it vietnam the plots not really essential they are more hightech and feature much more laughs yeah dig so what if they are distracting they are supposed be the acting from most around is great yeoh is actually one of the better bond girls mainly because she is so unique the better bond girls are more independent and have certain wilyness them pussy galore her homoerotic undertones and all is one of the best and diana rigg who married bond at the end of on her majestys secret service only be killed added some emotional depth yeoh is notable since she is so active and has great chemistry brosnan pryce is an awesome villain being slimy and lovable at the same time and brosnan is once again the mack daddy the bond series is built on cliches mainly because they are so fun and add the escapism if you can remember the dalton years and they are serious direction you remember how unsuccessful they were both financially and aesthetically the series would falter if bogged down too much plot too many themes and too much characterization do not really understand it myself yet am one of the bigger fans of the series in the northeast united states having seen all of them more than once yes have seen this twice already you can tell adore them while it is not one of the best like goldfinger or from russia love tomorrow never dies is nonetheless truly awesome installment even if not being as fully amazing as some of the better ones

this sometimestedious and oftenmoving documentary charts the life and times of anne frank the young diarist and mostfamous victim of adolph hitler writerdirectorproducer jon blair has collected staggering amount of historical material on both anne and the frank family we meet miep gies one of the familys protectors who is still alive she recounts how she found the diary in the days after the germans captured the franks we watch otto frank annes father and surviving family member in interview footage filmed before his death blair successfully combines these clips footage and other historical records recount exactly what happened during that terrible period of european history as narrated kenneth branagh and diary excepts read glenn close anne frank remembered retells more than just annes story we meet and learn about the many friends family members and acquaintances whose lives were touched this young woman and her writings winner of the last years academy award for best documentary

john sayles men guns is about what happens society when brute force and constant threat of violence are the only means of gaining and maintaining power the takes place in an unnamed central american country where the men guns are the rulers most of the country is divided into tiny segments some are controlled guerrillas guns some are controlled army soldiers guns and all the spaces inbetween are controlled thieves bandits and terrorists all people not fitting one of those descriptions are defined only their powerlessness however like so many central american countries this one also features modernity there is an unnamed capital city that bears all the hallmarks of contemporary civilization skyscrapers hospitals televisions highways etc but it might as well be in another country because those who live in the comforts of the city have either decided ignore the violence ravaging the rest of the land or else they are simply ignorant of it the films main character dr fuentes federico luppi falls into the latter category one of his patients an army general describes him as the most educated man he has ever met and also the most naive fuentes is true liberal caring man who thinks he can cure the ills of his country fighting bacteria and ignorance among the indigenous indians government assistance he has trained large group of eager young medical students and sent them into the rainforest cure and educate this program was be his legacy and he repeats over and over that it was good idea however when he ventures into that same rainforest visit his prot s he finds that things have not turned out as he has envisioned as he travels deeper into the forest going from village village the story is always the same the doctors were all killed either the guerrillas or the army soldiers usually for helping the other when dr fuentes asks village woman why the army killed one of the doctors she replies simply because they had guns and we did not rational science and all its attempts cure have been wiped out the men guns because others sickness and ignorance helps them maintain power dr fuentes picks up several companions during his journey all of whom are characterized their loss first there is young boy named conejo dan rivera gonz lez who has neither mother nor father next fuentes crosses paths thief named domingo dami delgado who deserted the army because he was tired of being jeered into committing murderous atrocities through his ordeal in the army domingo has lost most of his selfrespect and defines himself only his pistol along the way the group also picks up padre portillo dami alc zar priest who has lost his faith as domingo is running from the army so is portillo he has been labeled guerrilla sympathizer and ran away from the village in he was preaching last the group takes on mute girl named graciela tania cruz who has not spoken since she was raped two years earlier her innocence and even her will live forcefully taken from her sayles two major strengths as director characters and setting are abundantly evident in men guns like many of his films sayles might have tightened this one somewhat in the editing room but longerthannecessary running time is sin almost always committed when the director is also the editor he creates fascinating complex characters especially dr fuentes and domingo their uneasy relationship is also somewhat humorous in context of the films overarching theme of violence as power domingos attempts control fuentes his revolver are constantly undermined fuentes belief that the revolver is unloaded at first it is but later is is not the setting is also as thick detail as the rainforest itself sayles knows how bring location life whether it be an early twentiethcentury coal mining town in matewan or contemporary texasmexico bordertown in lone star sayles is not particularly inventive director he likes let his actors do most of the work but he and cinematographer slavomir idziak gattaca successfully evoke both the beauty and the danger of the central american terrain sayles also maintains strong sense of authenticity filming everything on location in mexico using all latin american actors and having all the dialogue spoken in either spanish or native indian dialects the one exception is couple of bumbling american tourists who work not only as comic relief but as evidence of just how clueless the united states is about what is going on few hundred miles south of the texas border it would not be stretch say that men guns is depressing in fact the two feelings it evokes most are hopelessness and failure in addition loss the main characters are also failures at something whether that be dr fuentes failure change anything through medicine or padre portillos inability stand up and be the martyr he always dreamed of being nevertheless it is bleak material sayles has chosen and he deals it accordingly the last shot of the does offer hint of hope even in world where as one character puts it nobody refuses the men guns

plot during week span in london in the fall of jack the ripper man whose identity was never uncovered committed five ritualistic grisly murders of prostitutes this is based on the graphic novel assembled theory behind the centuryold mystery critique awesome love dark movies love stylish movies love good mysteries and love johnny depp so yes really dug this movie the hughes brothers are back vengeance out show the world that they are directors be taken seriously and this movie my friends is very serious in fact it is also very gruesome and bloody and morbid and creepy and black as hell it as not for the kids will tell you that much and if any of those recent hack directors of twobit screamesque slasher flicks want some advice on effective kill scenes do not look any further because each one committed this is cinematic stunner especially when compared their generic sliceanddice contrivances in fact most of this films structure is very creative the actors all solid the atmosphere and feel of the picture remarkably real gotta love those unfortunates and the descent into darkness well honed the filmmakers you can almost taste the seediness off the screen and quickly come appreciate the politics of the time but it is also an impressive mystery based on the truelife tale of jack the ripper man whose identity was never discovered the theory in this is based on the graphic novel from hell written alan moore and presents compelling story despite being little oliver stoneish did manage tie up all of its loose ends quite nicely and present us an entertaining bowl of mayhem sexual depravity drug usage insanity murders and love yes the brothers even managed slip little love story in here and despite not truly being developed guess it could have been much worse and taken up more time than was provided already that is right there is no real need put any romance in about mass murderer but that aside you gotta give up the props actor extraordinaire johnny depp who once again possesses the strength in character and flawless acting abilities center this movie all the way through sure he is just playing less goofier version of his ichabod crane character from sleepy hollow but he does it so well and even added michael caine accent his mixed bag of tricks in this one was also surprised at how little heather graham annoyed me in this was sure that her presence would ruin this movie but she was fine and how little the dreamsfantasies of depps character had do the films development from what had seen in the trailer thought the filmmakers were going make this the crux of the story but thankfully it was not on the downside the does not really explain the whole freemasons cult organization real well and lacks character development but then again story about the most mysterious serial killer of alltime is probably not the ideal spot for character refinement mean the less knew about each person the more suspicious became of each ones motives reasons etc in fact was actually quite surprised who was presented as the killer in the end and that was in part due the distance would been held from the films characters or am giving the filmmakers too much credit for something that might not have been their intention perhaps overall this is an extremely creepy production glorious cinematography reminiscent of coppolas dracula and burtons sleepy hollow grim score and solid acting but it is not for everyone some may be utterly repulsed the gory particulars of these tragic events and even though the murders are not shown as graphically as you might think there is enough here send the squeamish right out the doors but for one love movies that blend their eclectic visual style an interesting mystery and palpable gothic atmosphere and this flick is just that and plenty more and god knows that will certainly not be surrendering the burnt image of jack the rippers haunting cape silhouette and gleaming silver knife from my mind anytime soon brrrrr where is joblo coming from the crow dark city dracula jfk the nightmare before christmas the ninth gate the others quills shadow of the vampire sleepy hollow

in enemy at the gates jude law is gifted russian sniper made hero political officer named danilov joseph fiennes who uses him in propaganda newspaper raise the hopes of the soldiers and people of stalingrad it is world war ii and the russiangerman standoff in town could determine the outcome of things for the motherland laws vassili is the russians top pawn victory lots of war stuff happens an older german version of judes character played ed harris shows up halfway into the proceedings he is equally talented and the two men play cat and mouse game trying kill each other they constantly switch roles as the war fades far into the background the cast also includes the terrific rachel weisz as love interest for both vassili and danilov the setup is decent and so are the production values boasting wide range of grimy locales greasy hair and tattered costumes the art direction prospers the actors however suffer the problem matt damon had in saving private ryan either their eyes teeth skin or combination of other features looked too white and clean dirt and blood all around the blinding teeth or bright eyes of these actors divert attention from the action that said the players are mostly good in their roles although do not think ed harris was really trying maybe he realized his role struck difficult chord in onenotedom while the is technically about snipers there are far too many predictable sniping scenes director jeanjacques annaud expects us view each tense situation jude and some cohort in tight spot as edgy and exciting but after about the sixth time in we realize that jude is not going die it is relatively pointless we get that he is talented okay let us move on that is the problem enemy at the gates it just does not know when stop witness the wasted seventeen minutes that could have been spent elsewhere reestablishing his title as the most beautiful and often talented man on jude law carries the movie without him this costly production would have gone into the ground the story and acting are of good quality but there is never sense of authenticity or reality something about this war movie is undeniably modern and it loses its feeling strange enough the screenplay is based on the true story of real russian sniper

it is been good long while since we had good old fashioned thriller where mostly everything goes right for the audience and wrong for the characters but it is been even longer since saw thriller that actually shock cared for the characters not merely judged them but actually allowed their human foibles flaws and strengths emerge so radiantly would saw that it is been at least couple decades even as far back the great hitchcock thrillers though am hardly comparing simple plan say rear window or strangers on train yet it is almost as good it is simple yet strangely complex and astonishingly rewarding because instead of moving from plot point plot point and merely laying out theymightbecaught overtones it instead concerns itself the moral corruption and depths of greed that its protagonists can go all without ever judging them as either evil or even immoral elegantly directed sam raimi yes the same simple plan concerns itself the discovery of crashed plane and within bag full of millions of dollars an upright moderately financially stable working man bill paxton his dimwitted brother billy bob thornton and his drinking buddy brent briscoe without anyone around and the possibility that no one would come looking for it the three debate and debate but finally reach the decision that yes they will keep it but until any authorities or possible owners of the cash come looking and so they generally do not flaunt anything they do not want flaunt they will keep it stored away in the custody of paxton the possibilites of this circumstance are much diverse they could endlessly play cat and mouse the authorities they could try fight off the rightful owners who are either villainous or just or they could fight amongst themselves simple plan though borrows little from each of these little tiff the cops here subplot involving an alleged fbi agent chilling gary cole there and bit of inside feuding over here but as austin powers would say that is not necessarily its bag baby what most admired about this and what makes this far superior and unique thriller is that it is successfully able have its cake and eat it too it effectively involves some of the traditional thriller cliches like the ones mentioned above but at the same time it involves itself more deeply the way the characters become morally corrupt and what price they have pay have what they think is happiness in black duffle bag so while steps are taken neatly cover things up and these subsequent steps go miserably awry the choses never loose the sight that in covering things up the extent that these characters have they are slowly losing their souls and their humanity in one early scene paxton and thornton have make trip back the plane return some of the money so it does not look like it was all stolen not bad idea when thornton screws up as he does continuously throughout the movie and paxton has do some major coveringup read homicide instead of quick murder and immeadiate handswashing raimi shows lengthy painful shot from lowangle onto paxtons face as he tries sift through his emotions and reach conclusion there is similar shot afterwards of paxton watching
