the murder he is committing and taking in all the horror is also wonderfully effective but the previous shot is even better more morally complex and more gutwrenching in short probably the best piece of direction raimis ever done demonstrating once again that sometimes the simplest way do something yields the best results for further proof watch persona sex scene and witness what may be the best scene ingmar bergmans ever done but the hardly stops here it follows completely through and rarely loses sight of its characters humanity and the depletion thereof yet it also moves from step step in such graceful method that we never feel like the is merely stamping out the plot points of the story when the time comes for paxton start becoming selfish and thus diabolical aid from his pregnant wife played bridget fonda pal raimi he does and soon the horror of the situation is escalating tragic heights there is at least two grand shootouts and at least one of them may be one of the greatest shootouts in cinema history and when they arrive they do not come masochistic delight but cringeinducing horror during the one was actually sinking into my chair the mantra they cannot do this can they streeming through my head in fact this is getting many comparisons the coens superior but forget about it fargo has many similar moments of manic insanity attributed the major amount of subtlety and restraint the directors direct what in other hands would be overthetop distractedness imagine suppose robert rodriguez directing this then again after seeing the evil dead films would hardly assume raimi would be able pull something like this off although there are moments of the are easily dubbed raimi moments rifleshot notwithstanding instead raimi directs maturity and gentle touch easily letting the story and characters coexist while still letting some of the more traditional raimi elements come out like some offbeat comic touches most particularly billy bob thorntons character jacob is brilliant creation his dimwittedness is often hilarious for most of the every line he uttered was greeted howling laughter but there is authenticity the performance that strangely enough makes sure that we are not totally laughing at him the chuckles he gets are not necessarily ones of fullcondescension because thornton is so damn real jacobs multidimensional character and while being stupid we see that as not so much flaw but strength his character his simplicity is endearing and many of the acts he commits are out of strong inner strength and belief system primarily towards the middle where his bud and coconspirator begins make some heavy waves concerning the money the final third of the spends much time him and many of the touches upon his character not only thornton but also screenwriter scott smith adapting his own book the way are just great particularly admired back story about an old high school girlfriend told thornton such sincerity and acception that the cruel story is reversed nearsweetness and further strength of his saddened character thornton is absolutely brilliant in this performance far the best performance he is ever given and further proof that he is the best character actor in contemporary cinema if you do not believe me go back and watch his wonderful performance in primary colors performance that would have been nominated for an oscar if this had not been in the same year because he is easily able slip into character and make him completely and utterly believable he brings so much weight the that as it is most character actors it is difficult picturing anyone else in the role the rest of the cast is great too from paxtons declining working man chelcie ross amiable town sheriff even fonda shows off her talents nicely and if had any complaints about the it is that the plot is almost too simplistic and that at times it seems too much like an exercise like cruel test on humanity that still pays attention the humanity involved and the occasional narration is as it usually is annoying narration should be used extreme caution especially when you are trying set things up andor express emotions did not raimi watch the first murder scene and the thing that can most usually go wrong movie the ending is basically amiss will not reveal it but it is way too cruel and too much of an outsider setup as if the appearance of plane was not already too much of that anyway for that deals so much and so intimately the humanity of the characters involved this is the wrong ending imagine charactercontrolled ending otherwise it is like if in crime and punishment if the police had caught him instead of him breaking down and confessing not that am at all comparing simple plan dostoevsky the ending does work despite my protestations but me there was something incessantly nagging and unsatisfying about it but if you had no qualms and were happy as clam it then just ignore me and go about your day but despite my mere claims make no mistake that was completely and utterly edge of my seat throughout and even sometimes curdling up the situations that occured not because of any kind of gore factor is thankfully for this very minimal but because the places its characters in situations and gives them such painful things overcome that have frankly not seen much like it in quite awhile at least not since the previous worthy hitchcockian masterpiece

some of my friends who went live in usa complain about one thing that country is very different from the one depicted in movies that is especially true for those who end up somewhere in that unexplored land between los angeles and new york where they find their big surprise that the majority of people vote republican go church every sunday and usually do not tolerate liberal attitudes that are taken for granted in an average american such rude awakening however can happen in another direction conservative people are sometimes forced discover unpleasant truths about world they live in something like that happens jake van dorn george scott successful grand rapids businessman who shares strong calvinist convictions the rest of his community one day his daughter kristen ilah davis disappears from calvinist youth convention in california van dorn is worried because he does not believe that his daughter would run from home however the truth delivered private investigator andy mast peter boyle is even harder kristen is spotted in cheap pornographic infuriated van dorn is unsatisfied the way masts investigation is going so he goes los angeles search for kristen himself unfortunately he lacks experience and the quest that brought him the utter depths of sex underworld is fruitless things change when he devises cunning plan and while doing it stumbles on sympathetic prostitute and part time porno actress nicky season hubley almost two decades after its release hardcore is mostly forgotten critics and scholars it is real shame because very few movies in todays would dare tackle controversial issues that writer and director paul schrader explored in his second directorial attempt in late it was totally different situation films were expected have mature serious themes for the mature audience for schrader this was nice opportunity expand the subplot of his previous work taxi driver one that deals the great generational divide that tormented the american society in on one side we have an old america that sticks the puritan ideals of hard work and strict morals that made that country great but that america is obviously unable cope the new challenges brought the social turmoil in and instead of facing them prefers live in rural conservative cocoons the new america on the other hand fares no better ideals of the socalled sexual revolution same as all other revolutions of the swinging sixties degraded into exploitation and depravity instead of being liberated baby boomers are stuck their own inability cope the newly discovered freedoms schrader very cleverly brings the idea that those two americas actually are not so far away nice example is brilliant scene in van dorn already described as an authoritarian and paternalistic capitalist meets sleazy porno producer the latter one also turns out be authoritarian paternalistic and very dedicated this job the difference between the two is simply in the line of work many contemporary critics actually accused schrader of promoting conservative agenda on the surface it may look that way audience is forced sympathise van dorn and his quest in the first scenes he is portrayed as nice family man who actually does not deserve experience parents worst nightmare the scene in the porno cinema that reveals kristens fate is extremely cruel pain and humiliation brought oscarwinning actor george scott is of such intensity that the audience feels sorry for him and simply must support his agenda van dorn is perhaps flawed and the subtle hints lead the unflattering truth at the end but the viewers simply know that his cause is just and that prodigal daughter must be better off her loving father than the sleazy pornographers that only want exploit her body on the other hand schrader who grew up in an environment very much like van dorns his own parents would not allow him watch movies until he was knows better and tries bring another side of coin even the people connected sex underworld can show redeeming qualities like nicky who actually tries improve her life and sleazy detective who develops something like conscience at the end unfortunately schrader fails erase the impact of the shocking scene at the beginning and his attempt reconcile the opposing sides of america seems lost in somewhat clich finale the script is slightly flawed and schrader as director does not show too much originality his style seems too influenced techniques that scorsese used in taxi driver apart from the scenes in grand rapids those two films even look alike but the content might be more than interesting for todays viewer especially those inspired the current revival until boogie nights no mainstream movie ever dared explore the phenomenon of pornography in hardcore on the other hand might serve as precious document because it depicts sex industry in the period often regarded as the golden age connoisseurs before the advent of video when many of the porno filmmakers could afford think of themselves as artists the view of such age and the industry is very unflattering though but for the whose main character takes time explain calvinist doctrines the audience that should not be too surprising anyway despite some flaws hardcore remains very interesting and powerful piece of cinema

vampire lore and legend has always been popular fantasy element substantiated not only the sheer number of movies about the subject but also the proliferation of cults and sects of adherents and unlike any of the more outlandish myths the vampire holds some realworld probability one study claims bloodsuckers exist worldwide and places in los angeles but lest the nasties be mistaken for simple comic book bad guys john carpenter would like remind us that they are and always have been truly frightening element of the thriller genre and remind us he does in his latest vampires there was some question as halloween weekend approached of how well vampires would do in comparison new line cinemas immensely successful blade released in august the two films take noticeably different stands on the vampire issue and do not even agree on some basic points of the slaying method for instance blades main weapons are silver and garlic whereas main character jack crows technique is wooden stake the heart blade also gives more of face the vampire civilization while carpenter would like us remain in the dark about how the pasties operate both have their advantages and here carpenters style lends itself darker breed of suspense rather than the action movie that blade director stephen norrington delievered when it is all said and done though the vampires still kill and die bloody flourish the level for gore is indeed set maximum this time our hero is vaticansponsored slayer jack crow james woods he is cynical battleworn veteran and the best of his bunch he and his team are responsible for cleaning out the american southwest and after exterminating nest one night they run up against supervampire termed master named valek thomas ian griffith valek kills all of jacks team except for his partner tony montoya daniel baldwin and as the two regroup they learn that valek is the original vampire now over six hundred years old apparently valek and his minions have been sweeping the southwest for decades in search of cross that will enable them walk in the daytime so the aid of priest named adam tim guinee and bitten hooker sheryl lee as bait they track valek down for the final confrontation the script for vampires written don jakoby and based on the john steakley novel is perhaps the wittiest piece of screenplay see production all year crow in particular is fun source of oneliners and woods does every one of them perfect stoicism baldwin lee and guinee are all fine supports adding the character pool but the other true highlight of the movie is thomas ian griffiths bad guy griffiths intense expression is perfect for the role and the only downside is that he is got talk sometime luckily he is got few lines and manages pull off rather thrilling performance all said fans will surely be impressed this picture and those who found apt pupil bit limp will be excited this one certainly worthwhile visit the theaters

if the current trends of filmmaking continue we are probably five or six years away from the moment when the would become the next golden age of movie nostalgia although some products already use the last decade as background for their stories mostly in ironic way like grosse pointe blank and romy michelles high school reunion some time should pass before the good memories of that era overcome the bad ones until that happens would be remembered as the decade of greed when the revolutionary ideals of turned into its cruel materialistic opposite and the money became the only thing that matters contemporary movies are good in illustrating what was bad for the people who had live in those times one of such movies one that probably brings the essence of the screen is william friedkins live and die in a the money is not just the symbolic motive in the it is the major elements of the plot rick masters willem dafoe is an exconvict who used his artistic abilities in order become one of the best counterfeiters in a being too intelligent fall into police traps and ruthless enough eliminate anybody or anything that could jeopardise his career masters managed elude law for years and became well connected richard chance william petersen is secret service agent adrenaline junkie whose life gets new meaning after his partner got killed masters however his plans of bringing the counterfeiter down meet one obstacle after another finally he sets up final sting but his superiors deny him the necessary money being frustrated and against the reluctance of his new partner john vukovich bill pankow he decides get the money robbing underworld courier their plan backfires almost tragic consequences when their target turns out be undercover fbi agent but chance decides carry out his scheme anyway like french connection one of his previous masterpieces this friedkins movie was inspired real life gerrald petievich author of the novel that later served as basis for his screenplay spent many years working as secret service agent that turned be useful for the portrayal of that law enforcement agency not much utilised secret service millieu was also cleverly used in order bring the viewer into the decade of greed the beginning scene where the movies hero works as part of presidential security detail is nice opportunity hear reagans speech that could illustrate the political and economical notions of those times ultramaterialistic and egotistical view of the world is shared almost any character in the movie willem dafoe brilliantly portrays dangerous and intelligent psychopath whose ruthlessness and lack of any moral fibber does not seem like affliction in the reagan years on the contrary those qualities actually makes masters socially acceptable compared him and all the other side characters that want their piece of the action two heroes on the side of law seem like losers instead of being classical good guy secret service agent richard chance portrayed william petersen in his most impressive role so far is nothing more than lunatic whose adrenaline addiction and madness work against his better judgement his sidekick who should serve as those better judgement is weakling and sentimental fool that gets suckered in the end in such surroundings of moral decay the not so happy yet surprising ending does not seem out of line although the very last shot leaves too much questions unanswered the dark atmosphere of a city of glamour and moral decay is nicely captured william friedkins directing skills the tight and realistic scripts memorable characters portrayed such capable actors like john turturro dean stockwell debra feuer darlanne fleugel and steve james gave opportunity for friedkin use another gimmick that made him famous in his masterpiece great car chase that scene alone lot of realism thrills and surprise twists is worth seeing the rest of the the soundtrack provided now almost forgotten band wang chung is also one of the more memorable of that decade in every case live and die in a is one of the rare movies in actually tries tell some unflattering truths about the world and succeeds in it

jeanluc picard patrick stewart and the rest of the crew of the s enterprise are back for their third outing in the ninth based on the series star trek gone are kirk spock and mccoy and in their wake in the very able and very talented cast from star trek the next generation as usual crisis is brewing and it is up the crew of the enterprise make the galaxy safe again this time out the united federation of planets and an alien race led murray abraham are trying move some colonists off planet against the colonists will it turns out that this planet is the fountain of youth and the federation and their alien buddies feel that is should be used for the good of everyone and not just few hundred colonists of course picard feels that this sort of treachery is wrong so he disobeys direct orders and vows help protect the colonists insurrection is lighter movie than the last two star trek films the focuses on the lofty question of whether the rights of society as whole outweighs the rights of small group in this respect it gets back the roots of star trek disguising social commentary as science fiction it does not do bad job other than it tries inject too much humor into the story line many of the jokes are your typical inside star trekfanonly jokes while many of the others just fall flat the other criticism that had the story was that it ignores common sense there are only few hundred people on this whole planet why do they have be moved the explanation is that the planet has be bombarded deadly radiation so that this fountain of youth effect will be strong enough help heal murray abrahams aliens who number only couple of dozen so the basic story line is bad enough in that we have few hundred being booted out for few billion at least that is plausible but in reality we have few hundred being moved for the benefits of few dozen makes no sense whatsoever the other little hiccup in logic is the inclusion of worf michael dorn the trusty klingon worf was on star trek the next generation so they want include him in the films no problem so far worf is now character of star trek deep space nine so the writers have find way have him show up in the last star trek movie first contact the included worf in credible fashion in this one the writers are so lazy that the completely gloss over why he is even in the movie what little explanation they do give is so small that you would have missed it if you were not hanging on every word on the screen my minor problems the movie aside star trek insurrection does have an overwhelming number of good points as compared its bad ones while many of the jokes do miss the mark many are pretty good even for nontrekkies the special effects are among the best for the star trek series the action is plentiful and well done this is very goodlooking movie it should come as no surprise anyone who ever watched star trek the next generation that the acting is first rate it is very obvious that these actors have been working together for over decade they interact each other skill that few other ensemble casts can muster most star trek fans probably will not be disappointed this latest in the series if you have always hated star trek there is nothing here that is going change your mind star trek insurrection is not the best in the series but it is good enough dispel the long standing tradition of the odd numbered films in the series being far inferior the even numbered ones

the promotion for fear and loathing in las vegas has made the out be comedy and for about the first hour or so it seems like it might be one it is and the hippie movement has left behind quite few washouts among them journalist raoul duke johnny depp and his attorney dr gonzo benito del toro these two spend most of the in druginduced stupor having strange hallucinations trashing their hotel rooms and either annoying or scaring almost everyone that crosses their path duke is first assigned cover an outdoor desert motorcycle race in las vegas but gets lost in blur of drugs beer and flying dust and ends up wandering around no clue who won he leaves vegas briefly before he is sent back in what can only be described as strangely appropriate twist of fate cover drug enforcement conference fear and loathing has been misinterpreted some as glorifying the use of drugs it does not even in the beginningwhile the pairs antics are sometimes amusing and relatively harmless at first the humor here is still fairly dark director terry gilliam views them rather satirical eye and even when we are laughing we are laughing at them rather than them they spend most of their time paranoid angry or just plain befuddled is probably an understandable reaction seeing the entire room suddenly fill up giant reptiles the black comedy may be entertaining watch onscreen but it is probably not something most other audience members would want experience firsthand all this aside was starting grow bit restless as the drew near its onehour mark thinking myself that wanted something more out of this than just an offkilter satire of drug culture thankfully the script delivers it before too long as duke in rare moment of lucidity stops recall how he was once an enthusiastic hippie riding the wave of something that seemed special and important now it is six years later and the wave has finally broken as he puts it materialistic culture is still alive and well and for most of this right in his face in las vegas the american dream of duke occasionally speaks is still just as shallow and phony as ever the social protesters have lost and the more questionable aspects of the movement have turned ugly and left casualties such as duke drift in sea of drugs and disillusionment in many ways fear and loathing is gilliams most realitybased all of his others the exception of the fisher king have made use of some sort of fantasy or sciencefiction plot elements yet it is his offthewall masterpiece brazil this bears the most visual resemblance the protagonist of brazil found himself alternately surrounded plastic soulless society and the constant chaos of totalitarian police inspections and terrorist attacks and similarly dukes world is composed of the artificial empty glam of las vegas and the bizarre anarchy of his drug hallucinations unlike the protagonist of brazil however duke is not particularly admirable figure and neither is gonzo during the latter half of the their trips turn nastier and the consequences worse eventually building up an incident an diner in gonzo crudely frightens and humiliates waitress while duke though he does not seem approve does not do anything stop it either the time this scene takes place they do not seem like hippies or peaceniks or protesters or anything of the sort any more they just seem like couple of stoned jerks in diner duke seems realize at some level that he is become something he does not like but he is either too apathetic or too defeated do anything change this has taken critical drubbing from many who view it as an essentially pointless that simply throws one trip scene after another at the audience while gilliam may have overdone it in few places think he and his cowriters deserve more credit than that there is plenty of substance here particularly in the second half its observations about the broken and defeated rebels from the and the objects of their rebellion just are not usually very pleasant unlike say brazil or the fisher king both of feature character who dares let himself dream in repressive environment fear and loathing in las vegas shows us someone who is given up on his dreams and resorts the quick fix of drugs in its own psychedelic whackedout way it is sad and regretful but think it is also bit of kick in the pants challenge find an alternative between chemicallyinduced withdrawal and the equally addictive drug of vegasstyle materialism indeed duke himself admits at one point that he is never learned accept that you can get higher without drugs than them am not sure if he is any closer accepting it the end or not but suspect the audience will get the idea

james cmaerons breakthrough feature was the first of his films showcase his obsession technology and more specfically technology run amok for those of you who do not know the plot in machines have engineered nuclear for the expressed purpose of wiping out the human race human survivors are systematically hunted down and destroyed however some humans are fighting back led the heroic john connor stop connor the machines send terminator arnold schwarzenegger back murder connors mother sara linda hamilton and thus prevent connor from ever being born in response the humans send protector kyle reese played michael biehn images of machines and of humans reliance on machines dominate the even though the characters know that the benign oil drillers of will become the ruthless hunter killers of humans continue use the machines in the climax of star wars luke relies on the force alonehis own spiritual powerto destroy the death star in the terminator however sara must use another machinea giant hydraulic pressto vanquish her enemy cameron seems be implying that this reliance on technology is inescapableand he is not happy about it unabated technological growth brings about the terminators other obsession the apocalypse we have plenty of imagery regarding armageddon thousands of human skulls line the streets of future la children watch the flames in burning television when the terminator arrives in an almost biblical lightning storm precedes him even though the future is not set there is no doubt about where the world is headed at the end of the movie the machines will rise and the humans will have struggle for their very existence all sara can do is await it cameron does not wimp out like he does in terminator the end of the world is the human races own fault too after all it is the humans that created in the evil machines in the first place back in when the cold war was still in full effect the must have been seen as very apt metaphor for nuclear war another obsession of camerons these days one can read criticism of machinelike behavior in humans true humanizing touches are put into paul winfields and lance henriksens detective characters but the terminator is also able move through the city undetected cameron also draw parallels between the mechanical efficiency between the terminator and reese when they first arrive in la from technical standpoint the terminator is very well done arnold schwarzenegger is perfect antagonistunstoppable merciless obdurate we are not meant empathize this ultimate killing machine as we are in some of schwarzeneggers later works eg commando but fear him cameron and hurds script basically depicts one hour and fortyfive minute chase taking few moments here and there explain time travel and develop the romantic subplot while we do see the hackneyed dialogue cameron is now so well known for there is also considerable suspense especially for the first time viewer who may be unsure of kyle reeses intentions cameron directs the at rapid kinetic pace either the camera is moving or something within the frame is movingusually both occurs the violence is not particularly graphic temple of dooms heartpull scene outgrosses the terminators but it is brutally staged making it that much more effective for low budget the terminators special effects and art direction especially in la are remarkably well done special mention should be made of the stop motion effects work at the end of the depicting the terminator endoskeleton it is some of the best stop motion have ever seen one thing that does not hold up after all the years however is linda hamiltons hairdo

it might surprise some know that joel and ethan coen who have brought such unabated lunacy our movie screens as raising arizona and the hudsucker proxy made their feature debut blood simple grim and often gruesome tale of revenge murder and literally fatal misconceptions in rural texas it bears some resemblance storywise the coens recent fargo but even the darkly satirical humor and the enjoyably quirky characterizations that characterized that are scarce here blood simple is pretty much cold and brutal from beginning end the premise of blood simple is really just slight variation on the standard lovetrianglerevenge scheme sleazy bar owner julian marty dan hedaya hires shifty private detective emmet walsh kill his wife abby frances mcdormand and her illicit lover ray john getz things start go haywire when walsh decides instead fake the murder photographic trickery but upon collecting the money becomes uncertain as whether or not marty is capable of keeping his mouth shut about the scheme reveal any more details of the story would be give away too much but what ensues is series of bloody and do mean bloody confrontations each triggered one or more characters misunderstanding what is actually happening every act of violence or deception in this makes sense when seen through the perpetrators eyes but we the audience are made privy the big picture and thus can recognize that each misdeed is somehow either unnecessary or directed at the wrong person this aspect of the story along the intense atmosphere of repulsion and brutality one gets the sense that if guns and in one case shovels were not available some of these characters would claw each other death are the most effective components of the the coens might have done well title the fear and loathing in texas some have labeled blood simple as modernday noir but while am not an expert on either genre it seems more like horror movie than anything else the coens seem much more interested in the plot twists and the atmosphere of confusion and paranoia than they do in the characters and the final sequence is nothing more than showdown between the one relatively innocent character and the only one of the murderers left alive that said blood simple is very good horror movie the fear and suspense here are genuine the coens also add plenty of quirky touches that nudge the weirdness meter upwards such as when character enters an empty room and accidentally steps on gun discharging it as it skitters across the floor or when murder attempt unfolds in way such that abby mistakes her attacker for another character who has in fact been killed earlier in the that said blood simple is not exactly flawless for one thing the motivations for the killings are still little thin at times can understand that the characters had tracks cover or at least thought they did but found it little hard accept that all of them would so quickly resort murder and although they at least didn have anyone get hacked death knife the coens also are not quite immune horror cliches they indulge in prolonged deadguyseemstohavecomebacktolifebutthenwefindoutit isonlyadream scene that had me rolling my eyes the also ends so quickly after the final confrontation that found myself wondering if they had simply run out of blood simple is not quite the masterpiece of neonoir that many seem think it is but it is decent movie and it showcases the coens ability handle suspense and violence in visceral but nonexploitative manner would firmly recommend it all coenheads as well as anyone looking for something original in thriller

kirk douglas is one of those rare american actors who can say more simple glance than most can say pages of dialogue all he has do is look at someone raised eyebrow and you instantly know what he is thinking detective story features one of kirk douglass finest performances he stars as new york detective that has his whole world fall apart in one night the is based on play and this is quite evident as most of the movie takes place in the oneroom flat that the detectives work in the opens the douglas character getting ready go home his wife but through series of events he never quite makes it there the bulk of the movie follows the case of man named schneider surgeon who routinely performs abortions high fatality rate however this schneider character has connection in the past of douglass wife connection douglas himself is not aware of many secrets are revealed in the last half hour of this secrets would not dream of giving away name like detective story one would assume the would resemble an episode of nypd blue but it does not quite work out that way however we do see douglas at work on few other cases throughout the running time lee grant virtually unrecognizable plays meek jewish woman arrested for shoplifting her scenes bendix another detective provide the movie few laughs the performances all around are fantastic douglas may be the leader of this ensemble but he is not the center of attention all the time we get catch glimpse into other cases and other detectives working on those cases brings me back douglas he has really emotional scene towards the end of the picture that really makes you feel for him we can see that this is man who has spent his whole life trying eliminate crime but has finally realized that what he is really done is gotten back at his criminal father how he handles coming terms this is something really worth seeing kirk douglas is the kind of actor we do not seem see much of these days he is tough guy but the human elements are never hidden too deeply underneath that gruff exterior

man is not man without eight taels of gold starring sammo hung sylvia chang directed mabel cheung written cheung and alex law cinematography bill wong eight taels of gold begins as fish out of water story and at some point becomes love story involving two people whose past choices prevent the fruition of their love neither aspect of the movie is entirely successful but both are good enough and along the way there is one perfect scene is one more than you find in most films slim played portly sammo hung better known as star and director of hong kong action movies is chinese immigrant who drives yellow cab in new york when the movie opens we see him shouting obscenities at another taxi driver he does not seem particularly out of place in fact he is about return visit his home in rural china for the first time in sixteen years spending most of his life savings in the process and it is there that he will become the proverbial fish out of water as he realizes that you can never go home he brings him some statue of liberty cigarette lighters cheap sunglasses and lobsters have be large prove they are american the tokens of his success he also wears gold chain and gold watch because without eight taels of gold man is not man my dictionary tells me that taels are unit of weight used in the far east and assume the phrase is chinese proverb he loses most of this stuffexcept the goldwhen his van crashes into river and he has hitch ride so speak on raft along the river runs past his parents village when he arrives unannounced he almost induces cardiac arrest in his father all of this has the makings of routine comedy and the movie has its amusing moments as when the villagers take turns giving slim gifts during celebration of his homecoming and they all give him birds so evenings end he is surrounded turkeys ducks geese and other sundry fowl but eight taels is not comedyit is sad sweet story about the choices people make and how they are sometimes irreparable director mabel cheung an autumns tale the soong sisters sees clearly what it is like have lived half of your life in one country and half in country on the other side of the worldwhat it is like no longer have place call home slim does not belong in china nor does he belong in america where he can barely speak the language seeing water buffalo in the fields and rafts poled down the river and fireworks exploding gloriously in the sky over small village we come know the world slim left behind and it seems as if he too is knowing it for the first time and wishes it felt more like home the condition of the expatriate is eloquently portrayed being one was sympathetic on his way his parents village slim hooks up jenny sylvia chang whom he knew when she was girl nicknamed oddsandends is what he continues call her although she is now mature professional attractive woman be married in the spring an americanchinese man slim and oddsandends fall for each other that is predictable the manner in their non romance is played out is not the emotions involved are adult and complex and the avoids cheap solutions their dilemma it is typical for instance that the fianc in this sort of plot be colossal jerk because it makes it easier empathize the unrequited lover but here the fianc is decent ordinary guy and although slim would like feel anger he cannot the fianc has done nothing wrong the situation is the result of bad luck or bad decisions take your pick eight taels has its share of flaws the early sequences in america and on the plane china are especially weak but it compensates insight when oddsandends tells slim that her future husband wants move san francisco she notes resignedly it is all the same wherever we go we will be in chinatown and her straightforward statement expresses much there is insight too in the understanding of the consequences of slim and oddsandends decisions he move america she marry chineseamerican both their choices were perhaps born of impatience perhaps of sense that the grass is always greenerand it turns out that both choices were wrong but they cannot undo them they must live what they have done such is life the movie is tender toward these people but it offers no false comforts everything that is right and true about eight taels comes together in one great scene is the culmination of the love story slim and oddsandends sit in secluded spot and talk hesitantly the muted poppop of fireworks exploding in the night behind them and it seems the conversation will lead kiss the exchange that follows and what slim then does is poignant and perfect clarity and understatement we see two peoples lives their heartbreaks and virtues summed up in single moment yes the is flawed but moments like that justify most of its inadequacies

the summer movie season is always the biggest and brightest season for movies throughout the year we are introduced blockbuster hits that are usually trashed critics loved the people and make tons of money at the box office this year the tradition continues an update on the universal classic the mummy have always been sucker for this kind of monster movies and always seem be the only critic who really likes them that tradition continues as well this fun special effects extravaganza in the mummy the up and coming brendan fraser stars as the adventurous explorer rick oconnell he teams up curious clumsy librarian named evelyn played rachel weisz find the mysterious city of the dead hamunaptra evelyn loves egypt and would truly like visit the city that people call fable rick has claimed he has been hamunaptra during battle and that is why she chose him lead her there also tagging along on the journey the city of the dead is evelyns brother jonathan played john hannah sliding doors now in hamunaptra the three uncover the book of the dead the curious evelyn unlocks the book reads from it and now the body of the ancient egyptian imhotep arnold vosloo becomes alive and is out kill the ones who opened and read from the book along imhotep arising from the dead the ten curses of egypt become in full effect launching unbelievable forces against the three and another group who set out find hamunaptra not only is imhotep furious those who awoke him he is also out restore the life of his girlfriend that lost her life long ago in ancient egypt do not expect huge things out of the mummy but just expect have good time this movie is extremely campy and plays out like an old horror beefed up special effects may turn off some viewers on the other hand this type of is one of my favorites but that is up you decide there is one thing that definitely not campy or corny about the mummy though the state of the art special effects take you into completely different world we are dazzled faces rising out of the desert swarms of beetles and locusts and even creatures crawling under humans skin these may have been in other movies before but not like in the mummy as of now the mummy holds the title for best special effects of this year but all this could change when star wars episode the phantom menace is released into theaters across the country in the past brendan fraser has played mainly comedic roles when playing george in disneys george of the jungle he was mainly not known anyone would say that gods and monsters is the that gave him name and now the mummy will give him name amongst teens in the mummy fraser gets play an action hero and liked him in this sort of role over the comedic role as in the films blast from the past and george of the jungle although brendan fraser is great rachel weisz gives the best performance among the cast weisz really reminded me of character from an old horror the way she acts looked and talked all reminded me of someone not from this time evelyn is probably the only character that was likable considering that the other characters like john hannahs did not get much personal attention in many films when different genres are mixed the mixing usually works and like it for the most part in the mummy though not all of the mixing works there are some scenes that have lot of potential horror some potential comedy some potential drama and some potential pure action but the tries mix them together too often for the mixing work the mummy could have gotten an rating from me if it had gone purely one of these did not mind the corny oneliners here and there during action sequences but it certainly could have done without them the cinematography is amazing in the mummy particularly in one scene depicting ancient egypt we are taken into very fun portrayal of egypt mummies and the treasures left behind the ancient egyptians the costume design in the is also up there the great cinematography from ancient egyptians outfits original troops outfits the costumes are always top notch the bottom line the mummy the summer is off its usually great start

jacques tatis classic les vacances de hulot also known as mr hulots vacation in english ought be the textbook on how do non dialogue comedy in the characters hardly ever speak each other directly and the operates on the paper thin premise that monsieur hulot played tati himself is awkward and clumsy and generally manages annoy the other guests at the beach resort hotel where he is taking weeks vacation yet the had me beside myself laughing more consistently than any in recent memory part of the reason the works so well is the clever setup for the various gags slapstick has often been regarded as an unsophisticated and even crude form of comedy but think part of the reason for this is that it often seems forced you can only see movie characters start running after something and then crash facefirst into pole so many times before you start wonder what all these poles are doing there in the first place or why these people do not watch where they are going in les vacances de hulot the gags build upon each other and often start out relatively lowkey in one sequence for example hulot is painting the side of his small row boat on the beach when while his back is turned the paint can gets caught up in the oncoming waves washes away then comes back up on the other side of the boat while crossing over get the can hulot steps in the boat and unknowingly cracks it when he actually takes the boat out into the water it breaks in half but the two halves flip up against each other trapping him inside as the bystanders mistake it for shark fin and panic on the beach ensues tati does not waste single opportunity for humor scenes that might have yielded one joke in most comedies are good for at least four or five in this it has been said that comedy relies on frustrating the audiences expectations and les vacances de hulot succeeds brilliantly in that area as well tati accomplishes this largely through sort of deadpan understatement when hulot goes into separate room during dinner and starts playing record at defeaningly loud volume no fights or shouting matches ensue instead the waiter calmly walks in and shuts off the power in the room disconnecting the record player and leaving puzzled hulot sitting in the dark tati also uses running gags this effect allowing them keep running far longer than most comedy directors would more often than not we can see them coming and think oh he is not going do that again but lo and behold he does for example there is recurring joke in hulots noisy sputtering car engine wakes everyone in the middle of the night as an exterior shot reveals the hotels lights coming on one one then this image turns up again in the finale will not give away other than say that involves lot more noise in the middle of the night than car engine could ever produce the ending is one of two elements that really make this fourstar as opposed merely an aboveaverage clever comedy as much as was laughing during this was thinking myself occasionally that tati had top himself at the end really make this work as complete viewing experience suffice it say that he did the other important aspect is that the never seems disdainful of its characters it easily could have turned the tables on hulot and had the other guests exact some kind of revenge on him alternatively it could have portrayed the others as humorless curmudgeons instead tati seems regard his characters cheerful amusement more than anything else and invites the audience like them however strange or irritating they might seem les vacances de hulot is not subtitled but the dialogue is sparse and for the most part not terribly essential the flow of events anyone taste for this kind of absurd humor ought make this their next rental from the video store note les vacances de hulot was not rated the mpaa it would at most receive pg rating

i had lost all faith in pg movies that are intended for teenagers and adults the last dozen or so that have seen have all felt incomplete as if the most crucial scene was deleted in order obtain more lucrative rating however after seeing the creative frequency last week and now the exciting my bias is beginning go away both films are as innocuous for younger viewers as they are intellectual for older viewers even better did not think either one of these films would be any good from first instincts everyone loves surprises looked like another action using an actual war as an excuse shoot torpedoes and bullets this may be true but the action is so extraordinary that it is clear directorcowriter jonathan mostow completed his ultimate goal blow the audiences socks off set during the early stages of world war when the united states struggled break the codes of the technologically advanced german uboats follows small crew of american men who swipe the typewriter necessary solve the enigma from an enemy ship there is only one problem the american ship they came from and hoped return has been shot down stranding the men on german submarine known as you guessed it it is now up the mostly young and inexperienced sailors led an interim captain named tyler matthew mcconaughey return the typewriter america without getting sunk far superior german ships the starts off very slowly somewhat weak opening action sequence and another uneventful half an hour introduce several of the sailors most of whom die when the mission goes awry or just inexplicably disappear once the crew gets on the uboat the movie shifts another level and never leaves this high energy level until the ending credits roll down as soon as the action starts it does not stop and luckily because it is so exciting did not want it stop this is not movie for those wanting avoid loud noises from the wonderful heartpounding score the constant yelling of panicking men make sure you see this at theater surroundsound otherwise do not see it all the best parts of are when tyler is forced make impromptu decisions on how escape seemingly impossible situations throughout the movie several morals or characters are introduced make tylers job as stressful as possible germans gun down their own men tylers mentor captain dahlgren warns him that captain has be prepared sacrifice even the most beloved soldiers for victory another sailor erik palladino threatens mutiny all of these examples and several others increase the chaotic atmosphere and the importance of tylers every move they also make one of the most exhilarating movies have seen in while

the produced two brilliant science fiction films one was _gattaca_ the other was _the thirteenth floor_ just as _gattaca_ was overshadowed the mighty _titanic_ _the thirteenth floor_ was relegated obscurity _the matrix_ however _the thirteeth floor_ though it deals similar themes is much better movie than the frenetic childish and improbable _matrix_ cutting edge computer scientist hannon fuller played the charming armin muellerstahl is murdered his associate douglas hall craig bierko apparently framed and suspected the police enters into the simulated world they have created in order unravel the mystery along the way beautiful blonde gretchen mol more bodies and deepening mystery about simulated worlds complicate the picture _the thirteenth floor_ unfolds slowly and telegraphs its punches choosing elicit the more complex emotional response of empathy and anticipation rather than the cheap one of mere surprise the result is movie that is failure from two conventional points of view first its plot revelations can be foreseen if one has carefully followed its complex storyline second and more seriously it demands that its audience think and feel no wonder it fell through the cracks done in noir style as murder mystery this is relatively deep movie that functions on several levels many audiences will simply be bewildered it rather than engaged is shame because this movie amply repays little emotional and intellectual investment recommend second viewing simply get the flavor of the frequent ironic foreshadowing in the opening parts of the movie despite its philosophical challenges _the thirteenth floor_ derives its emotional force from the love story between jane fuller mol and douglas hall bierko as well as the close friendship between douglas hall and hannon fuller in that sense it is more akin _gattaca_ than _the matrix_ for all of its cute philosophical byplay is an adolescent movie no emotional depth whatsoever the moment when jane fuller confesses her love for douglas hall is at once satisfying wrenching and intellectually challenging in its final moments the even takes on itself when david janes husband who has come enjoy killing accuses her of being the sick one although there is victory for the leading characters this resolution suggests disturbing element of fantasy in jane and thus deepseated character flaw in fact hannon fullers activities in the simulated world the behavior of janes husband and the effects of entering the simulation on douglas hall all hint at similar issues those characters this is not of good people beset from without great evil the tragedy is not in their stars but in themselves the major actors all of whom are required play two or even three roles perform extremely well bierko who will be familiar as the psycho from _the long kiss goodnight_ is outstanding donofrio as whitney who plays pivotal role in support also turns in good performance the lovely gretchen mol whose elegance integrity and determination suggest bergman in _casablanca_ does wonderful job her voice however lacks the necessary weight at times this could be because she was given the worst lines in movie whose major weakness is the script some minor flaws hairline cracks in fine porcelain appear in places there are one or two instances of jerky editing the script takes the edge off the films climaxes the atmosphere becomes too claustrophobic at times yet there is clue there too one wonders if even after two decades _blade runner_ is still casting its long shadow over scifi films one can see group of suits in their suite waving their hands imperiously at directors like the emperor in _amadeus_ make it more like_blade runner_ you know dark and rainy _the thirteen floor_ is that rare exception among movies rich emotionally satisfying intelligent scifi movie and yet ultimately it proves the suits right for when good scifi is made where is the sf community turning out in droves see it if we do not support great sf who will

finding the courage face life fullon is difficult task summoning up the audacity fall in love is harder job if you are total jerk like melvin udall is the odds are even more against you melvin jack nicholson is successful romance author who is just the opposite of what you would expect someone in that profession be solitary man hidden away in his new york apartment no human interaction and not even hint of ever having been in passionate relationship he avoids the outside world as much as possible his obsessivecompulsive disorder rules his life as he uses several different bars of soap wash his hands and refuses step on crack on the sidewalk there is great scene when he has cross floor made of mosaic tiles _very_small_ mosaic tiles melvin has some great lines when his publishers receptionist asks him how he writes women so well in his books he responds think of men and take away reason and accountability do not get him wrong he is not merely misogynist setting his sights higher than that he is also homophobe racist antisemite xenophobe animalhater and intensely dislikes people who talk in metaphors when we first meet him he is busy dumping neighbors dog down the garbage chute he is an equal opportunity bigot he does venture outside his apartment every day eat breakfast at local cafe melvin is such grouchy curmudgeon that waitress carol connelly helen hunt is the only one willing wait on him and she is none too happy about it when carol does not show up for work melvins routine is shot and he is determined do something about it tracking down her address he shows up at her place begging her come back work so that he can eat breakfast the fact that she is poor single mother caring for chronically ill son does not appear phase him he wants his food much more upsetting is that his gay artist neighbor simon bishop greg kinnear is brutally attacked during robbery this does not upset melvin much do not worry you will be back on your knees in no time but when he is bullied into taking care of simons dog his life is turned topsyturvey melvin is sequestered because he is afraid of what is out there on the other side of his apartment door he has make sure it is ritualistically locked three times keep the world on its proper side when he brings the dog home he reluctantly grows fond of it talking it and taking it everywhere he goes this little crack in his emotional armor opens him up hiding behind his need for carol return work so she can serve him he pays for specialist treat her son he even develops friendship simon all three people are heavily damaged melvin has retreated from life in his apartment carol has devoted herself her son convinced that she has give up her life for him simon is estranged from his parents and his friends disappear when he is hospitalized and his money runs out more unlikely trio form relationships you would rarely see and in the midst of it all there are some wonderful moments melvin is hilarious in his grouchiness and touching as he attempts be nice you make me want be better man he tells her one of the best aspects is that even as he opens up he is still curmudgeon carol afraid that his monetary contribution the wellness of her son hides hidden agenda rushes over his apartment in the rain explain in no uncertain terms that she will never sleep him it only takes her second realize that she is delivering that statement while looking as if she just left wet tshirt contest there is hardly anything left say about jack nicholson do not remember ever seeing him in anything less than stellar performance and his overtheedge melvin is no disappointment nicholson may be the best actor working today hunt does commendable job matching nicholsons energy she is not afraid be seen as something less than babe and her portrayal of exhausted rundown carol struggling seemingly overwhelming obligations is topnotch their onscreen chemistry is bit odd each does wonderful job the character but together there is something little off it is minor problem they do work well together but that missing element is what prevents this from being fourstar director james brooks terms of endearment broadcast news has movie that is picking up awards the bucketsful nominees for all the top golden globes winners from the national board of review inevitable oscars and has winner on his hands as good as it gets is not exactly the quality that the title says but it is pretty darn close michael redman has written this column for over years and as soon as he finishes this one he is off an annual night celebration typically held in freezing weather during snowstorm this year it is in the sixties and raining that wacky el nino

bruce willis stars as malcolm an award winning child psychologist who discovers one night that one of his former patients is still suffering from inner demons the now grown man breaks into his apartment while he and his wife olivia williams from rushmore are celebrating his award shoots malcolm in the stomach then takes his own life almost nine months later malcolm discovers cole haley joel osment in brilliant performance another young man afflicted the same turmoil as his former patient he takes on the childs case in the hope of redeeming himself for botching up the previous one alienating his wife in the process he soon discovers that they boy can see and speak the dead and his life becomes forever turned upside down although the first hour is very slow the sixth sense turns out be very powerful and moving was expecting this be mercury rising but was astonished discover an extremely well plotted out little thriller an outstandingly satisfying ending you will find yourself mentally retracing your steps through the see if you actually saw what you think you did once the credits roll must give night shyamalan lot of credit for brilliantly written screenplay the cast should also be given lot of credit for making the movie as solid as it is lesser cast could have made this joke bruce willis portrays his character perfectly balancing his need help cole and his agony over his strained relationship his wife skillfully haley joel osment shines as nine year old cole showing patience in his character that few young actors these days can pull off toni collette looking markedly different from her pathetic character in muriels wedding gives strong performance as coles mother who is trying cope both her sons illness and the passing of her mother finally olivia williams deftly portrays woman having struggle husband who is not around and flirtations coworker that could lead begrudgingly accepted end it is shame that they show coles abilities in the trailer because the movie takes close forty minutes get around doing the same so we already know what is going on before most of the rest of the cast does in retrospect though the forty minute setup is essential enjoying the end of the so have fewer complaints now then did while was watching the am glad that the run of teenstyled horror films has passed and filmmakers are starting make more adult fare films like this the similarly themed stir of echoes and countless others be released later in the year should make for pretty entertaining close pg

i suppose an argument could be made that toy story is one of those films that did not need sequel beloved kids and their parents respected equally mainstream america and geekish movie buffs that first movie remains landmark of recent history the one that burst open the possibilities of computer animation and demonstrated through wild invention and giddy chutzpah just how complacent the disney animation machine had become in cranking out fluffy razzledazzle entertainment full of formula storytelling and banal songwriting if disney was embarrassed at being beaten at its own game toy story was smash hit of unexpected proportions and one that caught the merchandising end of the business unaware as demand for action figures far outstripped supply it did not show and as distributor and partowner of the property at least it had piece of the action toy story was greenlighted as directtovideo project disneys standard tactic for milking few more bucks out of hot franchises without expending the effort of developing proper feature as someone who does not believe sequels are necessarily bad thing granted they usually are bad thing but that is because they are made for the wrong reasons had wonder what in the world they were thinking fortunately disney claimed have been so knockedout early animation tests that they let pixar go fullspeed ahead theatrical sequel lucky thing too like the first movie this one is joy behold on the big screen and technically it improves on its predecessor on just about every level from business standpoint the end credits show that the new creations are copyrighted pixar while the previous films elements are shared between pixar and disney sign of the production houses new cachet in visually the main shortcoming of this fully computergenerated movie is that human figures are still rendered relatively poorly making them look little creepy fortunately that eerie unreality fits in perfectly the perspective of the movie where the secret world of toys is more immediate and arguably more attractive than the world of the humans who surround them as before the story is predicated on the premise that the toys scattered around the bedroom of little boy named andy and indeed all the toys scattered around the bedrooms of all little children come life in the childs absence while the toys scamper about and chatter endlessly among themselves the real joy of toys life is mean something its owner one of the subjects of this new is the sadness of toys that have been broken or abandoned left on shelf gather dust and another is the sort of emotional limbo inhabited toys that are mere prizes of covetous collectors most often those toys are packed away in dark spaces safe from sunlight and humidity and often they are not even removed from their packaging imagine what chip that would put on your shoulder and you will understand the attitudes of the collectors items that show up in this movie sheriff woody voiced noteperfect tom hanks the longtime favorite among andys toys who was challenged in the previous goround the arrival of flashynewthing action figure buzz lightyear tim allen suffers an injury early in the when andy tugs too hard on his arm and pulls seam apart revealing the stuffing inside this accident catalyzes some uneasieness among the toys who know too well that broken toy is often forgotten toy and forgotten toy is one that loses its reason for existence those anxieties are crystallized when andys mom tears through his living room collecting old toys for yard sale and there is an ironic twist the tale as woody winds up being stolen an avid toy collector who needs exactly that quaint cowboy figure complete set that he hopes sell japanese toy museum for sizable sum the rest of andys toys who owe him quite debt resolve rescue him that this manages turn box marked cents into symbol of doom or make its screed against the retention of collectible toys wrongheaded profiteers fuel for metaphysical dilemma is testament its skill at metaphor seamlessly translating the hopes and fears of our real world into that of the toys operating on this level of abstraction toy story tackles some mighty heavy issues without once preaching or veering into pretentiousness the worst can say is that randy newman seems have reserved his sappiest lyric in years for sarah mclachlan who stops the movie cold singing it at just about the halfway mark sometimes think toy story tries too hard there is somewhat less of the seatofthepants loopiness that energized the first allowing it surprise and excite on nearconstant basis and more philosophizing about toys collectors the nature of happiness and the meaning of life while that leads fewer bellylaughs it does make way for more elaborate humor and an uncommonly ambitious reflexivity that asks the toys consider their own status as commodities that move in and out of fashion just do not ask why andys favorite toy is based on tv series that was canceled in where else in mainstream movies do you get such an awesome moment as the one where buzz arrives at als toy barn find it stocked the gills his doppelgangers buzz lightyear action figures forget the selfcongratulatory science fiction of the matrix this is fundamental mindbender for buzz and the audience shares his humility and wonderment at the sight here as in the roughly concurrent scene where woody watches tapes of the howdy doodyish childrens tv show that originated his character we see our protagonists come facetoface god in sly ways then toy story can be read as about mortality metaphorical consideration of aging and death significantly the films very first sequence concludes grim shocker that had our openingnight crowd in nearuproar and toward the end when buzz and woody speculate on how long they have before andy grows up and discards his old toys one of them observes an alacrity both inspirational and heartbreaking that it will be fun while it lasts so toy story joins the tradition of childrens stories largely neglected of late that say something real about the inevitable joys and tragedies of existence what is really striking is that both toy story films and lesser degree pixars bugs life are kids movies wit and sophistication shame most of their ostensibly adult counterparts not mention whatever piece of totfriendly eyecandy is due from the disney dream factory any given summer it puts one in mind of the glory days of chuck jones and the old gang at warner bros animation am not sure lasseter and his pals at pixar will ever operate at quite that level of purely visual invention they love traditional narrative too much but boy it makes me wonder what they might come up next directed john lasseter colin brady ash brannon and lee unkrich written lasseter brannon peter docter andrew stanton rita hsaio doug chamberlain and chris webb cinematography sharon calahan starring voices tom hanks tim allen and joan cusack usa theatrical aspect ratio

tone alone cannot sustain but it can go long way if can find myself lost in the time and place of story it scores immediate style points when that tone is backed up an outstanding story and great acting the effect can be described best an adjective do not use lightly literary what is eating gilbert grape is such it is rich memorable and stunningly acted story of desire colliding responsibility staged in manner many viewers might find too prosaic but insinuated itself into my imagination its confidence gilbert grape johnny depp is young man living in rural endora iowa facing incredible responsibilities as the man of the house since his fathers suicide gilbert must support the family working at the local grocery store he also must watch over his mentally handicapped brother arnie leonardo dicaprio and help care for his extremely overweight mother darlene cates gilbert seems destined spend the rest of his life in the small town until the arrival in endora of becky juliette lewis free spirit passing through her grandmother when their truck breaks down as he spends time becky gilbert begins think about all the things he is missing slowly his resentment builds until he realizes that he can no longer live his entire life for other people director lasse hallstrom my life as dog and legendary cinematographer sven nykvist create magnificent visual backdrop for peter hedges screenplay based on his own novel endora is town on the edge of the world represented the giant foodmart tiny insular community where everyone knows everyone else the midwestern sunsets and sprawling fields are beautifully photographed and the atmosphere of the town is intensely real minor characters like crispin glover as the towns mortician are vividly realized and there are echoes of the last picture show in mary steenburgens desperately unhappy housewife one of the most perfectly realized scenes focuses on the grand opening of burger franchise attended the entire town and accompanied the offkey high school band not single note in the depiction of endora rang false the same can be said of the character of gilbert it is testimony the precision involved in his creation that he came together completely one perfectly placed line when becky responds gilberts description of his father knew someone like that once gilbert is man harboring an evergrowing bitterness about where he finds himself in life bitterness reveals itself in moments of surprising cruelty in one scene he allows local children look at his mother through their window displaying her like side show attraction his entire life seems be mocked arnies repeated chants of we are not going anywhere but instead of expressing his dissatisfaction he lets his anger simmer and it becomes clear that he is following in his fathers footsteps in this regard johnny depp expertly demonstrates the tension central gilbert playing everything below the surface but he never gives in onedimensional blankness or simply regurgitates his naif roles in benny joon and edward scissorhands depps performance is overshadowed however leonardo dicaprios astonishing oscarnominated supporting work as arnie he puts shame such big name actors as john malkovich and dustin hoffman whose mentally challenged characters never seemed completely real dicaprio is perfect the last twitch and squeal and anyone who has ever spent time mentally challenged kids will be hardpressed spot flaw darlene cates firsttime actor brings real pain her scenes as gilberts tortured mother and laura harrington and mary kate schellhardt are solid as gilberts sisters only juliette lewis does not quite click playing critical role her now familiar dopey drone and too little genuine spark gilbert grape does seem drift into its conclusion but it never lost me thanks lovingly created setting and marvelous cast this release proves well worth the wait

has batting average elmore leonard adaptations last years touch was illconceived and just plain odd but get shorty jackie brown and now out of sight all were highly entertaining movies steven soderburgh master of sex lies and videotape now adds crime his repertoire in this tale of bank robbery prison doublecrossing uncut diamonds and oh yeah true love george clooney is the protagonist risky choice after such duds as batman and robin and the peacemaker but for once did not want slap the taste out of his mouth he plays his role in out of sight as the suave cary granttype perfected in hitchcock movies the kind of guy whom crime is just profession like any other nowhere present is clooneys usual as notisexy sneer there is just enough leftover lightheartedness fit in the leonard style clooney is definitely perfect successor john travolta in get shorty clooney plays man who is robbed about banks without ever using gun in the opening scene he walks into one bank and robs it not only ease but charm of course he gets caught so it is not all good it is while doing time in florida prison that clooney learns of one rich inmates albert brooks in frightful bald wig collection of diamonds in detroit clooney and cohort ving rhames plan the score while protection artist and fight promoter don cheadle begins rival plans meanwhile there is jennifer lopez unintentionally funny in selena and intentionally funny in anaconda she is finally graduated worthy role as the s marshal who happens be driving up the jail on the night clooney escapes rhames is waiting give him ride in stolen car and lopez makes it threesome her hostage ass locked in trunk clooney he is covered in dirt and has gun her neck and it is little cramped in there but they manage make love connection anyway probably because it is movie the relationship between clooney and lopez is at the heart of the movie and one of the details that elevates it beyond your normal noirish crime story the leonard movies are more obsessed dialogue than crime and this is no exception although they are not really germane the plot lopezs relationship her father dennis farina of get shorty rhames relationship his christian sister you could call her sister christian and popin cameo michael keaton all lend extra class movie already full of it out of sight spans at least three years but has nonlinear structure focusing on the jailbreak brooks score and flashing back earlier times this is movie brain as smooth and calculated as the clooney and lopez characters themselves the entire cast does the material justice clooney and lopez coming into their own and rhames and cheadle cementing their positions as two of my favorites heres hoping future leonard adaptations continue carry the torch serving america for almost th of century

synopsis rumored be about true person the story of mulan has circulated in oral tradition for over thousand years and has inspired operas literature and even coinage since china has been issuing annual gold and silver coin sets commemorating famous historical figures the set includes mulan in the ballad of mulan written in the th or th century an imperial edict the khan emperor orders men from each family be drafted into the army defend china girls parents hear sighing and think that their daughter mulan the name means magnolia is dreaming of boys but actually she is dreading what horrors might befall her old infirm father if he were be drafted off battle mulan bravely runs away masquerading as boy serve in the army instead of her father ten thousand miles and twelve years of brutal war later the army finally returns in triumph the emperor wants reward mulans valor prestigious position in government but she declines accepts horse and returns home quietly don her true clothes mulans old army buddies visit and get the shock of their lives when they find out that mulan is actually woman the disney animated feature mulan is similar the ballad story only it adds modern character for comic relief mushu the dragon eddie murphy in disneys mulan when fierce army of invading huns threatens overrun peaceful china the emperor orders one man from each family be conscripted into the army old mr fa soontek oh is handicapped and has no son he has only his spirited young daughter mulan mingna wen fearing for her fathers life the courageous mulan secretly cuts her hair disguises herself as man and sneaks off serve in the army in her fathers stead meanwhile mushu the disgraced and demoted guardian dragon of the fa family has been reduced the size of squirrel and the status of incense burner his only duty is ring gong mushu hits upon plan redeem himself and regain his guardian status helping the disguised mulan become macho male warrior hero the help of mushu horse and lucky cricket can army recruit mulan save china and bring honor the fa family opinion east meets west know chef in santa fe that does this sort of magic he combines asian culinary influences from the west coast latin american from down south and european from the atlantic concoct new creations that hit just the right combination of flavors from their state of the art animation studio in orlando disney is hoping work the same kind of eastwest magic mulan mean what would you say if told you that new movie featured tang dynasty art donny osmond singing mingna wen acting and eddie murphy playing chinese dragon that makes pop references batman and the reverend jessie jackson yet this is the case in the disneys reinterpretation of the familiar chinese classic the end result is spectacular mulan is one of disneys best movies ever personally am also glad see the detestable american stereotype of the weakwilled subservient asian woman take beating mulan is portrayed as normal if spirited compassionate gal capable of taking the initiative mulan is more than just eastern graphics and faces combined westernized pop and disney kids of any age will like the family themes and will understand the good guys versus bad guys thing and adolescent and preteen girls can appreciate the romance factor while the boys admire the battles and adults can admire those malefemale nuances as well as the interplay between traditional notions of family honor and duty industrial age notions of romantic love gumption and questioning but even the tiniest details reveal quality the movies art supervisors spent three weeks in china researching the right look negative spaces positive detail period clothing and graphic designs typical of the time and place computers were used for crowd scenes of up people and special program called attila was used for spectacular sequence involving attacking huns on horseback and singers osmond and salonga are at the top of their game balance is crucial movie about chuckling lone dragon played eddie murphy might not be disneys cup of tea but if you use the character as comic sidekick balance determined and spirited heroine then pow the dream team the same token tale about girl in the army might be sober exercise in filial piety itself but toss the dragon in there and you have got enough wahoo individualism for light hearted disney romp it is rare that movie can seamlessly combine elements from both east and west old and young male and female into cohesive and entertaining whole but mulan hits the universal bullseye it is movie for any age creed gender or color

if you have ever perused my college comedy diary another year in the life of nerd never run out of cheap plugs you know did not get along my firstsemester roommate too well in fact during the
