threeweek period between thanksgiving and christmas break said total of four sentences him so when saw in the residence hall cable listings movie called roommates envisioned minutes of conflict between couple of bickering young adults trapped in x foot dorm room then saw that the star of roommates is peter falk scratch that idea but still say someone should the story of two college roommates whose relationship is less than ideal of course in my case it would be silent picture even without the college element still decided watch roommates because had absolutely nothing do unless you count studying for final exams and who does am glad did peter falks performance was actually what made the movie and this is guy never considered real actor more like someone who went around in trenchcoat solving prescripted mysteries falk pleasantly surprised me here permanently earning my respect so all you columbo fans who think live insult the guy can just falk off falk plays rocky yearold polish baker who raises his grandson after both the kids parents die the movie begins the moms death and the son moving in his grandparents after couple stops along the sons journey manhood roommates progresses the present day the grandson surgeon and rocky in condemned house he refuses leave the surgeon reluctantly offers the only possible solution rocky will have move into his place the basement of building rented group of chinese students communists the movie spans nine more years of rockys relationship his grandson and the trials posed when the grandson meets and falls in love withgaspa woman and starts spending all his time her so in his grandsons absence rocky turns his pursuits professional boxing achieveing the world heavyweight title in climactic fight apollo creed or am confusing movie plots again roommates has an almost epic feel it covering several generations of family one fiesty immigrant who refuses die death though knocks at the door of almost every other major character in the the movie roommates has about as many casualties as the first halloween the number cannot be counted on one hand unless of course you are the victim of some hideous genetic mutation and you can probably guess who says farewell planet earth at the end of the movie no not duran duran will not come out and say it instead will just sit here and hum eye of the tiger until each and every one of you figures it out roommates plays on all the major emotions it knows when make you laugh and when make you cry movies that can perfectly mix comedy and drama are always hits the audience even though this one bombed at the theaters my point there are no absolutes or another possible point peter falk just is not such great box office draw either way this is still good movie and you should give it chance like did whether you hate your roommate or not

capsule the director of cure brings weird and very complex concept the screen one viewing will not be enough understand fully the premise of pulse the idea is something about ghosts and the internet the has an amazing apocalyptic style perhaps the most disturbing and disturbed filmmaker in the world is kiyoshi kurosawa his films all seem have one style bleak the worlds he creates are terrifying and cold little known in the us date his films deliver the kind of horror that so many of our filmmakers promise and are unable deliver most of his ideas are fresh and at the same time morbid his cure one of his niftiest ideas is just now getting sadly limited release in the us and hopefully enough people will see it that his name will soon be one conjure cure is probably his classic last year he released seance remake of seance on wet afternoon that was perhaps miscalculation inserting supernatural elements into nonsupernatural story pulse is kurosawa back on form taguchi young computer expert is late his delivery of some important software two coworkers go his apartment and find it dismal dark affair in spite of his computer equipment taguchi acting very strangely lets his friends look for the missing software meanwhile he slips behind plastic curtain when he fails respond calls his friends follow him behind the curtain and discover he has hanged himself if that was not horror enough the body seems disappear leaving just strange dark mildewlike spot on the wall taguchis computer seems have been infected some kind of computer virus people whose computer gets the virus seem superficially die via suicide but they are not entirely dead their spirits seem remain present somehow in the real world and on the internet people who get the computer virus are asked if they want see ghost if they say yes they seem be able see real time images of the spirits still nearby somehow the computer shows them impossible images of ghosts in their own rooms as seen from cameras that do not exist this is all somehow connected heaven and hell somehow filling up and overflowing like computer disk instead the dead seem be staying on earth and inhabiting computer viruses there is some sort of passage between worlds having something do doors marked red tape and strange electronic disturbances on computers leave it kurosawa find new kind of death this is that has more weird ideas piled together than lifeforce and somehow kurosawa makes the all work it may not totally convey his message of isolation and its parallels death but whatever it does convey is nightmarish kurosawa who directs his own screenplay ties his story into the real world some familiar and accurate computer discussion frequently the plot is advanced character hunches being assumed be fact his plotting is frequently hard follow and always very strange junichiro hayashi the cinematographer who recently has been doing all of kurosawas films creates dark cold and gloomy tone images are obscured semilighting or are behind plastic curtain scenes are not milked for their horror the way american exploitation films might people are shot guns but there is little if any blood in evidence seeing black silhouettes on computer screens is not immediately scary kurosawa is not going for and easy visual shock but deeper metaphysical dread of any horror filmmaker in the world kiyoshi kurosawa is the one watch rate this metaphysical look at isolation on the scale and on the scale

when first heard that disneys next animated feature was going be tarzan was almost horrified was worried that disney was going make another hercules sorry jerkules that effort was too overloaded comedy and the hero was too boastful and pompous be considered sympathetic hero and after viewing it this day find it disgrace for disney animation when saw the trailers was thinking hmm this is not bad at all this just might have potential when bought the soundtrack was really quite surprised at how different it sounded from most disney features have never really heard of phil collins nor have heard of mark mancina so was wondering how would these two make this disney flick spin was pleasantly surprised the music is topnotch phil collins songs are terrific percussionheavy pieces of work that seem break the formula for typical disney songs the score from mark mancina was also neat it reminded me bit of the lion king but it was more original so the soundtrack was not bad at all considering it was two people am not familiar this could be good but will it be when finally went see it on opening day as tend do most disney animated features my question was answered in complete turnabout of expectations for me disneys tarzan is surprisingly decent the story starts out tarzans parents surviving shipwreck and finding home on an island where apes live in peace however one day vicious leopard sabor attacks and kills tarzans parents leaving him at this time baby aloneuntil kala of the apes rescues him kala wants raise the child as her own she lost hers previously sabor but her mate kerchak is not too sure it is not our kind he says he agrees though let her take care of little tarzan but that does not make him my son tarzan grows up vowing be the best ape ever but no matter how hard he tries or what he does at the guidance of his hilarious ape friend terk he just cannot convince kerchak that he is one of the apes even when he defeats sabor in battle one day new animal shows up humans this is where jane comes into the picture she is on an expedition her father professor porter and despicable hunter clayton searching for gorillas tarzan rescues her when she is chased baboons and soon they get know each other even though tarzan falls in love jane this causes things go wrong clayton tricks tarzan into taking him jane and porter see the apes who are convinced that he has betrayed them worse clayton has plotted send the gorillas london for money will tarzan find out family he belongs and save the apes am not gonna tell you sorry you are gonna have see for yourself and see it you should the animation is as always top notch particularly when tarzan goes soaring through the trees read that skateboarding the deep canvas computer generated effect adds an authentic feeling the jungle tarzan lives in in fact it seems similar the computer imagerycel animation combination in rival disney animted films such as foxs anastasia and dreamworks prince of egypt could it be that disney was actually taking ideas from their rivals the casting is fairly good tony goldwyn is emotionally believeable as tarzan and my relief the animators have succeeded in not making him another hercules nicely done and glenn close is wonderful as kala she has beautiful singing voice too the way lance henrikson as kerchak somewhat reminds me of robby bensons beast voice makes him all the more ferocious and gripping minnie driver had me little worried at first as the voice of jane thought she had the most annoying voice in the whole when first saw the trailers but when saw the did not have problem her take back my insult on driver it is nice hear nigel hawthorne do another voice for disney animated feature he was fflewdurr flamm in disneys most underrated classic the black cauldron he is funny and delightful as professor porter on the villiany side of the voices brian blessed the guy who did boss nass in star wars episode ithe phantom menace brings pompous and later on vicious voice the sinister clayton he might not be the strongest character in the he is just plain bad guy nothing else but blesseds vocal work contributes greatly but if there is any voice that think steals the whole show it should be rosie odonnell who is hilariously funny as terk she also has fiesty attitude am gonna kill ya she says more than once almost sung along her during one of the films best moments where the apes make mess of the humans camp via song er scatting shoobedoo dabedah can see why she wanted have rock song for the she is good singer not that she was the only funny character in the though wayne knight who played stan in space jam gives whimsically funny style tantor an elephant who is especially worried about stepping into unsanitary water thankfully there is no real sound of flatuencethat would have killed the picture the songs as said before are decent mostly sung collins this sets new standard for disney animated films because for the first time the characters do not sing tolerate musical numbers from characters lot more than some other guys would but found this be nice change of pace the story does have elements of comedy in it but they also load it strong dramatic touches makes this far better than the unbelieveably uninspired hercules if there is anything disappointing about tarzan it might be the omission of the sync version of trashing the camp from the heard it on the soundtrack and wondered where it was going be was upset that it was not because had thought of taking few friends of mine who like sync see tarzan oh well overall was enthralled tarzan would not hold it high the way do mulan or the hunchback of notre dame my alltime favorite disney classics but this deserves high place among disneys greatest achievements give nod disney for following up their spectacular masterpiece mulan this great animated adaption of egar rice burroughs tarzan

the opening crawl tells us that the galaxy is in turmoil over the taxation of trade routes and the greedy trade federation has used it is armada of powerful space battleships blockade the planet naboo we soon find that the federation plans invade the planet an enormous army of warrior robots and force naboos ruler the young queen amidala natalie portman sign treaty giving the federation control however the galactic republic has sent jedi knights quigon jinn liam neeson and obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor as emissaries the federation in order negotiate for the ending of the blockade no sooner do they arrive than the federation leaders are instructed via holographic transmission mysterious cloaked figure destroy the jedi and the first battle begins it seems that for me and thousands of people like me the love for george lucass trilogy of star wars movies has only grown over time we are the fans not the freaks we will not go dressing up like darth vader although you have admit those imperial uniforms are pretty darn cool and we will not incorporate lines from the script in our everyday conversations not all the time anyway but if someone wants challenge us little trivia contest we are throwing down all right stop looking at me like that we have been faithfully and patiently waiting waiting for this movie ever since the end credits of return of the jedi started roll you see the trilogy is not just set of movies but religion of sorts we the faithful disciples and the phantom menace is tantamount the second coming of the messiah unfortunately it is not our savior for weeks beforehand was going around telling people that this movie had better be damned good stupendously good miraculously good anything less and it will be the biggest disappointment of the century did not want the doomsaying prophecy come true really did not but this nevertheless fails reach the pinnacles of filmmaking character development is virtually nonexistent the possible exception of quigon most of the films characters seem left nothing do but go through the motions none seem very affected their experiences and few even show any passion at all contrast this the horribly irritating comic relief we are nearly continuously subjected in the form of jar jar binks creature belonging race lives in underwater cities on naboo in precarious symbiosis the land dwellers led amidala jar jars life is saved quigon early in the and travels our heroes for the sole reason of making us laugh or supposedly so his speech mannerisms are so cuteified that could not understand third of what he was saying and the slapstick he performed was just distracting his head gets caught in an electronic field his foot gets caught in the stirrup of some large beast he describes being in trouble as deep doo doo and even manages step in some of the same while walking around in mos eisley spaceport therein lies key difference between this and one of its predecessors in star wars we had obiwan telling us mos eisley was wretched hive of scum and villainy in the phantom menace we get doo doo the films of the trilogy took me away from my everyday life and immersed me in story long time ago in galaxy far far away this on the other hand constantly reminds me that it is only movie including situations and phrases that are so uniquely modern american that they seem incredibly out of place and serve jerk the viewer from the experience perhaps the most blatant offense occurs during scene where young anakin skywalker enters into pod racing competition it is kind of like chariot racing large engines instead of horses and there are couple of commentators in press box delivering indy like play play liked the pod race it was really exciting and ratcheted the tension but when the heck did lucas think up the idea of putting in the sportscasters the race would have been even more exciting without the distraction this aspect coupled the emphasis on humor simply baffled me suppose one may say that lucas was trying appeal the younger viewer but would more intelligent scenes and dialog hurt this appeal at all did not millions of youngsters still go back see the original star wars in over and over again did not the action figures still sell like hotcakes of course they did and it is only poor judgment that allows the mosteagerly awaited in history be marred pandering children who would still have enjoyed more appeal for adults one aspect that will appeal broadly however is the use of special effects the people at lucass industrial light and magic the worlds premiere effects house outdid themselves in providing seamless integration of computergenerated images and reallife footage some of the scenes have be seen be believed especially the shots of land battle between the federations robot army and jar jars countrymen the space battles are also impressive although improved over past efforts only subtle margins the casual observer this however is testament the work ilm produced two decades ago and still holds up well today john williams is back of course providing score for the as only he can his music is pervasive throughout as rousing and as dramatic as ever always serving punctuate scenes noticeably and appropriately since this is supposed be the first installment in nineepisode story star wars the empire strikes back and return of the jedi being episodes four five and six respectively the phantom menace has the daunting task of setting up the origins of several characters we know already in addition those whom we unfamiliar as result attention history and characterization was spread little thin it would have been nice get more in depth yoda and obiwan for example but given the fact that there were several new characters cover it is understandable that some of the development has been left for the next two films one of the new characters is darth maul hailed as the new villain as much hype as marketing forces could muster prior this films release in spite of the hype darth maul is character almost did not have be in the his role is so insignificant he has maybe three spoken lines believe it or not second actor voices the character and the rest of the time just scowls and looks mean that working against him he never has chance at being interesting and instead ends up an utter disappointment lucas seems have wanted develop the spiritual nature of the star wars universe something has been prominent throughout however he does so largely paralleling the star wars spirituality the bible offering an easy out for storywriting and once again bringing the viewer back planet earth reallife connection oddly while trying capitalize on spirituality lucas at the same time introduces the fact that mastery of the force is dependent upon having little forceloving parasites in your bodys cells this only serves demystify the workings of the force few notches offering scientific connection do not let me mislead you too far the phantom menace most standards is good it contains lot of visual treats sets the stage for an epic story gives us bit of excitement here and there and even allows us revisit some of our old friends it is just that when held up it is predecessors and not do so would be unrealistic this simply pales

in december of little movie called scream was released became boxoffice smash and resurrected films targeted at teens first it was teen slasher movies that were the big fad both scream movies know what you did last summer urban legend etc but just recently the popularity has switched over the teen comedy genre la john hughes starting last junes cannot hardly wait it may be the first week of april in but so far this year we have been given movie aimed at the andunder market almost every single week varsity blues jawbreaker cruel intentions simply irresistible the rage carrie and the mod squad coming april are two more of this type never been kissed and go and on april we have got the teen satire election and the teen horrorcomedy idle hands jeesh out of all of these moves however the one that is most similar the latest incarnation things hate about you is this past januarys mediocre hohum she is all that although similar in plotting ok darn near identical things hate about you modernday version of shakespeares the taming of the shrew she is all that got its inspiration from pygmalion is an infinitely superior in every department from the smart direction firsttime feature director gil junger the charming and wellwritten screenplay karen mccullah lutz and kirsten smith the striking ensemble cast who give the best group of performances in teen comedy since the breakfast club and top it all off in the inevitable climax set at the prom at least we did not have once again suffer through goofy inappropriate dance sequence who could forget or want remember for that matter this ludicrous development in she is all that the day wideeyed shy new student cameron james joseph gordonlevitt starts school at seattlebased padua high he is swept away at the sight of the beautiful and popular sophomore bianca stratford larisa oleynik although he does not know french he purposefully learns some of it just so he can tutor her but finds that her paranoid gynecologist father larry miller will not allow her date until her bitter unconventional older sister kat julia stiles senior decides kat of course has sworn off the likes of boys but cameron sets out find someone that will be the perfect match for her is exactly what he finds in the form of the rebellious patrick verona heath ledger complicating matters camerons dorky friend michael david krumholtz decides use wealthy jock joey andrew keegan who also has his sights set on bianca as pawn so that he will pay patrick get kat go out him and then cameron hopes steal bianca away from joey as you can see things hate about you includes huge number of characters some of have not even mentioned such as kats shakespeareobsessed friend mandella susan may pratt and biancas materialistic comrade chastity gabrielle union at short but wellused running time of minutes all of the characters are perfectly handled satisfyingly developed and for the most part are not treated as caricatures another flaw of she is all that where the bad guys and gals ran around constantly saying you are vapor since could sympathize the realistic depictions of the central characters and since many of the comedic and dramatic scenes were surprisingly effective got completely caught up in all of the relationships and was thoroughly entertained aside from good screenplay it is the performances that can make or break movie and director junger has really hit the jackpot aside from joseph gordonlevitt rd rock from the sun who gives his strongest performance date here none of the actors are that wellknown but it is this aspect that brings particular freshness the proceedings as the main character of kat julia stiles last seen in the miniseries the is marvelous and always believable and certainly has bright future ahead of her even though it is her role that is initially the most difficult and hardedged it was easy identify kats way of thinking she is against the silly tradition of the prom and loves reading sylvia plath and completely admired her individuality no one think could have portrayed her as perfectly as stiles does heath ledger as the infamous badboy of the town injects much life into patrick and has lot of chemistry stiles one other actor of note is larisa oleynik who the help of screenwriters lutz and smith is able turn bianca into person multidimensions even though she is accurately selfcentered at the onset in one truthful scene cameron angrily asks her if she has always been so selfish and bianca grudgingly realizes that yes she has one offbeat element of the and source of some hearty laughs is the way that the schools staff act is strikingly unformal allison janney as the guidance counselor ms perky who is writing trashy harlequin romance novel is comic dynamite as is daryl chill mitchell as the english teacher who reads shakespeare the class in rap and at one point sends kat the office because for once she actually thinks one of his assignments is really good although there are few cheap laughs that are thrown into the near the beginning most of it actually works especially in the humorous and witty dialogue exchanges and quirks between the characters in one very funny scene chastity asks know people can be overwhelmed and they can be underwhelmed but can people just be whelmed at another point bianca and kats father standout larry miller who is constantly terrified that his daughters are going get pregnant only allows bianca go the prom on one occasion before she leaves she has put on the heavy fat suit he has so she will get an idea of what it is like be pregnant things hate about you once and for all proves that there is still life in the teen comedy genre and this movie is probably more reminiscent of the great john hughes than any other of the it also helps that the movie has perfectlyassembled soundtrack mixing indierock new wave songs and thank goodness no rap the films end it actually had me rooting for certain characters get together and was also quite pleased how everything was wrapped up especially in the final scenes involving kat and bianca kat and her father and flawlesslyacted and moving sequence in kat gets up read the poem she has written for her english class this is where the title comes from luckily doubt would be able find ten things hate about things hate about you but the positive aspects of the far outnumber ten

the last steve martin saw the spanish prisoner was very different approach for the comic actor as millionaire leading massive conspiracy in order rob process from clueless businessman martins character did it all for money in his most recent movie bowfinger martin plays yet another con man except this time he does it succeed in the industry he wants direct successful picture that will force people remember his name that will make him more popular at the parties and most importantly that will cause fed ex deliver important business packages his front door playing the title role martin is once again the good guy the one we cheer for complete his low budget action movie this con man is very likeable for some reason even though he is doing the same exact thing as the malicious jimmy del from the spanish prisoner maybe the message is that in win over the trust and friendship of others you have be little evil bowfinger is very clever comedy great performances from its two stars martin who also wrote the screenplay is perfect as jerk conscience and eddie murphy does his best peter sellers in two different but equally hilarious roles one as big time move star and the other as his nerdy burger king employee brother the story follows aging and failing directorproducer bobby bowfinger as he makes one last attempt become respected member of his field creating baction movie called chubby rain in order attract actors and crew members bowfinger promises them that hot shot actor kit ramsey will star in the movie the only problem is that kit refuses be in it but this will not stop the aggressive bowfinger he is so determined complete his that he decides put kit in it without even telling him he has his actors approach kit on the streets of los angeles in character hidden camera filming the footage will bowfinger be able make his or will kit ramsey discover what exactly is going on bowfinger is very cartoonlike movie that pokes fun at and its famous residents while simultaneously holding very solid story line the only area where the really lacks is the cameo department this is the kind of movie that cameos are all about it is always funny see actorsdirectorsproducers making fun of themselves or coworkers especially in playful movie such as this besides the very repetitive and superflous ending bowfinger is joy watch if you take movie like this seriously then you will never enjoy it if you accept the incredulous plot and the extreme caricatures of real entertainment figures the movie is great fun

whenever studio executives try combine the successful formula of two blockbuster films the end result is always mess of script acting directing and generally waste of time for any audience an average iq above the latest movie morass from the crew appeared equally destined fail strange combination of grumpy old men and goodfellas tossed together the likes of richard dreyfuss and burt reynolds helming the ship the scary thing is that it is actually entertaining and breath of fresh air in this otherwise stale month the crew works for several reasons the clever script is reminiscent of an old billy wilder movie following four past their prime wiseguys from jersey who now live in the raj mahal apartment house in miami beach the wiseguys find themselves being evicted from their golden paradise greedy landlords bent on raising rents for new beach bunnies and boys looking for beachfront property the four mobsters bobby bartellemeo richard dreyfuss joey bats pistella burt reynolds mike the brick donatelli dan hedaya and tony mouth donato seymour cassel decide hatch scheme plant there dead body heisted from the morgue in order drive out the new tenants and keep their home this simple plan suddenly goes screwy of course and the boys become involved stripper named ferris jennifer tilly who wants her stepmother killed paranoid latin drug lord who is convinced mysterious rival is out get him and rat its tail on fire the crew works as strong comedic vehicle driven great ensemble cast of talented character actors and subtle leading men instead of concentrating on bobbys search for his daughter the gives equal screen time all four wiseguys balancing the production the acting talents of such screen veterans as dan hedaya seymour cassel and the great great burt reynolds are brought out each characters uniqueness and synergy within the wiseguy circle strong supporting cast including jeremy piven as philandering boyfriendcoppartner and miguel sandoval as the paranoid drug lord provide the most laughs the was produced barry sonnenfeld and carries hint get shorty its energetic camera work michael dinner emmy awardwinning director of the wonder years the quick script written barry fanaro screenwriter of kingpin is carried plenty of subtly dry humor and wit the crew is prime example of how simple and drywitted comedy can get these days the great thing is that this comedy does not need be punctuated bodily fluids phallus symbols in the head or grandmothers giving head in spa in the steady flow of extreme comedy these days flowing from like broken water main it is the elder statesmen like dreyfuss reynolds and hedaya that can carry comic arc only few weapons of choice decent script and good acting

along his carreer mel gibson has collected several successes not only from an economic point of view but also from an artistic point of view for all that think no one could guess the skills and abilities now disclosed in braveheart the australian actor decided produce and direct about sir william wallace popular scotch hero of the th century where he would also perform the principal role accepting so huge challenge mel gibson run the risk of stain all his work of years suppoosed failure just see recognized everyone all his potentialities and that way consolidate his position in it was definitely an enormous risk but am sure mel knew exactly well what he was going face braveheart is in fact magnificent and magisterial for three hours we are completely absorbed the narratives rhyitm never gives place single moment of monotony or uninterest the william wallaces story is the story of so many others brave libertys defenders who fought and gave the life for that essential value along the centuries seeing himself and his people victims of injustices and violent repression william wallace dares face the powerful edward king of england in war the autonomy of scotland as the victories succeed the number of fighters wallace goes growing up his courage and inteligence are admired everyone including the princess isabelle of wales wife of edwards son however william wallace was also surrounded enemies and some of them were closer than he thought braveheart may not be an historically corrected movie but the nature of its message make us think about the importance that we give liberty nowadays mel gibson directs lot of brilliancy brilliant cast patrick mcgoohan has very nice performance as edward the king longshank the scene when he waits for the death and loses his voice is really good sophie marceau as princess isabelle has along the movie no more than fifteen minutes of performance but mel gibson gave those minutes such very special treatment that princess isabelle soon becomes one of the major characters in braveheart also liked the performances of angus macfadyen as robert the bruce and of course mel gibson as william wallace however think this time the mel gibsons work as director was much better than his work as actor the excellent music composed james horner is another thing that helps braveheart be the success that it really is when we join that music the beautiful scotch landscapes view the camera of john toll then we realize all the beauty of this braveheart is in my opinion one of the best movies of have heard some people saying that mel gibson is gonna be new david lean for now let us see if braveheart equalizes the oscars of lawrence of arabia it will not be easy it is gonna be one more challenge for mel gibson

renown surrealist director the yearold frenchman alain resnais hiroshima mon amourlast year at marienbadm lo has created lighthearted musical played as an homage britisher dennis potter and his pennies from heaven tv serial movie and the singing detective the follows potters gimmicky style of having the characters jump into lipsynched old or contemporary french pop songs express their private thoughts he also follows the kind of sweet and colorful musicals his fellow countryman jacques demy loved direct such as the umbrellas of cherbourg and the young girls of rochefort the tale has resnaiss unique touches as director go along his homage it is satire about class differences and falling in love the wrong person and that there is song in everyones heart for every occasion what hinders this production is that the stars are not portraying particularly engaging characters the songs are not memorable and stand little chance of being recognized an american audience the exceptions might be the edith piaf and maurice chevalier numbers and the farce seems more banal than daring yet it is not without its striking moments and charms such as when jane birkin does cameo and sings one of her own songs also the glossy amberlike photography added very french romantic feeling the story while the mood of paris as being place for love flourish above all else has always been embellished in movie lore comes through flying colors it also does good job of showing you the way paris is in the and in the way ordinary people exist there it tells the romantic story of six parisians who become intertwined each other in their ordinary lives as they search for happiness they are the attractive sisters odile sabine az ma and camille agnes jaoui the older businesswoman odile married and decidedly set on bourgeois life of material comforts she is married the glum and laconic claude pierre arditi she once went out businessman nicolas jeanpierre bacri who left her years ago and now shows up in paris and asks her help find someone rent flat for his family simon andre dussolier works as realestate salesman and is trying find nicolas flat in his spare time he writes radio plays simons boss is the much younger unscrupulous and arrogant marc duveyrier lambert wilson who inherited the firm from his father and is the realestate agent selling more luxurious and larger flat better view odile but fails tell her that building project is going up soon that will block her view screenwriters and actors jeanpierre bacri and agnes jaoui wrote themselves the best parts jaouis camille is university scholar finishing up ph in history using for her thesis the study of the yeomen in the year at lake paladru she works as tour guide in the meantime and suffers from panic attacks even though she appears have outwardly perfect selfcontrol on her tours for the last four years has been the much older simon pretending be doing research for his plays but really attracted her but not having the nerve tell her this his dismay he finds out she is dating his meanspirited but handsome boss whom she meets when looking at her sisters new place and seeing him crying but not realizing that it was from cold not because he is so sensitive bacri as the classy nicolas turns out be now working as chauffeur he is hypochondriac history of depression who visits many doctors until he finds one who tells him there is nothing wrong him odile still pines for him but he is married telling her he expects his wife arrive shortly love is the same old song that makes the world go round even when all the characters are liars and not exactly open what their true motives are everything comes together in bourgeois housewarming party for odiles place as the characters reveal their true feelings and all their deceptions and neurotic impulses are either uncovered or about be there is not lot of bite this satirical musical but resnais has never made bad and is one of the best current french directors if not the best this is not one his great ones but it still has enough pep in its light touches be interesting it not only has an odd way for the characters break into song but some males even sing in female voice while some females sing in male voice it is also interesting in the way it examines its characters behavior as being similar in business as in love

in the stock market crashed and oliver stones wall street was released critical acclaim and packed movie houses wall street lucked out in its timing the recent crash gave the resonation it might not of had and though its killorbekilled approach business was exaggerated that very ideology was keyed into the mind set of the quintessential reaganera businessman stone constructed his as mythical good vs evil tale relayed in the fastpaced milieu of the burgeoning stock exchange critics and audiences lauded wall street elevating its status that of contemporary classic am proud say that will never be counted as one of them found wall street be just as axiomatic and pandering as the majority of stones output its thin caricatures obvious sentiments and charisma barren performance the young charlie sheen stone goes for broke in every scene the same could be said for nearly all of his works this approach tends bury his purported message beneath heap of good intentions he directs stock exchange scenes in typical hyperbolic mode people shouting into phones as if they were in plummeting airplane it is all an excuse for stone ratchet up the emotion false intensity rather than explore what these situations are really like have feeling the brokers would be psychologically manipulative as they are presented in boiler room rather than laughably over the top these guys are salesmen after all not televised judges more than anything am baffled why so many adore wall street the only possible solution can muster is its release date and not just the timeliness of the greed is good subject matter the was plumped down in the eighties decade in the onejoke comedy rose an art form and group of glamorous brat packers smirked their way through inane high concept low result movies in my mind the eighties will forever be remembered as decade not only proliferation of bad movies but bad music bad hair and bad clothes maybe stones after school special set in wall street was viewed as welcome change of pace boiler room is an equally welltimed some similarities stones piece of crap they both feature consequential fatherson relationship though boiler rooms is much more subtle and touching and they are both concerned the power of greed yet the men in boiler room are akin poseurs presuming be big shots rather than the slipperysmooth heartless gordon gecko figures of wall street boiler room is message movie as well though at least until the end does not shove it in our faces boiler room is about the pursuit of cash and the degrees people will go for that cash as said this is indeed timely in society where who wants be millionaire is the number one prime time show every day bringing about revolution of prime time tv watching that has not been seen in quite while not only do we want be millionaires we want watch other people become millionaires in our superjudgmental poweroriented culture the desire for money supersedes everything when you have money you have it all and seth giovanni ribisi wants it all the easy way he is wellintentioned college drop out who gets lured into working for an illegally run brokerage firm the kind that sells junk stock whereupon he meets others just like him ben affleck is cast as jim the company headhunter who struts in commanding the room like frat boy gordon gecko his job is influence trainees into becoming enthusiastic employees giving speech that subtly attacks their man hood it is ironic that he sells these pups the same load of s that they are told dish out prospective buyers afflecks character is obviously supposed recall alec baldwins similar character in glengary glen ross and that proves detrimental the actors performance affleck shouts curses and belittles his rookie employees just like baldwin minus the edge when alec played the scene he became the part spewing those brutal lines as if they were his own comparison affleck simply looks as if he were doing really hammy line reading the brokers approach their job the fervor of overzealous jocks they storm work like football players on the way the big game rap music thumps on the soundtrack effectively illustrating who these guys think they are intellectual gangsters they are not above rumble as test of man hood especially during leisure time where the lumbering scott caan seems all too eager use his fists in minor disputes we drink up this world along seth and watch him become seduced it just like we might be as in all cautionary tales boiler room begins seducing us into its illustrious world of profit and wrongdoing then smacks us the consequences of all the recklessness know this story we all do but it can work if it is told intelligence and energy and that is how writer director ben younger tells it as director of please excuse my french miseenscene younger has much learn his style is sitcom bland but his writing is not youngers script is well studied in the vernacular of this bunch his dialogue is like junior david mamet despite the moderate camera work younger fills his phonepitch scenes tension that comes from just the performances and the tightly wound script the brokers hucksters counter every customer objection gently bullying them into buying stock these moments are filmed like psychological action scenes tense confrontation between victimizer and victim who is not aware that he is one the exception of afflecks brief appearances the performances are truly exceptional ribisi who has the edgy looks of character actor is extremely potent here working his pale angular face and eerie plaintive stare for all their worth he conveys childlike vulnerability his character seems hide in corner whenever things are not going his way in some scenes and in others he is ferociously cut throat the jekyll and hyde contradiction works well in the movie ribisi is confident when it is just him and the phone but cowardly in front of authority figures including his abrasive father authoritatively played ron rifkin boiler room thankfully avoids wall streetlike histrionics in the salespitch sequences the sales build slowly like crescendo of intelligent psychological ploys those ploys are taught seth chris vin diesel kind broker who alternates between seths friend and his mentor diesl shines in his minor role this week saw the scifi opus pitch black in diesel plays completely different role in an equally effective manner in that he has the kind of role that might have gone arnold schwarzenegger in the and in boiler room he has the kind of role that might have gone elliot gould in the nicky katt is also memorable as superior broker obsessed what he cannot have nia long as the firms secretary lone black women amongst many white men is ribisis love interest in part that at first looks be as insignificant as most of the parts this talented actress gets but develops into something more interesting the two make an oddly likeable couple long is smart and brash and ribisi is charmingly aloof at one point he says her am just lookin for some chocolate love it is terrible line but ribisi delivers it in such an innocuous childlike way it becomes sweetly endearing unfortunately towards the end the boiler room turns tad schmaltzy there is much crying hugging and sorrowful stares this is okay when taken in small doses but youngers conclusion is constructed as series of these boohoo moments one following the other particular misstep is his attempt show the effect that seths manipulations have on one of his poor victims it is not bad idea but the execution is lacking those scenes feeling tacked on further spell out the message that message being greed is bad yes it is patently obvious but boiler room conveys it introducing us culture that have not seen much of in the movies the disenfranchised twenty something entrepreneur and all wall street did was introduce us simplistic fantasy world of saints and sinners boiler room offers neither extreme it gives us what is in between and for that am thankful

look back at all the times in your life when there was fork in the path the future some sort of decision had be made and for better or worse it irrevocably altered the course of your existence from timetotime everyone thinks about the roads not taken and how things might have turned out if the choice had been different perhaps even more dizzying contemplate is how seemingly minor action catching the am train for example could have an equally profound yet less obvious impact maybe that is where you met your significant other and had you reached the platform just few seconds later makers are no less fascinated issues of destiny than anyone else and that is why there is no shortage of movies about this subject the best of the bunch were probably made the late polish director krzysztof kieslowski who was obsessed questions of fate and chance these themes weave their way through many of his movies including decalogue the double life of veronique and the triptych of blue white and red however they are most explicitly examined in called blind chance where kieslowski presents the three different fates of one man after minor action missing or catching train changes the course of his life in his autobiography kieslowski on kieslowski the director describes his attraction the concept this way the idea is rich and interesting that every day we are faced choice could end our entire life yet of we are completely unaware while this approach has been the fodder for several notable dramatic films including in way frank capras it is wonderful life sliding doors is the first romantic comedy plumb its depths the road not taken approach is not just plot device either writerdirector peter howitt expands upon both possible fates of character after she just missescatches train the audience watches evergrowing fascination how this one event impacts upon every aspect of her life her future career where she lives whom she loves and whether she has family as her separate destinies diverge and then reconverge she becomes two completely different individuals that woman is helen played gwyneth paltrow as long dark haired brit one day after losing her job as an advertising executive she decides return home in the middle of the day the scene of the pivotal moment is train platform in scenario she just slips through the sliding doors before the train pulls out of the station on board she meets the cheerful talkative james john hannah monty python fan who is taken her beauty minutes later in her flat she walks in on her lover gerry john lynch in bed another woman jeanne tripplehorn in scenario she misses the train and shortly thereafter is the victim of an attempted mugging she does not meet james and fails make it home in time discover gerrys infidelity juxtaposed one against the other while sharing many places cues and characters the two stories proceed in parallel from there on one level for viewers who enjoy pondering the workings of fate sliding doors can be viewed as deep and wonderful experience but for those who just appreciate romantic comedy characterized solid acting script few twists and great deal of genuinely funny material sliding doors still fits the bill one of its most obvious strengths is that it can satisfy many different types of audiences those who demand something substantial from their motion pictures and those who could care less it should not come as any surprise that the acting at least from three of the four leads is solid paltrow who does double duty as two helens who are initially the same yet gradually become much different is the standout she plays both of her roles effectively and believably the shy insecure woman who stays gerry and the liberated platinumblond who severs the ties her old life and embarks on new career new man john hannah known most american viewers as the younger gay character in four weddings and funeral is instantly likable john lynch taking break from movies about irelands troubles does good job presenting gerry as inept selfish philanderer only jeanne tripplehorn who plays an overthetop vixen seems out of place her attempts at broad comedy are occasionally jarring and it is occasionally difficult see her lydia as anything more than plot element one member of the supporting cast deserves special notice douglas mcferran who plays gerrys best friend russell is an absolute delight stealing every scene that he is in part of this is surely because he is given the best lines in the movie on one occasion he has marvelous monologue bemoaning how advances in the telecommunications industry have trapped men into life of monogamy on another occasion while laughing at gerrys plight the women in his life he comments being you makes the wait for the next episode of seinfeld more bearable but it is not all in the dialogue mcferran tears into this part relish his performance becomes one of the most memorable aspects of topnotch comedy this is the first feature for peter howitt and he approaches the task unimpeachable aplomb the script is shrewd and inventive combining wit romance and intelligent melodrama into crowdpleasing whole sliding doors grants more than just good time at the movies however for those who are so inclined its central theme offers an opportunity ponder some of the more philosophical questions about the workings of the universe all while having good time

three things learned from being john malkovich when getting on the elevator for your first day of work on the th floor of building always bring your crowbar do not stand in the way of your wifes actualization as man and whenever entering portal into the mind of another human being wear old clothes because hey it is muddy in there being john malkovich is the most original come down the pike in very long time wildly surrealistic yet presented in downtoearth funky style this is the kind of movie that sticks in your head after savoring the sheer inventiveness of the storyline you roll around the wealth of ideas contained within it from the ethics of relationships and politics of immortality the very nature of identity itself there is lot think about here just do not forget have fun clearly all parties involved in the making of the certainly did starting writer charles kaufman wrote being john malkovich without an outline he explains in the press notes blindly no sense of direction or purpose it is important me that do not have map before start this allows me surprise myself stay engaged discover things and hopefully allow the unconscious surface spike jonze mark wahlbergs na ve buddy in three kings takes it from there the whitehot director of the beastie boys sabotage an awardwinning parody of tv cop shows as well as numerous other music videos and commercials eschews typical mtv flash for his feature debut jonze wisely realized that storyline this unusual is most effectively presented in lowkey style his flat matteroffact approach works perfectly and then there is the cast john cusack plays control freak craig schwartz street performer who periodically gets decked parents objecting his remarkably expressive but decidedly erotic puppet shows over the years his marriage obsessive pet store employee lotte cameron diaz has devolved once passionate lovers the two are now little more than courteous roommates financially strapped craig takes job as an entrylevel file clerk at lestercorp located on the th floor of manhattan building navigating around dr lester orson bean his yearold boss and floris mary kay place lesters dotty secretary craig tries settle into his new position but two things keep him distracted first there is the beautiful and imperious maxine catherine keener who delights in tormenting craig over his obvious lust for her and then there is the hole behind the file cabinet turns out be portal into the mind of actor john malkovich craig learns that anyone who enters the portal gets whooshed into the subconscious of malkovich where they can experience life from his point of view enough concentration you can even influence his actions after minutes the visitor gets ejected and unceremoniously dumped in ditch on the side of the new jersey turnpike then things get little weird the way if you are concerned that gave away too much of the plot rest assured barely scratched the surface one of the most satisfying aspects of the fable is that kaufman is not content simply milk laughs from his bizarre setup instead he crawls into the dark premise as completely as craig crawls into malkovich rummaging around and toying the various philosophical implications of compromising another persons identity he also examines the consequences of the malkovisits craig lotte maxine and of course john malkovich himself the performances are superb malkovich best known mainstream audiences for his work in dangerous liaisons in the line of fire and as head psychopath in the guiltypleasure con air tweaks his own image in dandy selfdeprecating turn far from his effete vaguely reptilian persona this malkovich is just another schlub drinking his pals and trying get laid incidentally charlie sheen also plays himself in hilarious parody of his wellearned bad boy reputation as always john cusack nails his part handily pulling viewers along even as craigs actions become unconscionable the big surprises come from catherine keener and cameron diaz both playing against type kenner usually cast in icy subordinate roles is terrific as highly intelligent extremely manipulative femme fatale cameron diaz barely recognizable under mess of brown curly hair sheds her perpetually sunny smile and draws big laughs as woman thrown into extreme sexual confusion after taking ride in malkovich being john malkovich stumbles towards the end as jonze and kaufman try too hard resolve the various subplots additional characters and increasingly complex explanations lead cluttered finale regardless this contemporary alice in wonderland is real treat enjoyed watching being john malkovich but only later after reflecting on the did its resonance fully hit me at one point craig says do you know what metaphysical can of worms this portal is truer words were never spoken

in my reviews try make gentle recommendations rather than telling you what see or what not see realize that we all have different tastes and cannot predict what my audience will like and what they will dislike but in the case of american beauty must make an exception if you have not yet seen it go see it now stop reading this review and head for your local multiplex then after you have seen it come back will wait here welcome back if you followed my advice and see no reason why you should not have do you am sure you have just had one of the richest cinematic experiences of your life american beauty is an extraordinary powerful jolting exploration of the dark side of the american dream it is humorous but it is not funny because of the unrelenting ominous undercurrent that runs throughout the whole production mixing comedy and the darkest of drama was the way this was intended and god it works making it one of the years very best lester burnham kevin spacey has entered the mother of all midlife crises he is living life without purpose he is bored depressed and sick of his sheltered insignificant existence he barely ever talks his family has no sex life is stuck at deadend job and thinks he has no reason live but one day when he and his equally troubled wife annette bening attend one of his daughters thora birch cheerleading performances he sees something that makes him come alive what he sees is the performance his daughters friend the head cheerleader he develops lust for the promiscuous young girl an obsession soon becomes pedophilic in nature but for the first time lester feels that he is actually living this crush is only the beginning lester proceeds make more and more radical changes in his life buying the car of his dreams cursing off the boss and quitting his job today quit my job told the boss himself and blackmailed him for would you pass the asparagus please buying drugs from the voyeurnextdoor ricky fitts teenager who mysteriously videotapes what he considers be beauty and refusing be docile in family affairs his new attitude further alienates his daughter only reassuring her that her parents are nothing more than freaks of nature unjustly forced on her the powers that be and inspiring her enter relationship her eccentric neighbor and the burnhamss neighbors provide american beauty significant chunk of its dramatic momentum ricky fitts wes bentley serves as the films thematic center providing the obscure powerful meaning of the title colonel fitts the father is one of the most fascinating and complex characters in the movie even considering his limited screentime kevin spacey has never been better and this performance will certainly earn him chance put little gold person on his mantel he never plays his droll character as freak rather he effectively portrays him as normal person led drastic selfexploration his dissatisfaction life spacey is poignant and devastating in the role of lifetime equally astonishing is young thora birch who plays her potentially stereotypical rebellious teen character suprising feeling and tenderness at two hours and ten minutes american beauty did not feel nearly long enough it is complicated unforgettable that like the ice storm two years ago dares explore the darkest reaches of suburban life powerfully and cynically it dissects the notion of the pretty house the white picket fence and appealing garden being the american dream it claims that this pictureperfect image is just that an image and hiding behind it are lives much darker than common knowledge would have it the dark deeply ironic ending though given away our narrator in the first few minutes of the movie stays you for weeks after it is all over american beauty is just the kind of uncompromising needs every now and then counterbalance the mindless drivel we see released even more so considering it is masterpiece

pleasantville taps into hollywoods lack of integrity subtle messages that can be easily missed www pleasantville com april friday cast tobey maguire reese witherspoon william macy joan allen t walsh jeff daniels mpaa rating pg for sexual content and thematic elements genre drama in my opinion in short it takes lot of careful observation see the true morals and lessons brought out in this one can easily be misled as what the real message is review in literally colorless world an almost mechanical population there is no room for transitioning variety or even the customary happenings of everyday life such as rain fire or emotions the town of pleasantville has one adjective pleasant there is no sadness no fear no danger no discomfort no love and no hate put simply it is place alanis morissette could really work wonders for one big note however is that it is only s sitcom that airs in reruns on an oldies tv station or is it had waited months see this movie and after doing so on opening day was not disappointed found it quite intriguing and delightful and went back more times in the period it endured at the box office but it was not until months later when slipped in for small showing in one of those crummy dollar theaters after not having seen it for so long that my eyes were opened such deeper meaning and perspective than had previously experienced it is far too feasible misconception that this is forwards the idea that world without some healthy immorality is not world at all instead the actual message so far has not been recognized many viewers that know of is that world without immorality does not give one the ability discern right and wrong for himself because everything is automatically right there is no room for mistakes and growth and learning because there are no mistakes be made no space for growth and never anything new learn and that is the key component the entire purpose of the story now am not saying that is necessarily the way it was intended be interpreted but that is hands down the proper way in it should be besides hidden symbolic depth and themes that go beyond what we can absorb from previews this has elements of physical wonder and strength that make it just so great watch the visual effects are indeed striking and what little color is revealed is impartially favorable after spending the bulk of the movie staring at black and white it is hard not identify and appreciate the fact that our own world allows for all that brilliance and more truly intelligent addition it all however is the charming and ardently attainable cast that operates together like clockwork that said the plot goes as such david and jennifer are two very high school twins the typical relationship outline of do notmesswithmylifeandiwill notmesswithyours they demonstrate the wellknown teenage qualities of two of the common versions of adolescents today david is the shyer subtler twin who would rather watch tv land than mtv while jennifer is the wild licentious one who spends her days at the mall and relishes in the pleasures of the offensive world of degradation but when freak accident enchantingly plops them smack dab in the middle of pleasantville as two of the main characters they are forced depend on each other make it back home nevertheless jennifer works her magic and introduces the town more unrestrained approach life and while david frantically tries stop her and get them back home he realizes that change was exactly what the town needed and as said earlier not flip the town around into some corrupt society but rather give people the choice decide between good and bad and reap the results of their decisions and learn from them not only were difficult choices being brought upon the town but the simple accepted occurrences of ordinary existence also began take place people got hurt they cried they became afraid and happy and thoughtful and started think for themselves and that is when their physical world turned colors as well this can be looked upon as quite controversial movie but me the message is finally clear hope after reading this people can be more open the than they had been in the past and realize that without choosing how our own lives will be run we will never know what we could have done better until the next great movie see remain sincerely danielle flynn imr

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned east meets west in mulan the latest installment in disneys parade of annual animated feature films an odd fusion of ancient asian traditions and disconcerting elements betray obvious massmarket commercial sensibilities this confident entry is easily the most engaging and satisfying animated feature in years but falls short of actualizing its potential though not for lack of trying in many respects mulan is among disneys most mature efforts skirting the surface of adult themes and daring sneak glimpses into the messier side of combat the violence of the battles in the are admittedly sanitized the imagery of pillaged village neatly encapsulated in the form of childs discarded doll is in itself no more harrowing than luke discovering his fallen guardians in star wars and mulans later heroics in dispatching of the ruthless invaders is done so in the most tidy bloodless method imaginable yet how often does animated long considered as the last safe refuge for the innocent dare touch upon the consequential horrors of war in such provocative manner in an instant idealistic mulans innocence is lost and her jovial squadron are reminded of what their efforts are spent defending the based upon an ancient chinese fable centers on spirited young woman who disguises herself as man in order serve as her familys obligatory conscript when china finds itself under attack huns cartoonishly depicted easy demonic overtones replete glowing yellow eyes and daggeredged teeth although lent surprisingly genuine sense of menace dipping into the mythology of other cultures for the first time after cavorting in animated revisitings of familiar western european fables and literature for decades disneys new is boldly set in ancient china rather than relocated elsewhere story intact some neutral territory and revels in its east asian roots aside from predominantly asianamerican cast providing the films vocal work there is liberal usage of oriental iconography throughout and the artwork reveal hints of japanese anime influence while the does occasionally reach its limits and starts tread upon old stereotypes invoking pseudoasian references items like beancurd and rice in every third sentence grows rather hoary and cannot imagine that the regiment for ancient chinese warriors really included karatechopping blocks of stone in two it is rather remarkable that movie primarily positioned for american and european audiences delves so wholeheartedly into new foreign territory the also freely touches upon cultural idiosyncrasies from its outset although savvy viewers should easily pick up on the intrinsics immediately it is startlingly assertive in providing as little shorthand as it does unfamiliar youngsters regards the customs and traditions of mulans land at its core the is tale of heroic adventure and as such paints its story in bold strokes of honour perseverance nobility and courage as such animation is the perfect vehicle for this flavour of epic where stark emotional simplicity is able effectively work handinhand visual purity scenes would play out as unbearably hokey in live action such as mulans venerable father pridefully tossing aside his cane when accepting his draft notice are lent sense of strength and conveyed greater emotional clarity in animation mulan capitalizes on this during its strongest moments particularly during our heroines characterdefining opening halfhour it is when the attempts integrate the traditional mainstays of recent animation the friendly animal sidekick the colourful array of supporting characters into the mix where it goes slightly awry off battle mulan finds herself being trailed jivetalking diminutive dragon called mushu and an agreeable little lucky cricket who ostensibly appear assist in her subterfuge and realistically serve as audiencefriendly comic relief they are affable presences and not precisely ineffective reasonable amounts of humour are elicited and eddie murphy who voices mushu is amusingly earnest but amidst all the high melodrama the effect is mildly jarring and from storytelling perspective questionable in its necessity at training camp mulan antagonizes and eventually wins over trio of fumbling recruits easily characterized simply as the short clown the skinny clown and the big clown who provide more levity into the decidedly less effectiveness and in familiar retread of traditional disney patterns she grows certain fondness for handsome squarejawed young captain shang everybody needs love even ancient chinese warrior princesses but not necessarily in this the romantic angle lets the air out of the sails of the storys neofeminist underpinnings lacks any genuine spark and plays out like contractual obligation another staple of recent disney animated films cache of hummable little ditties has also obligingly been carried over mulan but proves be decided weakness composed matthew wilder none of the handful of tunes are particularly distinguishing and one will make man out of you unimaginatively accompanying tired montage featuring our crew of characters transforming into lean fighting machines becomes so grating and hackneyed that it seems almost interminable only reflections an early ballad of lament proves be song of any consequence serving as an effective showcase for lea salonga one of musical theatres most wondrously pure voices nonetheless mulan is an especially appealing piece of work from the disney factory strong narrative arc and pleasant artwork the computergenerated stampede of hun warriors charging down snow mountain is wholly impressive while the blatantly childfriendly elements at times seem incongruous the remainder of the they are not dissuasive and remain fairly enjoyable briskly paced smart energetic heroine and filled high adventure the is ultimately most satisfying on the intimate scale of father and daughter

plot bigtime mommas boy cannot seem leave his mothers crib and make good on the babies that he himself has produced in the world he visits his kids and their mommas every now and then but his main goal in life is well he does not have any goals then one day his mother gets an exgangsta boyfriend and suddenly he is not as welcome anymore in his own house it is not long after that that his girlfriends start realizing what jerk he really is and well it is either time grow up or bow down critique first things first this movie as not about the hood at all it is an intelligent about love relationships family friendship maturity and growing up do not avoid this because you think it is about gangbangers and stuff because it is not at all it is about you it is about me it is about your girlfriend your mother your problems and your inability face up your responsibilities and well grow up this is an extremely wellwritten some of the most developed characters that have seen on the screen all year superb acting performances match granted the does start little slow and go little long but hang in there because once you appreciate and get know all of its characters you will be glad that you did this is not kids movie this is about the step that you need take in order pass into full adulthood and some might not appreciate the grander theme behind that step certainly did because too passed and am passing through many of these very same things right now yeah yeah still live my momma and related lot of the events that went down in this flick oh yeah and for the record am not black but that made absolutely zero difference in this case but that is not even half the story you see the is damn funny too and mean damn funny was crackin up at almost every other scene and they were not setup jokes like your typical comedies either just daytoday things that we could all relate like the scene in ving rhames is drinking koolaid in the kitchen and his infamously improvised african squat k scene you just gotta see believe and there are the performances too ving rhames now heres man who has already established an early lead in the race for best supporting actor at the end of this year damn dude you scared the shit outta me tyrese gibson have no idea where this guy came from an rb singer and mtv vj you say hmmmm but other than his uncanny resemblance taye diggs he nailed this part the tee from scene one on was glued his performance and sympathized his character as he molded and shaped himself into the person that he hoped become one day and everyone else too gibsons girlfriend in the taraji henson made me backer her many subtle touches all of helped raise her character several levels above the typical bitchie girlfriend that we have seen in many of these relationship movies but that is the thing that liked the most about this movie everyone seemed real the situations felt authentic the characters all came across as people like you and me issues and struggles and hopes and fears liked this movie lot because it was masterfully written wonderfully acted and genuinely entertaining watch and yeah even liked the whole homage boyz the hood that singleton pulled off in the end he called this movie companion piece that very solid followup an ever greater original baby boy is be seen anyone who feels like they never wanna grow up note the guy who plays jodys best friend in this movie is omar gooding cuba gooding jr younger brother cuba starred in boyz the hood where is joblo coming from the best man brothers shaft summer of sam what is cooking

it is an understood passion and an understood calm bud white walks into the home of lynn bracken prostitute cut look like veronica lake he is one of a finest investigating the murder of fellow cop and one of the leads takes him her home it is understood that he is quiet thunder guy who is calm voice is more powerful than his arms it is understood that she is supposed be beautiful but underneath her face is pain and scraped out lines that say her life could have been so much more you know without having be told you are the first guy who has not told me look like veronicca lake in under minute she says you look ten times better he says it without thinking like he knows without her having say anything whites face does not turn it does not blush you see his eyes and you believe him it is perfect moment in near perfect movie a confidential is the best movie of the year it is grace and poetry richly layered work of pure entertainment it is portrait of police and morality as it works it is way through characters that are so real on screen that you believe that they might have soul in phrase it is everything it is funny it is exciting has enough action and adventure and mystery and grace and suspense it is the pinnacle of movie complete work flawless it is hard tell you about the plot because it is about so much more than plot besides there is too much describe sure it is about police and searching for corruption and who fights for the right reasons and the definition of justice but it is also about what you feel when you look into the eyes of the characters in the director curtis hanson has perfectly framed each character letting you see into them rooting for them one moment doubting them the next the actors work their lines but in this movie their most important weapon is their eyes you can tell what each person is feeling just looking into their eyes for one moment russell crowe plays bud white muscle cop beef for wife beaters his movements are fierce when he strikes you jump when he is calm you know it will not be for long his intensity oozes out of the screen you follow his character through the movie afraid of him but in sympathy of him because you know how good his heart is he is looking for way solve crimes you are just never sure how he is going do it his counter is ed exley played chisselled face guy pierce you feel for him for his character because of all the cops in the movie he is the one that is actually trying do the right thing going the book you know that he must face the reality of breaking the book and you love the way he gets there have seen a confidential twice immediately after it was over wanted hit the rewind button and watch it again did not want the theater experience end it is been long time since actually experienced movie feeling like got something after walked out that is why love movies the great ones can be too rich and powerful describe watch a confidential after you leave the theater you feel like you just watched classic movie that is why la confidential stands as the best movie of the year a confidential directed curtis hanson starring russell crowe guy pierce kevin spacey james cromwell and kim basinger

capsule bleak and pointblank just the way it should be makes its case coldblooded precision and intelligence serial killer chic is relatively new entry the cultural vocabulary and one of the more stomachturning ones have never found someone automatically admirable or even interesting because they killed creatively or in great numbers and because of that had apprehensions about seeing henry was not sure wanted see the story of multiple murderer henry lee lucas portrayed as some kind of nihilistic heroantihero thankfully that is not the way henry works the director john mcnaughton took small budget and gallery of actor friends and created chilling and intelligent piece of work it does not provide cheapjack explanations for henrys behavior it shows him up for what he is an unrepentant and unidolizable man who killed when the mood struck him at the films opening henrys friend ottis toole has sister who comes stay while she tries find work in chicago in viciously riveting scene he admits matteroffactly having murdered his own mother and she covers his hand hers they are damned together from that moment on henry and ottis eventually begin kill for fun the movie is especially good at showing how they seem have drifted casually into it there is scene where the two go buy new tv the pawnbroker they talk goads henry ugly words and henry responds stabbing the man death soldering iron no preface it smashes into us as suddenly as it does the broker in scene many damned the movie for unseen they steal video camera and the murder of whole household playing it back over and over again for their own enjoyment the movie itself however does not glorify the killings but shows instead that henry feels no joy at his work only irritation henry succeeds thanks excellent writing and direction as well as acting michael rooker is credible as henry from the first frame just standing there and the rest of the cast works being unaffected and casual as well the producers had originally comissioned slasher from mcnaughton but he decided give them something more memorable and consequently the nearly did not see release the does not glorify or justify it just shows us unflinching coldness what henry was am hard pressed see how anyone can see this and consider henry any kind of victim or hero then again probably so would henry

you do not have know poker like rounders but it might help that great deal of this sharp little drama is set in the back rooms of new yorks cardshark underground astoundingly does not limit its accessibility even for those who cannot tell royal and straight flushes apart rounders success then is owed its proficient cast and intriguing portrayal of world not many viewers will be familiar the
